b'Print\nVegan Stuffed Squash with Brown Rice and Mushrooms Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesCook time: 1 hourYield: Serves 6\nThe vegetables and rice for the filling and the roasted squash halves can be prepped a day or two ahead. Warm them on the stovetop or in the microwave before continuing with the recipe.\nNote that one of the squashes is pureed and mixed into the filling. The remaining squash halves will be stuffed and served.\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the squash:\n4 small winter squash (about 1 1/2 pounds each), like kabocha, acorn squash, or pie pumpkins\n1/2 tablespoon olive oil\n1/4 teaspoon salt\n1/4 teaspoon pepper\nFor the filling:\n4 tablespoons olive oil, divided\n2 cups brown rice\n4 cups low-sodium vegetable broth or water\n1 cup diced carrot\n1 cup diced shallots\n1 cup diced celery\n1 1/4 pounds mushrooms, diced (I used a mix of creminis and wild mushrooms),\n3 cloves garlic, minced\n1/2 cup white wine\nPinch cinnamon\n1 cup chopped mixed herbs (parsley, chives, and chervil work beautifully here)\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Heat the oven to 400F and prepare the squash. Cut the squash in half and scrape out the seeds. Cut a small sliver from the bottom of each squash half to create a stable surface for the "bowl." Rub the squash halves inside and out with olive oil, then sprinkle generously with salt and pepper.\n2 Roast the squash: Roast the squash halves cut-side down for 30 minutes, then flip them over and roast cut-side up (like a bowl) for another 15 minutes. When done, the squash should be easily pierced with a fork and toasted golden-brown on the surface. (About 45 minutes total; if the squash finishes roasting before the filling is ready, turn the oven heat to its lowest temperature and keep them warm until needed.)\n3 While the squash roasts, begin preparing the rice stuffing: In a large pot over medium heat, toast the rice with 1 tablespoon of olive oil until the rice smells fragrant and nutty, 3 to 5 minutes. Stir frequently to avoid burning.\n4 Cook the rice: Pour the vegetable broth or water over the rice and give it a quick stir. Bring to a boil over high heat. Once the water reaches boiling, turn down heat to low, cover the pot, and cook for 25 to 30 minutes until the rice is tender. If the rice isn\xe2\x80\x99t done, continue checking every five minutes.\n5 Cook the carrots, shallots, and celery: Warm 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a 12-inch skillet over medium heat. Saut\xc3\xa9 the carrot, shallot, and celery until the shallots become translucent, about 5 minutes. Transfer the veggies to a large bowl, and set aside.\n6 Cook the mushrooms in batches: In the same 12-inch skillet, add 1 tablespoon of olive oil and turn the heat to medium-high. Add a third of the mushrooms \xe2\x80\x93 do not to overcrowd the pan. Sprinkle 1/8 teaspoon salt and a little pepper over the mushrooms, but do not stir.\nLet the mushrooms cook without stirring for 2 to 3 minutes, until a caramelized crust forms on the bottom of the mushrooms. (Lift one up to check!) Once you see a brown crust, stir the mushrooms together. Continue cooking, stirring often, until the mushrooms have released all their liquid and look evenly browned on all sides.\nRepeat with the remaining mushrooms, adding more oil to the pan as needed.\n7 Finish the vegetables: When all the mushrooms are cooked, return the cooked mushrooms, carrots, shallots, and celery to the pan over medium-high heat. Stir in the garlic and cook until fragrant, 30 seconds. Add the white wine and scrape any glazed bits from the bottom of the pan as the wine simmers. Cook for another 2 to 3 minutes, until most of the wine has evaporated. Remove from heat.\n(If the vegetables and rice are ready before the roasted squash, cover the pans to keep warm until needed. If necessary, re-warm briefly on the stovetop or the microwave before continuing with the recipe.)\n8 Set 6 of the roasted squash halves on plates for serving; scoop the flesh from the remaining 2 squash halves. Transfer the flesh to a food processor. Add the cinnamon and puree until very smooth.\n9 Finish the squash filling: In a large bowl, combine the mushrooms, vegetables, cooked rice, and squash puree and mix until well-combined. Taste and add more salt, pepper, or cinnamon if you like. Finally, stir in fresh herbs, reserving some herbs for sprinkling over top.\n10 Stuff the squashes and serve: Divide the filling equally between all the squash halves, mounding the filling slightly. Sprinkle with chopped herbs and serve immediately while piping hot.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Save It Print\nRoasted Winter Squash with Cilantro Chimichurri Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 30 minutesYield: 6 to 8 servings\nI typically use acorn or delicata squash for this recipe since they don\xe2\x80\x99t have to be peeled and are easily prepped, though feel free to use any other hearty winter squash like butternut, pumpkin, or kuri. The chimichurri sauce is also great on roasted potatoes, carrots, and sweet potatoes.\nUrfa biber is a dark maroon chili flake common in Turkish cuisine. A super adulty spice. The chilies are sun-cured during the day and sweated at night before being ground with a touch of salt. The result is a smoky-salty-sweet-savory chili flake whose complex flavor is reminiscent of chocolate, raisins, and inky red wine. The heat is mild, but builds the more you eat, yet never overwhelms. It\xe2\x80\x99s one of those rare ingredients that really can go on nearly everything. I actually keep it in a small container on the kitchen table for this reason and recommend you do so as well.\nYou can find urfa biber pretty easily online at stores like Spice Jungle or Olive Nation. However, if you don\xe2\x80\x99t have urfa biber chili flakes, then feel free to use regular chili flakes. I have done this plenty of times and the recipe is equally awesome.\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the squash:\n3 pounds acorn or delicata squash\n1 tablespoon olive oil\n1/4 teaspoon salt\nGround black pepper\nFor the cilantro chimichurri:\n1/2 cup olive oil\n1/2 cup finely chopped cilantro\n1/2 cup finely chopped parsley\n1 tablespoon finely chopped oregano leaves\n1 1/2 teaspoons urfa biber, or regular chili flakes\n1/4 teaspoon salt\n4 garlic cloves, minced\n1/4 cup red wine vinegar\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat the oven to 375F. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil, a silicon baking mat, or parchment paper.\n2 Prepare the squash: Cut the squash in half lengthwise. Scoop out and discard the strings and seeds (save and roast the seeds, if you like). Cut the squash into 1-inch slices.\nToss the squash with a 1 tablespoon of olive oil, 1/4 teaspoon or so of salt, and ground black pepper. Place on the prepared baking sheet.\n3 Roast the squash for 30 minutes or until easily pierced with a fork.\n4 While the squash is cooking prepare the chimichurri. In a medium bowl, stir together the olive oil, cilantro, parsley, oregano leaves, chili flakes, garlic, red wine vinegar and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Taste and add more salt if needed.\n5 Serve: Transfer the roasted squash to a serving platter or individual plates, top with a generous amount of chimichurri, and enjoy.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Print\nStuffed Squash with Turkey and Apples Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 45 minutesYield: 2 servings\nWhile the squash roasts, you can do almost all of the prep work for this dish.\nThis recipe is easily doubled to create 4 servings.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 medium (about 1 1/4 to 1 1/2 pound) acorn squash, halved lengthwise and seeded\n2 tablespoons plus 1 teaspoon olive oil\n1 teaspoon salt, divided\n1/8 teaspoon ground black pepper\n1/2 cup uncooked wild rice\n6 ounces ground turkey or ground breakfast sausage\n1 small shallot, finely chopped\n1 stalk celery, finely chopped\n1/2 large apple (Honeycrisp, Jonagold, or Braeburn), unpeeled, cored, and cut into small dice\n1 tablespoon chopped fresh sage leaves\n1 tablespoon chopped fresh rosemary\n2 tablespoons dried cranberries\n1 tablespoon fine, dry breadcrumbs\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat the oven: Preheat the oven to 425\xc2\xbaF. Line a baking sheet with parchment.\n2 Roast the squash: Brush the squash with 1 tablespoon of the oil and sprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon salt and a pinch of pepper. With the cut sides down, place the squash on the baking sheet. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes, or until tender when pierced with the tip of a paring knife. Remove and cool briefly.\n3 While the squash roasts, cook the rice: In a small saucepan, bring 2 cups water and 1/4 teaspoon salt to a boil. Add the rice and adjust the heat to a simmer. Set a lid on top, slightly askew, and cook for 40 to 45 minutes, or until the rice \xe2\x80\x9cgrains\xe2\x80\x9d are tender (some grains may begin to separate or burst). Drain in a sieve or fine-mesh colander.\n4 Cook the turkey and vegetables: In a medium skillet over medium-high heat, add 1 tablespoon of the oil. Add the turkey and break it up into tablespoon-sized clumps using a stiff spatula or wooden spoon. Cook for 5 to 7 minutes, stirring often to further break up the meat, until it begins to brown.\nAdd the shallot, celery, apple, sage, rosemary, cranberries, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and a pinch of pepper. Cook and stir for another 3 to 4 minutes, or until the vegetables soften.\nIf the pan seems dry, add up to 1/4 cup water, 1 tablespoon at a time, and stir to scrape up any brown bits on the bottom of the skillet until the water evaporates. Stir in the cooked rice. Taste and add more salt and pepper, if you like.\n5 Stuff the squash: Turn the squash on the baking sheet so the cut side is up. Divide the filling between the halves.\n6 Bake the squash: In a small bowl, mix the breadcrumbs with 1 teaspoon of oil. Sprinkle on top of the squash halves.\nBake for 10 minutes, or until hot all the way through and the breadcrumbs are browned.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Save It Print\nRed Chile Marinated Grilled Chicken Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 1 hourMarinating time: 1 hourYield: Serves 4-6\nMaking the sauce from scratch, our chicken ended up quite spicy hot, almost like jerk chicken. Using canned sauce as a base, even one with medium heat, most of the heat was lost in the cooking process. If you like your chicken spicy hot, and you are using a canned sauce, I recommend starting with one that is graded "hot".\nINGREDIENTS\n3 pounds bone-in, skin-on chicken parts, preferably thighs, trimmed of excess skin and fat\nSalt\n1 1/4 cup Mexican red chili sauce, either homemade* or canned (if you are gluten intolerant and are using canned chili sauce, make sure to read the ingredients on the can, some makers put wheat products in their sauce)\n1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil\n2 tablespoons white or cider vinegar\n1/2 teaspoon ground cloves\n1/2 teaspoon ground allspice\n1 teaspoon cinnamon\n1/4 teaspoon ground cumin\nA couple of turns on a black pepper grinder\nA pinch of dried oregano, crushed\n1 teaspoon minced garlic\nGarnish\nAvocado slices\nThinly sliced lettuce or cabbage\nThinly sliced radishes\nCilantro\n* To make your own homemade sauce, take 2 ancho and 2 guajillo chiles, open them up, remove the stems, seeds, and ribs. Lightly toast the chiles on a medium griddle or cast iron pan for a minute or two, flattening them down with a metal spatula. Place the chiles in a saucepan, cover with water, bring to a boil, remove from heat and let soak for 10-15 minutes, until chiles are softened. Place chiles, 1 1/4 cup of the soaking water, 1 clove of garlic, a pinch of salt, in a blender. Blend until completely smooth. Put mixture through a strainer to strain out any solids. Proceed with the recipe, but don\'t add any more garlic to the sauce.\nMETHOD\n1 Simmer chili sauce and spices to make the marinade: Heat oil in a medium sized saucepan on medium heat. Add the chili sauce. Add vinegar (2 Tbsp if using canned sauce, 4 Tbsp in you\'ve made your own sauce), cloves, allspice, cinnamon, cumin, black pepper, oregano and garlic.\nBring to a simmer and let simmer for 5 minutes. Remove pan from heat and let cool.\n2 Marinate chicken: Sprinkle salt over all the chicken pieces on all sides. Put chicken pieces in a non-reactive bowl or a large freezer bag. Add the marinade, make sure all pieces are coated well with the marinade.\nMarinate in the refrigerator at least one hour, preferably overnight.\n3 Grilling Instructions: Remove the chicken from the refrigerator before starting up the grill. Preheat your grill, allowing for a space on the grill for cooking the chicken with indirect heat. (If using coals, move all the coals to one side of the grill, if using gas, after the grill is hot, turn off one of the burners.)\nBrush the grill grates with olive oil. Make sure the chicken pieces are well coated on all sides with the paste-like marinade.\nPlace the chicken pieces on the indirect heat part of the grill (not over a flame or coals). Cook, covered, for 25-30 minutes, turning the pieces over after the first 15 minutes. Try to keep the temperature in the grill around 350\xc2\xb0F. Chicken is done when juices run clear, breasts have an internal temperature of 165\xc2\xb0F and thighs 175\xc2\xb0F.\n3a Roasting Instructions: If you aren\'t in a grilling mood, you can roast the chicken pieces in the oven. Preheat the oven to 350\xc2\xb0F. Place the chicken pieces in a roasting pan, skin-side up. Cook for about 45-50 minutes, until breasts have an internal temperature of 165\xc2\xb0F and thighs 175\xc2\xb0F.\n4 Serve with garnishes: Serve garnished with sliced avocado, sliced lettuce or cabbage dressed with a little vinegar and oil, sliced radishes and cilantro.\nMakes for great leftover chicken to cut up and put into tacos.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nMexican Red Chili Sauce Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 25 minutesYield: Makes a little more than 1 cup\nINGREDIENTS\n3 dried Ancho (sometimes called pasilla in the US*) chiles OR 2 Ancho and 2 Guajillo chiles\nWater\n1 large clove garlic\n2 black peppercorns, crushed\nA pinch of ground cloves\n1/2 teaspoon of salt, more to taste\nExtra virgin olive oil\n* According to Diana Kennedy, Pasilla chilies are a long and skinny variety of chile, while Ancho chilies (dried poblanos) are shorter and wider. However, in certain parts of Michoacan, Mexico, the Ancho chile is called Pasilla, and because of immigration, is commonly known as Pasilla in many parts of the US.\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cut the chiles open and remove stem and seeds: Working on one chile at a time, use a paring knife to cut a slit all the way down one side of a chile. Open up the chile and remove the stem and seeds. Remove as much of the veins as you can.\nReserve a few of the seeds or veins for adding later if you want added heat.\nNote when working with chilies, either wear protective gloves or wash your hands very thoroughly with soap and warm water after handling the chilies. Do not touch or rub your eyes if you have been handling chili peppers.\n2 Heat the chiles on a skillet: Heat a large skillet on medium heat. Flatten out the dried chilies as well as you can and place on the skillet to heat.\nPress down on the opened chilies and leave for a few seconds. Turn the chilies over and heat a few seconds more.\nYou do not want to toast or burn the chilies! If they burn, they'll turn bitter. Just heat them enough to draw out more of their flavor.\n3 Soften the chiles in hot water: Add the chilies to a small saucepan and add enough water so that they are just covered. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat and let sit for 10 minutes, until the chilies have softened and plumped up.\n(OR pour place the chilies in a small saucepan and pour boiling water over them to cover. Let sit for 15 minutes, until softened.)\n4 Pur\xc3\xa9e with garlic, seasonings, water or poaching liquid: Reserving the soaking water, remove the chilies from the pan and place in a blender. Add the garlic, salt, crushed peppercorns, ground cloves, and 1 1/2 cups of the soaking liquid (taste the soaking water first, if it seems bitter, use plain water instead).\nPur\xc3\xa9e for 2 minutes, until the sauce is completely smooth. Taste the sauce and adjust the seasoning. If you want more heat, add in a few of the seeds or veins and pur\xc3\xa9e some more. Add more salt if needed.\n5 Strain through sieve into a skillet, simmer: Pour the sauce through a sieve into a skillet. Add a tablespoon of olive oil to the sauce.\nBring to a simmer and reduce heat to maintain the simmer, cook for 10 minutes. Skim off the foam.\nRemove from heat. Use immediately or pour into a glass jar (plastic will get stained) and refrigerate.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b"Save It Print\nAfrican Chicken Peanut Stew Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesCook time: 1 hour, 55 minutesYield: Serves 6-8\nUse chicken legs, thighs or wings for this recipe. They have more flavor and will hold up better with the flavors of the stew than breast meat.\nINGREDIENTS\n2-3 pounds chicken legs, thighs and/or wings\n3 Tbsp vegetable oil\n1 large yellow or white onion, sliced\nA 3-inch piece of ginger, peeled and minced\n6-8 garlic cloves, chopped roughly\n2-3 pounds sweet potatoes, peeled and cut into chunks\n1 15-ounce can of crushed tomatoes\n1 quart chicken stock\n1 cup peanut butter\n1 cup roasted peanuts\n1 Tbsp ground coriander\n1 teaspoon cayenne, or to taste\nSalt and black pepper\n1/4 to 1/2 cup of chopped cilantro\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Brown the chicken. Heat the vegetable oil in a large soup pot set over medium-high heat. Salt the chicken pieces well, pat them dry and brown them in the oil. Don't crowd the pot, so do this in batches. Set the chicken pieces aside as they brown.\n2 Saut\xc3\xa9 the vegetables. Saut\xc3\xa9 the onions in the oil for 3-4 minutes, stirring often and scraping any browned bits off the bottom of the pot. Add the ginger and garlic and saut\xc3\xa9 another 1-2 minutes, then add the sweet potatoes and stir well to combine.\n3 Cook the stew. Add the chicken broth, crushed tomatoes, peanut butter, peanuts, coriander and cayenne and stir well to combine. Add the chicken. Bring to a simmer and taste for salt, adding more if needed.\nCover the pot and simmer gently for 90 minutes (check after an hour), or until the chicken meat easily falls off the bone and the sweet potatoes are tender.\n4 Remove bones and chop the cooked chicken. Remove the chicken pieces and set them in a bowl to cool, until cool enough to touch. Remove and discard the skin if you want, or chop it and put it back into the pot.\nShred the meat off the bones and put the meat back in the pot.\n5 Adjust seasonings. Adjust the seasonings for salt and cayenne, then add as much black pepper as you think you can stand\xe2\x80\x94the stew should be peppery. Stir in the cilantro and serve by itself, or with simple steamed rice.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nPressure Cooker Moroccan Chicken Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 30 minutesYield: 6 to 8 servings\nFor stovetop pressure cookers: Follow the instructions as written, but decrease pressure cooking time to 12 minutes.\nFor pot-in-pot method of cooking rice alongside this dish: See headnotes.\nRecipe tester notes: This recipe also works just as well with black olives or with golden raisins. Next time, I might sprinkle some chopped almonds on top, as well! ~Emma\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the Ras el Hanout spice blend (or substitute 2 tablespoons store-bought blend):\n1 teaspoon paprika\n1 teaspoon ground ginger\n1 teaspoon ground cumin\n1 teaspoon ground coriander\n1/2 teaspoon ground turmeric\n1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon\n1/2 teaspoon ground allspice\n1/2 teaspoon kosher salt\nFor the Chicken:\n1 tablespoon olive oil\n1 red onion, sliced\n3 cloves garlic, chopped\n1 cup low sodium chicken broth\n1 cup pitted green olives (with or without pimentos)\n1/2 cup raisins\n1/2 lemon, sliced thinly, seeds removed\n3 pounds boneless, skinless chicken thighs\nTo Serve:\n1/4 cup chopped cilantro and/or parsley\nSpecial equipment:\n6-quart Instant Pot or other pressure cooker\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Make the spice blend: In a small bowl, stir together the spices and salt.\n2 Cook the onions, garlic, and spices: Select your pressure cooker\xe2\x80\x99s \xe2\x80\x9cSaut\xc3\xa9\xe2\x80\x9d setting and heat the olive oil. Add the onion and garlic and cook until the onions are softened and the garlic is beginning to brown, about 5 minutes. Stir in the spices and cook for one more minute.\n3 Add the remaining ingredients and pressure cook: Pour in the chicken broth and scrape the bottom of the pot release any browned spices. Stir in the olives, raisins, lemon slices, and chicken thighs.\nSecure the lid on the pressure cooker and make sure the pressure release valve is set to its \xe2\x80\x9cSealing\xe2\x80\x9d position. Select the \xe2\x80\x9cPoultry,\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x9cManual\xe2\x80\x9d or \xe2\x80\x9cPressure Cook\xe2\x80\x9d setting, and set the time to 15 minutes at high pressure.\nWhen the cooking program ends, either perform a quick pressure release by moving the pressure valve to its \xe2\x80\x9cVenting\xe2\x80\x9d position, or let the pressure release naturally and leave the chicken on your pressure cooker\xe2\x80\x99s warming setting until ready to serve.\n  4 Serve: Sprinkle the chicken with chopped cilantro and/or parsley, and serve it with rice, couscous, riced cauliflower, or zucchini noodles.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nChicken Drumsticks, Ethiopian Style Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 2 hoursYield: Serves 6-8\nYou can do this with chicken wings or thighs, too, but don't use breasts \xe2\x80\x94 they will dry out.\nINGREDIENTS\n3-4 pounds chicken legs, thighs or wings\n2 Tbsp peanut oil, or melted butter (or ghee)\nSalt\nLemons or limes for serving\nSpice Mix:\n2 Tbsp sweet paprika\n1 Tbsp hot paprika, or 1-2 teaspoons cayenne\n2 teaspoons garlic powder\n1 teaspoon ground ginger\n1 teaspoon ground cumin\n1 teaspoon onion powder\n1 teaspoon black pepper\n1 teaspoon ground fenugreek\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n1/2 teaspoon ground cardamom\n1/4 teaspoon ground cloves\nMETHOD\n1 Preheat oven to 325\xc2\xb0.\n2 Coat the drumsticks in the peanut oil or melted butter, then sprinkle with salt.\n3 Spice the chicken: Mix all the spices together in a small bowl. In a large bowl, mix half of the spice mix with the chicken.\n4 Place chicken in foil: Then arrange the drumsticks in a casserole dish lined with enough foil to make a package; you will be cooking these legs covered for most of the time.\nSprinkle more of the spice mix over the drumsticks. You can use all of the spice mix, or stop whenever you want. The more mix, the spicier the chicken.\nFold over the foil to seal up the drumsticks.\n5 Bake: Bake at 325\xc2\xb0F for 90 minutes. At 90 minutes, open up the foil packet to let the chicken continue to cook uncovered. Continue cooking for at least another 15 minutes, and as long as you like.\nI like the meat to almost fall off the bone on my drumsticks, so I cook uncovered for another 30-45 minutes.\n6 Serve: To serve, baste with a little of the sauce that forms at the bottom of the pan, and use the rest to flavor some rice or flatbread.\nSqueeze some lemon or lime juice over the chicken right before you serve it.\nA green salad is a good side dish, too.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nGrilled Moroccan Chicken Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 15 minutesMarinating time: 2 hoursYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n1/2 cup plain yogurt\n1 Tbsp lemon juice\n1/2 cup chopped fresh cilantro\n1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil\n2 cloves garlic, minced\n1 1/2 teaspoons ground cumin\n1 teaspoon paprika\n1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper\n1 1/2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breasts\nMETHOD\n1 Marinate the chicken: Mix the marinade ingredients (yogurt, lemon juice, cilantro, olive oil, garlic, cumin, paprika, cinnamon, salt, and pepper) together in a medium sized bowl.\nAdd the chicken pieces to the bowl and thoroughly coat with the marinade.\nCover with plastic wrap and chill in the refrigerator from 2 hours to overnight.\n2 Grill the chicken: Heat your grill on high heat if you are using a gas grill, or prepare coals for direct heat if you are using charcoal. Allow for one side of the grill to be the "cool" side. If you do not have a grill you can use a cast-iron grill pan on your stove.\nGrill the chicken breasts over direct high heat a couple of minutes on one side. Then turn them over and move them to the cool side of the grill. Cover and cook for a few minutes more, until the chicken is cooked through.\n(The easiest way to test for doneness is with your fingertips. See The Finger Test to Check the Doneness of Meat. Or use a meat thermometer, remove the meat from the grill when the internal temperature of the chicken breast reaches 165\xc2\xb0F.)\nTake care not to overcook, as chicken breasts can easily dry out.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nChicken Peanut Curry Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 45 minutesYield: Serves 6-8\nINGREDIENTS\n3 pounds boneless, skinless chicken pieces (or you can use bone-in for added flavor), cut into 1 1/2 inch wide chunks or strips\n2/3 cup all purpose flour\n4 tablespoons yellow curry powder\n1 1/2 teaspoons sea salt\n1/2 teaspoon freshly ground peppercorns\n1/3 cup extra virgin olive oil\n2 tablespoons fresh ginger, minced\n2 tablespoons garlic, minced\n2 serrano chili peppers, seeded, de-veined, minced\n4 cups chicken broth\n2/3 cup peanut butter (if using freshly ground peanuts, add 2 teaspoons of sugar)\n1 teaspoon ground coriander seeds\n8 green onions, chopped, greens included\n1/3 cup each finely chopped mint and cilantro\n3 tablespoons lime juice\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Coat chicken pieces in seasoned flour: Rinse chicken and pat dry. In a large bowl, combine the flour, curry powder, salt and pepper. Toss the chicken pieces to coat.\n2 Saut\xc3\xa9 chicken pieces: Heat oil in a large, heavy pot or Dutch oven on medium high heat. Add chicken pieces in batches, being careful to not crowd the pan. Cook 2-4 minutes per side, or until the coating sets and browns a little. Remove the chicken from the pot as it cooks and set aside in a bowl.\n3 Build curry base with ginger, garlic, chili, broth, peanut butter: When the chicken has all been browned, add the ginger, garlic, chili pepper and 1/2 cup of the chicken broth to the saucepan. Cook for a minute or two, scraping the pan with a spatula and stirring to combine everything well.\nWhisk in the peanut butter, and the remaining 3 1/2 cups of broth slowly, stirring continuously to maintain an even texture.\n4 Add chicken to pot, simmer: Return the chicken to the pot and simmer for 15-25 minutes.\n5 Serve with coriander and garnishes: Right before serving, add the ground coriander, cilantro, mint and green onions. Add salt and lime juice to taste. Serve with rice.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nSkillet Chermoula Chicken Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 30 minutesYield: Serves 4 to 6\nINGREDIENTS\n6 bone-in, skin-on chicken thighs (about 2 pounds), trimmed of excess fat\n1 teaspoon salt\n1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil\nChermoula Sauce\n1 1/2 teaspoons whole cumin seed (or 1 teaspoon ground)\n1/2 teaspoon whole coriander seed (or 1/4 teaspoon ground)\n4 cloves garlic\n1 1/2 cups medium packed parsley leaves\n1 1/2 cups medium packed cilantro leaves and tender stems\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n1/2 teaspoon paprika\n1 teaspoon lemon zest\n1/2 cup extra virgin olive oil\n2 tablespoons lemon juice\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Salt chicken thighs on both sides and let rest while you prepare the sauce.\n2 If using whole cumin and coriander seeds, lightly toast the whole cumin and coriander in a small skillet on medium heat, until fragrant. Put into a mortar and pestle and grind until powdery.\n3 Make the chermoula sauce: Put 4 cloves garlic, parsley, cilantro, salt, cumin, coriander, paprika, and lemon zest in a food processor. Pulse several times. With the motor running, slowly add in 1/2 cup of olive oil, then the lemon juice. Process until you have a smooth paste. You should have almost a cup of chermoula sauce.\n4 Brown chicken thighs in skillet: Heat 1 Tbsp olive oil on medium high heat in a large cast iron pan and preheat oven to 350\xc2\xb0F.\nPat dry the chicken pieces and place them skin side down in the hot pan. Let them cook until deep golden brown, about 5 to 6 minutes.\nThen turn them over and cook a few minutes more.\n5 Drain excess fat: Because you are working with skin-on thighs, you will likely render quite a bit of fat. Remove the chicken from the pan and pour off any excess fat. (Do not pour down the drain unless you want to clog your drain pipes.) Return the chicken to the pan.\n5 Spread chermoula on chicken, bake in oven: Spread most of the chermoula sauce on both sides of the chicken thighs, reserving 1/4 cup of the fresh sauce to add later.\nWith the chicken skin-side up, put the skillet in the 350\xc2\xb0F oven for 10 to 15 minutes, until the thighs are cooked through and the temperature near the bone is 165\xc2\xb0F when tested with a meat thermometer.\n6 Spoon remaining sauce over chicken: Stir the reserved fresh chermoula sauce in with the pan sauce. Spoon sauce over the chicken to serve.\nServe with couscous or with basmati rice for a gluten-free option.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nVegetable Shakshuka with Pesto Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesCook time: 30 minutesYield: 4 servings\nINGREDIENTS\n4 plum tomatoes, cored and cut into 8 pieces\n1 medium beefsteak tomato, cored and cut into 8 pieces\n2 tablespoons olive oil\n1 bunch scallions, trimmed and thinly sliced\n1 medium clove garlic, chopped\n1/8 teaspoon black pepper\n1/8 teaspoon crushed red pepper\n1/2 teaspoon ground cumin\n1/2 teaspoon paprika\n1/4 cup water, or more if needed\n1 yellow pattypan squash, 1 medium summer squash, or 1/2 golden zucchini\n4 large eggs\n3/4 cup pesto, homemade or store-bought\nHandful of fresh basil leaves, for garnish (optional)\nBaguette or thick slices of bread, to serve\nEquipment:\nA blender or food processor\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Blend the tomatoes: Blend the plum and beefsteak tomatoes in a blender or food processor until they are saucy (you should have about 3 cups).\n2 Cook the tomato sauce: Heat the olive oil in a large saut\xc3\xa9 pan over medium heat. Add the scallions and cook, stirring often, for 5 minutes. Add garlic, salt, black pepper, red pepper, cumin, and paprika. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute more.\nAdd the tomatoes and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes or until they stop sizzling. Add 1/4 cup of water. Lower the heat and simmer the sauce for 5 minutes. If the mixture seems dry, add more water, 1 tablespoon at a time.\n3 Prepare the squash or pattypan: Trim top and bottom from the squash and cut into quarters. If using a yellow squash or zucchini, remove the column of seeds from the center (the pattypan has fewer seeds, so it\xe2\x80\x99s OK to leave them in). Very thinly slice the vegetables.\n4 Add the squash to the tomato sauce. Stir well and continue cooking for 5 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender. Add more water, if needed.\n5 Cook the eggs: BUse the back of a spoon to make 4 indentations in the tomato mixture. Break one of the eggs into a measuring cup and then carefully pour it into an indentation, being careful not to break the yolk. Repeat with the remaining eggs. Cover the pan and cook over medium heat for 8 minutes or until the whites are set (the yolks will still be runny).\n6 Serve: Garnish the dish with dabs of pesto and fresh basil leaves. Serve straight from the pan to individual dishes.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nAgua de Jamaica (Hibiscus Tea) Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 25 minutesYield: Makes 2 quarts\nINGREDIENTS\n2 quarts water\n3/4 to 1 cup sugar (depending on how sweet you would like it to be)\n1 cup dried hibiscus flowers\n1/2 cinnamon stick (optional)\nA few thin slices ginger (optional)\nAllspice berries (optional)\nLime juice (optional)\nOrange or lime slices for garnish\nMETHOD\n1 Boil water with sugar and spices: Put 4 cups of the water and the sugar in a medium saucepan. Add cinnamon, ginger slices, and/or a few allspice berries if you would like. Heat until boiling and the sugar has dissolved.\n2 Steep with dried hibiscus flowers: Remove from heat. Stir in the dried hibiscus flowers. Cover and let sit for 20 minutes.\n3 Strain:  Strain into a pitcher and discard the used hibiscus flowers, ginger, cinnamon, and/or allspice berries.\n(At this point you can store ahead the concentrate, chilled, until ready to make the drink.)\n4 Add water: Add remaining 4 cups of water (or if you want to chill the drink quickly, ice and water) to the concentrate, and chill.\nAlternatively you can add ice and chilled soda water for a bubbly version.\nAdd a little lime juice for a more punch-like flavor.\nServe over ice with a slice of orange or lime.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nCucumber Lime Mint Agua Fresca Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesYield: Makes about 1 quart\nINGREDIENTS\n1 lb of cucumbers (about 2 good sized cucumbers), ends trimmed, but peel still on, coarsely chopped\n1/2 cup lime juice from fresh limes (from about 1 pound of limes, or 5 to 10 limes, depending on how juicy they are)\n1 1/4 cup packed (spearmint) mint leaves (about a large handful), woody stems removed\n1/2 cup sugar\nApproximately 1 1/4 cup of water\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Blend ingredients: Put ingredients in blender, add enough water to fill 3/4 of blender. Hold the lid on the blender and pur\xc3\xa9e until smooth.\n2 Strain out solids: Place a fine mesh sieve over a bowl and pour the pur\xc3\xa9e through it, pressing against the sieve with a rubber spatula or the back of a spoon to extract as much liquid out as possible.\n3 Add ice: Fill a large pitcher halfway with ice cubes. Add the juice. Serve with sprigs of mint and slices of lime.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. b'Save It Print\nSeared Tuna with Avocado Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 6 minutesYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n1/2 cup chopped fresh cilantro leaves\n2 jalape\xc3\xb1o chiles, seeded, de-ribbed, minced (if very hot, use only 1 chile)\n2 tablespoons of peeled and minced fresh ginger\n4 garlic cloves, minced\n4 tablespoons freshly squeezed lime juice (from 2 to 4 limes, depending on how juicy your limes are)\n1/3 cup soy sauce (use gluten-free soy sauce if you need to avoid gluten)\n1-2 tablespoons sugar\nSalt and freshly ground black pepper\n1 teaspoon dark sesame oil\n1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil\n2 tablespoons canola oil or extra virgin olive oil\n4 (6 ounce) blocks sashimi-quality tuna\n2 ripe avocados, halved, pitted, peeled and sliced\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Make the sauce: In a bowl, combine the cilantro, jalape\xc3\xb1o, ginger, garlic, lime juice, soy sauce, sugar, salt, sesame oil and olive oil. If you want, you can pur\xc3\xa9e the sauce in a blender or food processor.\n2 Sear the tuna steaks: Heat a large skillet on high heat for one minute. Coat the pan with the canola oil or EVOO and let heat up for 30 to 45 seconds. Sprinkle the tuna pieces with salt. Sear the tuna for a minute on each side.\n3 Serve the tuna with sauce and avocado: Transfer the seared tuna to a bowl and coat with some of the sauce. Pour some sauce on the plates, top with the tuna and serve with the sliced avocado and a wedge of lime.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. b'Save It Print\nAir Fryer Crispy Cauliflower Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 12 minutesYield: Serves 6\nTo cook without an air fryer: Preheat the oven to 350\xcb\x9aF. Spread the cauliflower florets out on a baking sheet and bake for 20-30 minutes, or until cauliflower is crisp. Rotate the cauliflower once during baking so they cook evenly.\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the blue cheese dip:\n1/4 cup Greek yogurt\n1/4 cup mayonnaise\n1/4 cup crumbled blue cheese\nPinch of ground black pepper\nDash of hot sauce\nFor the crispy cauliflower:\n1 head cauliflower\n1 teaspoon kosher salt\n1/2 teaspoon chili powder\n1/2 teaspoon garlic powder\n2 large eggs + 1/4 cup water\n1 cup breadcrumbs\nNonstick spray, for air fryer\nSpecial equipment:\nAir Fryer\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Make the blue cheese dip: Stir together ingredients in a medium bowl. Keep in fridge until needed.\n2 Prepare the cauliflower: Cut the cauliflower into florets. It\xe2\x80\x99s okay to have a few different sizes, but try to make sure there are no florets bigger than about 1 1/2 inches.\n3 Bread the cauliflower: In a medium bowl toss florets with salt, chili powder, and garlic powder. In a separate small bowl, add eggs and water and whisk together. Add the egg mixture to the bowl with the cauliflower and toss to coat. Once the cauliflower is coated with the egg mixture, toss with breadcrumbs and coat well.\n3 Air-fry the cauliflower: Spray the basket of an air fryer with nonstick spray and place as many cauliflower florets in the basket as will fit in a single layer. Return the basket to the fryer and cook at 350\xcb\x9aF for 7 minutes. Then flip the florets and fry for another 7 minutes.\nRepeat until all cauliflower is done.\n4 Serve! Serve cauliflower immediately once all batches are done, or serve on a rolling basis as the batches come out of the fryer. Cauliflower is best right out of the fryer! Serve with the blue cheese dip as an appetizer or side dish.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nAir Fryer Crispy Cauliflower Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 12 minutesYield: Serves 6\nTo cook without an air fryer: Preheat the oven to 350\xcb\x9aF. Return the basket to the fryer and cook at 350\xcb\x9aF for 7 minutes. Then flip the florets and fry for another 7 minutes.\nRepeat until all cauliflower is done.\n4 Serve!
