b'Save It Print\nHow to Cook Dried Beans Recipe\nCooking time: 45 minutes to 3 hours, depending on the type of beanYield: About 6 cups cooked beans\nINGREDIENTS\n1 pound dried beans, such as chickpeas, great northern, cannellini, navy, or black beans\nWater\n4 teaspoons kosher salt, divided\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Sort through the beans: Pull out and discard any small stones or wrinkled or broken beans.\n2 Soak the beans (optional): Place the beans in bowl. Cover with 2 to 3 inches of water. Cover and leave on the countertop until you are ready to cook them the following day. Drain the water. Rinse the beans.\nAlternatively, you can quick-soak your beans or skip soaking altogether; see above for a breakdown of these options.\n3 Cook the beans: In a large pot set over medium high heat, add the beans (either soaked or unsoaked) and cover them with water until it reaches about 3 inches above the beans.\nBring the beans up to a boil, then reduce the heat to gentle simmer. Leave the pot uncovered and cook.\n4 Salt the beans: After about 40 minutes, check a bean to taste it. If it\xe2\x80\x99s firm, but tender, add 4 teaspoons of salt. Give the pot a gentle stir.\nContinue cooking until the beans are creamy, but intact, about another 20 to 50 minutes.\nNote: Total cooking time will vary based on the type of bean, the age, and whether you soaked or not. See total cooking time estimates in the headnotes above.\n5 Store or serve: If serving immediately, drain the beans through a fine mesh sieve and place them in a bowl. Season as desired (see headnotes for suggestions) and serve.\nIf storing, allow the beans to cool completely in their liquid, and then store in their broth in the fridge for up to 4 days, or freeze for up to three months.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nSanta Fe Pork and Black Bean Stew Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 2 hours, 10 minutesYield: Serves 4\nWe are using canned black beans in this recipe, but you could easily use dry beans if you cook them ahead. Here's how to make beans on the stovetop or in a pressure cooker.\nThis recipe makes a relatively small batch for a stew (serves 4). You can easily double the recipe to make a larger batch.\nINGREDIENTS\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n2 pounds of pork shoulder, trimmed of excess fat, cut into 1 1/2-inch cubes\n1 teaspoon kosher salt\n1 large onion, chopped (about 2 cups)\n4 cloves garlic\n1-2 jalape\xc3\xb1o chili peppers, less or more to taste, seeded, stems removed\n2 tablespoons cornmeal\n1 teaspoon ground cinnamon\n2 teaspoons ground cumin\n1 teaspoon dried oregano\n1/2 teaspoon cayenne (less or more to taste)\n1 1/2 tablespoons molasses\n1 red bell pepper, diced, about 3/4 cup\n2 long 1-inch wide strips of orange zest (optional)\n1 cup water\n1 15-ounce can black beans (we recommend Bush's or S&W premium), liquid included\nMore salt to taste\n1 to 2 limes\nCilantro for garnish\nMETHOD\n1 Sprinkle 1 teaspoon salt over the pork pieces and let sit while you prep the other ingredients.\n2 Brown the pork: Heat 2 Tbsp olive oil in a thick-bottomed stew pot on medium high heat. Add the pork pieces to the pot and brown them on all sides.\n3 Add the onions: Once the pork pieces have browned, add the chopped onions to the pot with the pork. Lower the heat to medium and cook until the onions are translucent, about 7-10 minutes more.\n4 Make garlic jalape\xc3\xb1o spice mixture: As the onions are cooking, work on the garlic spice mixture. Place the garlic and the jalape\xc3\xb1os in the bowl of a food processor and pulse until minced. Then add the oregano, cumin, cinnamon, cayenne, and cornmeal and pulse everything until ground.\n5 Add spice mixture to pork and onions: Once the onions are cooked, add the spice mixture to the pork and onions.\n6 Add molasses, bell pepper, zest, cover and cook: Add the molasses, bell pepper, orange zest (if using), and water to the pot. Bring it to a simmer and then reduce the heat to the lowest setting. Cover and let cook until the pork is completely tender, about 1 1/2 hours. Stir occasionally and scrape up any browned bits stuck to the bottom of the pot.\n7 Remove zest, add black beans: When pork is tender, remove the orange zest and add the black beans to the pot and cook for 20 minutes more on low heat.\n8 Remove from heat, and stir in the lime juice. Add more salt to taste.\nServe garnished with fresh cilantro. Great with warm corn tortillas.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nTurkey Black Bean Enchiladas Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 50 minutesYield: Serves 6\nFeel free to substitute cooked chicken meat for the cooked turkey.\nINGREDIENTS\nEnchilada sauce:\n7 Tbsp chili powder (note that chili powders vary in strength, you may want to start with less and add more to taste)\n2 teaspoons ground cumin\n1 teaspoon crushed oregano\n1 teaspoon garlic powder\n1 teaspoon cinnamon\n1/8 teaspoon ground cloves\n1 teaspoon sugar\n2 teaspoons salt (less if using salted stock)\n1/4 cup flour\n2 Tbsp extra virgin olive oil\n2 cups of turkey or chicken stock\nEnchilada filling:\n1 Tbsp extra virgin olive oil\n1 medium onion, chopped\n3 garlic cloves, minced\n1 to 2 jalape\xc3\xb1o chili peppers (1 for mild, 2 or more for spicy), seeded, minced\n3 cups cooked turkey meat, chopped\n1 15-ounce can black beans, rinsed and drained, or homemade\n8 ounces Monterey Jack cheese, grated (makes 2 cups grated cheese)\n1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro\n2 Tbsp lime juice (can sub lemon juice)\n1 to 2 teaspoons salt or more to taste\n8-16 flour tortillas, depending on size and thickness\nGarnishes:\nChopped red onion\nChopped avocado\nChopped fresh cilantro\nSour cream or crema fresca\nIce berg lettuce, sliced thin and sprinkled with salt and vinegar\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Make enchilada sauce: In a medium bowl, whisk together the chili powder, cumin, oregano, garlic powder, cinnamon, ground cloves, sugar, salt, and flour.\nHeat olive oil on medium heat in a cast iron pan (or other thick-bottomed saut\xc3\xa9 pan). Add the spices and cook for a minute or two, until fragrant.\nSlowly whisk in the stock, until smooth. Let come to a simmer, cook for a minute, then remove from heat, cover and set aside.\n2 Prepare the filling: Heat olive oil in a saut\xc3\xa9 pan on medium heat. Add the chopped onion and jalape\xc3\xb1os and cook until the onions are translucent, about 3-4 minutes. Add the garlic and cook a minute more. Remove from heat.\nPlace onion mixture in a medium mixing bowl. Mix in the cooked turkey meat, the beans, 1 cup of the grated cheese, 1/4 cup of chopped cilantro, 2 Tbsp lime juice, and 1/2 a cup of the enchilada sauce. Add 1 to 2 teaspoons of salt, or more to taste. Set aside.\n3 Assemble the enchiladas: Preheat the oven to 350\xc2\xb0F. Heat the pan with the enchilada sauce on medium heat. Spread 1/2 cup of the sauce over the bottom of a 9x13 casserole dish (pyrex works well).\nWorking one at a time, dip the flour tortillas in the sauce to coat them on both sides. If the sauce is too thick, thin it with a little water.\nPlace the tortilla in the casserole dish and place anywhere from 1/4 of a cup to 1/2 cup of the filling in the middle of the tortilla.\nRoll up the tortilla around the filling and place it in the casserole dish. Continue to roll up the rest of your tortillas until they fill the casserole dish. Cover the enchiladas with the remaining sauce, and sprinkle with the remaining cheese.\n4 Bake: Place in the oven and bake, uncovered, for 15 to 20 minutes, until the enchiladas are heated through and the cheese has melted.\n5 Sprinkle with lime juice, serve with garnishes: Sprinkle with a little more lime juice before serving. Serve with chopped red onion, chopped avocado, fresh cilantro, sour cream or crema fresca, and thinly sliced iceberg lettuce that has been dressed with vinegar and salt (no oil).\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nMoroccan Chickpea Barley Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 30 minutesYield: Serves 6-8\nINGREDIENTS\n1 1/2 cups barley\n1 1/2 cups chicken or veggie broth (use veg broth for vegan version)\n1 1/2 cups water\n1 teaspoon salt\nExtra virgin olive oil\n1 15-ounce can of chickpeas (garbanzo beans), rinsed and strained, or 1 1/2 cups cooked\n1 cup shelled pistachio nuts\n1 cup diced dried apricots\n2-3 chopped green onions or scallions\n1 cup chopped parsley\nZest and juice of a lemon\n1 tablespoon of ras el hanout spice mix*\nSalt to taste\n*Ras El Hanout Spice Mix:\n1 teaspoon black pepper\n1 teaspoon cardamom\n1/4 teaspoon cayenne\n1/4 teaspoon ginger\n1/4 teaspoon nutmeg\n1/4 teaspoon cinnamon\n1/2 teaspoon turmeric\nMETHOD\n1 Cook the barley: Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large pot on medium high heat. Add the barley and saut\xc3\xa9 for 3-4 minutes, stirring often.\nAdd the broth, water, and a teaspoon of salt. Bring to a simmer and simmer until the barley is tender, anywhere from 30 minutes to an hour, depending on how old the barley is.\n2 Strain the barley, toss with olive oil: Strain the cooked barley through a colander or sieve and run cold water over to cool it quickly. Toss and mix in the colander to strain as much water as you can.\nLay out the barley on a sheet pan and drizzle olive oil over it. Mix to coat well and set aside.\n3 Combine salad ingredients: In a large bowl, add the chickpeas, pistachios, apricots, green onions and parsley and mix well.\nAdd the zest and juice of the lemon and mix again.\nAdd the barley and mix.\nSprinkle the ras el hanout spice mixture over the barley and mix well. Taste, and add salt if needed.\n4 Marinate before serving: Let the salad marinate for an hour or so before serving. If the barley has absorbed all the olive oil, drizzle a little more on right before serving.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nLemon Chicken Chickpea Soup Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 1 hourYield: Serves 4 to 6\nINGREDIENTS\n1 1/4 pound boneless skinless chicken thighs, cut into 1-inch pieces\n1 teaspoon salt\n1 teaspoon ground turmeric\n1 teaspoon ground cumin\n1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n1 onion, chopped (about 1 1/2 cups)\n1 celery rib, chopped (about 1/3 cup)\n4 cloves garlic, minced (about 1 1/2 Tbsp)\n1 teaspoon grated fresh ginger (or powdered ginger)\n2 bay leaves\n6 cups chicken stock\n2-3 strips of lemon zest from one lemon\n2 tablespoons lemon juice\n1/3 cup basmati rice\n1 15-ounce can chickpeas, drained, or 1 1/2 cups cooked chickpeas\nCilantro or parsley for garnish\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Coat the chicken pieces with the spices: Whisk the salt, turmeric, cumin, and black pepper together in a medium bowl. Add the chicken pieces and toss with the spices to coat.\n2 Brown the chicken in olive oil: Heat olive oil in a large, thick-bottomed soup pot on medium high. Add the chicken pieces and brown lightly on all sides, 5-7 minutes total. Remove chicken to a bowl and set aside.\n3 Saut\xc3\xa9 onions, celery, garlic, ginger: Add the chopped onion and celery to the pot. Saut\xc3\xa9 until lightly browned, about 5 to 6 minutes. Add the garlic and ginger and cook a minute more.\n4 Add chicken, stock, bay leaves, lemon zest strips, then simmer: Add the chicken pieces back to the pot. Add the stock, bay leaves, lemon zest strips. Bring to a simmer and simmer for 15 minutes.\n5 Add rice, chickpeas, lemon juice, simmer: Add the rice, chickpeas, and lemon juice. Bring to a simmer and cook for 20 minutes, until the rice is cooked through.\n6 Add salt pepper to taste: Remove bay leaves and lemon peel strips. Add salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with cilantro or parsley to serve.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nCrispy Air Fryer Chickpeas Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 10 minutesYield: 2 cups; 2 to 4 for snacking\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the chickpeas:\n1 (15-ounce) can chickpeas, drained and rinsed\n1 tablespoon canola or vegetable oil\nZa'atar seasoning:\n2 teaspoons fresh thyme, minced\n1 teaspoon za\xe2\x80\x99atar seasoning\n1/2 teaspoon sea salt\n1/4 teaspoon cracked black pepper\nSpicy seasoning:\n1/2 teaspoon sea salt\n1/2 teaspoon chili powder\n1/2 teaspoon paprika\n1/4 teaspoon cayenne\nFrench herb seasoning:\n1 teaspoon Herbs de Provence\n1/2 teaspoon sea salt\n1/4 teaspoon freshly cracked black pepper\n1 teaspoon lemon zest\nItalian seasoning:\n1 teaspoon finely grated Parmesan or Pecorino Romano cheese\n1 teaspoon Italian seasoning or equal parts oregano, thyme, basil, and marjoram\n1/2 teaspoon sea salt\n1/4 teaspoon freshly cracked black pepper\nSpecial equipment:\nAir fryer, such as the Phillips Air Fryer\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat the air fryer to 390\xc2\xb0F for 10 minutes, or according to the manufacturer's instructions.\n2 Prep the chickpeas: Dry the chickpeas thoroughly on a paper towels or a clean kitchen towel. You can even dry them in a salad spinner, but you might lose a few depending on the design of your spinner. Discard any skins that come off of the chickpeas during this step.\n3 Season the chickpeas: Combine the oil and spice mix in a bowl and whisk to combine. Gently incorporate the chickpeas until coated.\n4 Air fry the chickpeas: Transfer to the preheated air fryer and air fry for 8 to 10 minutes until crispy. Taste one of the chickpeas; if it's not as crispy as you'd like, then continue to cook for another 1 to 3 minutes.\nSome of the chickpeas may look as though they have \xe2\x80\x9cpopped.\xe2\x80\x9d Don\xe2\x80\x99t fret if that happens!\n5 Season and serve: Remove from the basket to a bowl, taste, and add more salt, pepper or seasoning to your liking. Serve immediately; the crispy chickpeas will not keep.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Print\nWhite Bean and Vegetable Soup Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 1 hour, 50 minutesYield: Serves 4-6\nAdapted from Bon Appetit magazine.\nINGREDIENTS\n2 15-oz cans cannellini or white kidney beans (or 1/2 lb dried beans, soaked overnight in water), drained\n1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil\n1/2 large yellow onion, chopped\n1 tablespoon chopped fresh thyme\n2 garlic cloves, minced\n1/8 head of green cabbage, cut into 1/2 inch pieces\n1 cups chopped fresh tomatoes\n2 celery stalks, cut into 1/2 inch pieces\n1 1/2 carrots, cut into 1/2 inch pieces\n5 cups (or more) vegetable stock\n1 medium potato, cut into 1/2 inch pieces\n1/4 cup chopped fresh basil\n1/4 head of red cabbage, cut into 1/2 inch pieces\n2 zucchini or summer squash, cut into 1/2 inch pieces\n2 teaspoons salt\n1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese\nTabasco sauce (optional)\nMETHOD\n1 Cook onions, with thyme and garlic: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onion, thyme, and garlic. Saut\xc3\xa9 5 minutes.\n2 Add green cabbage, tomatoes, celery, and carrots. Saut\xc3\xa9 10 minutes.\n3 Add beans, 5 cups of stock, potatoes, and basil. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover and simmer for one hour.\n4 Add red cabbage and zucchini. Add salt. Cover and simmer until vegetables are tender, about 20 minutes longer.\n5 Serve: To serve, stir in the cheese. Sprinkle in a dash of Tabasco hot sauce if you want to give the soup a little zip.\nServe with ground pepper and bread.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b"Save It Print\nShrimp, Arugula, White Bean, Cherry Tomato Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 10 minutesYield: Serves 4\nIt always helps to brine the shrimp before cooking. An extra step, but worth it if you have the time!\nTo brine the shrimp, mix together 4 cups water, 1/4 cup kosher salt (or 3 Tbsp table or sea salt), 1/4 cup white sugar until the salt and sugar have dissolved. Add one cup of ice and the shrimp. After 30 minutes (time it!) remove the shrimp and give them a quick rinse.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 pound 16-20 count shelled and deveined shrimp\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n2 15-ounce cans cannellini white beans, rinsed and drained\n1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved or quartered\n1/2 cup finely diced red onion\n3/4 teaspoon grated lemon zest\n3 handfuls baby arugula leaves\nDressing:\n3 tablespoons red wine vinegar\n1/2 cup extra virgin olive oil\n2 cloves minced garlic\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n1/4 teaspoon black pepper\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cook the shrimp: Heat a large cast iron skillet or griddle on high heat. Add 2 Tbsp of olive oil to coat the pan. When the oil is hot, working in batches of half of the shrimp at a time, add the shrimp and saut\xc3\xa9 a minute on each side to sear. (You can also grill the shrimp if you prefer.)\nWhen the shrimp are barely cooked through, remove from the pan and set aside to cool. (The shrimp will continue to cook for a little bit after you remove them from the pan, and you don't want overcooked rubbery shrimp.)\n2 Assemble the salad: Put the drained beans, cut cherry tomatoes, diced onion, lemon zest, and arugula leaves into a large bowl. Fold in the shrimp.\n3 Make the dressing: In a small bowl, whisk together the red wine vinegar, olive oil, garlic, salt and pepper.\nGently fold the dressing into the salad and serve!\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b"Print\nWhite Beans and Sausage Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 20 minutesSoaking and Cooking Beans from Scratch time: 6 hoursYield: Serves 4-8\nINGREDIENTS\n1 pound dried cannellini beans\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n4-5 fresh sage leaves\n2 cloves garlic, crushed\n3 teaspoons kosher salt\n4 black peppercorns\nOR\n4 15-ounce cans cannellini beans\n  5 tablespoons extra olive oil\n1 1/2 pounds sweet Italian sausage\n4 cloves garlic, peeled and crushed\n3-4 canned plum tomatoes, chopped\nPinch red pepper flakes\n1 cup tomato pur\xc3\xa9e\nSalt (about 2 teaspoons) and freshly ground black pepper\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\nPreparing dry beans if using:\n1 Rinse and soak the beans: Rinse the dry beans under cold running water, removing any stones you may find. Place the beans in a large pot and cover with at least a couple of inches with cold water. Soak for at least 4 hours. (To do a quick soak, you can pour boiling water over the beans and cover by a couple of inches, and just soak for one hour instead of four.)\n2 Cook beans with aromatics: Drain the beans. Return the beans to the pot and add 3 quarts of water to the pot. Add 2 Tbsp olive oil, the sage leaves, 2 cloves crushed garlic, 3 teaspoons kosher salt, and the peppercorns. Cover, bring to a simmer on medium heat, and simmer beans for one hour. Lower the heat so that the beans are barely simmering. Cook for an additional 1-2 hours, or until beans are just tender. Note that the fresher the beans the shorter the cooking time, the older the beans the longer the cooking time. Remove from heat and let cool in cooking liquid. Set aside 1/2 cup of the cooking liquid, drain the rest from the beans.\nPreparing canned beans if using:\nTaste the liquid in the cans of beans. If it tastes good (and it should), drain the beans and reserve 1/2 a cup of the bean liquid. If the liquid doesn't taste good (which may happen if the can has been sitting around too long), discard the liquid and use 1/2 cup of water instead of the bean liquid in the next step.\nPreparing the beans and sausage:\n3 Cook the sausage: Heat one tablespoon of olive oil in a large, heavy-bottomed skillet over medium heat. Remove sausages from their casings (if the sausage has come in casings), and cook in the skillet until lightly browned, about 3-4 minutes.\n4 Add the reserved bean cooking (or can) liquid, 4 Tbsp olive oil, garlic, chopped tomatoes, and red pepper flakes, stirring occasionally until slightly thickened, about 5 minutes.\n5 Add the reserved beans and tomato pur\xc3\xa9e. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Simmer a few minutes longer, stirring gently, until sausage is cooked through and the sauce has thickened. Be careful not to break up the beans.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b'Save It Print\nMexican Three Bean Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 20 minutesMarinating time: 1 hourYield: Serves 4-6\nINGREDIENTS\n1 15-ounce can black beans, drained and rinsed\n1 15-ounce can pinto beans, drained and rinsed\n1/2 pound green beans\nSalt\n3 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n3 green onions, sliced\n1-2 jalapenos, seeded, chopped\n1 large garlic clove, sliced thin\n1 cup Cotija queso seco cheese, crumbled (can sub feta)\n1/4 cup chopped cilantro\n1/3 cup lime juice\n1/4 cup sugar\nMETHOD\n1 Boil the green beans: Cut the ends off the green beans and slice into pieces about an inch long. Fill a medium sized pot halfway with well salted water. Bring to a boil.\nAdd the beans to the pot and boil for 5 minutes, or as long as it takes for the beans to get tender. Green beans can be highly variable in how long it takes to cook them to tenderness. More mature beans can take longer, up to 20 minutes.\n2 Combine with pinto beans, green onions, jalape\xc3\xb1os, garlic, Cotija, olive oil: Drain the green beans and put in the bowl with the pinto and black beans. Drizzle the olive oil over everything and toss to combine. Mix in the green onions, jalape\xc3\xb1o, garlic, and Cotija cheese.\n3 Make dressing, add to salad to marinate: In a separate bowl, mix the lime juice and sugar until the sugar dissolves, then add it to the salad. Coat the beans well and let marinate for at least 1 hour, preferably several hours.\n4 Right before you serve, toss in the cilantro. Add more salt to taste if needed.\nHello! b'Save It Print\nLemony Broccoli Rabe with White Beans Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 12 minutesYield: 4 servings\nINGREDIENTS\n1 bunch broccoli rabe, ends trimmed (about 2 1/2 pounds)\n1/2 teaspoon salt, or more to taste\n4 tablespoons olive oil\n1 lemon, very thinly sliced\n1 clove garlic, chopped\n2 (15-ounce) cans cannellini beans, drained and rinsed\n1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper\n1/2 cup water, or more if needed\n1 lemon, cut into wedges, for serving\nExtra crushed red pepper, for serving\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Prepare the broccoli rabe: Cut any thick stems (with leaves still attached) in half lengthwise. Then cut all the stems into 4-inch pieces.\n2 Blanch the broccoli rabe: Bring a saucepan of water to a boil and add 1/4 teaspoon of the salt. Add the broccoli rabe and cook for 1 minute, turning them in the water occasionally so they cook evenly.\nDrain and rinse with very cold water until the broccoli is no longer warm. Pat dry with paper towels.\n2 Cook the lemon slices: In a large heavy skillet over medium-high heat, heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil. Add the lemon slices, overlapping if necessary, and cook without disturbing for 2 minutes. Turn and cook the other sides for 2 minutes more. The slices should be browned in spots. Transfer to a clean plate.\n3 Warm the white beans: In the same skillet over medium heat (no need to clean), heat the remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil. Add the garlic, white beans, red pepper, and remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 2 minutes. Add the water and bring to a boil, lower the heat, and simmer for 1 minute more.\n4 Add the broccoli rabe to the pan and cook: Add the broccoli rabe and cook, stirring often, for 3 minutes, or until it is tender when the stems are pierced with the tip of a knife. During cooking, add more water if the pan seems dry. Stir in the lemon slices and turn them in the mixture until the slices are just heated through.\nTaste for seasoning and add more salt, if you like. Serve with lemon and red pepper.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nTurkey Black Bean Quinoa Bake Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 30 minutesYield: Serves 4 to 6\nTo save time, prep the ingredients and start on the onions and peppers while the quinoa is cooking.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 cup uncooked quinoa\n2 cups water\nSalt\n3 cups shredded, chopped cooked turkey\n2 Tbsp extra virgin olive oil\n2 cups onion, chopped\n2 bell peppers, seeded and chopped\n4 cloves garlic, minced\n1 cup frozen corn, defrosted\n1 teaspoon ground cumin\n1 teaspoon chili powder (chipotle chili powder if available), less or more to taste\n1 15-ounce can black beans, drained\n1/2 cup chopped cilantro\n3 cups grated cheddar cheese, divided 2 cups and 1 cup\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cook the quinoa: Cook the quinoa according to package directions. Typically package directions ask you to put 1 cup of quinoa with 2 cups of water and a pinch of salt into a pot, bringing it to a boil, reduce to a very low simmer, cover and cook for 15 minutes. Then remove from heat and fluff with a fork.\n2 Cook peppers and onions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet on medium high heat. Add the onions and the bell peppers and cook until softened and browned at the edges, about 10 minutes.\n3 Add garlic, spices, corn: Add the garlic, cumin, chili powder, and corn, and cook a minute more. Remove from heat.\n4 Place the cooked quinoa, black beans, onion mixture, cilantro, 2 cups of grated cheddar cheese, and cooked turkey in a large bowl. Toss to combine.\n5 Top with cheese and bake: Place in a casserole dish. Sprinkle the top with remaining 1 cup of cheddar cheese, and bake at 350\xc2\xb0F uncovered for 15 minutes, until the cheese is melted and bubbly.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nCheesy Quinoa Black Bean Stuffed Bell Peppers Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 1 hour, 10 minutesYield: Serves 4 to 6\nFor a non-vegetarian option, cook up some Mexican chorizo on medium heat until cooked through, and mix that in with the stuffing!\nAlthough I've focused on the orange and red bell peppers in the photographs, personally I prefer the green bell peppers with this dish.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 cup uncooked quinoa (white or red or both)\nSalt\n6 large bell peppers, any color\n1 15-ounce can black beans, drained\n4 cups grated sharp cheddar cheese, 2 cups for stuffing, 2 cups for topping\n3 to 4 green onions, finely sliced\n1 teaspoon ground cumin\n1/2 cup loosely packed chopped fresh cilantro (optional)\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cook the quinoa: Place 1 cup of quinoa, 2 cups of water, and 1/2 teaspoon of salt in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil, cover, reduce to a simmer and cook for 15 minutes.\nRemove from heat and let sit for 10 minutes, covered. Spread cooked quinoa out in a baking dish to cool quickly.\n2 Steam the bell peppers:  Cut the top 1/2 to 1 inch off of the bell peppers and remove the core and seeds inside. (If you want, you can finely chop the pieces of good bell pepper you've removed and include them in the stuffing, otherwise, save them for another use.)\nFill a large pot with an inch of water. Place a steamer rack in the pot, place the pepper shells on the steamer rack, cut side up. Bring to a boil, cover and steam the peppers 5 to 10 minutes, until they begin to soften.\n3 Make the filling: In a large bowl mix the cooked quinoa, drained black beans, 2 cups of the grated cheddar cheese, most of the green onion (save some for topping), cumin, and cilantro if using.\n4 Stuff the bell peppers with the stuffing you've prepared. You should have plenty of stuffing, you can pack it and mound the stuffing in the peppers. Place 1/4 cup of water at the base of the peppers.\n5 Bake: Cover with aluminum foil. Bake at 350\xc2\xb0F for 35 minutes. Then remove from oven, uncover, top with the remaining 2 cups of cheese, and return to the oven to cook, uncovered, until the cheese has melted about 5 to 10 minutes.\nSprinkle with remaining finely sliced green onions to serve.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Print\nThree Sisters Casserole with Cornbread Topping Recipe\nPrep time: 35 minutesCook time: 25 minutesYield: 8 servings\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the cornbread topping:\n1 1/4 cups yellow cornmeal\n1/2 cup all-purpose flour (or your favorite all-purpose gluten-free flour blend)\n2 teaspoons baking powder\n1 teaspoon kosher salt\n2 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted\n1/2 cup whole milk\n1/2 cup water\nFor the filling: \n3 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n1 yellow onion, diced (about 1 cup)\n4 cloves garlic, minced\n1 pound butternut or kabocha squash, peeled and cut into 1-inch cubes (about 2 cups)\n1 (15-ounce) can diced fire-roasted tomatoes\n2 tablespoons tomato paste\n1 teaspoon ground coriander\n1 1/2 teaspoons ground cumin\n1/2 teaspoon chili powder\n1/4 teaspoon smoked paprika\n1/2 teaspoon kosher salt\n3/4 cup vegetable broth\n1 cup fresh or frozen corn kernels\n1 (15-ounce) can kidney beans, rinsed and drained\n2 cups chopped greens (such as spinach or kale)\nMETHOD\n1 Preheat the oven to 350\xc2\xb0F. Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with non-stick cooking spray and set aside.\n2 Make the filling: In a large, high-sided skillet or Dutch oven, warm the olive oil over medium heat until it\xe2\x80\x99s shimmering and add the onions. Cook until translucent, about 4 to 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for an additional minute.\nAdd the squash, tomatoes, tomato paste, spices, and salt. Stir in the broth and bring mixture to a boil.\n3 Simmer the filling: Cover the pot and reduce heat to low. Simmer for 15 to 18 minutes, or until squash is tender.\n4 Make the cornbread topping while the filling simmers: In a medium mixing bowl, whisk together cornmeal, flour, baking powder, and salt. Using a wooden spoon, slowly stir in the butter, milk, and water; mix only until just combined. Set aside and let it sit for ten minutes or so, while the filling simmers.\n5 Add the rest of the ingredients to the filling: Stir in the corn, beans, and greens into the filling, and continue cooking, covered, for 3 to 5 minutes, until mixture has thickened slightly and all the ingredients are incorporated.\n5 Transfer to baking dish and bake: Scrape the filling into the prepared pan and top with generous biscuit-sized clumps of cornbread topping (this can be rustic and uneven).\nBake for 20 to 25 minutes, or until filling is bubbling and topping is golden brown.\n6 Serve: Remove from the oven allow to cool for 5-10 minutes before serving.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b"Save It Print\nBBQ Chicken Burrito Bowl Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 10 minutesYield: 4 servings\nIf you're making this for lunch, assemble the bowls in a lunch container, but pack the lettuce and salsa separately. Heat the bowls, then add top with the lettuce and salsa.\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the BBQ sauce (or substitute 3/4 to 1 cup bottled sauce):\n1 cup ketchup\n1/2 cup tomato sauce\n2 tablespoons distilled white vinegar (apple cider vinegar also works)\n2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce\n1 tablespoon honey (light brown sugar or maple syrup also works)\n2 1/2 teaspoons paprika\n1/2 teaspoon granulated garlic\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n1/4 teaspoon ground cumin\nFor the burrito bowls:\n1 pound (450g) chicken breasts (or substitute 2 cups cooked, shredded chicken)\n4 cups chicken broth or water, for cooking the chicken\n1 cup uncooked brown rice (or substitute 3 cups cooked rice)\n1 1/4 cup fresh or frozen corn kernels\n1 15-ounce (425g) can black beans, drained and rinsed\n6 to 8 romaine lettuce leaves, chopped into strips\n1 cup pico de gallo or your favorite salsa\n1 cup shredded cheddar or monterey jack cheese, optional\nCrushed tortilla chips, for topping\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\nDo-ahead steps:\n1 Make the barbecue sauce (or substitute 3/4 to 1 cup bottled sauce): Mix all of the ingredients for the BBQ sauce (ketchup through cumin) in a saucepan and heat over medium heat. When the sauce starts bubbling, reduce the heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes, stirring frequently. (This sauce splatters everywhere once it heats up. Be prepared to wipe down your stovetop and countertops after making this!) Remove from heat.\nYou should have about 1 2/3 cups of sauce.  The sauce will keep for 1 to 2 weeks refrigerated.\n2 Cook the chicken (or substitute 2 cups shredded cooked chicken): Place the chicken breasts in a 4-quart or larger pot with a lid and pour the chicken broth over top. The chicken should be covered by about an inch; add additional broth or water if needed. Place over high heat and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for 10 minutes. Check that the chicken is cooked through and registers 165F in the thickest part. Cook another few minutes if needed. Use tongs to transfer the cooked chicken breasts to a cutting board to cool briefly.\nWhen the chicken is cool, shred the meat into bite-sized pieces. Refrigerate in an air-tight container for up to 5 days.\n3 Cook the rice (or substitute 3 cups cooked rice): Combine the rice with 1/2 teaspoon of salt and 2 cups of water (or enough to cover by about an inch). Bring to a simmer over medium heat, then lower the heat and cover. Cook until the rice is tender, 35 to 45 minutes (or according to package instructions). Check occasionally and add more water if the pan seems dry before the rice is cooked.\nCool the cooked rice, and then transfer to a storage container. Refrigerate for up to 5 days.\n  To assemble the burrito bowls:\n1 Mix the chicken with the barbecue sauce: Warm the barbecue sauce for a few minutes in a small pan or skillet over medium-high heat. Add the shredded chicken and stir to coat with the barbecue sauce. Leave the chicken in the pan until it has warmed through, about 2 to 3 minutes. Turn off heat.\n2 Warm the corn and beans: Heat the corn and black beans together or separately in a pan or skillet over medium-high heat for 2 to 3 minutes. Add a pinch of salt to your corn and beans and turn off heat.\n3 Warm the rice in the microwave or on a pan. If you are using the microwave, pour the rice into a large bowl and cover it with a damp paper towel. Microwave the rice on high for about 1 minute. Check to see if the rice has warmed through. If it is still cold in some spots, give everything a stir and continue microwaving at 15-second intervals, until the rice is heated to your liking.\n4 Assemble the burrito bowls: Divide the rice, chicken, corn, beans, romaine lettuce, and pico de gallo into 4 bowls. Top with cheese, if using, and then crush a few tortilla chips on top of each bowl for extra crunch.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nWhite Bean Soup with Ham, Pumpkin, and Chard Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesCook time: 2 hours, 30 minutesYield: Serves 5-6\nThis recipe calls for a sugar pumpkin (the kind you use to make pies). You can easily substitute the same quantity of butternut squash or almost any winter squash.\nINGREDIENTS\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n2 cups chopped yellow onion\n3 bay leaves\n2 stalks of celery, chopped\n4 cloves garlic, peeled and minced\nOne 2 pound whole sugar pumpkin, halved, seeds scooped out, flesh peeled, and cut into 1-inch chunks (resulting in 3 1/2 cups or 1 pound of chunks)\n1/2  pound ham hock\n8 cups chicken stock\n1 15-ounce can of whole peeled tomatoes, drained OR 1 large fresh, ripe tomato, peeled and chopped\n6 sprigs of thyme, tied with string (or 1/2 teaspoon dried thyme)\n2 15-ounce cans of cannellini white beans, rinsed and drained, or homemade\n4 large Swiss chard leaves (can substitute kale), center rib removed, leaves roughly chopped\nFreshly ground black pepper to taste\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Saut\xc3\xa9 onions, bay leaves, celery, garlic: Heat the olive oil on medium heat in a large, thick-bottomed pot (5 to 6 quart). Add the onion and the bay leaves and cook for 2 to 3 minutes, until slightly softened. Add the chopped celery, cook for 2 to 3 more minutes. Add the minced garlic and cook for a minute more.\n2 Add pumpkin, ham hock, stock, tomatoes, thyme: Add the chopped pumpkin and the ham hock to the pot. Add the chicken stock, tomatoes, and thyme. Increase heat to bring to a simmer. Reduce heat to maintain a simmer, uncovered. Let simmer for an hour and a half.\n3 Remove ham hock, add white beans, chard: Remove the ham hock from the soup pot, to a plate to let cool enough to handle.  Add the white beans and cook for 15 minutes. Add the chopped chard, simmer until chard is wilted, a few minutes more.\n4 Strip ham from bone, chop, return to soup: Strip the meat from the ham hock, chop it, and return to the pot. Add 1 to 2 cups of water to the soup to thin it to your preference. Remove the bay leaves before serving.\nAdd freshly ground black pepper and adjust seasonings to taste.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Print\nSweet Potato White Bean Dip Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 30 minutesYield: 6 to 8 servings\nNote from the Editors: During testing, we found that we preferred the flavor and texture of this dip when it was served cold, though you could definitely also serve it at room temperature!\nINGREDIENTS\n1 pound sweet potatoes\n2 shallots (about 1/4 pound), cut into 4 pieces each\n4 tablespoons olive oil, divided\n1 teaspoon sea salt\n1 15-ounce can (or 1 1/2 cups cooked) white beans, drained (reserve the liquid) and rinsed\n1 to 2 chipotles in adobo sauce\n2 tablespoons lime juice\n1/4 cup cilantro, plus more for serving\nFor serving:\nChips\nChopped cilantro\nSpecial equipment:\nFood processor\nMETHOD\n1 Roast the sweet potatoes: Preheat your oven to 450\xcb\x9aF. Peel the sweet potatoes and cut into 1 1/2-inch cubes.\nPlace both the sweet potatoes and shallots on a rimmed baking sheet and toss with 2 tablespoons of olive oil and sea salt. Roast until the sweet potatoes are tender, about 25 to 30 minutes.\n2 Make the dip: Place the roasted sweet potatoes and shallots in a food processor or blender along with the white beans, 2 tablespoons olive oil, chipotles, lime juice, and cilantro. Puree, adding reserved bean liquid as needed, until the dip is smooth and thick, like a hummus would be.\n3 Serve the dip: Serve immediately or refrigerate until needed; serve room temperature or cold. Sprinkle the top of the dip with cilantro, and serve with your favorite tortilla chips or an assortment of fresh vegetables.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Print\nPinto Beans with Bacon and Jalape\xc3\xb1os Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 25 minutesYield: Serves 4-6\nINGREDIENTS\n1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil\n2 to 3 whole jalape\xc3\xb1o chile peppers\n2 to 3 thick-cut slices of bacon\n2 cups of chopped onion\n2 medium clove of garlic, minced\n4 cups of cooked pinto beans (2 15-ounce cans, rinsed and drained)\nSalt\n1/2 cup, loosely packed, chopped fresh cilantro\nMETHOD\n1 Cook and prep jalape\xc3\xb1os: Heat oil in a medium skillet on high heat. Put the jalape\xc3\xb1os in the pan and stir to coat with the oil. Let cook, turning occasionally, on all sides, until all sides are nicely browned (about 10-15 minutes, depending on how hot your burner is).\nRemove from pan. Cut away and discard the stem, core, seeds, and veins. Coarsely chop the remaining jalape\xc3\xb1o flesh.\n2 Cook bacon: While the jalape\xc3\xb1os are cooking, cook the bacon slices on medium low heat in a large skillet, until crispy. Remove bacon from the pan to a paper towel-lined plate. Pour off (do not discard down the drain!) all but 2 tablespoons of bacon fat.\n3 Cook onion in bacon fat: Add the chopped onion to the pan with the bacon fat. Increase the heat to medium high and cook until translucent and lightly browned. Add the minced garlic and cook a minute more. While the onion is cooking, chop the cooked bacon.\n4 Add the cooked beans, chopped bacon, and the chopped jalape\xc3\xb1os to the pan and stir to mix. Sprinkle with salt.\nServe with chopped fresh cilantro, and steak and salsa.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Print\nWhite Bean and Cherry Tomato Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 25 minutesYield: Serves 6 to 8\nINGREDIENTS\n1 15-ounce cans of white beans, such as Great Northern or cannellini beans, drained and rinsed\n1 pint cherry or plum tomatoes, halved\n1/3 cup coarsely chopped parsley\nDressing ingredients:\n1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil\n3 cloves garlic, peeled and smashed\n1 3-inch sprig of fresh rosemary\n3 anchovy fillets, coarsely chopped (omit for vegetarian option)\n1/4 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese\n3/4 teaspoon Kosher salt\n1/4 teaspoon freshly ground pepper\n1 teaspoon lemon zest\n1/4 cup of lemon juice\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Infuse rosemary in olive oil: Place the garlic and sprig of rosemary in the olive oil in a small saucepan. Heat the oil on medium until the rosemary begins to sizzle.\nRemove the pan from the heat and let sit for 20 minutes, allowing the rosemary and garlic to infuse in the oil.\n2 Make the dressing: Remove rosemary sprig from the oil, discard. Remove the garlic from the oil, reserving the oil.\nAdd the garlic, anchovies (omit for vegetarian option), Parmesan cheese, salt, pepper, lemon zest, and lemon juice to a food processor or mini chopper. Pulse until smooth.\n3 Mix dressing with beans: In a medium bowl, gently mix the garlic Parmesan lemon mixture in with the beans until the beans are well coated.\nLet the beans sit for a few minutes so they absorb some of the dressing.\n4 Gently mix in the reserved olive oil, tomatoes, and parsley.\nHello! b'Save It Print\nEasy Stovetop Baked Beans Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 30 minutesYield: Serves 6-8\nINGREDIENTS\n1/2 pound thick-cut bacon, cut crosswise into 1/4-inch wide strips\n1/2 peeled onion, stem intact\n4 (15-ounce) cans navy beans, rinsed and drained\n1 (8-ounce) can tomato sauce\n3 tablespoons molasses\n2 tablespoons brown sugar\n2 teaspoons dry mustard powder\n1 bay leaf\n1 teaspoon salt\n1 cup water\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cook the bacon: In a large soup pot over medium heat, cook the bacon, turning often, for 5 minutes, or until browned. Pour off and discard about half the excess fat. Set aside about 1/4 cup bacon for garnish.\n2 Cook the beans: Add the onion half, drained beans, tomato sauce, molasses, brown sugar, mustard powder, bay leaf, salt, and water to the pot. Bring to a simmer over medium heat.\nCover the pot and simmer for 25 to 30 minutes, or until the sauce is thick. If your sauce doesn\xe2\x80\x99t seem to be thickening to your liking, remove the lid for the final 5 minutes of cooking. Remove the onion half and bay leaf.\n  3 To serve: Serve the beans from the pot, or transfer them to a bowl, and sprinkle the reserved bacon on top.\nHello! b"Print\nCreamy Tomato and White Bean Soup Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 35 minutesYield: 6 servings\nWhen it's fresh and in season, basil makes a nice alternative to the rosemary in this recipe.\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the soup:\n2 tablespoons olive oil\n1 large onion, chopped\n2 medium cloves garlic, thinly sliced\n3 pounds ripe plum (Roma) tomatoes, cut into 1-inch pieces (or 2 (28-ounce) cans whole tomatoes and their juices, crushed in a bowl)\n1 15-ounce can cannellini beans, drained and rinsed, or homemade\n1 sprig fresh rosemary\n1 1/2 cups water, plus more as needed\n1/2 cup freshly grated Parmesan\n1 teaspoon salt, plus more to taste\n1/8 teaspoon black pepper, plus more to taste\nFor the garnish:\n12 cherry tomatoes, sliced or quartered\n1 tablespoon olive oil\n1 teaspoon red wine vinegar\nSalt and pepper, to taste\n12 basil leaves, thinly sliced\nSpecial Equipment:\nBlender or immersion blender\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cook the onion and garlic: Heat the oil in a soup pot over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 6 to 8 minutes, or until softened.\n2 Add the tomatoes and beans: Add the fresh or canned tomatoes, rosemary, beans, 1 1/2 cups of water, salt, and pepper to the pot. Bring to a simmer and cook, uncovered, for 20 minutes, or until the tomatoes are very soft. Remove the rosemary sprig. Stir in the Parmesan.\n3 Puree the soup: In 2- to 3-cup batches, puree the soup in a blender until smooth, or use an immersion blender. (Warning! The soup is hot! To puree hot liquid in a blender, only fill it 1/3 full. Cover the lid with a folded dishtowel and hold it down with your hand. Start on low speed, and increase the speed gradually.)\nTransfer the soup to a pot and stir in enough additional water to bring the soup to your desired consistency (up to 2 1/2 cups of water). Taste and add salt and pepper, if you like. Reheat over low heat until hot.\n4 Make the garnish: In a bowl, stir together the tomatoes, oil, vinegar, salt, and pepper. Just before serving, stir in the basil.\n5 Serve the soup: Ladle the soup into bowls, and top each bowl with the fresh tomato garnish.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b"Save It Print\nChickpea Potato Curry Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 45 minutesYield: Serves 4-6\nAdapted from a recipe by Ann Martin Rolke in her book, Hands-Off Cooking: Low-Supervision, High-Flavor Meals for Busy People.\nINGREDIENTS\n2 1/2 cups vegetable broth\nTwo 15-ounce cans chickpeas (garbanzo beans), drained and rinsed, or about 3 cups cooked\nOne 14 1/2-ounce can fire-roasted or stewed tomatoes with chiles (See Muir Glen. If you can't find canned tomatoes with chiles you can add half a 4-ounce can of diced green Anaheim chiles to a 14.5 ounce can of tomatoes.)\n6 baby (new) Yukon Gold potatoes (about 12 ounces), quartered\n1 medium onion, diced (about 2 cups)\n2 tablespoons unsalted butter (or ghee if you have it, or you can sub extra virgin olive oil)\n2 teaspoons minced ginger\n1-2 teaspoons salt\n1 teaspoon ground cumin\n1 teaspoon ground coriander\n1/8 to 1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper (to taste)\nMETHOD\n1 Saut\xc3\xa9 onions and ginger: In a large pot, heat the butter over medium-high heat and saut\xc3\xa9 the onions and ginger until the onion begins to brown, about 4-5 minutes.\n2 Add the seasonings: Add the salt, cumin, coriander and cayenne, stir to combine and cook for another minute or two.\n3 Add the remaining ingredients, stir to mix and simmer, partially covered, for about 35 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender. Add more salt to taste.\nServe the curry in bowls over rice. Great accompanied with plain yogurt.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nBlack-Eyed Pea Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 35 minutesYield: Serves 8-10\nYou can substitute canned black-eyed peas for the dry peas. Use approximately two 15-ounce cans. Rinse thoroughly. Skip step 1 and step 3 in the method instructions.\nINGREDIENTS\n2 cups dry black-eyed peas\nSalt\n1 package of feta cheese, about 7 ounces\n1 jar of sun-dried tomatoes in oil, about 8 ounces\n1 cup black olives, preferably Kalamata or oil-cured\n1 finely chopped green onion\n1 finely chopped garlic clove\n1 large bunch of spinach, about 1 pound, washed, chopped\nZest and juice of a lemon\nMETHOD\n1 Bring a medium pot of water to a boil. Add enough salt to make the water taste like the sea. Turn the heat down to low and add the black-eyed peas. Let them cook slowly, uncovered, until they are done, anywhere from 30 minutes to an hour, depending on how old the peas are. Don\xe2\x80\x99t let the water simmer.\n2 Add the spinach to a large bowl. Crumble the feta cheese into the bowl and add all the other ingredients except the lemon juice. Mix well.\n3 When the black-eyed peas are done, pour them into a colander and spray them with cold water to stop the cooking. Pick through and discard any loose skins or mashed peas; you\xe2\x80\x99ll find a few, but hopefully not many.\n4 Add the black-eyed peas to the salad, mix well and serve. Squirt some lemon juice over each serving before you take them to the table.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. b"Print\nCreamy Polenta with White Beans and Roasted Broccoli Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 30 minutesYield: 4 servings\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the polenta:\n2 cups water\n3/4 teaspoon salt\n1/2 cup yellow polenta\nFor the roasted broccoli:\n4 cups chopped broccoli\n2 tablespoons olive oil\n1/2 teaspoon sea salt\nFor the white beans:\n1 cup white beans, homemade or canned, drained and rinsed\n3 tablespoons olive oil\n1 tablespoon nutritional yeast\n1 teaspoon garlic powder\n1/4 teaspoon onion powder\nPinch of salt\nFor the chili oil:\n1/4 cup olive oil\n2 teaspoons chili flakes\nMETHOD\n1 Make the polenta: Bring the water and salt for the polenta to a boil over medium heat in a 2-quart saucepan. Once it's boiling, add the polenta and whisk until the polenta is fully incorporated.\nLower the heat (as low as it can go) and cook the polenta for 20 to 25 minutes, stirring every 5 to 10 minutes with a whisk to break up any clumps.\n2 Roast the broccoli: Heat your oven to 425\xcb\x9aF. Arrange the chopped broccoli on a rimmed baking sheet and toss with the 2 tablespoons of olive oil and salt. Roast until the broccoli is tender and beginning to char, about 15 to 20 minutes.\n3  Make the bean puree: While the polenta and broccoli are cooking, combine the drained beans with the olive oil, nutritional yeast, garlic powder, onion powder, and salt in the bowl of a food processor or in a high speed blender. Puree until smooth, adding a few tablespoons of water as needed to help smooth it out.\nWhen the polenta is done cooking, stir the bean puree into the polenta.\n4 Make the chili oil: Heat the oil in a small skillet. Add the chili flakes, remove from the heat, and let it rest until ready to serve. (You can make this ahead of time!)\n5 Assemble the bowls: Divide the polenta among four bowls. Top with the broccoli and a drizzle of the chili oil.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b"Print\nChipotle Bean Tostadas Recipe\nYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\nThe Beans\n2 Tbsp extra virgin olive oil\n1 medium onion, chopped\n1 teaspoon ground cumin\nAbout 4 cups of cooked pinto beans, drained, or or 2 15-oz cans\n4 teaspoons of Chipotle Tabasco Sauce (definitely do not use regular Tabasco sauce, only the Chipotle kind)\nSalt\nThe Tostadas\n1/2 cup peanut oil or canola oil\n1 dozen corn tortillas\nSalt\n1 cup of crumbled Cotija Queso Seco (Mexican farmers cheese) or you can use feta cheese\n1 cup finely diced fresh tomato\n1/2 cup thinly sliced red radishes\n1/2 cup loosely packed cilantro leaves\nOptional\nIceberg lettuce, thinly sliced and sprinkled with vinegar and salt\nGuacamole\nSour cream\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cook and mash the beans: Prepare the beans by saut\xc3\xa9ing onions in oil until softened in a large, thick-bottomed skillet. Add ground cumin and cook an additional 30 seconds. Add the beans, a teaspoon of salt, and a cup of water.\nUse a potato masher to mash the beans into the pan, until the consistency of (somewhat lumpy) mashed potatoes. Cook for a few minutes on medium hight heat until water is absorbed.\nStir in the Chipotle Tabasco sauce and season to taste with more salt if needed. Remove to a warm burner out of the way, cover.\n2 Make the tostada shells: To prepare the tortillas, heat the oven to 200\xc2\xb0F. Line a baking pan with paper towels and place next to the stove. Heat 5 Tbsp of oil in a small skillet on medium high heat, until the bubbles form immediately when you insert the edge of a tortilla in it.\nUsing tongs, place a tortilla in the hot oil and let cook until golden brown on both sides, about 30 seconds per side. You can use a metal spatula to flatten down the tortilla while cooking.\nUse tongs to lift the cooked tortilla out of the pan, allowing the excess oil to drip off of it, back into the pan. Place the cooked tortilla on the paper towels to absorb more of the oil. Sprinkle a little salt onto each warm tortilla.\nDo each tortilla one at a time this way. As you fill up a baking pan, put the pan in the oven to keep the tortillas warm.\nAdd more oil as needed. Carefully monitor the oil temperature. Don't let it get too hot, or the tortillas will burn, or too cool - they won't fry up crisp enough.\n3 Arrange toppings to serve: To serve, arrange the cheese, cilantro and tomatoes in separate small bowls. Put beans into a serving dish. Bring out the tortillas by batches, keeping the rest warm in the oven.\nLet people spread beans on to their tortillas and add sprinkle on the cheese, cilantro and tomatoes for each tostada.\nOptional additions are sliced lettuce, guacamole, sour cream, and salsa (though with the chipotle, you probably don't need any more heat).\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b'Save It Print\nPasta and Bean Picnic Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 30 minutesCook time: 10 minutesYield: 8 to 12 servings as a side dish\nThis recipe can be prepared up to a day ahead.\nINGREDIENTS\n3 teaspoons salt\n1 pound small-shaped pasta (curly, twisted, corkscrew, shells, or bow-ties)\n7 tablespoons olive oil, divided\n2 cans (15-to 16-ounces each) white beans, like Great Northern, navy, or cannellini, drained and rinsed\nZest of 1 lemon\n2 tablespoons apple cider vinegar\n1 heaping teaspoon Dijon mustard\n1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper\n1 pint mixed cherry or grape tomatoes, sliced or cut into quarters\n2 stalks celery, halved lengthwise and very thinly sliced\n1/2 red onion, very thinly sliced\n1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cook the pasta: Bring a large pot of water with 2 teaspoons of the salt to a boil. Add the pasta and cook, stirring occasionally, for 8 minutes or until the pasta is tender.\nDrain but do not rinse; shake the colander to remove excess water.\n2 Combine the pasta and beans: Transfer the pasta to a large bowl and sprinkle with 3 tablespoons of the olive oil. Shake the bowl to distribute the oil.\nAdd the rinsed beans and lemon zest to the hot pasta. Stir the salad gently. Leave to cool.\n3 Make the dressing: In a bowl, whisk the vinegar, mustard, remaining 1 teaspoon salt, and pepper. Slowly whisk in the remaining 4 tablespoons oil until it is all added.\nTaste for seasoning and add more salt and pepper, if you like.\n4 Finish mixing the salad: Pour the dressing over the pasta and beans and stir. Add the tomatoes, celery, onion, and parsley to the pasta mixture and stir gently but thoroughly.\nTaste for seasoning and add more salt and pepper, if you like. You can also squeeze some lemon juice over the top if it needs a touch more brightness.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nChickpea and Tomato Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesYield: Serves 6-8\nIf you really want to take the dressing up a notch, add 4 minced anchovies (salted, canned) to the mix. The dressing will not taste like anchovies, but the addition will make everything taste better.\nINGREDIENTS\n2 15-ounce cans of garbanzo beans (chickpeas), drained and rinsed, or 3 cups cooked chickpeas\n4 tomatoes (about 2 lbs.), cored and chopped\n4 large hard-boiled eggs, peeled and chopped\n1 cup of chopped red onion, green onion, or sweet yellow onion\n2 Tbsp chopped fresh parsley\nDressing:\n1/2 cup extra-virgin olive oil\n4 Tbsp of white wine vinegar or sherry vinegar\n3 cloves garlic, minced (about 1 Tbsp)\n1 teaspoon Dijon mustard\n1 teaspoon salt\n1/2 teaspoon freshly ground pepper\n1/2 teaspoon Italian seasoning (or 1/2 teaspoon dry thyme or a teaspoon of fresh chopped thyme)\nMETHOD\n1 Combine the garbanzo beans, tomatoes, and onions in a large bowl.\n2 Put the dressing ingredients into a small jar, close the lid and shake until the dressing is emulsified. Pour over beans, tomatoes and onions.\nYou can chill the undressed salad up to six hours, until ready to serve.\n3 When ready to serve, gently stir in the chopped eggs and parsley.\nHello! b"Save It Print\nTomato, White Bean, Bacon Soup Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 45 minutesYield: Serves 8-10\nWe've used canned white beans here for their convenience. If you want you can take this soup up a notch and use dried beans, you can make them on the stovetop or in a pressure cooker.\nINGREDIENTS\n1/4 pound bacon, diced\n1 large onion, chopped (about 2 cups)\n2 cloves garlic, minced\n2 cups peeled (about 3/4 lb), chopped potatoes (recommend Yukon Gold)\n6 cups peeled, chopped fresh tomatoes (or canned whole tomatoes with juice)*\n2 cups chicken stock or broth\n1 Tbsp dark brown sugar\n1 15-ounce can white beans, drained\nSalt and pepper to taste\n* To peel fresh tomatoes, cut a shallow cross on one end, blanch in boiling water for about 30 seconds, remove from boiling water and the peels should easily come off.\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cook bacon: Cook bacon on medium heat in a large thick-bottomed pot (5 to 6 quart) until lightly browned and fat is rendered.\nUse a slotted spoon to remove bacon from the pan. Set on a plate lined with a paper towel. Drain off all but 1 Tbsp of bacon fat.\n2 Saut\xc3\xa9 onion and garlic, add potatoes: Add the chopped onion to the pot, cook in the bacon fat on medium heat until soft.\nAdd the minced garlic and cook a minute more.\nAdd the chopped peeled potatoes and cook a few minutes more.\n3 Add tomatoes, stock, simmer: Add the tomatoes and chicken broth. Bring to a boil, lower heat to maintain a simmer. Cover and cook until potatoes are cooked through, about 20 minutes (or longer).\n4 Add beans, blend half the soup: Stir in the brown sugar. Add half of the beans to the mixture. Use an immersion blender to blend about half of the soup mixture (or blend half of the soup in a standing blender and return to the pot).\n5 Add bacon, remaining beans: Add bacon to the soup and the rest of the beans. Add salt and pepper to taste.\nServe with crusty bread.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b"Save It Print\nSriracha Orange Glazed Green Beans Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 10 minutesYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n3/4 pound to 1 pound of green beans, tough ends snipped off and discarded\nSalt\n1/3 cup sweet orange marmalade\n1 1/2 teaspoons soy sauce\n1/2 teaspoon sriracha\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Boil green beans in salted water: Fill a 4 quart pot half-way with water. Add 2 teaspoons of salt. Bring water to a boil. Place green beans in the boiling water. Cook for 5 minutes, or until the green beans are just tender.\nIf your green beans are fresh and young, they should cook quickly. If they are older tougher beans, they may take longer than 5 minutes to cook.\nWhen the are just cooked to the point of tenderness, remove the pot from heat and strain out the hot water.\nPlace the beans into a bowl of icy water to quickly stop the cooking and then place them in a large bowl.\n2 Mix marmalade, soy sauce, Sriracha: While the beans are cooking stir together in a small bowl the orange marmalade, soy sauce, and Sriracha hot sauce. Taste and adjust proportions to your taste.\nIf you are using a marmalade that isn't particularly sweet, you may want to add a teaspoon or two of sugar. If you are using soy sauce that isn't very salty, you may want to add a little more soy sauce. Add more Sriracha to taste if you would like the sauce spicier.\n3 Toss cooked green beans with sauce: Add the marmalade sauce to the cooked green beans and toss to coat.\nServe immediately.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nThree Bean Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesYield: Serves 4 to 8\nPrep the onion first. Soak the chopped onion in a small bowl of water to take the edge off the onion while you prep the other ingredients.\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the salad:\n1 (15-ounce) can cannellini beans, rinsed and drained\n1 (15-ounce) can kidney beans, rinsed and drained\n1 (15-ounce) can garbanzo beans, rinsed and drained\n1/2 red onion, finely chopped (about 3/4 cup), soaked in water to take the edge off the onion\n2 celery stalks, finely chopped (about 1 cup)\n1 cup loosely packed, fresh, finely chopped flat-leaf parsley\n1 teaspoon fresh finely chopped rosemary\nFor the dressing:\n1/3 cup apple cider vinegar\n1/4 cup granulated sugar (more or less to taste)\n3 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n1 1/2 teaspoons salt\n1/4 teaspoon black pepper\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Make the salad: In a large bowl, mix the 3 different types of beans, the celery, onion (drained of soaking water), parsley, and rosemary.\n2 Make the dressing: In a separate small bowl, whisk together the vinegar, sugar, olive oil, salt, and pepper. Add the dressing to the beans. Toss to coat.\n3 Chill and Serve: Transfer the salad to the refrigerator for several hours, to allow the beans to soak up the flavor of the dressing. Let come to close to room temperature to serve.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nGreen Bean Salad with Basil, Balsamic, and Parmesan Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: Serves 6\nTo save time, while the water is coming to a boil, prep the other ingredients.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 1/2 pounds trimmed green beans, cut to 2 to 3 inch long pieces\nSalt\n1/2 cup finely chopped red onion (or shallots)\n2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar\n4 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n3/4 cup chopped fresh basil leaves\n3/4 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese (about 1 1/2 ounces)\nFreshly ground black pepper\nMETHOD\n1 Soak chopped onions in water: Place the chopped onions in a small bowl of water. This will help take the edge off the onions. Let sit while you prepare the rest of the salad.\n2 Blanch the green beans: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil (2 Tbsp salt for 2 quarts of water). Add the green beans to the water and blanch only for about 2 minutes or so, until the beans are just barely cooked through, but still crisp.\nFresh young beans should cook quickly. Older, tougher beans may take longer.\n3 Shock in ice water: While the beans are cooking, prepare a large bowl of ice water. When the beans are ready, use a slotted spoon to remove them from the boiling water to the ice water to stop the cooking.\nDrain the green beans and the red onions.\n4 Toss with red onion, balsamic, Parmesan: Place the green beans, red onion, and chopped basil in a large bowl. Sprinkle in the olive oil, toss to coat. Sprinkle in the balsamic and Parmesan cheese. Toss to combine. Season to taste with salt and freshly ground black pepper.\nChill until ready to serve.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nQuick and Easy White Bean Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesYield: Serves 4\nYou can easily double or quadruple the recipe to serve a larger group.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 14.5-ounce can white beans, drained but not rinsed\n2 tablespoons chopped red onion\nA squeeze of lemon juice\n2 teaspoons wine vinegar (red or white)\n1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil\n1/2 teaspoon dry Herbs de Provence (crumbled) OR 1 teaspoon of some combination of finely chopped rosemary, tarragon, thyme, and lavender\nSalt and freshly ground pepper to taste\nMETHOD\n1 Let the onion marinate in lemon juice: After you chop up the onion, squeeze a little lemon juice over it and let it sit while prepping the other ingredients. According to my mother, this will take the edge off the onion.\n2 Combine all ingredients into a serving dish. You can serve right away if you want, but if you chill for a few hours, the flavors will come together better.\nLasts a couple of days in the refrigerator.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Print\nWhite Bean and Tuna Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n1 cup of chopped red onions or shallots\nThe zest and juice of 1 lemon or 2 limes (can sub a tablespoon or two of cider vinegar)\n2 five to six ounce cans of tuna packed in olive oil\n2 15-ounce cans of cannellini or Great Northern white beans, rinsed and drained\n1/2 cup (loosely packed) of chopped parsley or arugula, or 2 tablespoons thinly sliced mint\nA few splashes of Tabasco sauce, or 1 minced Serrano chile or 1 teaspoon red chile flakes\n1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper\nSalt and more extra virgin olive oil to taste\nMETHOD\n1 Sprinkle some of the lemon juice over the chopped onions while you prepare the other ingredients. This will take some of the oniony edge off the onions.\n2 Combine ingredients in a bowl: Drain the oil from the tuna and put the tuna into a large bowl. Add the beans to the tuna and gently stir to combine.\nAdd the onions, herbs, black pepper, lemon zest and lemon juice and mix to combine. Add Tabasco or chili to taste.\nIf the salad needs more acid, add a little more lemon juice. If the salad seems a little dry, add a little bit of extra virgin olive oil. Add salt to taste.\n3 Chill before serving. This salad will last several days in the fridge, tightly covered.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'

b"Print\nBlack Bean Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesYield: Serves 6 to 8\nWe've sample many brands of canned black beans (see our Black Bean Burrito Bowl for details). Our favorites for flavor are S&W Premium Black Beans, Bush's Best Black Beans, and Goya.\nThis black bean salad uses cilantro. For those of you who don't like cilantro, feel free to substitute with fresh basil.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 (15 ounce) can of black beans, rinsed and drained (or 1 1/2 cups of freshly cooked black beans)\n1 1/2 cups frozen corn, defrosted (or fresh corn, parboiled, drained and cooled, or grilled and cooled)\n1/2 cup chopped green onions (including onion greens) or shallots\n1/2 fresh jalape\xc3\xb1o pepper, seeded and minced, or 1/2 pickled jalape\xc3\xb1o pepper, minced (not seeded)\n3 fresh plum tomatoes, seeded and chopped and/or 1 red bell pepper, seeded and chopped\n2 tablespoons lime juice (about the juice from one lime)\n1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil\n1 avocado, peeled, seeded, and cut into chunks\n1/2 to 1 teaspoon of sugar (to taste)\nSalt and pepper to taste\n1/2 cup chopped fresh cilantro\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 In a large bowl, gently combine the black beans, corn, chopped green onions, minced jalape\xc3\xb1os, chopped tomatoes (or red bell pepper), lime juice, and olive oil. Gently fold in the chopped avocados.\n2 Add salt and pepper to taste. Sprinkle with sugar to taste, enough to balance the acidity from the lime juice.  Chill.\n3 Right before serving, add the chopped fresh cilantro.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b'Save It Print\nMexican Three Bean Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 20 minutesMarinating time: 1 hourYield: Serves 4-6\nINGREDIENTS\n1 15-ounce can black beans, drained and rinsed\n1 15-ounce can pinto beans, drained and rinsed\n1/2 pound green beans\nSalt\n3 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n3 green onions, sliced\n1-2 jalapenos, seeded, chopped\n1 large garlic clove, sliced thin\n1 cup Cotija queso seco cheese, crumbled (can sub feta)\n1/4 cup chopped cilantro\n1/3 cup lime juice\n1/4 cup sugar\nMETHOD\n1 Boil the green beans: Cut the ends off the green beans and slice into pieces about an inch long. Fill a medium sized pot halfway with well salted water. Bring to a boil.\nAdd the beans to the pot and boil for 5 minutes, or as long as it takes for the beans to get tender. Green beans can be highly variable in how long it takes to cook them to tenderness. More mature beans can take longer, up to 20 minutes.\n2 Combine with pinto beans, green onions, jalape\xc3\xb1os, garlic, Cotija, olive oil: Drain the green beans and put in the bowl with the pinto and black beans. Drizzle the olive oil over everything and toss to combine. Mix in the green onions, jalape\xc3\xb1o, garlic, and Cotija cheese.\n3 Make dressing, add to salad to marinate: In a separate bowl, mix the lime juice and sugar until the sugar dissolves, then add it to the salad. Coat the beans well and let marinate for at least 1 hour, preferably several hours.\n4 Right before you serve, toss in the cilantro. Add more salt to taste if needed.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nWhite Bean and Cherry Tomato Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 25 minutesYield: Serves 6 to 8\nINGREDIENTS\n1 15-ounce cans of white beans, such as Great Northern or cannellini beans, drained and rinsed\n1 pint cherry or plum tomatoes, halved\n1/3 cup coarsely chopped parsley\nDressing ingredients:\n1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil\n3 cloves garlic, peeled and smashed\n1 3-inch sprig of fresh rosemary\n3 anchovy fillets, coarsely chopped (omit for vegetarian option)\n1/4 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese\n3/4 teaspoon Kosher salt\n1/4 teaspoon freshly ground pepper\n1 teaspoon lemon zest\n1/4 cup of lemon juice\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Infuse rosemary in olive oil: Place the garlic and sprig of rosemary in the olive oil in a small saucepan. Heat the oil on medium until the rosemary begins to sizzle.\nRemove the pan from the heat and let sit for 20 minutes, allowing the rosemary and garlic to infuse in the oil.\n2 Make the dressing: Remove rosemary sprig from the oil, discard. Remove the garlic from the oil, reserving the oil.\nAdd the garlic, anchovies (omit for vegetarian option), Parmesan cheese, salt, pepper, lemon zest, and lemon juice to a food processor or mini chopper. Pulse until smooth.\n3 Mix dressing with beans: In a medium bowl, gently mix the garlic Parmesan lemon mixture in with the beans until the beans are well coated.\nLet the beans sit for a few minutes so they absorb some of the dressing.\n4 Gently mix in the reserved olive oil, tomatoes, and parsley.\nHello!
