b'Save It Print\nCarbonnade Beef and Beer Stew Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 3 hours, 30 minutesYield: Serves 6\nYou are trying to achieve a sweet and sour flavor with this stew. You can swap out the sugar for tomato paste and you can use cider vinegar instead of mustard if you want.\nYou can brown the meat in vegetable oil instead of butter, though it will be more flavorful with the butter. You can also use a couple slices of bread, instead of adding flour, to thicken the stew.\nINGREDIENTS\n3 1/2 lbs chuck roast, cut into 1-inch pieces\nSalt and freshly ground black pepper\n4 Tbsp butter, divided 2 Tbsp and 2 Tbsp\n3 medium yellow onions sliced about 1/4 inch thick (about 8 cups)\n3 Tbsp all-purpose flour\n1 1/2 cups chicken or beef broth\n1 1/2 cups (12 oz bottle) Belgian beer\n4 sprigs fresh thyme\n2 bay leaves\n1 Tbsp whole grain mustard\n1 Tbsp brown sugar\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Brown the beef: Pat beef dry with paper towels, then season well with salt and pepper. On the stove top, heat 2 tablespoons of butter in a large heavy bottomed dutch oven over medium-high heat until hot, almost smoking.\nWorking in batches, brown the meat, without stirring, about 3 minutes on each side (do not stir, give the meat an opportunity to brown well).\nTransfer browned beef to a separate bowl.\n2 Cook the onions: Add 2 tablespoons butter to dutch oven; reduce heat to medium. Add the onions and 1/2 teaspoon of salt; cook until onions are browned, about 15 minutes.\n3 Add flour and stir until onions are evenly coated and flour is lightly browned, about 2 minutes.\n4 Stir in broth, scraping pan bottom to loosen browned bits; stir in beer, thyme, bay, browned beef with any of the accumulated juices, and salt and pepper to taste. Increase heat to medium-high and bring to a full simmer. Reduce heat to low, partially cover, let cook for 2-3 hours until beef is fork tender. (Alternatively can cook in the oven at 300\xc2\xb0F.)\nStir occasionally, scraping up anything that is sticking to the bottom of the pan.\nAbout half an hour before it finishes cooking, add the mustard and brown sugar. Adjust seasonings to taste.\n5 Serve: Discard thyme and bay leaf. Adjust seasonings with salt and pepper to taste and serve. Can serve plain, with potatoes, over noodles, or over French fries.\nWhatever ale you have used in the cooking makes for a great drink accompaniment to the stew.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nRabbit Braised in Belgian Ale Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesCook time: 1 hour, 15 minutesYield: Serves 4\nMany markets carry whole frozen rabbits. Call ahead to have your butcher defrost and cut rabbit into parts. Otherwise, defrost by by placing into a large bowl of cool water. Once thawed, cut into parts (see these instructions). Try to remove any stray little bones at the edges of some of the cuts of rabbit.\nThe dish works best with a Belgian ale. If not available, try Newcastle brown ale or Anchor Steam ale, or O-Doule amber ale if you need to avoid alcohol. Do not attempt this recipe with a hoppy beer.\nINGREDIENTS\nOne 2 1/2 to 3 pound rabbit, cut into 6 to 7 serving pieces (2 front legs, 2 back legs, the loin cut into 2 to 3 pieces), plus ribs and flap meat\nSalt\n1/2 cup all purpose flour for dredging\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n2 tablespoons butter\n2 medium onions, sliced stem to root (about 2 1/2 cups sliced)\n4-6 whole cloves of garlic, peeled\n6 sprigs of fresh thyme, tied together with kitchen string (or 1/2 teaspoon dried thyme)\n1 1/2 cups of Belgian ale, such as Chimay or Ommengang\n1/2 cup of chicken stock\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper\n1 celery root, peeled and diced\n2 teaspoons whole grained mustard\n2 teaspoons brown sugar\n1 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Sprinkle rabbit pieces with salt: Place rabbit pieces on a platter, sprinkle both sides with kosher salt. Let sit for 30 minutes to an hour.\n2 Dredge rabbit with flour, brown in butter: Place flour on plate. Dredge rabbit pieces in flour.\nHeat oil and butter in a large  Dutch oven on medium heat (large enough to fit rabbit pieces in a single layer). Once the butter is melted and foamy, add the rabbit pieces in a single layer to the pot.\nBrown on one side without stirring for 5 to 6 minutes. Then turn the pieces over and brown on the other side. Remove to a plate.\n3 Brown the onions, add garlic and thyme: Add the sliced onions to the pot, and cook, stirring occasionally, until lightly brown, scraping up and browned rabbit bits from the bottom of the pot. Add garlic cloves and thyme, cook until onions are soft and the garlic quite fragrant.\n4 Add ale, then stock, salt, pepper: Increase the heat to high and add the Belgian ale. Let it simmer for a minute or two, then add the stock. Add a half teaspoon of salt and the freshly ground black pepper.\n5 Add celery root, rabbit, then simmer: Place the diced celery root over the onions in a single layer. Place the browned rabbit pieces over the  celery root. Bring to a simmer. Cover and reduce heat to maintain a very low simmer. Cook for 45 minutes, or until the rabbit is just cooked through and tender.\n6 Reduce sauce: Remove rabbit pieces from the pot and keep warm on a platter. Increase the heat to high and reduce the liquid by one third. Then, reduce the heat to low, stir in the mustard and sugar. Taste and add more salt and pepper in needed.\n7 Return meat to sauce in pot: Slice the flap meat pieces of the rabbit into strips and return to the pot. Strip away any available meat from the back and chest parts and return meat to the pot. Add the serving pieces to the pot. Cover and let rewarm for a minute.\n8 Serve: Sprinkle with chopped parsley to serve. Serve with crusty bread, egg noodles, or rice pilaf, along with some Belgian ale.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nYeasted Belgian Waffles Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 5 minutesRise time: 8 to 24 hoursYield: 6 waffles (6 servings)\nMaking the batter overnight means you can have incredibly crisp and flavorful waffles without a lot of fuss in the morning. Just make sure to use a large container, as the batter more than doubles in size as it rises overnight.\nYou'll need a Belgian waffle maker with deep wells for this recipe. If you don't have a Belgian waffle maker (or aren't sure), just err on the side of caution and add a little less batter so your waffle iron doesn't overflow as the waffles cook.\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the waffle batter:\n1 3/4 cups whole milk\n2 1/4 teaspoon (7g) active yeast (or 1 package, not fast acting or instant)\n2 cups (280g) all-purpose flour\n1/4 cup (40g) yellow cornmeal\n1 tablespoon brown sugar\n1 teaspoon kosher salt\n1/2 cup unsalted butter, melted\n2 large eggs\n1/2 teaspoon baking soda\nFor topping:\nPowdered sugar, optional\nMaple syrup\nWhipped cream\nFresh fruit\nJam or preserves of your choice\nSpecial equipment:\nBelgian Waffle Iron\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Make the batter: Warm the milk up on the stovetop until it is warm to the touch, but not hot. (This should only take about 5 to 10 seconds on a gas or induction stovetop; an electric will take slightly longer.) Remove from heat and pour into a large mixing bowl. Add the yeast and stir to dissolve. Let the mixture sit for 5 minutes to proof. You should see a few bubbles form at the top.\nAdd the flour, cornmeal, brown sugar, and salt to the yeasted milk. Stir with a large spatula, and as the dry ingredients become incorporated into the batter, drizzle the melted butter over the entire mixture, stirring constantly. Stir until all the dry ingredients are absorbed and then cover the bowl with plastic wrap.\n2 Let the batter sit on the counter overnight, up to 8 hours.\n3 The next day, preheat your waffle iron. Spray your waffle iron lightly with cooking oil.\nAlso, preheat your oven to 250\xc2\xb0F for the finished waffles. Place a wire metal rack on a rimmed baking sheet and put in the oven\xe2\x80\x94or directly onto the oven rack itself.\n4 Make the waffles: The batter will have more than doubled in size after resting. Whisk in the eggs and baking soda. This will deflate the batter.\nPour 3/4 cup (or the manufacturer\xe2\x80\x99s suggested amount) of batter into the waffle maker, making sure it fills all the crevices. Close and cook the waffle to your preferred toasty level.\n5 Keep the waffles warm until serving: Once the waffle is done, move the waffle to the warm oven, on the wire racked baking sheet and repeat the process until all the batter is used and waffles made. Serve with a dusting of powdered sugar, maple syrup on the side, or whatever topping you choose!\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nMom\xe2\x80\x99s Ground Turkey and Peppers Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: Serves 4\nThe method given is my mother\'s "one pan" approach, because she\'s only cooking up one pound of ground turkey, enough for 4 people. If you are increasing this ground turkey recipe to serve more people, you may want to remove the vegetables after they\'ve cooked and set them aside as you cook the turkey meat, or cook the meat and the vegetables in two separate skillets.\nINGREDIENTS\n3 to 4 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n1 cup chopped yellow onion, including some chopped greens from scallions or green onions\n1 bell pepper (red or yellow preferred), chopped\n2 cloves garlic, minced\nKosher salt\n1 pound ground turkey, preferably ground turkey thighs\n1 teaspoon chipotle powder or chili powder (or to taste)\n2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley or cilantro\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Saut\xc3\xa9 the onions, bell pepper, garlic: Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large skillet on medium high heat. Add the chopped onions and bell pepper and cook until onions and peppers are softened, a couple minutes.\nAdd the garlic and cook 30 seconds more.\n2 Add the ground turkey, salt, chipotle chili powder: Push the vegetables to the edge of one side of the pan and position that side of the pan so that it is off the burner, away from the heat. The empty part of the pan should be right over the burner.\nAdd one or two more tablespoons of oil to coat the empty part of the pan. Put crumpled chunks of ground turkey in the pan, sprinkle with salt and chipotle or chili powder.\n3 Brown the turkey, stir in the peppers and onions: Cook the turkey without stirring until it is browned on one side, then turn the pieces over to brown the other side.\nOnce the turkey is just cooked through, stir in the onions and peppers, and sprinkle with more salt and chili powder to taste. Remove from heat.\nStir in fresh chopped parsley or cilantro.\nServe alone, or with steamed rice or noodles.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Print\nDad\xe2\x80\x99s Stuffed Bell Peppers Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 50 minutesYield: Serves 4-6\nINGREDIENTS\n1 1/2 cup of cooked white rice (from about 3/4 cup raw rice)\n4 to 6 bell peppers, any color\n5 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil\n1 medium yellow onion, peeled and chopped\n1 clove garlic, peeled and chopped\n1 pound lean ground beef\n1 cup chopped tomatoes, fresh or canned (if using can, drain of excess liquid first)\n1 tablespoon chopped fresh oregano, or 1 teaspoon of dried oregano\n1 teaspoon salt\n1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper\n1/2 cup ketchup\n1/2 teaspoon of Worcestershire Sauce\nDash of Tabasco sauce\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cook the rice (if needed): If you are starting with raw rice, you'll need to cook it first. Cook the rice following the directions on the rice package.\n2 Steam the bell peppers: Cut the tops off of the bell peppers about 1/2 inch to 1 inch from the stem end and remove the seeds. (Save the extra bits of bell pepper for another dish such as Ground Turkey and Peppers.)\nPlace a steaming rack in a large pot and add enough water to cover the bottom of the pan by an inch. Place the bell peppers on the rack, cut side up, and bring the water to a boil. Cover the pot and let the peppers steam for 5 to 10 minutes until they start to soften.\nNote that you can skip the steaming if you want, but this step will help ensure that the peppers cook through thoroughly when they are stuffed and baked.\n3 Saut\xc3\xa9 onions and garlic: Preheat oven to 350\xc2\xb0F. Heat 4 tablespoons of the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onions and cook, stirring often, until soft and translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook a minute more.\n4 Make filling: Add the meat, cooked rice, cooked onions, tomatoes, oregano, salt, and pepper to a large bowl. Mix everything together with your hands or a wooden spoon, just enough so that the ingredients are all well distributed. Do not over-mix.\n5 Stuff the peppers: Drizzle remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil inside the peppers. Arrange the cut side of the peppers up in a baking dish, then stuff peppers with filling.\nCombine ketchup, Worcestershire sauce, Tabasco sauce, and 1/4 cup of water in a small bowl, then spoon over filling.\n6 Bake: Add 1/4 cup of water to the baking dish. Place in 350\xc2\xb0F oven and bake for 40-50 minutes (or longer, depending on how big the peppers are that you are stuffing), until the internal temperature of the stuffed peppers is 150-160\xc2\xb0F.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b'Save It Print\nRoasted Red Pepper Potato Soup Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 30 minutesYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n4 large red bell peppers\n1 medium yellow onion, peeled and diced (about 1 cup)\n1 large russet potato, peeled and diced (about 1 1/2 cup)\n3 cloves garlic\n1 quart chicken stock (or vegetable stock for vegetarian option)\n1/4 cup cream or milk\n3 tablespoons butter\nCayenne, salt and pepper to taste\nMETHOD\n1 Roast bell peppers until blackened all over: Roast the red bell peppers by placing them over or under an open flame until they blacken on all sides. (You can use a grill, cooktop gas burner, or oven broiler.) Place the blackened peppers in a bowl, cover the bowl with a plate, and let the peppers steam for 5 minutes, or until the skins feel like they can easily be slipped off. Remove the peppers from the bowl, peel off the blackened skins, remove the seeds. Chop the peppers roughly.\n2 Saut\xc3\xa9 onions in butter: Heat the butter in a large soup pot over medium-high heat. Add the chopped onion and saut\xc3\xa9 for 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally.\n3 Add potatoes, garlic: Add the potatoes and cook another 1-2 minutes, then add the garlic and the chopped roasted peppers. Stir well and cook for 2 minutes.\n4 Add stock, simmer:  Add the stock, stir well and bring to a simmer. Cook over medium heat until potatoes are soft, about 12 to 15 minutes.\n5 Pur\xc3\xa9e soup: Pur\xc3\xa9e the soup in a blender or food processor until very smooth. Fill the blender about halfway with the soup. Start the blender on low and keep your hand on the top, in case the lid wants to pop off from the rising steam. Once everything is well chopped, turn the blender to its highest setting and blend until smooth, about 1 minute. You might need to do this in batches.\n6 Add cream, seasonings: Return to a clean pot set over low heat. Add the cream, stir well and taste. Add some cayenne, salt and pepper to taste.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nMom\xe2\x80\x99s Stuffed Bell Peppers Recipe\nYield: Serves 4 to 6\nRed and yellow bell peppers have a very different flavor than green bell peppers. The red ones especially are much sweeter. Any bell pepper can be used for this recipe; use the type you like the best.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 1/2 to 2 cups cooked white rice (starting from about 3/4 to 1 cup raw white rice)\n4 to 6 bell peppers (red, yellow, or green), use 4 large, or 6 medium sized\n1 to 1 1/4 pound of ground beef (ground chuck, 16% fat)\n6 large fresh basil leaves, chopped (or 1 1/2 teaspoons dried basil)\n1/2 teaspoon dry summer savory or thyme\n1/2 teaspoon ground marjoram (or 2 teaspoons of fresh chopped)\n(Can substitute herbs with other herbs such as an Italian herb mix)\n1 teaspoon salt\nFreshly ground black pepper\n1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil\nPaprika\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cook the rice: If you haven't already made the rice, start cooking the rice following the package instructions (usually 1 cup of raw white rice plus 1 1/2 cups of water and 1/2 teaspoon of salt, bring to boil, reduce heat to low, cover and cook for 15 minutes.)\n2 Steam the bell peppers: Cut the tops off of the bell peppers. Remove and discard (compost) the stem and seeds.\nPlace bell peppers cut side up on a steaming rack over an inch of water in a large covered pot. Bring to boil, let steam for 10 minutes. (Note you can skip this step if you want, but steaming the pepper shells first will make them more tender and easier to eat.)\n3 Mix the filling: Heat oven to 350\xc2\xb0F. In a large bowl mix together the ground beef, basil, summer savory, marjoram, salt, several turns of black pepper, and the cooked rice.\n4 Fill the bell peppers: Remove bell peppers from steamer pan. Place cut side up in a pyrex or other oven-proof casserole. Gently stuff the peppers with the ground beef rice mixture.\nDrizzle olive oil over the stuffed peppers, along the outside of the peppers, and into the pan. Rub the oil over the outside of the peppers; it will help with browning. Sprinkle the tops generously with paprika.\n5 Bake: Place on the middle rack of the oven and bake at 350\xc2\xb0F for 35-50 minutes, or longer, until the meat is cooked through.\nServe with ketchup.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Print\nFlank Steak Stir Fry with Asparagus and Red Pepper Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 25 minutesYield: Serves 4\nIf you are planning to serve this dish with rice, in a separate pan, prepare 2 cups of white rice, following the instructions on the rice package.\nINGREDIENTS\n3 Tbsp canola or peanut oil\n1/2 lb asparagus, trimmed, cut on the diagonal into 1 1/2 inch lengths (about 1 1/2 cups)\n1 lb of flank steak, sliced in half lengthwise (along the grain) and then cut into thin strips (across the grain), 2 inches long and 1/4 inch wide (put the steak in the freezer for 15 minutes before slicing to make it easier to slice)\n1 red bell pepper, seeded, de-ribbed, and cut into thin strips 2 inches long and 1/4 inch wide\n2 teaspoons of cornstarch dissolved into 3 Tablespoons of water\nStir Fry Sauce\n3 Tbsp soy sauce (use gluten-free soy sauce for gluten-free version)\n1 teaspoon finely chopped, peeled, fresh ginger\n1 small clove garlic, minced\n1 green onion, including green tops, chopped\n1/2 teaspoon chili oil\nMETHOD\n1 Blanch the asparagus: Fill a medium sized saucepan halfway with water and bring to a boil. Blanch the cut asparagus for 2 minutes. Drain, rinse with cold water to stop the cooking, and set aside.\n2 Assemble stir fry sauce: In a small dish, stir together the stir fry sauce ingredients\xe2\x80\x94soy sauce, chopped ginger, minced garlic, chopped green onion, chili oil\xe2\x80\x94and set aside.\n3 Stir fry asparagus: Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a wok (or a thick-bottomed pot that can handle high heat) on high heat until shimmery. Add the asparagus and fry, stirring constantly, for 2 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove the asparagus from the pan and set aside.\n4 Stir fry beef strips: Heat another tablespoon of oil in the pan on high heat until shimmery. Stir fry the beef strips in batches, for 2 to 3 minutes per batch, until they are browned but still a little pink inside.\n5 Stir fry bell pepper: Return the first batches of beef strips to the pan along with the bell pepper strips. Stir and toss over high heat until the bell pepper strips are just beginning to wilt, 1-2 minutes.\n6 Add cornstarch slurry and stir fry sauce: Quickly stir the cornstarch liquid and add it to the pan along with the stir fry sauce. Cook until sauce thickens, 1-2 minutes.\nReturn the asparagus to the pan, toss to evenly coat and serve with steamed white rice (unless you are going low-carb, in which case, leave out the rice).\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Print\nSausage, Pepper, and Potato Bake Recipe\nPrep time: 25 minutesCook time: 1 hourYield: 4 servings (or 6 with other side dishes)\nINGREDIENTS\n3 tablespoons olive oil, separated\n1 1/2 pounds Yukon gold potatoes (about 4 medium), washed and unpeeled\n1 teaspoon kosher salt, separated\n1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper, separated\n5 tablespoons balsamic vinegar\n2 teaspoons Dijon mustard\n1 tablespoon fresh rosemary, chopped\n1 teaspoon whole grain mustard\n1 clove garlic, peeled and crushed\n1/2 red bell pepper, thinly sliced\n1/2 yellow bell pepper, thinly sliced\n1/2 orange bell pepper, thinly sliced\n1/2 white onion, thinly sliced\n1 (14-ounce) package kielbasa (or Polish sausage), sliced into thin rounds about 1/4-inch thick\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat your oven to 400\xc2\xb0F and prep the pan. Pour 1 tablespoon of the olive oil into an 9x13 baking dish and use your hand, or a brush, to grease the bottom and sides of the dish. This oil will help create a crisp crust on the bottom of the baked potatoes.\n2 Prep and start baking the potatoes: Thinly slice the potatoes to about 1/8-inch thick; use a mandoline if needed. Try to keep the potato slices together as you cut as this makes it easier to assemble them in the dish.\nFan the potatoes slightly in the dish, overlapping them like a fallen set of dominoes in the pan and creating four rows of potatoes. Sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon of kosher salt and an 1/8 teaspoon of the black pepper.\nBake the potatoes for 30 minutes.\n3 Make the vinaigrette: Combine the vinegar, 2 tablespoons olive oil, both mustards, rosemary, garlic, and the remaining salt and pepper in a glass jar with a tight-fitting lid (or in a bowl).\nShake the ingredients together vigorously until combined. If you\xe2\x80\x99re making the dressing in a bowl, use a whisk or an immersion blender to combine. Set this aside.\n4 Add the peppers, onions, and sausage to the dish: Carefully remove the dish of potatoes from the oven and evenly arrange the peppers, then the onions, and lastly, the sausage, on top of the potatoes.\nGive the dressing another vigorous shake and pour evenly over the top of the casserole.\n5 Bake the dish: Return the dish to the oven and bake for an additional 30 minutes, or until a knife inserted into the middle of a potato offers no resistance.\n6 Cool and serve: Remove the dish from the oven and cool for 5 minutes before serving. Leftovers will keep in a covered container for up to two days in the fridge.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Save It Print\nCheesy Hamburger Pasta Skillet Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 30 minutesYield: 6\nINGREDIENTS\n1 pound lean ground beef\n1 medium green bell pepper, diced\n1/2 large sweet onion, diced\n2 medium cloves garlic, minced\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n1/2 teaspoon ground pepper\n2 1/2 cups chicken broth\n1 1/2 cups half-and-half\n2 tablespoons all-purpose flour\n8 ounces wide egg noodles\n2 cups shredded cheddar or mozzarella\nSpecial equipment:\n12-inch skillet\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Brown the ground beef: Heat a large 12-inch skillet over medium heat. Add the ground beef and brown, breaking into smaller pieces with a spatula or spoon. When browned, place onto a paper towel lined plate, and drain the beef. Set aside.\n2 Cook the pepper and onion: In the same pan, add in the bell pepper and onion. Cook until golden brown and softened. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer this mixture to another plate and set aside.\n3 Make the sauce: Still in the same the pan, whisk together the chicken broth and half-and-half. Bring this mixture to a simmer. Whisk in flour and continue to simmer, about three minutes until the mixture begins to thicken slightly.\n4 Cook the noodles: Add the egg noodles to the milk mixture. Cover pan and cook for about 8 minutes, or until the noodles are cooked through. Stir occasionally to ensure all noodles are submerged and cooking.\n5 Add the ground beef, green peppers, and onions back to the pan. Stir to combine. Lastly, stir in the shredded cheese and combine until the cheese has melted. Serve immediately.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. b'Print\nPeperonata (Saut\xc3\xa9ed Peppers and Onions) Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: Serves 4 to 6\nINGREDIENTS\n1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil\n2 red bell peppers, seeded, sliced into 2 1/2 to 3-inch long strips\n2 yellow bell peppers, seeded, sliced into 2 1/2 to 3-inch long strips\n2 orange or green bell peppers, seeded, sliced into 2 1/2 to 3-inch long strips\n1 large onion, sliced into half-moons\n4 garlic cloves, sliced thin\n1 tablespoon dried oregano\n1 tablespoon sugar\n4-5 Roma or other plum tomatoes, seeded and diced\nSalt and pepper to taste\n1/2 cup fresh basil, leaves torn roughly\nLemon juice\nMETHOD\n1 Saut\xc3\xa9 the onions: Heat olive oil in a large saut\xc3\xa9 pan on medium high heat. When the oil is shimmering, add the onions. Sprinkle with a little salt and saut\xc3\xa9 for 2-3 minutes, until the onions just begin to color.\n2 Add the peppers: Add the peppers and stir well to combine with the onions. Saut\xc3\xa9 for 4-5 minutes, stirring often. The peppers should be al dente\xe2\x80\x94cooked, but with a little crunch left in them.\n3 Add the garlic: Add the garlic, and saut\xc3\xa9 another 1-2 minutes.\n4 Add salt, sugar, oregano: Sprinkle a little more salt over everything and add the sugar and dried oregano. Cook 1 minute.\n5 Add the diced tomatoes, and cook just one minute further.\n6 Add basil, black pepper, lemon juice: Turn off the heat and mix in the torn basil. Grind some black pepper over everything. Right before serving squeeze a little lemon juice over the dish.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Save It Print\nQuick Beef Stir-Fry with Bell Peppers Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 10 minutesYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n1 pound top sirloin or chuck steaks (about 1/2 inch thick), trimmed\nSalt and freshly ground black pepper\n1 large garlic clove, minced\n3 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil, divided\n2 medium bell peppers, one red, one green, sliced into 1/4-inch strips\n1/2 yellow onion, thinly sliced lengthwise (root to top)\nA dozen cherry tomatoes, cut in half, or one large tomato, roughly chopped\n2 tablespoons chopped cilantro (optional)\n1 tablespoon soy sauce\n2 teaspoon toasted sesame oil\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Season steaks with salt, pepper, garlic, then pound thin: Season the steaks with salt and pepper and rub minced garlic over one side. Place the steaks between two sheets of plastic wrap. With a meat pounder, pound the steaks to a 1/4 inch thickness.\nLet the steaks sit for 10 minutes to absorb the flavor of the garlic.\n2 Cut the steaks across the grain into 1/2-inch wide strips.\n3 Saut\xc3\xa9 onions and peppers: Heat 2 Tbsp oil in a large skillet on high heat. Add the sliced onions and bell peppers, cook, stirring, until just barely tender, about 1-2 minutes. Remove the vegetables from the pan to a bowl and keep warm.\n4 Saut\xc3\xa9 beef strips: Heat an additional Tbsp of oil in the skillet on high heat, until the oil is shimmering, but not smoking. Add the strips of beef let the beef brown initially, without stirring, but as soon as it is brown on one side, then stir. Cook for no more than a minute (for medium-rare).\n5 Add the peppers and onions, tomatoes, cilantro, soy sauce and sesame oil and cook for a half minute longer, stirring. Remove from heat.\nServe alone (paleo, low carb), or with steamed rice. Salt and pepper to taste.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nRoasted Red Pepper Pasta Sauce Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 40 minutesYield: Serves 6-8\nINGREDIENTS\n3 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n1 onion, chopped\nSalt\n4 garlic cloves, chopped\n1 tablespoon fresh sage, chopped\n3-5 anchovies, or 2 teaspoons anchovy paste\n2 tablespoons tomato paste\n1 1/2 cups red wine\n4 cups roasted red peppers (jarred or freshly roasted)\n1/4 teaspoon smoked paprika (optional)\n1/2 teaspoon cayenne or hot paprika\nGrated cheese (parmesan, pecorino, manchego, etc.)\nSome minced fresh sage for garnish\nMETHOD\n1 Soak jarred peppers in water: If you are using jarred peppers, drain away the marinade and soak them in a large bowl of cold water. If you skip this step, the sauce will become too acidic. Soak for 10-15 minutes before proceeding.\n2 Saut\xc3\xa9 onions: Heat the olive oil in a pot over medium-high heat. Add the chopped onion and saut\xc3\xa9, stirring from time to time, until it is wilted and translucent, about 3 minutes. Sprinkle some salt over the onions as they cook.\n3 Add garlic and sage, then anchovies, then tomato paste: Add the garlic and sage, mix well, and saut\xc3\xa9 another minute. Mix in the anchovies, smashing them up, and cook for 1 more minute.\nStir in the tomato paste and cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring often, until the paste begins to turn a brick red.\n4 Add wine, roasted peppers, then simmer: Add the red wine and stir well. Turn the heat up to high and let this boil down by half. Stir in the roasted red peppers and turn the heat back down to medium.\nLet this simmer for 10-20 minutes \xe2\x80\x93 it\xe2\x80\x99s pretty forgiving at this point. You just want the peppers to be cooked through and soft.\n5 Pur\xc3\xa9e: Pur\xc3\xa9e the sauce in a blender. You might need to do this in batches, because you don\xe2\x80\x99t want to fill your blender more than 2/3 up at one time.\nPur\xc3\xa9e the sauce, starting with the machine on low for 1-2 minutes to break up the big pieces. Turn off the blender and scrape the sides down. Turn it on again, and starting at the low setting, bring it up to its highest setting. Pur\xc3\xa9e for at least a minute, until smooth.\n6 Add spices: Return the sauce to the pan and heat to medium-low. Taste for salt and add some if needed. Add the cayenne or hot paprika, along with smoked paprika if you have some. If you want, a teaspoon of sugar helps, too, if your peppers are not already sweet enough. Keep the sauce warm while you make the pasta.\n7 Make the pasta according to the package instructions, depending on the type of pasta you are using.\n8 Serve pasta with sauce: To serve, drain the cooked pasta and put it into a large bowl. Ladle some sauce over the pasta and mix with tongs to combine. You want to coat all the noodles evenly. Divide into servings. Garnish with some grated cheese and minced fresh sage. Serve with a medium-bodied red wine, or a dry rose.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Print\nQuick and Easy Shrimp with Angel Hair Pasta Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: Serves 4\nIf you are working with frozen shrimp, to defrost place in a large bowl, cover with an inch or two of cold water, stir a couple teaspoons of salt into the water, add a few ice cubes. Let sit until defrosted.\nINGREDIENTS\n1/2 cup extra virgin olive olive\n2 cups finely diced red and green bell peppers (3 to 4 bell peppers)\n2 Tbsp grated fresh ginger root\n2 cloves garlic, minced (about 2 teaspoons)\nSalt\n1 pound peeled and deveined medium sized shrimp (31-40 count)\n4 Tbsp fresh lime juice (can sub lemon juice)\n1/2 teaspoon black pepper\n3 Tbsp chopped chives (or green onion greens)\n3/4 pound angel hair pasta\nMETHOD\n1 Heat salted water for pasta: Put a large pot of salted water (4 quarts of water, 2 Tbsp salt) on high heat. While the water is heating, continue with the recipe.\n2 Saut\xc3\xa9 bell peppers, ginger, garlic: Heat 3 Tbsp olive oil in a large saut\xc3\xa9 pan on medium high heat. Add the diced bell peppers and cook until softened, about 4 to 5 minutes. Add the grated ginger and minced garlic, and cook for 1 to 2 minutes more.\n3 Add shrimp: Add the shrimp and cook until just cooked through and no longer translucent, about 2 to 3 minutes. Sprinkle with lime juice, the remaining olive oil, and black pepper. Remove from heat.\n4 Cook pasta: When the pasta water is boiling, add the angel hair pasta and cook for 2 minutes or until cooked through, but still slightly al dente. Drain, reserving 1/2 cup of the pasta water.\n5 Add pasta to shrimp: Add the drained pasta back to the pan with the shrimp. Add the reserved pasta cooking water to the pot. Stir to combine all of the ingredients. Sprinkle with chopped chives to serve.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Save It Print\nMarinated Roasted Red Bell Peppers Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesCook time: 40 minutesWater bath time: 15 minutesYield: Makes 3 pint jars\nRecipe adapted from Eugenia Bone\'s fabulous canning book Well-Preserved and a marinated pepper recipe from University of Minnesota.\nUser water bath method instructions if canning for shelf storage, otherwise just use clean jars and lids and store in the refrigerator for up to 3 weeks.\nINGREDIENTS\n4 pounds firm, fresh, clean red bell peppers\n1 cup bottled lemon juice*\n2 cups white vinegar (5%)\n1 cup extra virgin olive oil + additional for roasting the peppers\n2 cloves garlic, quartered\n1 1/2 teaspoons salt\n3 pint canning jars\n*Bottle lemon juice has a consistent level of acidity which you need for this canning recipe.\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Prepare water bath and mason jars if canning: If you are canning for shelf storage (and not just chilling in the refrigerator), place a steaming rack at the bottom of a large (12-qt) pot, add the empty mason jars that you will be using for canning.\nFill the pot with enough water to cover the jars and bring to a boil. It takes a while to get a large pot of water to boil, so while the water is heating, proceed with the recipe.\n2a Blacken Peppers, Broiler Method Position rack in oven so that the top surface of bell peppers placed in the oven will be 4-5 inches from the broiler heat element. Rub the surface of the peppers with a little olive oil (this will help them blister faster).\nPreheat broiler on high. Place peppers either directly on the top oven rack, with a pan to catch the drippings on a rack beneath, or place on a aluminum-foil or Silpat lined broiler pan (a cookie sheet will warp).\nAs the surface of the peppers blister and blacken, turn them with tongs so that they will blacken on all sides.\n2b Blacken Peppers, Stovetop Method If you have a gas range (or grill) you can place the peppers directly on the range top so that the flames lick the peppers. Work carefully so that as soon as one section of a pepper is blackened, you turn it to work on a fresh side.\nIf you have an electric stove, heat a cast iron pan on high and place the peppers in the pan, allowing the peel to blister and blacken, turning so that all sides get blackened.\n3 Remove blackened peel: When the peppers are all well blistered and blackened, place in a non-reactive bowl and cover. (The steam from the hot peppers will help dislodge the skins.)\nOnce the peppers have cooled enough to handle, work with them one by one over a plate, gently peel off the blackened skins.\nCut the peppers in half and remove and discard the seed pods, stems and all seeds.\n4 Heat lemon juice, white vinegar, olive oil, garlic, and salt, in a saucepan until boiling.\n5 Sterilize the lids: If canning for shelf storage, remove some boiling water from the pot of boiling water in step one and place into a bowl. Put the lids in that bowl.\n6 Distribute peppers and vinegar mixture in jars: Use tongs or a jar lifter to remove mason jars from the boiling water in step 1 (if canning). Distribute the peppers evenly among the jars. Pour the hot vinegar mixture over the peppers to cover (try to make sure some garlic gets in each jar).\nLeave 1/2-inch head space on the jars. Wipe the rims with a clean, dampened paper towel. Place on lids and rings (do not tighten rings too tight).\nAt this point you can store in the refrigerator for several weeks. If you want longer storage, or shelf storage, proceed.\n7 Water bath for canning: Place filled jars in boiling water on a rack (from step 1). (Helps to use tongs and wear thick rubber gloves). Water should cover jars by at least an inch. Boil for 15 minutes.\nLet cool in pot for several minutes, remove. Let cool completely. You should hear the jars "pop" as the lids seal.\nIf a jar does not seal, store it in the refrigerator and use up within a few weeks. Otherwise the jars should last a year.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Print\nEggplant and Red Pepper Terrine Recipe\nUse high-quality, soft, fresh Mozzarella (the kind packed in water in the refrigerated section of the grocery store).\nINGREDIENTS\nTerrine ingredients:\n3 large red bell peppers (about 1 1/2 pounds)\n2 large, firm eggplants (about 2 1/2 pounds)\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n1 1/2 cups loosely-packed flat-leaf parsley leaves\n3/4 teaspoon salt\n1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper\n8 oz of fresh Mozzarella, cut into 1/8-in slices, about 14 slices\nRaw tomato sauce:\n3 cloves of garlic, peeled and finely chopped\n2 to 3 ripe tomatoes (1 1/4 pounds), each cut into 6 to 8 pieces\n1/4 cup virgin olive oil\n2 Tbsp red wine vinegar\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper\n1/4 teaspoon Tabasco sauce\nMETHOD\n1 Blacken and peel the red peppers: Arrange the red peppers on a broiling pan and place them under a hot broiler so that their upper surfaces are about 1/2 inch from the heat.\nBroil for 15 minutes, turning occasionally, until the peppers are blistered and black on all sides. (You can alternatively blacken the peppers directly over the open flame of a gas cook-top, holding them and turning them with tongs.)\nPlace them in a bowl and cover the bowl with a plate. Let the peppers steam in their own residual heat inside the bowl for 10 minutes. Then peel them (the skin will slide off) and remove the seeds.\nNote that Trader Joe's makes an excellent bottled cooked red pepper that can be used as a shortcut to the above step.\n2 Grill the eggplants: Heat a grill or grill pan until very hot. Cut the eggplants into 1/2-inch slices and lay out flat on a large flat surface such as a baking pan. Brush the slices on both sides with olive oil, and sprinkle with salt.\nCook the eggplant slices on the grill, covered, for 4 minutes on each side, until they are nicely browned and softened. If your grill does not have a lid, make a tent-like lid of aluminum foil and place it over the eggplant as it cooks.\n3 Blanch the parsley: While the eggplant is grilling, soften the parsley by blanching it in boiling water for 5 to 10 seconds. Remove, cool under cold water, drain.\n4 Build the terrine: Line a terrine mold (loaf pan) with plastic wrap. Arrange a layer of eggplant in the bottom of the mold and top it with about a third each of the red pepper pieces, parsley, and cheese.\nRepeat, beginning and ending with a layer of eggplant, until all the ingredients are used.\nCover with plastic wrap and press down on the wrap to compact the mixture. Refrigerate.\nAt this point you can make the terrine in advance and store in the refrigerator until you are ready to serve it.\n5 Prepare the sauce: Place the garlic and tomatoes in a blender and blend until smooth. Push the mixture through a food mill (fitted with a fine screen) over a bowl. Add the remainder of the sauce ingredients. Mix well.\n6 Serve: To serve, pour some of the sauce on a large platter and un-mold the terrine in the center. Cut it into slices and serve with the remainder of the sauce.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b"Print\nGrilled Italian Sausage with Peppers, Onions and Arugula Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 20 minutesYield: Serves 4-6\nIf you don't have a grill, sear the onions and bell peppers in a little oil on high heat in a large, preferable cast iron, frying pan. Then lower the heat to medium low, add the sausages, and cook, turning the sausages occasionally, until the sausages are cooked through.\nTowards the end of cooking, baste with the honey balsamic mixture.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 large red onion, cut into wedges*\n2 large red bell peppers, seeded and cut into thirds\n1 pound sweet Italian sausage links\nExtra virgin olive oil\nSalt\n3 Tbsp honey\n3 Tbsp balsamic vinegar\n2 to 3 handfuls of baby arugula\n*Cut the onion wedges so that the root end is still intact on each wedge. It will make the onion wedges easier to grill and help keep them from falling apart on the grill.\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat the grill.\n2 Mix together the balsamic vinegar and honey in a small bowl and set aside.\n3 Grill the onions: Coat the onions with a little olive oil, and sprinkle with salt. Coat the grill grates with a little olive oil. Put the onion wedges on the grill and cover the grill.\nLet the onions roast for 5 minutes, or until they are a little charred. Turn the onions and move them to a cooler part of the grill to finish.\n4 Grill the sausages and peppers: Coat the sausages and peppers with olive oil. Sprinkle salt on the peppers. If your grill has two levels, place the sausages on the top part of the grill and the peppers directly below them.\nDone this way, as the sausages drip juice and fat, it will fall on the peppers, flavoring them while simultaneously preventing flare-ups.\nIf your grill does not have two levels, put the peppers on the hottest part of the grill and the sausages on the coolest.\nCover and grill everything for 15 to 20 minutes or so, periodically checking and turning the sausages and peppers as needed.\n5 Baste with honey balsamic mixture: Towards the end of cooking, baste the sausages, peppers and onions with the honey and balsamic mixture.\n6 Remove from grill, cut sausages, cut peppers and onions: When the sausages are cooked through and the peppers and onions cooked, remove them from the grill to a sheet pan or large bowl.\nIf you want, pick off some or all of the charred skin on the peppers. Cut the peppers into long strips, and slice the root end off the onions to separate the pieces.\nCut the sausages into thirds. Mix everything well in the pan or bowl.\n7 Serve: To serve, place a bed of baby arugula on the serving plates and top with the sausage, peppers and onion.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b'Save It Print\nPasta Salad with Corn, Bacon, and Buttermilk Ranch Dressing Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: Serves 4 to 6\nINGREDIENTS\n8 ounces orecchiette pasta\nSalt for pasta water\n4 ounces bacon (about 4 strips)\n1 3/4 cup fresh or frozen corn kernels\n3/4 cup green onions, thinly sliced (from about 6 green onions)\n3/4 cup diced red bell pepper\n1/4 cup coarsely chopped fresh basil\n1/3 cup of buttermilk ranch dressing\nSalt and pepper to taste\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cook the pasta and corn: Heat 2 quarts of water in a large pot until boiling. Add 1 tablespoon of salt. Add the pasta and boil uncovered at a rolling boil until al dente.\nAbout 1 minute before the pasta is ready, add the corn to the boiling pasta water with the pasta.\nDrain the pasta and corn, and set aside.\n2 Cook the bacon: Cut the bacon into 1/2 inch pieces. Put in a frying pan and heat on medium. Cook until the fat has rendered and the bacon is well browned. Remove bacon to a paper towel lined plate.\nNote: Do not pour rendered fat down your kitchen sink unless you really like your plumber. Pour it into a jar to use for another cooking purpose or discard.\n3 Combine the ingredients to make the salad: In a large bowl add the drained, cooled pasta and corn, the bacon, and the remaining ingredients. Toss with with dressing. Add more salt and pepper to taste.\nGreat served with grilled chicken or steak.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nCheesy Quinoa Black Bean Stuffed Bell Peppers Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 1 hour, 10 minutesYield: Serves 4 to 6\nFor a non-vegetarian option, cook up some Mexican chorizo on medium heat until cooked through, and mix that in with the stuffing!\nAlthough I've focused on the orange and red bell peppers in the photographs, personally I prefer the green bell peppers with this dish.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 cup uncooked quinoa (white or red or both)\nSalt\n6 large bell peppers, any color\n1 15-ounce can black beans, drained\n4 cups grated sharp cheddar cheese, 2 cups for stuffing, 2 cups for topping\n3 to 4 green onions, finely sliced\n1 teaspoon ground cumin\n1/2 cup loosely packed chopped fresh cilantro (optional)\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cook the quinoa: Place 1 cup of quinoa, 2 cups of water, and 1/2 teaspoon of salt in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil, cover, reduce to a simmer and cook for 15 minutes.\nRemove from heat and let sit for 10 minutes, covered. Spread cooked quinoa out in a baking dish to cool quickly.\n2 Steam the bell peppers:  Cut the top 1/2 to 1 inch off of the bell peppers and remove the core and seeds inside. (If you want, you can finely chop the pieces of good bell pepper you've removed and include them in the stuffing, otherwise, save them for another use.)\nFill a large pot with an inch of water. Place a steamer rack in the pot, place the pepper shells on the steamer rack, cut side up. Bring to a boil, cover and steam the peppers 5 to 10 minutes, until they begin to soften.\n3 Make the filling: In a large bowl mix the cooked quinoa, drained black beans, 2 cups of the grated cheddar cheese, most of the green onion (save some for topping), cumin, and cilantro if using.\n4 Stuff the bell peppers with the stuffing you've prepared. You should have plenty of stuffing, you can pack it and mound the stuffing in the peppers. Place 1/4 cup of water at the base of the peppers.\n5 Bake: Cover with aluminum foil. Bake at 350\xc2\xb0F for 35 minutes. Then remove from oven, uncover, top with the remaining 2 cups of cheese, and return to the oven to cook, uncovered, until the cheese has melted about 5 to 10 minutes.\nSprinkle with remaining finely sliced green onions to serve.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nFoil Baked Salmon with Leeks and Bell Peppers Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 35 minutesYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n1 1/2 to 2 pounds (680 to 900 g) of salmon fillets, cut into 4 portions\n1 Tbsp butter\n2 Tbsp extra virgin olive oil\n2 large red, yellow, or orange bell peppers, cored and sliced (about 3 cups)\n3 medium leeks, cleaned and sliced, white and light green parts only (see How to Clean Leeks)\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n1 teaspoon dried tarragon (can sub thyme)\n4 teaspoons dry vermouth or dry white wine (optional)\n4 lemon wedges\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Saut\xc3\xa9 leeks and bell peppers: In a large saut\xc3\xa9 pan, heat the butter and olive oil on medium heat until the butter is melted and foamy.  Stir in the sliced leeks and bell peppers, sprinkle with salt and dried tarragon, and gently cook until completely soft, 10 to 15 minutes.\n2 Prepare foil packets: Preheat oven to 375\xc2\xb0F (190\xc2\xb0C). Prepare 12x12-inch foil pieces for each of the salmon fillets. Portion out the leek and bell pepper mixture evenly onto the centers of each of the foil pieces. Top with a salmon fillet. Sprinkle lightly with salt. Sprinkle each fillet with a teaspoon of dry vermouth or white wine if using.\nFold up the foil packets to allow some room over the salmon, but seal so that steam is not allowed to escape. (There are many ways to fold the foil, do which ever way works best for you!)\n3 Bake: Place the salmon filled foil packets on a baking sheet and  place in the oven in the middle rack. Bake at 375\xc2\xb0F (190\xc2\xb0C) about 12 to 15 minutes, or until just barely cooked through.\nSprinkle with lemon juice to serve or serve with lemon wedges.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nSlow Cooker Cajun-Spiced Stuffed Peppers Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 4 hoursYield: 5 to 6 servings\nLook for Cajun seasoning in the spice section at the grocery store. It is typically a mix of paprika, cayenne, garlic, cumin, oregano, and a few other dried spices.\nBe sure to buy bell peppers that are shaped like big cups and can stand upright on their own.\nYou can also cook these peppers in the oven: Put them in a baking dish, cover with foil, and bake at 400F for 50 to 60 minutes. Slice one pepper open to make sure the beef has cooked through.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 pound (450g) lean ground beef\n1 1/2 (225g) cups cooked brown rice\n1 1/4 cups (150g) diced yellow onions\n1 1/4 (115g) cups shredded mozzarella cheese\n3/4 cup (80g) corn kernels (fresh or frozen)\n1 1/2 teaspoons Cajun seasoning\n1 teaspoon dried oregano\n1 teaspoon sea salt\n1/2 teaspoon paprika\n5 to 6 large bell peppers\nSpecial Equipment:\n4- to 6-quart slow cooker, though any size will work as long as the peppers will stand upright\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Mix the filling: In a large bowl, mix the ground beef, cooked rice, onions, 3/4 cup of the mozzarella cheese, corn, Cajun seasoning, oregano, sea salt and paprika together. The beef can be a bit difficult to break apart in the beginning. Using a fork can help. Set filling aside (or cover and refrigerate for up to 24 hours).\n2 Prepare the peppers: Slice off the tops of the bell peppers. You don\xe2\x80\x99t need to cut off a lot; just enough to get the stem off. Remove the seeds and membrane from the insides of the peppers. The peppers should look like little cups that are ready for stuffing.\n3 Stuff each pepper with beef and rice filling. Carefully place each stuffed pepper into the slow cooker. Cover the pot.\n(The stuffed peppers can also be covered and refrigerated for up to 24 hours before cooking.)\n4 Set the slow cooker on low and cook for 4 to 5 hours. The peppers are done when the meat is cooked through. About 10 minutes before the peppers are done, sprinkle the remaining cheese on top of the peppers and close the lid.\n5 Drain excess liquid and serve: Carefully remove peppers from the slow cooker. Some of your peppers may have filled with some liquid. That\xe2\x80\x99s perfectly normal. I like to gently tip the peppers over to drain the excess liquid before serving. Be careful when doing this, as the peppers may still be quite hot.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nRoasted Red Bell Pepper Dip Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesChilling time: 1 hourYield: 2 cups\nINGREDIENTS\n1 clove garlic\n1 cup mayonnaise\n1 cup roasted red bell peppers\n1 teaspoon balsamic vinegar\n1 fresh red bell pepper, minced\nMETHOD\n1 In a food processor or mini chopper, mince the garlic. Blend in the mayonnaise. Add the roasted bell peppers and pulse until well blended.\n2 Remove to a bowl and stir in the balsamic vinegar and the minced fresh red bell pepper. Chill for an hour before serving.\nServe with strips of fresh jicama, celery, and carrots, or with bread sticks or tortilla chips.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. b'Save It Print\nSheet Pan Hawaiian Chicken Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 25 minutesYield: 2 to 4 servings\nRecipe reprinted with permission from the publisher of The Super Easy 5-Ingredient Cookbook by Sarah Walker Caron. Available on Amazon.com and wherever books are sold.\nThis recipe is easily doubled; divide between two sheet pans if necessary and bake in the top third and lower third of the oven.\nNote: I doubled the amount of soy sauce to 1/2 cup in order to provide some for tableside use.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 pound thin-cut chicken breasts, sliced into strips\n1 (20-ounce) can pineapple chunks in juice, drained and juice reserved\n1 red bell pepper, seeded and cut into strips\n1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil\n1/2 teapsoon Kosher salt\n1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper\n1/4 cup soy sauce or tamari (gluten free, if needed)\n1 tablespoon freshly grated ginger\nCooked rice, to serve\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Bake the chicken: Preheat the oven to 400\xc2\xb0F. Arrange the chicken on a nonstick rimmed baking sheet (or line a rimmed sheet with aluminum foil).\nPlace the pineapple chunks and red pepper strips on and around the chicken. Drizzle with olive oil, season with salt and pepper, and bake for 20 minutes.\n2 Make the sauce: In a measuring cup, whisk together the soy sauce, 5 to 6 tablespoons of reserved pineapple juice, and the grated ginger. Set aside.\n3 Brush the chicken, pineapple, and peppers with the sauce: At the 20 minute-mark, remove the pan from the oven and generously brush the sauce all over the chicken, pineapple, and peppers.\nBake for an additional 5 to 7 minutes until the peppers start to look lightly browned around the edges and the pineapples have lightly caramelized.\n4 Remove and serve. Remove from the oven and serve immediately with rice and the extra sauce. Leftovers can be stored in covered containers in the fridge for up to 3 days.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Print\nHalibut with Fennel, Peppers, and Tomatoes Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 30 minutesYield: 4 servings\nLook for skinless halibut fillets, or ask the person at the fish counter to remove them for you. If you end up with fillets with the skin still on, just cook them skin-side down and sprinkle the tops with the Panko.\nINGREDIENTS\n4 halibut fillets (6 ounces each)\n4 teaspoons lemon juice\nLeaves from 1 sprig rosemary\nLeaves from 2 stems thyme\nLeaves from 2 stems basil\nLeaves from 2 stems oregano\n1/2 cup Panko breadcrumbs\n2 teaspoons plus 2 tablespoons plus olive oil\n1/2 medium red onion, sliced\n1 bulb fennel, cored and sliced\n1 yellow bell pepper, seeded and sliced into strips\n1 orange bell pepper, seeded and sliced into strips\n4 Roma (plum) tomatoes, halved lengthwise and cut into strips\n1/2 cup pitted Kalamata olives\n3 tablespoons chopped parsley (to garnish)\n1 lemon, quartered (to garnish)\nSpecial equipment:\nLarge, oven-proof skillet\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Prep the fish: Preheat the oven to 425\xc2\xb0 F. Place the halibut fillets on a large plate and season both sides with salt and pepper. Sprinkle each fillet with 1 teaspoon lemon juice.\n2 Prep the herbs and Panko: Combine the herbs on a cutting board and coarsely chop. In a small bowl, combine the Panko, 2 teaspoons of the oil, and a pinch each of salt and pepper.\n3 Cook the vegetables: In a large, oven-proof skillet, heat the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil over medium heat. Add the onion and cook for 3 to 4 minutes, or until it begins to soften. Add the fennel and bell pepper slices, and cook for 5 minutes. Add the tomatoes, olives, and the chopped herbs. Cook for 3 minutes. Salt and pepper to taste.\n4 Bake the fish: Place the fish fillets on top of the vegetables in the skillet. Sprinkle each fillet with 2 tablespoons of the Panko mixture.\nPlace the skillet in the oven and bake for 6 minutes. Check the fish: if the panko is browning too quickly, place a piece of aluminum foil loosely on top of the fish.\nBake another 6 to 9 minutes (12 to 15 minutes total), until the center of the fish is opaque when probed with a small knife. If you have an instant read thermometer, the temperature of the center of the fish should register a 135\xc2\xb0F.\n5 Serve: Divide the vegetables between four plates and top each plate with a fish fillet. Sprinkle with parsley and serve with lemon wedges.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'

Serve with steak, carnitas, or carne asada.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Print\nHawaiian SPAM Tacos with Pineapple Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 30 minutesYield: 12 small tacos, serving 4 adults\nIf making the Dad Add: When dealing with haba\xc3\xb1ero peppers, be very careful. They are very spicy. I recommend using gloves to help protect your hands and a separate cutting board. If you don\xe2\x80\x99t do that, be sure to wash your hands immediately after to avoid any cross-contamination.\n  INGREDIENTS\nDAD ADD: Haba\xc3\xb1ero Guacamole\n1 haba\xc3\xb1ero pepper, seeded and minced\n1/4 cup minced red onion\n2 tablespoons minced cilantro\n1 lime, juice only\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n2 large ripe avocados\nFor the tacos:\n1/2 tablespoon olive oil\n1 (12-ounce) container SPAM, sliced into matchsticks\n2 cups fresh pineapple, chopped\n1 red pepper, sliced into matchsticks\n1/2 head of green cabbage, shredded (about 2 cups)\n4 ounces queso fresco, crumbled\n1 cup sour cream\nFresh cilantro, garnish\n12 small flour tortillas\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Make the Dad Add: Haba\xc3\xb1ero Guacamole: In a medium bowl, combine minced haba\xc3\xb1ero, red onion, cilantro, lime juice, and salt. Mash together with a fork.\nAdd in ripe avocados and mash until the guacamole comes together. Some chunks are good, but it should be creamy and dippable.\nGuacamole can be made a day in advance. To store it, place plastic wrap directly on the surface of the guacamole to slow oxidation and refrigerate.\n2 Make the taco filling: In a large skillet over medium-high heat, add the olive oil and SPAM strips. Cook until strips start to get crispy and browned, about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.\nRemove strips from the skillet and add the pineapple and red peppers. Continue to cook until red peppers soften slightly and pineapple starts to turn tan in spots, another 6 to 8 minutes.\nAdd strips back to skillet and toss to combine. Keep warm until serving.\n3 Assemble the tacos: Warm tortillas by wrapping them in damp paper towels and microwaving them for 10 seconds. Then add a smear of sour cream (and/or guacamole) to each tortilla. Top with a handful of shredded cabbage, 2 to 3 strips of crispy SPAM, and seared pineapple and red pepper. Garnish the taco with queso fresco and cilantro. Serve while warm!\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Save It Print\nEasy Grilled Steak Fajitas Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 10 minutesYield: Serves 4\nAfter seasoning the steak and vegetables, you might have some spice mix leftover. You can use it to sprinkle on the fajitas before serving or keep it in the pantry. The spice mix is great on tacos and keeps well for three months in an airtight container.\nINGREDIENTS\nFajita Spice Mix:\n1 teaspoon kosher salt\n1/2 teaspoon black pepper\n1/2 teaspoon garlic powder\n1/2 teaspoon onion powder\n1/2 teaspoon ground cumin\n1/2 teaspoon chili powder\nFor the fajitas:\n1 1/2 pounds steak, skirt, flank, or strip (no more than 1-inch thick)\n1 large green pepper, sliced thin\n1 large red pepper, sliced thin\n1 medium sweet onion, sliced thin\n4 teaspoons olive oil\n10-12 medium flour tortillas\nDAD ADD \xe2\x80\x94 Lime Cumin Sour Cream:\n1 cup sour cream\n1 lime, zest and juice\n1/2 teaspoon ground cumin\nPinch of salt\nTo serve:\nAvocado\nSalsa\nHot sauce\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Make the fajita spice mix: In a small bowl combine kosher salt, black pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, cumin, and chili powder.\n2 Make the vegetable foil pack: Fold a large piece of foil in half so you have a double layer. Add the sliced peppers and onions. Season the vegetables with 1 tablespoon of olive oil and sprinkle with 1 teaspoon fajita seasoning.\nFold the sides of the foil up and crimp it tightly on top to make a packet.\n3 Season the steak: Season the steak liberally with the seasoning mix (about 3/4 teaspoon per side).\n4 Preheat your grill to 450\xc2\xb0F for high heat grilling.\n5 Grill the packet and the steak: Once the grill is hot, transfer the veggie packet and the steak to the grill. Grill over steak over high, direct heat. After 4 minutes, flip the steak and grill for 5 to 7 additional minutes.\nThis will finish cooking the steak to about a medium to medium-rare temperature and soften the veggies. Remove both the foil packet and the steak from the grill and let cool for a few minutes.\n6 Make the Dad Add Lime Sour Cream (optional): In a small bowl, combine sour cream, zest, juice from 1 lime, cumin, and salt. Serve alongside the fajitas.\n7 Slice the steak: Slice the steak thinly against the grain.\n8 Serve: You can add the steak to the veggies and serve the fajitas right out of the foil packet alongside a stack of flour tortillas. The foil should be strong enough, but if yours seems unstable, you can also transfer the ingredients to a serving platter.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nStrawberry Shortcake Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 25 minutesYield: Serves 6 to 9\nI updated the biscuit recipe to use less cream. If you liked the original, use 1 1/2 cups of heavy whipping cream in place of the 1 cup of milk and 1/4 cup of cream.\nINGREDIENTS\nStrawberries:\n3 baskets of fresh strawberries (about 6 cups)\n1/2 cup (100 g) white granulated sugar for the strawberries\nWhipped Cream:\n1 cup (236 ml) of heavy whipping cream\n2 teaspoons powdered sugar\n2 drops of vanilla extract\nBiscuits:\n3 1/4 cups (455g) all purpose flour, divided ( 3 cups and 1/4 cup)\n3 tablespoons sugar\n1 1/2 tablespoons baking powder\n3/4 teaspoon salt\n12 tablespoons (168g) unsalted butter, cut into small cubes\n1 cup (236 ml) milk\n1/4 (60 ml) cup heavy cream\n1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\nSTRAWBERRIES\n1 Prep the strawberries: Cut the stems away from the strawberries and discard. Cut the strawberries in half, and then either quarters or thick slices.\n2 Macerate the strawberries with sugar: Put the cut strawberries into a large bowl and sprinkle with sugar. Start with 1/4 cup of sugar and then add up to another 1/4 cup depending on how sweet your strawberries are. Gently stir the strawberries until they are all coated with some sugar.\nLet sit at room temperature for about 20 minutes, until the berries soften and begin to release their juices.\n3 Mash some of the strawberries: After 20 minutes or so, mash about a quarter of the berries in the bowl with a potato masher and stir to mix.\nYou don't want to mash all the berries, just enough of them for their juices. Let sit while you bake the biscuits.\n4 Bake the biscuits using one of the recipes below.\n5 Make whipped cream: While the biscuits are baking, whip the cream using an electric mixer, adding a drop or two of vanilla and 2 teaspoons of powdered sugar. Cover with plastic and place in the refrigerator to chill until ready to serve.\nTo serve, break up one biscuit per person into big pieces into a bowl. Ladle strawberries over the biscuit. Add a dollop of whipped cream.\nHOMEMADE BISCUITS\n1 Stir flour with dry ingredients: In a large bowl, vigorously whisk together 3 cups of the flour, the sugar, baking powder, and salt.\n2 Work in the butter: Cut the butter into the flour mixture, either using your fingers, a pastry cutter, a fork, or a food processor, until the largest pieces of butter are the size of peas.\n3 Add the wet ingredients: Stir together the milk and cream, add the vanilla extract. Make a well in the center of the flour and pour the milk mixture into it.\nMix with a fork or wooden spoon until the mixture is just combined. It should look rather shaggy. If it is too wet to work with, sprinkle some of the remaining 1/4 cup of flour over it. Gently knead by hand a few times to form a loose ball of dough, adding more flour if needed. It should be slightly tacky but not wet.\n4 Chill: Place the dough on a lightly floured surface and form it into an 8-inch square, about 3/4-inch to an inch thick. Place it on a parchment or silicone-lined baking sheet, cover with plastic wrap and chill for 20 minutes.\n5 Bake: Heat the oven to 425\xc2\xbaF. Remove the dough from refrigerator. Cut the dough into 9 even squares and space them about 2 inches apart from each other on the baking sheet.\nBake until the biscuits are medium golden brown, 18 to 20 minutes.\nMakes 9 biscuits.\nBisquick biscuits:\nFor quick and easy shortcake biscuits using Bisquick baking mix, see our Bisquick shortcake biscuit recipe.\nGluten-free biscuits:\nFor flaky, fluffy, tender gluten-free biscuits, see our Gluten-free Biscuits Recipe.\nDairy-free vegan biscuits:\nFor easy, tender vegan shortcake biscuits, see our Dairy-free Vegan Biscuits recipe.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b"Print\nBlackberry Muffins Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesCook time: 20 minutesYield: Makes about 18 muffins\nINGREDIENTS\n2 1/2 cups (320g) all purpose flour\n1 tablespoon baking powder\n1/2 teaspoon baking soda\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n1/2 teaspoon cinnamon\n2 large eggs\n1 cup (236ml) sour cream\n1 teaspoon milk or water\n1 cup (200 g) sugar\n8 tablespoons warm melted butter (1 stick, 112 g)\n1 teaspoon vanilla\n1 1/2 cups (about 5-6 oz, about 150g) of blackberries, fresh or frozen (if using fresh berries, cut them in half, if using frozen berries, defrost first, drain excess liquid, then coat them lightly in flour)\nMETHOD\n1 Preheat oven, prepare muffin pan: Position rack in center of oven. Preheat oven to 400\xc2\xb0F (200\xc2\xb0C). Grease a standard 12 muffin pan or line with paper muffin cups. (Actually, with the berries you'll have more batter than just for 12 muffins. This batch made 18 muffins.)\n2 Combine dry ingredients: Whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon and salt in a large bowl.\n3 Combine wet ingredients and sugar: In a separate bowl, whisk together eggs, sour cream, milk, sugar, butter and vanilla.\n4 Add wet ingredients to dry, then add berries: Add the wet mixture to the dry mixture, and mix together with a few light strokes, just until the dry ingredients are moistened.\nAdd the berries. (If you are using frozen berries, defrost them first, then drain the excess liquid, then coat them lightly in flour.)\nDo not over-mix! Over-mixing will cause the muffins to be dense, not fluffy. The batter should not be smooth, but rather lumpy.\n5 Put into muffin cups and bake: Divide the batter evenly among the muffin cups. Bake at 400\xc2\xb0F (200\xc2\xb0C) until a toothpick inserted into the middle of 1 or 2 of the muffins comes out clean, 17-20 minutes (or longer).\n6: Let cool: Let cool for 2 to 3 minutes before removing from the pan. If not serving hot, let cool on a rack.\nServe as soon as possible, preferably within a few hours of baking.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b"Save It Print\nBlueberry Muffins Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 25 minutesYield: Makes one dozen muffins\nIf you are using frozen berries, you can use them frozen, just separate them so they're not sticking together and toss them in flour to coat. Your cooking time may need to increase by a few minutes.\nSome brands of sour cream are much thicker than others. Feel free to dilute the sour cream with a little water if you think it's too thick. You can also substitute the sour cream with plain yogurt; if you do, you likely will not need both tablespoons of added milk.\nINGREDIENTS\n2 1/2 cups of all-purpose flour, plus 1 tablespoon for dusting the blueberries\n1 tablespoon baking powder (make sure your baking powder is still good! click to see how)\n1/2 teaspoon baking soda\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n8 tablespoons butter (1 stick), melted\n1 cup sugar\n2 large eggs\n1 1/2 cup plain sour cream\n2 tablespoons milk\n1 teaspoon vanilla extract\n1 teaspoon lemon zest\n1 1/2 cups blueberries, fresh or frozen (see Recipe Note)\nSpecial equipment:\nStandard 12-cup muffin tin\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat the oven and prep the muffin tin: Preheat your oven to 400\xc2\xb0F with a rack in the lower middle. Using a standard 12-well muffin pan, place a muffin liner in each well, or if you don't have muffin liners, grease the inside of the muffin pan wells with vegetable oil or butter.\n2 Toss the berries with flour: Place the blueberries in a bowl. Sprinkle 1 tablespoon of flour over them and gently toss to coat. (The flour will help keep the blueberries from sinking in the muffin as it cooks.)\n3 Mix the dry ingredients: In a mixing bowl, whisk together the dry ingredients\xe2\x80\x94the flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt.\n4 Mix the wet ingredients separately: In a large mixing bowl, place the sour cream, sugar, eggs, milk, melted butter, lemon zest, and vanilla (the wet ingredients). Whisk together until smooth.\n5 Make the batter: Add the dry ingredients to the butter/sugar/egg mixture a third at a time and mix until just incorporated.  Do not over mix!\nGently fold the blueberries into the mixture.\n6  Portion out the muffins: Distribute the dough equally among the cups. You'll need to fill them very high to use all of the batter in 12 muffins, which is fine. They won't spill. If you still have too much dough, start filling another tin.\n7 Bake the muffins: Place the muffins in the oven and bake at 400\xc2\xb0F until the muffins are golden brown, about 20 minutes. (If the muffins are getting too brown, tent with foil.) Test with a bamboo skewer to make sure the centers of the muffins are done.\n8 Cool and serve: Let the muffins cool in the muffin pan for 2 to 3 minutes, then remove them from the pan. Let cool another 10 minutes before eating.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nBlackberry Cobbler Recipe\nPrep time: 35 minutesCook time: 30 minutesYield: Makes 9 servings\nYou can use fresh or frozen berries for this blackberry cobbler. If using frozen, defrost and drain first.\nMake sure you do a taste test to adjust sugar levels. Some berries are more tart than others and need more sugar for balance.\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the berry mixture:\n4 cups blackberries, rinsed clean\n1/2 cup white granulated sugar (less or more to taste, depends on how sweet the berries are and how sweet you would like your cobbler to be)\n1 teaspoon lemon zest\n1 tablespoon lemon juice\n1/4 teaspoon cinnamon\n1 1/2 tablespoons cornstarch (or instant tapioca)\nFor the cobbler topping:\n1 cup all purpose flour\n3 tablespoons sugar\n1 1/2 teaspoon baking powder\n1/4 teaspoon salt\n4 tablespoons unsalted butter\n1/4 cup milk\n1 large egg, lightly beaten\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Make the berry mixture: Put the blackberries, sugar, lemon zest and juice, cinnamon and cornstarch in a 9x9 baking dish. Stir to combine everything and make sure that the berries are all evenly coated with sugar.\nLet sit for 30 minutes for the berries to macerate so that the sugar dissolves and the berries release their juices.\n2 Preheat your oven to 350\xc2\xb0F.\n3 Make biscuit dough topping: Vigorously whisk together the flour, 3 tablespoons of the sugar, baking powder, and salt in a medium bowl. Cut the butter into the flour mixture with your fingers or a fork until the topping mixture resembles coarse crumbs.\nMake a well in the center and stir in the milk and beaten egg until the dough is just moistened.\n4 Top the cobbler: Scoop up the dough in large spoonfuls, and drop over the berries in the baking dish like cobblestones.\n5 Bake: Bake for 30 minutes at 350\xc2\xb0F, or until the berry mixture is bubbly and the topping is nicely browned.\n\n\nGreat served with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Print\nMixed Berry Sangria Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesChill time: up to 2 hoursYield: 4 to 8 servings, depending on how thirsty you are and the size of your glass\nINGREDIENTS\n3 tablespoons sugar\n1 orange, cut into chunks, seeds removed\n1 1/4 cups mixed berries, fresh or frozen, such as blueberries, raspberries, or strawberries\n1 750-ml bottle red wine\n1/3 cup brandy\n3/4 cup orange juice\nExtra fruit for garnish (optional)\nSoda water or blood orange soda (optional)\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Muddle the fruit with sugar: Place sugar, orange chunks, and berries into a pitcher and smash with a wooden spoon or a muddler to release some of the juices and break up the fruit a little bit.\n2 Add the red wine, brandy, and orange juice and steep for about 5 minutes or up to 2 hours. The flavors will mellow and improve the longer you can wait before serving.\n3 Pour into glasses filled with ice and extra fruit. If you prefer a very clear sangria with no fruit pulp, pour the sangria through a strainer when serving.\nIf you want, add some soda water or a little blood orange soda (I like blood orange San Pellegrino) to your sangria for some bubbles and a little extra pizzaz.\n  Hello!
