Tent with aluminum foil and let rest for 5 to 10 minutes before serving.\n6 Make gravy: If you would like to make gravy with the drippings from the chicken, place the roasting pan with all its drippings on the stovetop and set the burner to medium heat.\nUse a metal spatula to scrape up the stuck drippings from the bottom of the pan. When the pan is hot, pour in some white wine or chicken stock to help loosen the drippings from the pan.\nTransfer the drippings and stock/wine mixture to a saucepan and heat on medium high until reduced to your desired thickness.\nIf you want the gravy even thicker, you can make a slurry with a little cornstarch or flour (a teaspoon) and water (1/4 cup), and add that to the gravy while it cooks.\n7 Serve: Serve with steamed rice, mashed potatoes, or Spanish rice.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b'Print\nMom\xe2\x80\x99s Ground Turkey and Peppers Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: Serves 4\nThe method given is my mother\'s "one pan" approach, because she\'s only cooking up one pound of ground turkey, enough for 4 people. If you are increasing this ground turkey recipe to serve more people, you may want to remove the vegetables after they\'ve cooked and set them aside as you cook the turkey meat, or cook the meat and the vegetables in two separate skillets.\nINGREDIENTS\n3 to 4 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n1 cup chopped yellow onion, including some chopped greens from scallions or green onions\n1 bell pepper (red or yellow preferred), chopped\n2 cloves garlic, minced\nKosher salt\n1 pound ground turkey, preferably ground turkey thighs\n1 teaspoon chipotle powder or chili powder (or to taste)\n2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley or cilantro\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Saut\xc3\xa9 the onions, bell pepper, garlic: Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large skillet on medium high heat. Add the chopped onions and bell pepper and cook until onions and peppers are softened, a couple minutes.\nAdd the garlic and cook 30 seconds more.\n2 Add the ground turkey, salt, chipotle chili powder: Push the vegetables to the edge of one side of the pan and position that side of the pan so that it is off the burner, away from the heat. The empty part of the pan should be right over the burner.\nAdd one or two more tablespoons of oil to coat the empty part of the pan. Put crumpled chunks of ground turkey in the pan, sprinkle with salt and chipotle or chili powder.\n3 Brown the turkey, stir in the peppers and onions: Cook the turkey without stirring until it is browned on one side, then turn the pieces over to brown the other side.\nOnce the turkey is just cooked through, stir in the onions and peppers, and sprinkle with more salt and chili powder to taste. Remove from heat.\nStir in fresh chopped parsley or cilantro.\nServe alone, or with steamed rice or noodles.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b"Print\nPenne Pasta with Meat Sauce Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 45 minutesYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n1/2 pound penne pasta (use rice pasta for gluten-free version)\nSalt\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n2 cups chopped onion (from about 1 large onion)\n2 cloves garlic, chopped\n1 teaspoon Italian seasoning (blend of dried basil, oregano, rosemary, thyme, marjoram, and savory)\nDash red pepper flakes\n1/2 teaspoon fresh thyme (or a pinch of dried)\nSalt and freshly ground black pepper\n1 pound (16% fat) ground beef\n3 fresh basil leaves, chopped (or a 1/2 teaspoon of dried)\n2 1/2 cups canned chunky tomato sauce (almost 1 28-ounce can, Muir Glen brand if you can get it)\n1 teaspoon sugar\n1 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cook the penne pasta: Heat to boiling a large pot with 4 quarts of water in it. Once the water is boiling, salt it with 2 Tbsp of salt. Once the water returns to a boil add the pasta to the pot.\nLeave uncovered, let cook on high heat with a vigorous boil. Put the timer on for 8-10 minutes, or whatever your pasta package says is appropriate for al dente (cooked but still a little firm). Drain.\n2 Saut\xc3\xa9 onions, garlic, with seasonings: Once you've started to heat the water, start working on the sauce. Heat olive oil in a very large skillet on medium heat. Add the chopped onion, Italian seasoning and red pepper flakes.\nCook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the onions are softened. Add the garlic, fresh thyme, season with salt and pepper. Cook for an additional minute, until the garlic is fragrant. Remove from heat and set aside.\n3 Brown the ground beef: Heat a large cast iron pan on high heat. Salt the bottom of the pan generously. Once the pan is hot, break up small chunks of ground beef and add them to the pan, without stirring. (You may need to work in batches; do not crowd the pan.) You want the meat to get well browned.\nIf the pan is too hot and the meat is burning, not browning, take the pan off the heat for a little, and reduce the heat to medium high. On our coil electric stove, it takes the high heat setting for the meat to brown sufficiently, but your stove may be different.\nOnce the meat is browned on one side (a couple of minutes), use a metal spatula to flip the meat over to brown on the other side. At this point, assuming you are using a cast iron pan, you can remove the pan from the heat. The residual heat in the pan will finish cooking the meat.\n4 Add beef and tomato sauce to onions: Use a slotted spoon to lift the meat from the cast iron pan and add it to the pan with the seasoned onions.\nAdd tomato sauce. Use the edge of your metal spatula to break up the bigger chunks of meat into smaller pieces.\nAdd basil. Add a teaspoon of sugar. Bring to a simmer on low heat, let cook, uncovered, for 15 minutes.\n5 Adjust seasonings and add the pasta: Once the sauce has simmered for 15 minutes, adjust seasonings. Add salt and pepper to taste. Add a little more sugar if the sauce is too acidic. Add more tomato sauce if the sauce is a little dry. Stir in the cooked penne pasta. Sprinkle with chopped parsley. Serve immediately.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b'Print\nHamburger and Macaroni Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 20 minutesYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n2 cups uncooked macaroni (use rice pasta or gluten-free pasta for gluten-free version)\n1 Tbsp extra virgin olive oil\n1 pound ground beef\n1 yellow onion, chopped (or mixed chopped green onion greens and yellow onion)\n1/2 teaspoon seasoned salt\nPinch chili pepper flakes\n1/2 teaspoon celery seed\n1 large can (28 oz) of diced tomatoes\n2 Tbsp Worcestershire sauce\n1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley\nSalt  and freshly ground black pepper to taste\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Start cooking the pasta: Get a large pot of salted hot water (1 tablespoon of salt for 2 quarts of water) heating and begin cooking the macaroni as per the directions on the macaroni package.\n2 Brown the beef and onions: While the water is heating and macaroni cooking, prepare the sauce. In a skillet, brown the ground beef in a tablespoon of olive oil on high heat. Stir only infrequently so that the ground beef has an opportunity to brown.\nWhen the beef has mostly browned, add the onions to the pan and toss to combine. Cook until the onions are soft, about 4-6 minutes.\n3 Add seasonings, tomatoes: Add the celery seed, a dash of crushed red pepper and seasoned salt. Pour in canned tomatoes, add the Worcestershire sauce and stir to combine. Simmer for 5 minutes.\n4 Add cooked pasta: Reserve a half cup of the pasta cooking water. Mix in the drained and cooked macaroni and the parsley. Cook for another 5 minutes. Add in some of the pasta water if the dish is too dry.\nAdd freshly ground black pepper and salt to taste.\nHello! b'Print\nBaked Cod with Ritz Cracker Topping Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 20 minutesYield: Serves 4-6\nAny white, lean fish will work with this recipe. In New England, cod, haddock, pollock and hake are traditional, but walleye, catfish, bass, snapper, Pacific rock cod, striped bass or Gulf Coast redfish will all work.\nINGREDIENTS\n2 pounds skinless cod fillets\nSalt\n1 sleeve of Ritz crackers (about 34 crackers)\n5 Tbsp unsalted butter\nLemon and parsley for garnish (optional)\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Prepare oven, baking pan, fish: Preheat the oven to 350\xc2\xb0F. Grease a small baking pan or casserole pan with butter or a little oil. Rinse off the fish fillets with cold water, pat dry. Use long nose pliers to remove any pin bones from the fillets.\n2 Place fillets in bottom of dish: If you want, cut the fillets into large serving pieces. Place the fillets at the bottom of the pan, sprinkle with salt.\n3 Top fish with Ritz Cracker butter mixture: Melt the butter. Crush the Ritz crackers and place in a bowl; they should look like coarse breadcrumbs. Mix the melted butter with the breadcrumbs. Pack the crumb mixture over the top and sides of the fish fillets.\n  4 Bake: Place in the 350\xc2\xb0F oven and bake for 20 minutes, or until the fish flakes easily. (Thin fillets may take less time, very thick fillets may take longer.)\nServe the fish with lemon and parsley.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Print\nEasy Buttered Noodles Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 8 minutesYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n1/2 pound egg noodles\n2 Tbsp butter\n2 Tbsp grated Parmesan cheese\n1 Tbsp chopped fresh parsley\nSalt and pepper to taste\nMETHOD\n1 Cook the noodles: Heat 2 quarts of water with 1 Tbsp kosher salt in a large pot on high heat until boiling. Add the egg noodles. Cook for 5 minutes. Reserve 1/4 cup of the pasta cooking liquid and drain the noodles.\n2 Add butter, cheese, parsley: Place the drained hot noodles in a large bowl. Add the butter and Parmesan and stir until the butter has melted. Stir in a tablespoon or two of the pasta cooking water. Stir in the chopped parsley. Add salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Print\nPepperoni Pizza Penne Pasta Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 30 minutesYield: 4 to 6 servings\nIf you can\xe2\x80\x99t find mini pepperoni, you can use normal-sized pepperoni and cut it into quarters.\nIf you have leftovers (my family of four made it through a little over half of this serving size), I\xe2\x80\x99d recommend tossing it in a small buttered baking dish, adding the leftover crispy breadcrumbs to the top, and baking it the next day at 350\xc2\xb0F for about 20 minutes. Delicious baked pasta dish!\nINGREDIENTS\n12 ounces penne pasta\n1 cup marinara sauce, homemade or store-bought\n1/2 teaspoon dried oregano\n4 ounces mini pepperoni (see Recipe Note)\n8 ounces mini mozzarella balls\nBasil chopped, garnish\nDAD ADD: Spicy Breadcrumb Topper\n2 tablespoons butter\n1/2 cup breadcrumbs\n1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes\nPinch of salt and pepper\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cook the pasta: Add penne pasta to salted water and cook according to package instructions.\n2 While the pasta cooks, make the spicy breadcrumb topper: If you\xe2\x80\x99re making the Dad Add (highly recommended), melt the butter in a small skillet over low heat. Add breadcrumbs and red pepper flakes and cook, stirring regularly, for 4 to 5 minutes until breadcrumbs are toasted and browned. Season with a pinch of salt and pepper.\n3 Assemble the pasta: When the penne has cooked, drain it and return to hot pot. Stir in marinara sauce and oregano.\nOff the heat, fold in mini pepperoni and mini mozzarella balls.\n4 Serve: Divide pepperoni pizza penne between bowls and garnish with fresh basil and spicy crispy breadcrumbs, if using.\nHello! b"Print\nHamburger Stroganoff Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 25 minutesYield: Serves 4\nYou can substitute the sour cream and lemon juice for a cup of full-fat plain yogurt (room temperature). Do not allow to boil.\nINGREDIENTS\nButter\n1 pound ground chuck beef\nSalt and pepper\n1 yellow onion, chopped (about 1 cup)\n8 ounces sliced cremini mushrooms (can substitute button mushrooms), sliced\n1/3 cup of dry sherry, dry white wine, or water\n1/2 cup chopped parsley, loosely packed\n1 1/4 cups full fat sour cream (room temperature)\n1 teaspoon lemon juice\n1/4 teaspoon paprika or more to taste\n8 ounces egg noodles\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Heat pasta water: Put a large pot of salted water (1 teaspoon salt for every quart of water) on to heat, for the pasta.\n2 Brown the ground beef: Heat a large saut\xc3\xa9 pan on medium high heat. Melt 1 teaspoon butter in the pan and swirl it around.\nWorking in batches as not to crowd the meat (crowding it will make it hard to brown), break up the ground beef and add it to the pan. Sprinkle the meat with salt. Do not stir the meat, as stirring will prevent browning.\nOnce the meat is well browned on one side (a couple minutes, depending on how hot the pan), use tongs or a fork or a metal spatula to flip to the other side.\nOnce that side is browned as well, use a slotted spoon to remove from the pan and set aside.\nContinue to brown the meat in batches, adding a teaspoon of butter to the pan with each batch if needed, and salting the pan and the meat, until it is all browned. Remove meat from pan. Drain excess fat from pan.\n3 Saut\xc3\xa9 the onions: Add the onions to the pan. If you are working with very lean meat, you may not have any residual fat in the pan. If this is the case, you'll want to add in a tablespoon of olive oil or butter to the pan.\nCook the onions, scraping up the meat drippings, until soft, about 5 minutes. Remove onions from the pan (add to the meat).\n4 Start cooking pasta: Depending on the cooking times of your particular brand of pasta, this is likely a good time to add the pasta to the (should be now) boiling, salted water.\n5 Saut\xc3\xa9 mushrooms, add sherry: While the pasta is cooking, add a tablespoon of butter to the pan, increase the heat to medium high. Add the sliced mushrooms. Saut\xc3\xa9 until nicely browned (about 4 minutes).\nAdd the sherry (or dry white wine or water) to the pan to deglaze the pan, scraping up any browned bits. Let the sherry reduce by at least a half, then lower the heat to low.\n6 Stir in sour cream, paprika, lemon juice, meat, onions, parsley: Remove the pan from the heat. Mix in the sour cream and paprika until smooth. Return the pan to very low heat, and not let the sour cream boil (or it may curdle). You may add a few tablespoons of water to the mixture to thin it out a bit at any time.\nStir in the lemon juice, and about 1/4-1/2 teaspoon of salt (taste).\nStir in the meat and onions. Stir in the chopped parsley. Add more salt, pepper, and/or paprika to taste.\n7 Serve with noodles: Keep the stroganoff on warm heat until the noodles are done cooking. When the noodles are ready (al dente) drain.\nServe the hamburger stroganoff on top of egg noodles.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b"Print\nChicken Paprikash Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 35 minutesYield: Serves 4-6\nWe like cooking chicken skin-on and bone-in, but this recipe will easily work with boneless, skinless chicken pieces as well, if that's what you prefer.\nPaprika can go flat and tasteless if it is too old. So check your paprika first, before starting this dish.\nINGREDIENTS\n2 to 2 1/2 pounds of chicken pieces, preferably thighs and legs\nSalt\n2-3 Tbsp unsalted butter\n2 pounds yellow onions, (about 2-3 large onions)\nBlack pepper to taste\n2 Tbsp sweet paprika, preferably Hungarian\n1 teaspoon (or to taste), hot paprika or cayenne\n1 cup chicken broth\n1/2 cup sour cream\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Salt the chicken pieces well and let them sit at room temperature while you cut the onions. Slice the onions lengthwise (top to root).\n2 Brown the chicken pieces: Heat a large saut\xc3\xa9 pan over medium-high heat and melt the butter. When the butter is hot, pat the chicken pieces dry with paper towels and place them skin-side down in the pan.\nLet the chicken pieces cook 4-5 minutes on one side, until well browned, then turn them over and let them cook 2-3 minutes on the other side. (Take care when turning so as not to tear the skin if any is sticking to the pan.)\nRemove the chicken from the pan to a bowl, set aside.\n3 Saut\xc3\xa9 the onions: Add the sliced onions to the saut\xc3\xa9 pan and cook them, stirring occasionally, scraping up the browned bits from the chicken, until lightly browned, about 7 minutes.\n4 Add the paprika and some black pepper to the onions and stir to combine. Let cook for a minute.\n5 Add the chicken broth, place chicken on onions, cover and cook: Add the chicken broth, again scraping up the browned bits from the bottom of the pan, and then nestle the chicken pieces into the pan, on top of the onions.\nCover and cook on a low simmer for 20-25 minutes (depending on the size of your chicken pieces).\nWhen the chicken is cooked through (165\xc2\xb0F if you use a thermometer, or if the juices run clear, not pink when the thickest part of the thigh is pierced with a knife) remove the pan from the heat.\n(If you want, you can also keep cooking the chicken until it begins to fall off the bone, which may take another 30 minutes or so.)\n6 Remove chicken, stir in sour cream: When the chicken is done to your taste, remove the chicken from the pan. Allow the pan to cool for a minute and then slowly stir in the sour cream and add salt to taste.\nIf the sour cream cools the sauce too much, turn the heat back on just enough to warm it through. Add the chicken back to the pan and coat with the sauce.\n7 Serve: Serve with dumplings, rice, egg noodles or potatoes. (If cooking gluten-free, serve with rice, potatoes or gluten-free noodles or dumplings.)\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b"Print\nAfrican Chicken Peanut Stew Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesCook time: 1 hour, 55 minutesYield: Serves 6-8\nUse chicken legs, thighs or wings for this recipe. They have more flavor and will hold up better with the flavors of the stew than breast meat.\nINGREDIENTS\n2-3 pounds chicken legs, thighs and/or wings\n3 Tbsp vegetable oil\n1 large yellow or white onion, sliced\nA 3-inch piece of ginger, peeled and minced\n6-8 garlic cloves, chopped roughly\n2-3 pounds sweet potatoes, peeled and cut into chunks\n1 15-ounce can of crushed tomatoes\n1 quart chicken stock\n1 cup peanut butter\n1 cup roasted peanuts\n1 Tbsp ground coriander\n1 teaspoon cayenne, or to taste\nSalt and black pepper\n1/4 to 1/2 cup of chopped cilantro\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Brown the chicken. Heat the vegetable oil in a large soup pot set over medium-high heat. Salt the chicken pieces well, pat them dry and brown them in the oil. Don't crowd the pot, so do this in batches. Set the chicken pieces aside as they brown.\n2 Saut\xc3\xa9 the vegetables. Saut\xc3\xa9 the onions in the oil for 3-4 minutes, stirring often and scraping any browned bits off the bottom of the pot. Add the ginger and garlic and saut\xc3\xa9 another 1-2 minutes, then add the sweet potatoes and stir well to combine.\n3 Cook the stew. Add the chicken broth, crushed tomatoes, peanut butter, peanuts, coriander and cayenne and stir well to combine. Add the chicken. Bring to a simmer and taste for salt, adding more if needed.\nCover the pot and simmer gently for 90 minutes (check after an hour), or until the chicken meat easily falls off the bone and the sweet potatoes are tender.\n4 Remove bones and chop the cooked chicken. Remove the chicken pieces and set them in a bowl to cool, until cool enough to touch. Remove and discard the skin if you want, or chop it and put it back into the pot.\nShred the meat off the bones and put the meat back in the pot.\n5 Adjust seasonings. Adjust the seasonings for salt and cayenne, then add as much black pepper as you think you can stand\xe2\x80\x94the stew should be peppery. Stir in the cilantro and serve by itself, or with simple steamed rice.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b"Print\nSlow Cooked Boston Baked Beans Recipe\nCook time: 8 hoursYield: Serves 5-6 as a main dish or 10-12 as a side\nWhy pre-soak the beans? You don't have to (see this great Russ Parsons article in the LA Times about why you don't need to soak beans), but not doing so in this recipe will increase the cooking time. With the beans pre-soaked, they'll still take 8 hours to cook and soften in a slow-cooker. Once beans come in contact with the molasses, the sugar in the molasses will keep the beans firm. That's why they take so long to cook.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 pound (2 to 2 1/4 cups) dry white beans such as Navy beans or Great Northern beans (can also use kidney beans)\n1/3 cup molasses\n1/3 cup brown sugar\n3-4 Tbsp Dijon mustard\n1/8 teaspoon ground cloves\n3 cups hot water\n1/2 pound salt pork (can sub bacon), cut into 1/2-inch to 1-inch pieces\n1 medium onion, (1 1/2 cups) chopped\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Soak beans in water: Place beans in a large pot and cover with 2 inches of water. Soak overnight and drain. Alternatively, bring a pot with the beans covered with 2 inches of water to a boil, remove from heat and let soak for a hour, then drain.\n2 Mix molasses, brown sugar, mustard, ground cloves with water: Whisk together the molasses, brown sugar, mustard, and ground cloves with 3 cups of hot water.\n3 Add ingredients to slow-cooker, layering them, starting with the salt pork: Line the bottom of a slow-cooker (or a Dutch oven if you are cooking in the oven) with half of the salt pork (pick the fattiest pieces). Layer over with half of the drained beans. Add all of the chopped onion in a layer.\nTop with another layer of beans and the remaining salt pork. Pour the molasses water mixture over the beans to just cover the beans.\n4 Slow cook until beans are tender: Cover and cook in a slow-cooker on the low setting for 8 hours (or in a 250\xc2\xb0F oven), until the beans are tender. Check the water level a few hours in, and if the beans need more water, add some. Add additional salt to taste if needed.\nNote that fresher beans will cook faster than older beans. Your beans may be ready in less than 8 hours, or they may take longer. Best the next day.\nServe with Boston brown bread.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b"Print\nBean and Bacon Soup Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 1 hour, 30 minutesBean soaking time: 8 hoursYield: Serves 6 to 8\nIn this recipe we are making the bean soup starting with dry beans that we soak overnight. If you don't have time to soak beans overnight, you can put the beans into a pot of water, bring the water to a boil, remove from heat, and let sit for hour, and then drain. Pre-soaking the beans will help them cook faster.\nIf you would rather work with canned beans, use 3 to 4 15-ounce cans of drained white beans and cook them in step 3 for only 15 minutes, not an hour.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 pound dry Great Northern white beans, covered with a couple inches of water and soaked overnight\n5 ounces of bacon, cut into 1/2-inch wide pieces\n2 cups chopped onion (1 large onion)\n3/4 cup chopped celery (about 2 ribs of celery)\n3/4 cup chopped carrots (1 large carrot)\n3 cloves garlic, minced (about 1 tablespoon)\n6 cups chicken stock\n2 bay leaves\n1 Tbsp fresh thyme\n2 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt\n1/4 teaspoon black pepper\n3 Tbsp tomato paste\n1/2 teaspoon paprika\n1 ounce bacon (1 to 2 slices), cooked and crumbled for garnish (optional)\n2 Tbsp chopped fresh parsley for garnish (optional)\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Drain the beans: Drain the beans that have been soaking in water. (If you haven't already soaked the beans, and you don't have time to do so overnight, you can put them in a large pot of water, bring to a boil, remove from heat and let sit for an hour, then drain.)\n2 Cook the bacon and vegetables: Put the bacon into a large (5 to 6 quart) thick-bottomed Dutch oven on medium high heat. Let the bacon cook for a minute or two to start rendering out some of its fat, then add the chopped onion, celery, and carrots.\nLower the heat to low, cover and cook for 12 to 15 minutes, until vegetables are completely cooked through and softened. Add the garlic and cook a minute more.\n3 Add beans, stock, seasonings, simmer: Add the drained beans to the pot. Add the stock, the bay leaves, thyme, salt and pepper.\nIncrease heat to high to bring to a simmer, then lower the heat to maintain a simmer, partially covered, for 1 hour or until the beans are very soft.\n4 Add tomato paste and paprika: Stir in the tomato paste and the paprika. Cook for 5 more minutes.\n5 Pur\xc3\xa9e half the soup: Remove the bay leaves. Using an immersion blender, pur\xc3\xa9e most of the soup. You don't want the soup to be perfectly smooth, but you want to pur\xc3\xa9e enough of it so that the beans create a creamy base.\nAdd more salt and pepper to taste.\nGarnish with crumbled cooked bacon and chopped parsley to serve.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b"Print\nRefried Black Beans Recipe\nPrep time: 1 hour, 10 minutesCook time: 3 hoursYield: Serves 6\nThis recipe gives instructions for making refried beans from scratch, starting with dry beans which must first be cooked. You can also start with three 15-ounce cans of whole black beans, in which case, skip to step 5, rinse and drain the beans and add to the pan with a little water in step 6.\nINGREDIENTS\nIngredients for cooking the dry beans:\n1 pound dry black beans\n1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil\n1/2 teaspoon ground cumin\n1/2 large white onion, chopped (about 1 1/2 cups)\n1 garlic clove, minced\n2 teaspoons salt\n1/2 cup chopped fresh cilantro (leaves and tender stems)\nAdditional ingredients for frying the beans after they've been cooked:\n1 teaspoon chipotle chili powder\n1 teaspoon chili powder\n1/2 teaspoon ground cumin\n1/2 large white onion, chopped (about 1 1/2 cups)\n1 garlic clove, minced\nGreen onion\nCilantro\nCrumbled cotija or queso fresco cheese (omit for vegan version)\nTortilla chips or corn tortillas\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Soak dry beans: Place dry black beans in a bowl and add enough water to cover the beans by two inches. Let sit overnight.\nAlternatively, if you don't have time to soak the beans overnight, place the dry beans in a large bowl and pour boiling water over the beans, covering the beans with at least an inch of water, and let sit for one hour.\nNote, if your dry beans are a little old, or if you have reason to believe that they will be tough to cook (beans stored in hot or humid climates can get tough), you can add some salt to the water (1 1/2 teaspoons of salt 2 quarts of water) which at this stage will help the beans soften when they cook later.\n2 Saut\xc3\xa9 cumin, onion, garlic:  Heat a tablespoon of olive oil in a large thick-bottomed pot (the pot you will use to cook the beans) on medium high heat.\nAdd the cumin. Once the cumin is sizzling, add the chopped onion. Cook for 5 minutes or so, until translucent. Add the minced garlic and cook for a minute more.\n3 Add drained beans and water, simmer 2 hours: Once the beans have soaked, they should have expanded noticeably. Drain the soaking liquid.\nAdd the drained beans and 2 quarts of water to the onions. Bring to a simmer. Partially cover the pot and lower the heat to maintain a simmer. Simmer for 2 hours.\n4 Add Salt and Cilantro, cook 30 min more: After the beans have simmered for 2 hours, add 2 teaspoons of salt (if you salted the soaking water in step 1, then taste first, and only add a teaspoon or so more of salt if you think it needs it).\nAdd 1/2 cup chopped fresh cilantro. Let cook uncovered for another half hour, or until the beans are tender.\n5 Saut\xc3\xa9 the spices, then add onions and cook: Heat 2 Tbsp of olive oil in a large frying pan on medium high heat. Add the chipotle powder, chili powder, and cumin.\nOnce the spices are sizzling, add the chopped white onion and cook until translucent.\nAdd the garlic and cook a minute more.\n6 Add beans, then mash: Add the cooked black beans (and liquid from the pot) to the frying pan. Use a potato masher to mash the beans in the pan.  Let them cook 3 to 4 minutes longer.\nIf the beans are a little soupy for your taste, just let them cook longer. If too thick or dry, add more water. Adjust seasonings to taste.\n7 Serve: Garnish with chopped green onions, fresh cilantro, and crumbled cotija or queso fresco cheese.\nServe with tortilla chips or corn or flour tortillas (corn if you are gluten-free). Great in tacos or burritos, or for a dip, or a side with steak.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b"Print\nChicken Scampi with Angel Hair Pasta Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: 2 to 4 servings\nINGREDIENTS\n1/2 pound angel hair pasta\n2 tablespoons unsalted butter\n2 tablespoons olive oil\n1/2 pound boneless, skinless chicken cutlets\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper\n4 cloves garlic, minced\n1/8 teaspoon (a pinch) crushed red pepper flakes\n1/2 cup dry white wine, such as Sauvignon Blanc\nZest and juice of 1 lemon, plus more lemon wedges for serving (about 1 tablespoon of zest and 3 tablespoons of juice)\n1/4 cup chopped parsley\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Make the pasta: Cook the pasta in a large pot of salted boiling water, according to package instructions or until al dente. Scoop out about a cup of the pasta cooking water and set it aside. Drain the pasta.\n2 Cook the chicken:  Meanwhile, melt the butter with the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Pat the chicken dry and season both sides with the salt and a few grinds of fresh black pepper. Add the chicken to the skillet and cook about 2 minutes per side, until golden brown and cooked through.\nTransfer the chicken to a cutting board to rest, leaving the fat in the pan.\n3 Make the sauce: Add the garlic and red pepper flakes to the skillet and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the wine and lemon juice, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom of the pan, and simmer until reduced by about half, 3 to 5 minutes.\n4 Finish the pasta: Add the cooked pasta, lemon zest, parsley, and 1/2 cup of the reserved pasta water to the skillet and toss to combine. If it seems too dry or like the sauce isn't coating the pasta, stir in some more of the reserved pasta cooking water.\nCut the chicken into slices and toss with the pasta. Serve with extra lemon wedges for squeezing over the scampi.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b'Print\nOne Pot Chicken and Orzo Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 30 minutesYield: Serves 4 to 6\nTo save time, while the chicken is browning, prep the onion, garlic, and parsley.\nYou can easily swap out the thighs for bone-in, skin-on chicken breasts. Depending on the size of the pieces you may want to cut them in half.\nIf you use boneless, skinless thighs or breasts do not brown them as long in the first step. They will not need as much cooking time as the bone-in, skin-on thighs.\nINGREDIENTS\n2 1/2 to 3 pounds bone-in, skin-on chicken thighs, trimmed of excess fat\n2 teaspoons extra virgin olive oil\n1 teaspoon butter\n2 cups (12 ounces or 340 g) orzo pasta\n1 1/2 cups chopped onion (about 1 medium onion)\n2 cloves garlic, minced\n2 1/4 cups chicken stock\n3/4 cup canned crushed tomatoes (including juices)\n1/2 teaspoon black pepper\n1 teaspoon salt\n2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Prep and salt the chicken: Trim the chicken thighs of excess skin and fat. Sprinkle both sides with a little salt.\n2 Brown the chicken thighs: Heat olive oil and melt butter on medium high heat in a large skillet (large enough to fit all of the chicken pieces) to coat the bottom of the pan. When the oil is hot, pat the chicken pieces dry on both sides with paper towels and place skin-side down in the pan. Let cook for 5 minutes or until the chicken has browned on one side.\nThen turn the chicken pieces over and cook for another 4 minutes until lightly browned. Remove the chicken from the pan, set aside.\n3 Brown the orzo pasta, add onions, garlic: Add the orzo pasta to the pan. Stir to coat and let the pasta brown. Once the orzo starts to brown, stir in the chopped onions.\nReduce the heat to medium and let cook, stirring often for 2 to 3 minutes until the onions begin to soften. Add the minced garlic and cook a half minute more.\n4 Stir together stock  tomatoes, salt, pepper: In a large measuring cup, stir together the chicken stock, crushed tomatoes, 1/2 teaspoon pepper, and 1 teaspoon of salt.\n5 Add back chicken, pour stock mixture over orzo: Place the chicken pieces skin-side up, on top of the orzo.\nPour the stock tomato mixture over the orzo. Increase heat to medium high and let the stock in the pan come to a full boil.\n6 Cover and cook: Lower the heat to the lowest heat you need to maintain a bare simmer. Cover and let cook until the orzo has completely absorbed the liquid and the chicken is cooked through, about 10 to 12 minutes.\nRemove from heat and let sit for 5 minutes before serving.\nTaste for salt and pepper and add more if needed. Sprinkle with fresh chopped parsley to serve.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Print\nBaked Chicken with Cherry Tomatoes and Garlic Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 50 minutesYield: Serves 4 to 6\nThis dish produces a lot of flavorful liquid. You can use it for dipping crusty toasted bread. Or, you can remove the chicken, tomatoes, and garlic to a serving dish and pour the strained liquid into a small saucepan and boil until reduced to a thicker sauce. You can pour this sauce back over the chicken or pour it over rice or pasta.\nThe recipe calls for bone-in thighs. If you make it with boneless thighs you may need to reduce the cooking time by a few minutes.\nThe recipe calls for skin-on thighs. If you make it with skinless thighs, try to cover the thighs as much as you can with the tomatoes, to help prevent the meat from drying out. If you make it with skinless breasts, do the same, and reduce the cooking time to 25 minutes.\nINGREDIENTS\n2 pounds (900 g) bone-in, skin-on chicken thighs, trimmed of excess fat\n1/2 teaspoon kosher salt\n2 cups of cherry tomatoes (a heaping basket or 25 to 30 cherry tomatoes)\n6 whole cloves garlic, peeled\n1 1/2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar\n1 1/2 teaspoons extra virgin olive oil\n2 sprigs fresh rosemary (or 1/2 teaspoon dry rosemary)\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Arrange chicken thighs in casserole dish, sprinkle with salt: Place chicken thighs in a baking dish that allows for a little room between the thighs. Sprinkle both sides of the chicken thighs with salt.\n2 Preheat oven to 375\xc2\xb0F (190\xc2\xb0C).\n3 Prep cherry tomatoes with garlic, vinegar, oil: Cut the cherry tomatoes in half. Place in a bowl with the whole garlic cloves. Sprinkle with balsamic vinegar and olive oil.\n4 Place tomatoes, garlic, rosemary around chicken: Pour the cherry tomatoes over the chicken pieces and arrange so that they are squeezed around the chicken pieces. You want the chicken skins to be exposed so they brown in the oven. Lay sprigs of rosemary over the tomatoes.\n(If you are using dry rosemary instead of fresh sprigs, just mix it in with the tomatoes.)\n5 Bake: Bake, uncovered for 45 minutes, until the chicken is well browned on the top and cooked through. Remove from oven and cool for 5 minutes. Skim the excess chicken fat with a ladle.\nServe with toasted crusty bread, buttered noodles, or rice. (Skip for paleo option, skip bread and noodles for gluten-free versions.)\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Print\nAvocado Tuna Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesYield: Makes enough tuna salad for 2 sandwiches\nINGREDIENTS\n1 5-ounce can tuna, preferably packed in olive oil, drained\n1/2 ripe avocado, roughly chopped\n1/2 cup minced celery\n1/4 cup minced red onion\n1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil\n2 teaspoons lemon juice\n1 teaspoon lemon zest\n2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro or parsley\n1/2 teaspoon kosher salt\nFreshly ground black pepper\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Mix: Place all of the ingredients in a medium bowl. Mix with a fork, mashing the avocado and breaking up the chunks of tuna as you go, until the ingredients are well combined.\n2 Finish and serve: Add more oil or salt and pepper if necessary, serve on your favorite sandwich bread or toast.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b"Print\nShrimp Pasta alla Vodka Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 20 minutesYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n12 ounces fettuccine pasta\nSalt\n2 tablespoons butter\n1 1/2 cups finely chopped onion\n4 cloves garlic, minced, about 4 teaspoons\n1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes\n1 28-ounce can crushed tomatoes\n1/4 cup vodka\n6 tablespoons heavy whipping cream\n1 teaspoon lemon zest\n1 pound peeled, deveined raw shrimp\n3 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley\nFreshly ground black pepper\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Put pasta water on to boil: Put a large pot of salted water (1 Tbsp salt for every 2 quarts of water) on to boil for the pasta.\n2 Saut\xc3\xa9 onions, garlic, red pepper flakes: Melt butter in a large, thick-bottomed pot on medium high heat. Add the onion and saut\xc3\xa9 5 to 7 minutes, until lightly browned.\nLower the heat to medium, add the garlic and red pepper flakes and cook a minute more.\n3 Add tomatoes, vodka, cream, zest: Add the crushed tomatoes to the onions. Stir in the vodka, cream, and lemon zest. Increase heat to bring to a simmer, then lower the heat to maintain a simmer.\n4 Start cooking pasta: As soon as you start simmering the sauce, add pasta to boiling salted water. Pasta should be done in 10 minutes.\n5 Add raw shrimp to sauce: After the sauce has simmered for 5 minutes, about halfway through the pasta cooking time, taste for salt and add salt to taste (you'll likely need about 1 teaspoon). Add the raw peeled and deveined shrimp to the sauce.\nCook until the shrimp is just cooked through, about 5 minutes, then remove from heat.\n6 Add cooked pasta to sauce and shrimp: When the pasta is done, al dente, strain it and add it to the vodka tomato sauce and shrimp.\nSprinkle with parsley and freshly ground black pepper to serve.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b'Print\nQuick and Easy White Bean Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesYield: Serves 4\nYou can easily double or quadruple the recipe to serve a larger group.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 14.5-ounce can white beans, drained but not rinsed\n2 tablespoons chopped red onion\nA squeeze of lemon juice\n2 teaspoons wine vinegar (red or white)\n1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil\n1/2 teaspoon dry Herbs de Provence (crumbled) OR 1 teaspoon of some combination of finely chopped rosemary, tarragon, thyme, and lavender\nSalt and freshly ground pepper to taste\nMETHOD\n1 Let the onion marinate in lemon juice: After you chop up the onion, squeeze a little lemon juice over it and let it sit while prepping the other ingredients. According to my mother, this will take the edge off the onion.\n2 Combine all ingredients into a serving dish. You can serve right away if you want, but if you chill for a few hours, the flavors will come together better.\nLasts a couple of days in the refrigerator.\nHello! b"Print\nDeviled Egg Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: Serves 4-6\nINGREDIENTS\n12 large eggs\n1/4 cup chopped green onion\n1/2 cup chopped celery\n1/2 cup chopped red bell pepper\n2 tablespoons Dijon mustard\n1/3 cup mayonnaise\n1 tablespoon cider, white wine or sherry vinegar\n1/4 teaspoon Tabasco or other hot sauce (more or less to taste)\n1/2 teaspoon paprika (more or less to taste)\n1/2 teaspoon black pepper (more or less to taste)\n1/4 teaspoon salt (more to taste)\n  METHOD\n1 Hard boil the eggs: The easiest way to make hard boiled eggs that are easy to peel is to steam them. Fill a saucepan with 1 inch of water and insert a steamer basket. (If you don't have a steamer basket, that's ok.)\nBring the water to a boil, gently place the eggs in the steamer basket or directly in the saucepan. Cover the pot. Set your timer for 15 minutes. Remove eggs and set in icy cold water to cool.\nFor more advice, see our How to Steam Hard Boiled Eggs. (You can also pressure cook them.)\n2 Prep the eggs and veggies: Chop the eggs coarsely and put them into a large bowl. Add the green onion, celery, and red bell pepper.\n3 Make the salad: In small bowl, mix together the mayo, mustard, vinegar, and Tabasco. Gently stir the mayo dressing into the bowl with the eggs and vegetables. Add the paprika and salt and black pepper. Adjust seasonings to taste.\nBest served chilled.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b'Print\nSkillet Chicken Puttanesca Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 20 minutesYield: 4 servings\nThe anchovy fillets in this recipe are highly recommended. They add a savory, somewhat salty depth and hardly any fishiness.\nYou can double the recipe easily if you have a larger skillet.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 can (28 ounces) whole peeled tomatoes, with their juices\n4 anchovy fillets, coarsely chopped (optional)\n1 cup pitted Kalamata or other black olives, coarsely chopped\n1/4 cup capers\n1 teaspoon crushed red pepper, or more to taste\n3 tablespoons chopped fresh oregano\n4 skinless, boneless chicken breasts (about 3 pounds)\n1/2 teaspoon salt, or more to taste\n1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper, or more to taste\n3 tablespoons olive oil, divided\n2 cloves garlic, finely chopped\nExtra sprigs fresh oregano, for garnish\nCrusty bread, to serve (skip if serving gluten-free)\nSpecial equipment:\n12-inch skillet with a lid\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Prep the tomato sauce: Pour the tomatoes into a bowl and crush with your hands or with a wooden spoon until you have uneven 1-inch pieces (you can also use scissors to snip the tomatoes into small pieces).\nMix in the anchovies, olives, capers, red pepper, and 2 tablespoons of the oregano to the bowl. Set aside.\n2 Sear the chicken: Sprinkle the chicken all over with salt and black pepper. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil until hot.\nAdd the chicken and cook without disturbing for 3 minutes, or until browned. If you are using a cast-iron or stainless steel skillet, do not turn until the chicken moves easily without prodding.\nTurn and cook the other side for 3 minutes. Transfer to a plate.\n3 Make the sauce: In the skillet over medium heat, heat the remaining 1 tablespoon oil. Add the garlic and cook, stirring, for 1 minute.\nAdd the tomato mixture \xe2\x80\x93 be careful since the juices will splutter when you add them to the pan. Cook for 1 minute or until the spluttering stops. Stir well, turn down the heat, and simmer for 5 minutes. Taste for seasoning and add more salt, black pepper, or red pepper, if you like.\n4 Add the chicken and finish the sauce: Add the chicken breasts and any juices to the skillet and spoon a little sauce over top.\nCover the pan and simmer for 5 to 8 minutes, or until a meat thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the chicken registers 165F.\n5 Serve: Serve straight from the skillet or transfer to a serving platter. Sprinkle the remaining 1 tablespoon oregano over the top and garnish with oregano sprigs. Serve with plenty of crusty bread.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b"Print\nMom\xe2\x80\x99s Stuffed Bell Peppers Recipe\nYield: Serves 4 to 6\nRed and yellow bell peppers have a very different flavor than green bell peppers. The red ones especially are much sweeter. Any bell pepper can be used for this recipe; use the type you like the best.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 1/2 to 2 cups cooked white rice (starting from about 3/4 to 1 cup raw white rice)\n4 to 6 bell peppers (red, yellow, or green), use 4 large, or 6 medium sized\n1 to 1 1/4 pound of ground beef (ground chuck, 16% fat)\n6 large fresh basil leaves, chopped (or 1 1/2 teaspoons dried basil)\n1/2 teaspoon dry summer savory or thyme\n1/2 teaspoon ground marjoram (or 2 teaspoons of fresh chopped)\n(Can substitute herbs with other herbs such as an Italian herb mix)\n1 teaspoon salt\nFreshly ground black pepper\n1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil\nPaprika\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cook the rice: If you haven't already made the rice, start cooking the rice following the package instructions (usually 1 cup of raw white rice plus 1 1/2 cups of water and 1/2 teaspoon of salt, bring to boil, reduce heat to low, cover and cook for 15 minutes.)\n2 Steam the bell peppers: Cut the tops off of the bell peppers. Remove and discard (compost) the stem and seeds.\nPlace bell peppers cut side up on a steaming rack over an inch of water in a large covered pot. Bring to boil, let steam for 10 minutes. (Note you can skip this step if you want, but steaming the pepper shells first will make them more tender and easier to eat.)\n3 Mix the filling: Heat oven to 350\xc2\xb0F. In a large bowl mix together the ground beef, basil, summer savory, marjoram, salt, several turns of black pepper, and the cooked rice.\n4 Fill the bell peppers: Remove bell peppers from steamer pan. Place cut side up in a pyrex or other oven-proof casserole. Gently stuff the peppers with the ground beef rice mixture.\nDrizzle olive oil over the stuffed peppers, along the outside of the peppers, and into the pan. Rub the oil over the outside of the peppers; it will help with browning. Sprinkle the tops generously with paprika.\n5 Bake: Place on the middle rack of the oven and bake at 350\xc2\xb0F for 35-50 minutes, or longer, until the meat is cooked through.\nServe with ketchup.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b'Print\nPaprika Chicken with Chickpeas Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 40 minutesYield: Serves 4 to 6\nFeel free to add other spices if you have them on hand, like ground cumin, coriander, even a pinch of cinnamon.\nINGREDIENTS\n2 tablespoons smoked paprika\n1 1/2 teaspoons salt\n3/4 teaspoon black pepper\n1/2 teaspoon garlic powder\n1/4 teaspoon ground oregano\n2 pounds chicken thighs (we used bone-in, skin-on), trimmed of excess fat\n1 medium onion, thinly sliced\n1 14-ounce can chickpeas, drained\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n1 teaspoon lemon zest\n1 tablespoon lemon juice\n1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro or parsley\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Coat chicken with spices: Stir together the smoked paprika, salt, garlic powder, pepper, and ground oregano in a large bowl. Place the chicken thighs in the bowl and toss to coat completely with the spices.\nYou can do this several hours ahead, or right before cooking. Your choice. The longer the chicken sits in the rub, the more the flavors will permeate.\n2 Preheat oven to 350\xc2\xb0F.\n3 Layer a casserole dish with sliced onions: Place the thinly sliced onions in the bottom of a casserole dish large enough to hold the chicken pieces with room in between.\nToss with about 1 teaspoon of the olive oil and spread out in an even layer at the bottom of the dish.\n4 Add chickpeas, lemon, oil to chicken: Add drained chickpeas, lemon zest, lemon juice, and remaining olive oil (2 Tbsp minus 1 teaspoon) to the bowl with the chicken and spices.\nToss to coat the chicken evenly with the lemon and oil, and make sure that the chickpeas are coated with the spice mixture as well.\n5 Arrange chicken and chickpeas over onion slices: Arrange chicken pieces, skin-side up, on top of the sliced onions in the casserole dish. Arrange the chickpeas between the chicken pieces.\n6 Bake: Bake uncovered at 350\xc2\xb0F for 40-45 minutes, or until the internal temperature of the chicken thighs is at least 165\xc2\xb0F when tested with a meat thermometer, and the top is lightly browned.\nSprinkle with chopped fresh cilantro or parsley. Add more salt and pepper to taste.\nServe with a side salad.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Print\nPasta Skillet with Chicken Sausage, Cheese & Spinach Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 30 minutesYield: 4 to 6 servings\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the marinara sauce (or substitute 2 1/2 to 3 cups store-bought sauce):\n1 1/2 tablespoons olive oil\n1 1/2 cups (180g) diced red onions\n2 cloves garlic, minced\n1 28-oz. (795g) can of crushed tomatoes\n1 tablespoon honey or sugar\n1/4 cup (5g) chopped fresh parsley\n1/4 cup (5g) chopped fresh basil\n1 teaspoon dried oregano\nFor the pasta:\n8 ounces (225g) penne pasta\n1 1/2 tablespoons olive oil\n1 pound (450g) chicken sausage, cut into bit-sized pieces\n4 to 6 cups (100g to 150g) baby spinach\n1 1/2 cups (140g) shredded mozzarella cheese\nChopped parsley, to garnish\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat the oven to 350F.\n2 Make the marinara sauce (or substitute store-bought sauce): Heat 1 1/2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large oven-safe saut\xc3\xa9 pan over medium-high heat. Add the onions and cook for 3 to 4 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the onions are softened and translucent. Add the minced garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Add crushed tomatoes and cook until the sauce starts bubbling at a rapid simmer, 1 to 2 minutes.\nReduce heat to low and let the sauce continue slowly simmering for 5 to 7 minutes, stirring occasionally. Mix in honey, parsley, basil and oregano and cook for another minute. Season sauce with salt to your taste. Turn off heat. (Makes 2 1/2 to 3 cups; keeps 4 to 5 days refrigerated or 3 months frozen.)\n3 Cook the pasta: Bring 2 quarts of water to boil in a pot. Season with a generous pinch of salt. Once the water boils, add pasta and cook for 7 to 9 minutes, depending on how you like your pasta. Drain and run pasta under cold water. Set aside.\n4 Make the sausage and spinach sauce: Heat 1 1/2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chopped sausage and cook for 5 to 7 minutes, until the meat is cooked through. Add pasta sauce and heat for a minute. Add spinach and fold it into the sauce. The spinach should start wilting in 30 seconds.\n5 Bake the pasta: Add pasta to the pan and stir until combined. Top with mozzarella cheese. Put the skillet in the oven and bake for 10 to 12 minutes until the cheese is bubbly and slightly browned at the edges. For a quicker alternative, skip the oven and just stir the cheese into the pasta until the cheese is melted.\n6 Top the pasta with chopped parsley and season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Print\nParmesan Chicken Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: Serves 4-6\nNote that the color of your roasting pan may make a difference in your results. A dark roasting pan (as pictured) may impart more heat and may brown the bottom of the chicken more.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 clove garlic, minced (1 teaspoon)\n1 stick butter (1/2 cup or 1/4 pound), melted\n1 cup dried bread crumbs\n1/3 cup grated Parmesan cheese (or 2/3 cup if you are using a Microplane zester)\n2 Tbsp chopped fresh parsley\n1/4 teaspoon salt\n1/4 teaspoon garlic salt (can sub regular salt)\nA large pinch of Italian seasoning (herb mix)\n1/8 teaspoon ground black pepper\n2 lbs of skinless, boneless, chicken meat, cut into 1-inch to 2-inch wide pieces\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat oven to 450\xc2\xb0F.\n2 Pat chicken pieces dry: Pat the chicken pieces dry with paper towels. Patting the chicken pieces dry will help the chicken pieces have crispy breading when baked.\n3 Prepare melted butter and breadcrumbs: In a small bowl, stir the minced garlic into the melted butter. In another bowl mix together the breadcrumbs, Parmesan, parsley, salt, garlic salt, Italian seasoning, and pepper.\n4 Dredge chicken pieces in butter and Parmesan mixture: Piece by piece, dip the chicken pieces into the garlic melted butter, and then dredge into the Parmesan breadcrumb mixture to coat.\nNote that if your chicken pieces are cold, they may cause the melted butter to thicken, leaving too much butter sticking the chicken pieces. If you see this happening, just reheat the butter.\n5 Place chicken on roasting dish: Place coated chicken pieces on to a 9x13 (or larger) roasting dish. Try to leave a little room between each piece. (You may need to use more than one roasting pan.) Drizzle with remaining garlic butter.\n6 Bake: Bake uncovered at 450\xc2\xb0F 15 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through and juices run clear. Note that the chicken will get much more browned on the bottom side than on the top.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Print\nCauliflower Cheddar Soup Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesCook time: 40 minutesYield: Serves 6 to 8\nINGREDIENTS\n2 Tbsp butter\n2 cups sliced onion\n1 1/2 cups sliced celery (about 2 to 3 ribs)\n1/2 cup sliced carrot (1 small carrot)\n1 1/2 Tbsp minced garlic\n2 Yukon gold potatoes, peeled and thinly sliced, about 1 1/2 to 2 cups\n6 cups chicken stock\n6 cups roughly chopped cauliflower (see How to Cut and Core Cauliflower)\n2 bay leaves\n1 1/2 teaspoons fresh thyme leaves, or 1 teaspoon dried thyme\n1 teaspoon kosher salt\n1/8 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper\n1 1/2 cups grated sharp cheddar cheese (about 6 ounces)\n1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Saut\xc3\xa9 the onions, celery, carrots, garlic: Heat butter in a large 5- to 6- quart Dutch oven or thick bottomed pot on medium high heat. Add the onions, celery, and carrots.\nCook for 5 to 8 minutes until the onions are softened. Add the minced garlic and cook a minute more.\n2 Add the potatoes, stock, cauliflower, bay leaves, thyme, salt and black pepper. Heat on high and bring the stock to a simmer. Lower the heat to maintain a simmer. Partially cover and cook for 12 to 15 minutes, or until the vegetables are completely tender.\n3 Pur\xc3\xa9e until smooth: Remove from heat and remove the bay leaves. Either using an immersion blender or a standing blender, pur\xc3\xa9e the soup mixture until completely smooth.\n4 Add the cheddar cheese and Worcestershire: Slowly add the grated cheddar cheese, continuing to pur\xc3\xa9e the soup as you add the cheese, until completely blended. Stir in the Worcestershire sauce.\nAdd more salt and pepper to taste, if needed.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Print\nEasy Black Beans and Rice Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 20 minutesYield: Serves 6\nINGREDIENTS\n1 cup uncooked white rice\n1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil\n1 small onion, chopped\n1/2 green bell pepper, thinly sliced\n1/2 red bell pepper, thinly sliced (for added flavor you can substitute roasted red bell peppers or some chopped pimentos)\n3 cloves minced garlic\n2 16-ounce cans of black beans, rinsed and drained\n2 tablespoons white vinegar\nA few dashes of Tabasco or 1/4 teaspoon cayenne powder\n1 teaspoon dried oregano OR 1 heaping tablespoon chopped fresh oregano\nSalt and pepper to taste\nOptional Lime wedges and cilantro for garnish\nMETHOD\n1 Cook the rice: Cook rice according to package instructions. White rice usually takes 15 minutes to cook once the water is simmering, and 10 minutes to sit.\n2 Saut\xc3\xa9 onions, bell peppers, garlic: Heat oil in a large skillet on medium high. Saut\xc3\xa9 onions and bell peppers for 3-4 minutes, until just beginning to soften, then add garlic and saut\xc3\xa9 a minute more.\n3 Add beans, vinegar, Tabasco, then simmer: Add the black beans, vinegar and Tabasco or cayenne. Bring vinegar to a simmer, reduce heat, cover and simmer for 5 minutes.\n4 Stir in rice and oregano. Add salt and pepper to taste.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. b'Print\nBaked Chicken Marinara Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 35 minutesYield: Makes 6 servings\nINGREDIENTS\nSauce:\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n3 shallots, peeled, finely chopped\n4 garlic cloves, finely (about 4 teaspoons)\n1 28-ounce can crushed tomatoes\n2 teaspoons dried oregano\n1/4 teaspoon dried crushed red pepper flakes\n1/2 cup chopped fresh basil\nChicken:\n3/4 cup breadcrumbs\n3/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese\n1/2 cup all purpose flour\n2 large eggs, beaten\n9 boneless chicken thighs (skinless or skin-on, your preference), if large pieces, then cut in half\n4 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n3/4 cup grated mozzarella cheese\nMETHOD\n1 Make the sauce: Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in heavy large saucepan over medium heat. Add the shallots and saut\xc3\xa9 until tender, about 4 minutes. Add the garlic and cook a minute more.\nAdd the tomatoes, oregano, and crushed red pepper flakes. Simmer until sauce thickens, about 10 minutes. Stir in the basil and season to taste with salt and pepper. Set aside.\n2 Bread the chicken pieces: Combine the grated Parmesan and the breadcrumbs in a shallow bowl. Put the flour in another separate bowl, and the beaten eggs in another bowl.\nDredge each piece of chicken first in the flour, then dip in the beaten eggs, and then dredge in the breadcrumb mixture.\n3 Preheat oven to 350\xc2\xb0F.\n4 Brown the chicken on the stovetop: Heat 4 Tbsp of olive oil in heavy large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.\nWorking in batches if necessary, add chicken and saut\xc3\xa9 until golden brown and cooked through, about 4 minutes per side.\n5 Bake the chicken with the sauce and cheese: Place chicken pieces on an oven-proof serving dish. Spoon sauce over chicken pieces. Sprinkle with Mozzarella cheese.\nBake for 10 minutes at 350\xc2\xb0F, or microwave on high heat for 10-20 seconds, just until the cheese has melted.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b"Print\nRefried Black Beans Recipe\nPrep time: 1 hour, 10 minutesCook time: 3 hoursYield: Serves 6\nThis recipe gives instructions for making refried beans from scratch, starting with dry beans which must first be cooked. You can also start with three 15-ounce cans of whole black beans, in which case, skip to step 5, rinse and drain the beans and add to the pan with a little water in step 6.\nINGREDIENTS\nIngredients for cooking the dry beans:\n1 pound dry black beans\n1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil\n1/2 teaspoon ground cumin\n1/2 large white onion, chopped (about 1 1/2 cups)\n1 garlic clove, minced\n2 teaspoons salt\n1/2 cup chopped fresh cilantro (leaves and tender stems)\nAdditional ingredients for frying the beans after they've been cooked:\n1 teaspoon chipotle chili powder\n1 teaspoon chili powder\n1/2 teaspoon ground cumin\n1/2 large white onion, chopped (about 1 1/2 cups)\n1 garlic clove, minced\nGreen onion\nCilantro\nCrumbled cotija or queso fresco cheese (omit for vegan version)\nTortilla chips or corn tortillas\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Soak dry beans: Place dry black beans in a bowl and add enough water to cover the beans by two inches. Let sit overnight.\nAlternatively, if you don't have time to soak the beans overnight, place the dry beans in a large bowl and pour boiling water over the beans, covering the beans with at least an inch of water, and let sit for one hour.\nNote, if your dry beans are a little old, or if you have reason to believe that they will be tough to cook (beans stored in hot or humid climates can get tough), you can add some salt to the water (1 1/2 teaspoons of salt 2 quarts of water) which at this stage will help the beans soften when they cook later.\n2 Saut\xc3\xa9 cumin, onion, garlic:  Heat a tablespoon of olive oil in a large thick-bottomed pot (the pot you will use to cook the beans) on medium high heat.\nAdd the cumin. Once the cumin is sizzling, add the chopped onion. Cook for 5 minutes or so, until translucent. Add the minced garlic and cook for a minute more.\n3 Add drained beans and water, simmer 2 hours: Once the beans have soaked, they should have expanded noticeably. Drain the soaking liquid.\nAdd the drained beans and 2 quarts of water to the onions. Bring to a simmer. Partially cover the pot and lower the heat to maintain a simmer. Simmer for 2 hours.\n4 Add Salt and Cilantro, cook 30 min more: After the beans have simmered for 2 hours, add 2 teaspoons of salt (if you salted the soaking water in step 1, then taste first, and only add a teaspoon or so more of salt if you think it needs it).\nAdd 1/2 cup chopped fresh cilantro. Let cook uncovered for another half hour, or until the beans are tender.\n5 Saut\xc3\xa9 the spices, then add onions and cook: Heat 2 Tbsp of olive oil in a large frying pan on medium high heat. Add the chipotle powder, chili powder, and cumin.\nOnce the spices are sizzling, add the chopped white onion and cook until translucent.\nAdd the garlic and cook a minute more.\n6 Add beans, then mash: Add the cooked black beans (and liquid from the pot) to the frying pan. Use a potato masher to mash the beans in the pan.  Let them cook 3 to 4 minutes longer.\nIf the beans are a little soupy for your taste, just let them cook longer. If too thick or dry, add more water. Adjust seasonings to taste.\n7 Serve: Garnish with chopped green onions, fresh cilantro, and crumbled cotija or queso fresco cheese.\nServe with tortilla chips or corn or flour tortillas (corn if you are gluten-free). Great in tacos or burritos, or for a dip, or a side with steak.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b"Print\nChicken Scampi with Angel Hair Pasta Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: 2 to 4 servings\nINGREDIENTS\n1/2 pound angel hair pasta\n2 tablespoons unsalted butter\n2 tablespoons olive oil\n1/2 pound boneless, skinless chicken cutlets\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper\n4 cloves garlic, minced\n1/8 teaspoon (a pinch) crushed red pepper flakes\n1/2 cup dry white wine, such as Sauvignon Blanc\nZest and juice of 1 lemon, plus more lemon wedges for serving (about 1 tablespoon of zest and 3 tablespoons of juice)\n1/4 cup chopped parsley\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Make the pasta: Cook the pasta in a large pot of salted boiling water, according to package instructions or until al dente. Scoop out about a cup of the pasta cooking water and set it aside. Drain the pasta.\n2 Cook the chicken:  Meanwhile, melt the butter with the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Pat the chicken dry and season both sides with the salt and a few grinds of fresh black pepper. Add the chicken to the skillet and cook about 2 minutes per side, until golden brown and cooked through.\nTransfer the chicken to a cutting board to rest, leaving the fat in the pan.\n3 Make the sauce: Add the garlic and red pepper flakes to the skillet and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the wine and lemon juice, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom of the pan, and simmer until reduced by about half, 3 to 5 minutes.\n4 Finish the pasta: Add the cooked pasta, lemon zest, parsley, and 1/2 cup of the reserved pasta water to the skillet and toss to combine. If it seems too dry or like the sauce isn't coating the pasta, stir in some more of the reserved pasta cooking water.\nCut the chicken into slices and toss with the pasta. Serve with extra lemon wedges for squeezing over the scampi.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b'Print\nOne Pot Chicken and Orzo Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 30 minutesYield: Serves 4 to 6\nTo save time, while the chicken is browning, prep the onion, garlic, and parsley.\nYou can easily swap out the thighs for bone-in, skin-on chicken breasts. Depending on the size of the pieces you may want to cut them in half.\nIf you use boneless, skinless thighs or breasts do not brown them as long in the first step. They will not need as much cooking time as the bone-in, skin-on thighs.\nINGREDIENTS\n2 1/2 to 3 pounds bone-in, skin-on chicken thighs, trimmed of excess fat\n2 teaspoons extra virgin olive oil\n1 teaspoon butter\n2 cups (12 ounces or 340 g) orzo pasta\n1 1/2 cups chopped onion (about 1 medium onion)\n2 cloves garlic, minced\n2 1/4 cups chicken stock\n3/4 cup canned crushed tomatoes (including juices)\n1/2 teaspoon black pepper\n1 teaspoon salt\n2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Prep and salt the chicken: Trim the chicken thighs of excess skin and fat. Sprinkle both sides with a little salt.\n2 Brown the chicken thighs: Heat olive oil and melt butter on medium high heat in a large skillet (large enough to fit all of the chicken pieces) to coat the bottom of the pan. When the oil is hot, pat the chicken pieces dry on both sides with paper towels and place skin-side down in the pan. Let cook for 5 minutes or until the chicken has browned on one side.\nThen turn the chicken pieces over and cook for another 4 minutes until lightly browned. Remove the chicken from the pan, set aside.\n3 Brown the orzo pasta, add onions, garlic: Add the orzo pasta to the pan. Stir to coat and let the pasta brown. Once the orzo starts to brown, stir in the chopped onions.\nReduce the heat to medium and let cook, stirring often for 2 to 3 minutes until the onions begin to soften. Add the minced garlic and cook a half minute more.\n4 Stir together stock  tomatoes, salt, pepper: In a large measuring cup, stir together the chicken stock, crushed tomatoes, 1/2 teaspoon pepper, and 1 teaspoon of salt.\n5 Add back chicken, pour stock mixture over orzo: Place the chicken pieces skin-side up, on top of the orzo.\nPour the stock tomato mixture over the orzo. Increase heat to medium high and let the stock in the pan come to a full boil.\n6 Cover and cook: Lower the heat to the lowest heat you need to maintain a bare simmer. Cover and let cook until the orzo has completely absorbed the liquid and the chicken is cooked through, about 10 to 12 minutes.\nRemove from heat and let sit for 5 minutes before serving.\nTaste for salt and pepper and add more if needed. Sprinkle with fresh chopped parsley to serve.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Print\nBaked Chicken with Cherry Tomatoes and Garlic Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 50 minutesYield: Serves 4 to 6\nThis dish produces a lot of flavorful liquid. You can use it for dipping crusty toasted bread. Or, you can remove the chicken, tomatoes, and garlic to a serving dish and pour the strained liquid into a small saucepan and boil until reduced to a thicker sauce. You can pour this sauce back over the chicken or pour it over rice or pasta.\nThe recipe calls for bone-in thighs. If you make it with boneless thighs you may need to reduce the cooking time by a few minutes.\nThe recipe calls for skin-on thighs. If you make it with skinless thighs, try to cover the thighs as much as you can with the tomatoes, to help prevent the meat from drying out. If you make it with skinless breasts, do the same, and reduce the cooking time to 25 minutes.\nINGREDIENTS\n2 pounds (900 g) bone-in, skin-on chicken thighs, trimmed of excess fat\n1/2 teaspoon kosher salt\n2 cups of cherry tomatoes (a heaping basket or 25 to 30 cherry tomatoes)\n6 whole cloves garlic, peeled\n1 1/2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar\n1 1/2 teaspoons extra virgin olive oil\n2 sprigs fresh rosemary (or 1/2 teaspoon dry rosemary)\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Arrange chicken thighs in casserole dish, sprinkle with salt: Place chicken thighs in a baking dish that allows for a little room between the thighs. Sprinkle both sides of the chicken thighs with salt.\n2 Preheat oven to 375\xc2\xb0F (190\xc2\xb0C).\n3 Prep cherry tomatoes with garlic, vinegar, oil: Cut the cherry tomatoes in half. Place in a bowl with the whole garlic cloves. Sprinkle with balsamic vinegar and olive oil.\n4 Place tomatoes, garlic, rosemary around chicken: Pour the cherry tomatoes over the chicken pieces and arrange so that they are squeezed around the chicken pieces. You want the chicken skins to be exposed so they brown in the oven. Lay sprigs of rosemary over the tomatoes.\n(If you are using dry rosemary instead of fresh sprigs, just mix it in with the tomatoes.)\n5 Bake: Bake, uncovered for 45 minutes, until the chicken is well browned on the top and cooked through. Remove from oven and cool for 5 minutes. Skim the excess chicken fat with a ladle.\nServe with toasted crusty bread, buttered noodles, or rice. (Skip for paleo option, skip bread and noodles for gluten-free versions.)\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Print\nAvocado Tuna Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesYield: Makes enough tuna salad for 2 sandwiches\nINGREDIENTS\n1 5-ounce can tuna, preferably packed in olive oil, drained\n1/2 ripe avocado, roughly chopped\n1/2 cup minced celery\n1/4 cup minced red onion\n1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil\n2 teaspoons lemon juice\n1 teaspoon lemon zest\n2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro or parsley\n1/2 teaspoon kosher salt\nFreshly ground black pepper\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Mix: Place all of the ingredients in a medium bowl. Mix with a fork, mashing the avocado and breaking up the chunks of tuna as you go, until the ingredients are well combined.\n2 Finish and serve: Add more oil or salt and pepper if necessary, serve on your favorite sandwich bread or toast.\nHello! b"Save It Print\nShrimp Pasta alla Vodka Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 20 minutesYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n12 ounces fettuccine pasta\nSalt\n2 tablespoons butter\n1 1/2 cups finely chopped onion\n4 cloves garlic, minced, about 4 teaspoons\n1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes\n1 28-ounce can crushed tomatoes\n1/4 cup vodka\n6 tablespoons heavy whipping cream\n1 teaspoon lemon zest\n1 pound peeled, deveined raw shrimp\n3 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley\nFreshly ground black pepper\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Put pasta water on to boil: Put a large pot of salted water (1 Tbsp salt for every 2 quarts of water) on to boil for the pasta.\n2 Saut\xc3\xa9 onions, garlic, red pepper flakes: Melt butter in a large, thick-bottomed pot on medium high heat. Add the onion and saut\xc3\xa9 5 to 7 minutes, until lightly browned.\nLower the heat to medium, add the garlic and red pepper flakes and cook a minute more.\n3 Add tomatoes, vodka, cream, zest: Add the crushed tomatoes to the onions. Stir in the vodka, cream, and lemon zest. Increase heat to bring to a simmer, then lower the heat to maintain a simmer.\n4 Start cooking pasta: As soon as you start simmering the sauce, add pasta to boiling salted water. Pasta should be done in 10 minutes.\n5 Add raw shrimp to sauce: After the sauce has simmered for 5 minutes, about halfway through the pasta cooking time, taste for salt and add salt to taste (you'll likely need about 1 teaspoon). Add the raw peeled and deveined shrimp to the sauce.\nCook until the shrimp is just cooked through, about 5 minutes, then remove from heat.\n6 Add cooked pasta to sauce and shrimp: When the pasta is done, al dente, strain it and add it to the vodka tomato sauce and shrimp.\nSprinkle with parsley and freshly ground black pepper to serve.\nHello! b'Print\nQuick and Easy White Bean Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesYield: Serves 4\nYou can easily double or quadruple the recipe to serve a larger group.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 14.5-ounce can white beans, drained but not rinsed\n2 tablespoons chopped red onion\nA squeeze of lemon juice\n2 teaspoons wine vinegar (red or white)\n1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil\n1/2 teaspoon dry Herbs de Provence (crumbled) OR 1 teaspoon of some combination of finely chopped rosemary, tarragon, thyme, and lavender\nSalt and freshly ground pepper to taste\nMETHOD\n1 Let the onion marinate in lemon juice: After you chop up the onion, squeeze a little lemon juice over it and let it sit while prepping the other ingredients. According to my mother, this will take the edge off the onion.\n2 Combine all ingredients into a serving dish. You can serve right away if you want, but if you chill for a few hours, the flavors will come together better.\nLasts a couple of days in the refrigerator.\nHello!
