b"Print\nDeviled Egg Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: Serves 4-6\nINGREDIENTS\n12 large eggs\n1/4 cup chopped green onion\n1/2 cup chopped celery\n1/2 cup chopped red bell pepper\n2 tablespoons Dijon mustard\n1/3 cup mayonnaise\n1 tablespoon cider, white wine or sherry vinegar\n1/4 teaspoon Tabasco or other hot sauce (more or less to taste)\n1/2 teaspoon paprika (more or less to taste)\n1/2 teaspoon black pepper (more or less to taste)\n1/4 teaspoon salt (more to taste)\n  METHOD\n1 Hard boil the eggs: The easiest way to make hard boiled eggs that are easy to peel is to steam them. Fill a saucepan with 1 inch of water and insert a steamer basket. (If you don't have a steamer basket, that's ok.)\nBring the water to a boil, gently place the eggs in the steamer basket or directly in the saucepan. Cover the pot. Set your timer for 15 minutes. Remove eggs and set in icy cold water to cool.\nFor more advice, see our How to Steam Hard Boiled Eggs. (You can also pressure cook them.)\n2 Prep the eggs and veggies: Chop the eggs coarsely and put them into a large bowl. Add the green onion, celery, and red bell pepper.\n3 Make the salad: In small bowl, mix together the mayo, mustard, vinegar, and Tabasco. Gently stir the mayo dressing into the bowl with the eggs and vegetables. Add the paprika and salt and black pepper. Adjust seasonings to taste.\nBest served chilled.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b'Print\nSkillet Chicken Puttanesca Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 20 minutesYield: 4 servings\nThe anchovy fillets in this recipe are highly recommended. They add a savory, somewhat salty depth and hardly any fishiness.\nYou can double the recipe easily if you have a larger skillet.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 can (28 ounces) whole peeled tomatoes, with their juices\n4 anchovy fillets, coarsely chopped (optional)\n1 cup pitted Kalamata or other black olives, coarsely chopped\n1/4 cup capers\n1 teaspoon crushed red pepper, or more to taste\n3 tablespoons chopped fresh oregano\n4 skinless, boneless chicken breasts (about 3 pounds)\n1/2 teaspoon salt, or more to taste\n1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper, or more to taste\n3 tablespoons olive oil, divided\n2 cloves garlic, finely chopped\nExtra sprigs fresh oregano, for garnish\nCrusty bread, to serve (skip if serving gluten-free)\nSpecial equipment:\n12-inch skillet with a lid\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Prep the tomato sauce: Pour the tomatoes into a bowl and crush with your hands or with a wooden spoon until you have uneven 1-inch pieces (you can also use scissors to snip the tomatoes into small pieces).\nMix in the anchovies, olives, capers, red pepper, and 2 tablespoons of the oregano to the bowl. Set aside.\n2 Sear the chicken: Sprinkle the chicken all over with salt and black pepper. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil until hot.\nAdd the chicken and cook without disturbing for 3 minutes, or until browned. If you are using a cast-iron or stainless steel skillet, do not turn until the chicken moves easily without prodding.\nTurn and cook the other side for 3 minutes. Transfer to a plate.\n3 Make the sauce: In the skillet over medium heat, heat the remaining 1 tablespoon oil. Add the garlic and cook, stirring, for 1 minute.\nAdd the tomato mixture \xe2\x80\x93 be careful since the juices will splutter when you add them to the pan. Cook for 1 minute or until the spluttering stops. Stir well, turn down the heat, and simmer for 5 minutes. Taste for seasoning and add more salt, black pepper, or red pepper, if you like.\n4 Add the chicken and finish the sauce: Add the chicken breasts and any juices to the skillet and spoon a little sauce over top.\nCover the pan and simmer for 5 to 8 minutes, or until a meat thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the chicken registers 165F.\n5 Serve: Serve straight from the skillet or transfer to a serving platter. Sprinkle the remaining 1 tablespoon oregano over the top and garnish with oregano sprigs. Serve with plenty of crusty bread.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b"Print\nMom\xe2\x80\x99s Stuffed Bell Peppers Recipe\nYield: Serves 4 to 6\nRed and yellow bell peppers have a very different flavor than green bell peppers. The red ones especially are much sweeter. Any bell pepper can be used for this recipe; use the type you like the best.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 1/2 to 2 cups cooked white rice (starting from about 3/4 to 1 cup raw white rice)\n4 to 6 bell peppers (red, yellow, or green), use 4 large, or 6 medium sized\n1 to 1 1/4 pound of ground beef (ground chuck, 16% fat)\n6 large fresh basil leaves, chopped (or 1 1/2 teaspoons dried basil)\n1/2 teaspoon dry summer savory or thyme\n1/2 teaspoon ground marjoram (or 2 teaspoons of fresh chopped)\n(Can substitute herbs with other herbs such as an Italian herb mix)\n1 teaspoon salt\nFreshly ground black pepper\n1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil\nPaprika\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cook the rice: If you haven't already made the rice, start cooking the rice following the package instructions (usually 1 cup of raw white rice plus 1 1/2 cups of water and 1/2 teaspoon of salt, bring to boil, reduce heat to low, cover and cook for 15 minutes.)\n2 Steam the bell peppers: Cut the tops off of the bell peppers. Remove and discard (compost) the stem and seeds.\nPlace bell peppers cut side up on a steaming rack over an inch of water in a large covered pot. Bring to boil, let steam for 10 minutes. (Note you can skip this step if you want, but steaming the pepper shells first will make them more tender and easier to eat.)\n3 Mix the filling: Heat oven to 350\xc2\xb0F. In a large bowl mix together the ground beef, basil, summer savory, marjoram, salt, several turns of black pepper, and the cooked rice.\n4 Fill the bell peppers: Remove bell peppers from steamer pan. Place cut side up in a pyrex or other oven-proof casserole. Gently stuff the peppers with the ground beef rice mixture.\nDrizzle olive oil over the stuffed peppers, along the outside of the peppers, and into the pan. Rub the oil over the outside of the peppers; it will help with browning. Sprinkle the tops generously with paprika.\n5 Bake: Place on the middle rack of the oven and bake at 350\xc2\xb0F for 35-50 minutes, or longer, until the meat is cooked through.\nServe with ketchup.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b'Print\nPaprika Chicken with Chickpeas Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 40 minutesYield: Serves 4 to 6\nFeel free to add other spices if you have them on hand, like ground cumin, coriander, even a pinch of cinnamon.\nINGREDIENTS\n2 tablespoons smoked paprika\n1 1/2 teaspoons salt\n3/4 teaspoon black pepper\n1/2 teaspoon garlic powder\n1/4 teaspoon ground oregano\n2 pounds chicken thighs (we used bone-in, skin-on), trimmed of excess fat\n1 medium onion, thinly sliced\n1 14-ounce can chickpeas, drained\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n1 teaspoon lemon zest\n1 tablespoon lemon juice\n1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro or parsley\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Coat chicken with spices: Stir together the smoked paprika, salt, garlic powder, pepper, and ground oregano in a large bowl. Place the chicken thighs in the bowl and toss to coat completely with the spices.\nYou can do this several hours ahead, or right before cooking. Your choice. The longer the chicken sits in the rub, the more the flavors will permeate.\n2 Preheat oven to 350\xc2\xb0F.\n3 Layer a casserole dish with sliced onions: Place the thinly sliced onions in the bottom of a casserole dish large enough to hold the chicken pieces with room in between.\nToss with about 1 teaspoon of the olive oil and spread out in an even layer at the bottom of the dish.\n4 Add chickpeas, lemon, oil to chicken: Add drained chickpeas, lemon zest, lemon juice, and remaining olive oil (2 Tbsp minus 1 teaspoon) to the bowl with the chicken and spices.\nToss to coat the chicken evenly with the lemon and oil, and make sure that the chickpeas are coated with the spice mixture as well.\n5 Arrange chicken and chickpeas over onion slices: Arrange chicken pieces, skin-side up, on top of the sliced onions in the casserole dish. Arrange the chickpeas between the chicken pieces.\n6 Bake: Bake uncovered at 350\xc2\xb0F for 40-45 minutes, or until the internal temperature of the chicken thighs is at least 165\xc2\xb0F when tested with a meat thermometer, and the top is lightly browned.\nSprinkle with chopped fresh cilantro or parsley. Add more salt and pepper to taste.\nServe with a side salad.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Print\nPasta Skillet with Chicken Sausage, Cheese & Spinach Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 30 minutesYield: 4 to 6 servings\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the marinara sauce (or substitute 2 1/2 to 3 cups store-bought sauce):\n1 1/2 tablespoons olive oil\n1 1/2 cups (180g) diced red onions\n2 cloves garlic, minced\n1 28-oz. (795g) can of crushed tomatoes\n1 tablespoon honey or sugar\n1/4 cup (5g) chopped fresh parsley\n1/4 cup (5g) chopped fresh basil\n1 teaspoon dried oregano\nFor the pasta:\n8 ounces (225g) penne pasta\n1 1/2 tablespoons olive oil\n1 pound (450g) chicken sausage, cut into bit-sized pieces\n4 to 6 cups (100g to 150g) baby spinach\n1 1/2 cups (140g) shredded mozzarella cheese\nChopped parsley, to garnish\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat the oven to 350F.\n2 Make the marinara sauce (or substitute store-bought sauce): Heat 1 1/2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large oven-safe saut\xc3\xa9 pan over medium-high heat. Add the onions and cook for 3 to 4 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the onions are softened and translucent. Add the minced garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Add crushed tomatoes and cook until the sauce starts bubbling at a rapid simmer, 1 to 2 minutes.\nReduce heat to low and let the sauce continue slowly simmering for 5 to 7 minutes, stirring occasionally. Mix in honey, parsley, basil and oregano and cook for another minute. Season sauce with salt to your taste. Turn off heat. (Makes 2 1/2 to 3 cups; keeps 4 to 5 days refrigerated or 3 months frozen.)\n3 Cook the pasta: Bring 2 quarts of water to boil in a pot. Season with a generous pinch of salt. Once the water boils, add pasta and cook for 7 to 9 minutes, depending on how you like your pasta. Drain and run pasta under cold water. Set aside.\n4 Make the sausage and spinach sauce: Heat 1 1/2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chopped sausage and cook for 5 to 7 minutes, until the meat is cooked through. Add pasta sauce and heat for a minute. Add spinach and fold it into the sauce. The spinach should start wilting in 30 seconds.\n5 Bake the pasta: Add pasta to the pan and stir until combined. Top with mozzarella cheese. Put the skillet in the oven and bake for 10 to 12 minutes until the cheese is bubbly and slightly browned at the edges. For a quicker alternative, skip the oven and just stir the cheese into the pasta until the cheese is melted.\n6 Top the pasta with chopped parsley and season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Print\nParmesan Chicken Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: Serves 4-6\nNote that the color of your roasting pan may make a difference in your results. A dark roasting pan (as pictured) may impart more heat and may brown the bottom of the chicken more.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 clove garlic, minced (1 teaspoon)\n1 stick butter (1/2 cup or 1/4 pound), melted\n1 cup dried bread crumbs\n1/3 cup grated Parmesan cheese (or 2/3 cup if you are using a Microplane zester)\n2 Tbsp chopped fresh parsley\n1/4 teaspoon salt\n1/4 teaspoon garlic salt (can sub regular salt)\nA large pinch of Italian seasoning (herb mix)\n1/8 teaspoon ground black pepper\n2 lbs of skinless, boneless, chicken meat, cut into 1-inch to 2-inch wide pieces\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat oven to 450\xc2\xb0F.\n2 Pat chicken pieces dry: Pat the chicken pieces dry with paper towels. Patting the chicken pieces dry will help the chicken pieces have crispy breading when baked.\n3 Prepare melted butter and breadcrumbs: In a small bowl, stir the minced garlic into the melted butter. In another bowl mix together the breadcrumbs, Parmesan, parsley, salt, garlic salt, Italian seasoning, and pepper.\n4 Dredge chicken pieces in butter and Parmesan mixture: Piece by piece, dip the chicken pieces into the garlic melted butter, and then dredge into the Parmesan breadcrumb mixture to coat.\nNote that if your chicken pieces are cold, they may cause the melted butter to thicken, leaving too much butter sticking the chicken pieces. If you see this happening, just reheat the butter.\n5 Place chicken on roasting dish: Place coated chicken pieces on to a 9x13 (or larger) roasting dish. Try to leave a little room between each piece. (You may need to use more than one roasting pan.) Drizzle with remaining garlic butter.\n6 Bake: Bake uncovered at 450\xc2\xb0F 15 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through and juices run clear. Note that the chicken will get much more browned on the bottom side than on the top.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Print\nCauliflower Cheddar Soup Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesCook time: 40 minutesYield: Serves 6 to 8\nINGREDIENTS\n2 Tbsp butter\n2 cups sliced onion\n1 1/2 cups sliced celery (about 2 to 3 ribs)\n1/2 cup sliced carrot (1 small carrot)\n1 1/2 Tbsp minced garlic\n2 Yukon gold potatoes, peeled and thinly sliced, about 1 1/2 to 2 cups\n6 cups chicken stock\n6 cups roughly chopped cauliflower (see How to Cut and Core Cauliflower)\n2 bay leaves\n1 1/2 teaspoons fresh thyme leaves, or 1 teaspoon dried thyme\n1 teaspoon kosher salt\n1/8 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper\n1 1/2 cups grated sharp cheddar cheese (about 6 ounces)\n1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Saut\xc3\xa9 the onions, celery, carrots, garlic: Heat butter in a large 5- to 6- quart Dutch oven or thick bottomed pot on medium high heat. Add the onions, celery, and carrots.\nCook for 5 to 8 minutes until the onions are softened. Add the minced garlic and cook a minute more.\n2 Add the potatoes, stock, cauliflower, bay leaves, thyme, salt and black pepper. Heat on high and bring the stock to a simmer. Lower the heat to maintain a simmer. Partially cover and cook for 12 to 15 minutes, or until the vegetables are completely tender.\n3 Pur\xc3\xa9e until smooth: Remove from heat and remove the bay leaves. Either using an immersion blender or a standing blender, pur\xc3\xa9e the soup mixture until completely smooth.\n4 Add the cheddar cheese and Worcestershire: Slowly add the grated cheddar cheese, continuing to pur\xc3\xa9e the soup as you add the cheese, until completely blended. Stir in the Worcestershire sauce.\nAdd more salt and pepper to taste, if needed.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Print\nEasy Black Beans and Rice Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 20 minutesYield: Serves 6\nINGREDIENTS\n1 cup uncooked white rice\n1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil\n1 small onion, chopped\n1/2 green bell pepper, thinly sliced\n1/2 red bell pepper, thinly sliced (for added flavor you can substitute roasted red bell peppers or some chopped pimentos)\n3 cloves minced garlic\n2 16-ounce cans of black beans, rinsed and drained\n2 tablespoons white vinegar\nA few dashes of Tabasco or 1/4 teaspoon cayenne powder\n1 teaspoon dried oregano OR 1 heaping tablespoon chopped fresh oregano\nSalt and pepper to taste\nOptional Lime wedges and cilantro for garnish\nMETHOD\n1 Cook the rice: Cook rice according to package instructions. White rice usually takes 15 minutes to cook once the water is simmering, and 10 minutes to sit.\n2 Saut\xc3\xa9 onions, bell peppers, garlic: Heat oil in a large skillet on medium high. Saut\xc3\xa9 onions and bell peppers for 3-4 minutes, until just beginning to soften, then add garlic and saut\xc3\xa9 a minute more.\n3 Add beans, vinegar, Tabasco, then simmer: Add the black beans, vinegar and Tabasco or cayenne. Bring vinegar to a simmer, reduce heat, cover and simmer for 5 minutes.\n4 Stir in rice and oregano. Add salt and pepper to taste.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. b'Print\nBaked Chicken Marinara Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 35 minutesYield: Makes 6 servings\nINGREDIENTS\nSauce:\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n3 shallots, peeled, finely chopped\n4 garlic cloves, finely (about 4 teaspoons)\n1 28-ounce can crushed tomatoes\n2 teaspoons dried oregano\n1/4 teaspoon dried crushed red pepper flakes\n1/2 cup chopped fresh basil\nChicken:\n3/4 cup breadcrumbs\n3/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese\n1/2 cup all purpose flour\n2 large eggs, beaten\n9 boneless chicken thighs (skinless or skin-on, your preference), if large pieces, then cut in half\n4 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n3/4 cup grated mozzarella cheese\nMETHOD\n1 Make the sauce: Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in heavy large saucepan over medium heat. Add the shallots and saut\xc3\xa9 until tender, about 4 minutes. Add the garlic and cook a minute more.\nAdd the tomatoes, oregano, and crushed red pepper flakes. Simmer until sauce thickens, about 10 minutes. Stir in the basil and season to taste with salt and pepper. Set aside.\n2 Bread the chicken pieces: Combine the grated Parmesan and the breadcrumbs in a shallow bowl. Put the flour in another separate bowl, and the beaten eggs in another bowl.\nDredge each piece of chicken first in the flour, then dip in the beaten eggs, and then dredge in the breadcrumb mixture.\n3 Preheat oven to 350\xc2\xb0F.\n4 Brown the chicken on the stovetop: Heat 4 Tbsp of olive oil in heavy large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.\nWorking in batches if necessary, add chicken and saut\xc3\xa9 until golden brown and cooked through, about 4 minutes per side.\n5 Bake the chicken with the sauce and cheese: Place chicken pieces on an oven-proof serving dish. Spoon sauce over chicken pieces. Sprinkle with Mozzarella cheese.\nBake for 10 minutes at 350\xc2\xb0F, or microwave on high heat for 10-20 seconds, just until the cheese has melted.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b"Save It Print\nChicken Cacciatore (Hunter Style Chicken) Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 1 hour, 10 minutesYield: Serves 4-6\nThis recipe calls for added wine, which is traditional. It does add to the flavor. If you have a dietary restriction that prohibits wine, just omit.\nINGREDIENTS\nOne 4 pound chicken, cut into serving pieces, trimmed of excess fat (or 3 1/2 to 4 pounds of chicken thighs, bone in, skin on)\nSalt\n2 Tbsp extra virgin olive oil\n1 medium onion, thinly sliced root to tip, about 1 1/2 cups\n1 red or green bell pepper, seeded, sliced into 1/4-inch wide slices\n8 ounces cremini mushrooms, thickly sliced\n2 garlic cloves, thinly sliced\n1/3 cup white or red wine\n2 1/2 to 3 cups peeled and chopped, firm ripe tomatoes, with their juices,  or 1 28 ounce can of plum tomatoes in their juice\n1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper\n1 teaspoon dry thyme (or 2 teaspoons fresh, chopped)\n1 teaspoon dry oregano (or 2 teaspoons fresh, chopped)\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Brown the chicken: Rinse chicken and pat dry. Season the chicken pieces on all sides with salt. Heat olive oil in a large skillet on medium heat.\nWorking in batches so that you don't crowd the pan, place the chicken pieces skin side down in the pan.  Cook until nicely browned, about 5 minutes, then turn over and lightly brown the other side.\nRemove chicken to a bowl, set aside. Drain off all but 2 tablespoons of the rendered fat. If you have less than 2 Tbsp of fat in the pan, add more olive oil until you have about that much oil coating the pan.\n2 Saut\xc3\xa9 the onions, bell peppers, mushrooms, garlic: Add the sliced onions, bell peppers, and mushrooms to the pan. Increase the heat to medium high.\nCook until the onions are translucent, and the mushrooms have given up most of their moisture, stirring frequently, about 10 minutes.\nAdd the garlic to the pan and cook a minute more.\n3 Deglaze pan with wine, add tomatoes, spices: Add the wine and scrape up any browned bits at the bottom of the pan. Simmer until the wine is reduced by half. Add the tomatoes.\nStir in the pepper, thyme, oregano, and about a teaspoon of salt. Test and taste to adjust. Simmer uncovered for another 5 minutes.\n4 Add chicken back to pan, partially cover, cook until tender: Place the chicken pieces on top of the tomatoes and onions, skin side up. Lower the heat and cover the skillet with the lid slightly ajar.\nCook the chicken on a low simmer, turning and basting from time to time. Cook until the thighs are tender, about 30 to 40 minutes.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Print\nEasy Mexican Chicken and Rice Soup Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 20 minutesYield: 4 to 6 servings\nINGREDIENTS\n2 tablespoons olive oil\n1 medium onion, diced\n1 teaspoon dried oregano\n1/4 teaspoon salt, or to taste\n1/8 teaspoon black pepper, or to taste\n1 (15-ounce) can fire-roasted diced tomatoes, with juices\n6 cups low-sodium chicken broth\n1 cup fresh or frozen corn kernels\n1/3 cup medium- or long-grain white rice (not cooked)\n2 cups cooked and shredded chicken (See Recipe Note)\nLeaves from 1/2 bunch fresh cilantro sprigs, for garnish\n1 to 2 limes, quartered, for garnish\nCorn or flour tortillas, to serve\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cook the onion: In a large pot over medium heat, warm the oil. Add the onion and oregano. Cook, stirring often for 3 to 4 minutes, or until the onion begins to soften. Stir in the salt and pepper.\n2 Simmer the soup: Add the tomatoes, chicken broth, corn, and rice. Bring to a boil over high heat. Turn down the heat and simmer for 18 to 20 minutes, or until the rice is tender.\n3 Add the chicken: Add the chicken and simmer for 1 to 2 minutes, or until the chicken is hot. Taste, and season with more salt and pepper, if you like.\n4 Serve the soup: Ladle the soup into bowls and serve hot with the cilantro and lime wedges on top, and warm tortillas on the side.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Save It Print\nCurried Ground Turkey with Potatoes Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesCook time: 40 minutesYield: Serves 4\nYou can easily substitute ground chicken, beef or lamb for the ground turkey. The "curry" part of this recipe is flexible. Use your favorite curry powder, garam masala, or Indian spice mix.\nINGREDIENTS\n3-4 Tbsp vegetable oil (or ghee or coconut oil)\n1 pound ground turkey (thigh meat if you can get it)\n1 chopped onion\n1-2 chopped fresh red chiles (optional)\nSalt to taste\nA 1-inch piece of peeled ginger, grated fine\n2 garlic cloves, minced (about 2 teaspoons)\n1 Tbsp garam masala (or curry powder)\n1 teaspoon turmeric\n1 teaspoon ground cumin\n1 teaspoon ground coriander\n1/2 cup water\n2 large Yukon Gold potatoes, peeled and cut into 1-inch chunks\n2-4 Roma or other plum tomatoes, diced\n1 cup fresh or frozen peas\n1/2 cup (loosely packed) chopped cilantro or parsley\nMETHOD\n1 Brown the ground turkey: Heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat in a large pot with a lid. When the oil is hot, add the ground turkey, spreading it out over the pan.\nTry not to crowd the meat (you may need to cook in batches). Cook the meat without stirring, until it begins to brown.\n2 Add onion and chiles: Add the chopped onion and chiles. Stir and saut\xc3\xa9 for 4-5 minutes, or until the onion begins to color a bit. Sprinkle salt over everything.\n3 Add ginger and garlic: Add the grated ginger and garlic, mix well and saut\xc3\xa9 for another 1-2 minutes.\n4 Add spices, water, potatoes, then simmer: Mix in the spices (garam masala, turmeric, cumin, coriander), water, and the potatoes. Stir to combine and cover. Turn the heat down to medium-low and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender.\n5 Add tomatoes and peas: When the potatoes are tender, add the diced tomatoes and peas. Mix well and cover the pot. Cook 2-3 minutes. Add salt, if needed, to taste.\n6 Stir in chopped cilantro to serve: Right before you serve, mix in the chopped cilantro. Serve alone or with flatbread or white rice.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Print\nWhite Bean and Tuna Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n1 cup of chopped red onions or shallots\nThe zest and juice of 1 lemon or 2 limes (can sub a tablespoon or two of cider vinegar)\n2 five to six ounce cans of tuna packed in olive oil\n2 15-ounce cans of cannellini or Great Northern white beans, rinsed and drained\n1/2 cup (loosely packed) of chopped parsley or arugula, or 2 tablespoons thinly sliced mint\nA few splashes of Tabasco sauce, or 1 minced Serrano chile or 1 teaspoon red chile flakes\n1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper\nSalt and more extra virgin olive oil to taste\nMETHOD\n1 Sprinkle some of the lemon juice over the chopped onions while you prepare the other ingredients. This will take some of the oniony edge off the onions.\n2 Combine ingredients in a bowl: Drain the oil from the tuna and put the tuna into a large bowl. Add the beans to the tuna and gently stir to combine.\nAdd the onions, herbs, black pepper, lemon zest and lemon juice and mix to combine. Add Tabasco or chili to taste.\nIf the salad needs more acid, add a little more lemon juice. If the salad seems a little dry, add a little bit of extra virgin olive oil. Add salt to taste.\n3 Chill before serving. This salad will last several days in the fridge, tightly covered.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. b'Print\nPulled Pork Sandwich Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 2 hours, 45 minutesYield: Serves 6 to 8\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the sauce:\n1 large onion, chopped\n6 garlic cloves, peeled\n1 pickled jalape\xc3\xb1o pepper, seeded and chopped\n2 teaspoons Chipotle chile powder\n1 tablespoon tomato paste\n2 tablespoon Dijon mustard\n3/4 cup distilled white vinegar\n1 teaspoon paprika\n1/3 cup ketchup\n2 teaspoons Worcestershire sauce\n1/4 cup light brown sugar\nSalt\nFor the pork:\n1 bay leaf\n3 pounds pork butt shoulder roast\nHamburger buns\nMETHOD\n1 Pur\xc3\xa9e sauce ingredients in blender: Pur\xc3\xa9e all of the sauce ingredients (everything except the bay leaf, the pork and the buns) in a blender until smooth.\nIf you have extra time, marinate the pork in the sauce overnight or for several hours before cooking.\n2 Simmer pork: Put sauce, bay leaf, and pork into a large pot and add 1 quart of water. Bring mixture to a boil, then reduce to a simmer. Cook, covered, turning frequently, for 2 hours or until the meat pulls apart easily with a fork.\n3 Shred the pork: Remove from heat and cool pork in the sauce. When cool enough to touch, remove the pork from the sauce and shred into small pieces. Set aside.\n4 Reduce sauce, return pork to sauce: Put the sauce back on the stove and bring it to a low boil. Let the sauce boil down until it has been reduced by two thirds. Add the pork back to the sauce. Salt to taste.\n5 Serve: Remove the bay leaf before serving. Serve the pork hot over open-face hamburger buns.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Print\nAsian Tuna Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesYield: Serves 2-4\nINGREDIENTS\n10-12 ounces of canned white albacore tuna packed in water, drained\n8-10 small radishes, cut into wedges\n1 large carrot, shredded\n1 clove garlic, smashed and minced\n1 teaspoon minced ginger\n1/2 to 1 serrano chile, seeded and minced (taste for heat and adjust, can also sub some chili pepper flakes)\n2 Tbsp vegetable oil\n1 teaspoon dark sesame oil\n3 Tbsp seasoned rice vinegar (or plain rice vinegar with a teaspoon of sugar)\nSalt and black pepper to taste\n2 Tbsp chopped cilantro\n1 whole green onion, chopped\nOptional: 8 ounces (dry) soba noodles* or fresh lettuce\n*If mixing in with soba noodles, cook soba noodles according to package directions, and rinse with cold water.\nMETHOD\n1 Place the drained tuna, radishes, shredded carrot, garlic, ginger, chile, vegetable oil, dark sesame oil, and rice vinegar in a large bowl. b'Print\nTuna and Tomato Pasta Casserole Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 40 minutesYield: Serves 6-8\nTuna packed in olive oil is highly recommended for this recipe. If all you have is tuna packed in water, you can try draining it and then adding olive oil to the can, and letting it soak in the olive oil in the fridge for several hours, but you will get the best results if you start with tuna packed in oil.\nINGREDIENTS\n4 tablespoons unsalted butter\n1 28-ounce can of tomatoes, whole or crushed\nSalt\n1 pound pasta shells\n1/2 cup ricotta cheese\n1 6-ounce can tuna packed in olive oil\n1/4 cup fresh basil, chopped or torn\nA generous 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Simmer tomatoes with butter 30 min: Melt the butter in a medium pot on medium heat and add the can of tomatoes, including the juice. If you are using whole canned tomatoes (or fresh ones) crush them with your (clean) fingers as you put them in the pot. Simmer gently, partially covered, for 30 minutes.\n2 Cook pasta: While the sauce is cooking, heat a large pot of well salted water to a strong boil. Add the shell pasta to the boiling water and cook at a vigorous boil, uncovered, until al dente, cooked through but still a bit firm to the bite, which is usually whatever the time specified on the pasta package minus about 2 minutes. Drain and set aside.\n3 Combine tuna, tomato sauce, ricotta, pasta, basil: Pour off the excess oil from the tuna can and stir the tuna into the tomato sauce. Add the ricotta cheese, and add salt to taste. Turn off the heat. Mix the sauce with the pasta in a large bowl. Mix in the basil.\n4 Put into casserole, top with parmesan, broil: Pour the pasta into a 2 to 3-quart casserole dish and top with the parmesan cheese. Put under a hot broiler for 4-6 minutes, until the cheese is melted and lightly browned. Serve hot.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Print\nSpanish Roasted Potatoes with Tomato Sauce (Patatas Bravas) Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 1 hourYield: Serves 4 as a side dish\nThis recipe makes more than enough sauce for the potatoes, so you can double the amount of potatoes for more servings, or save the extra sauce for later. It will keep a week in the refrigerator.\nINGREDIENTS\n2 pounds Yukon gold potatoes, or other waxy potato (peeled or un-peeled, your choice), cut into 1 to 1 1/2-inch chunks\nExtra virgin olive oil\nSalt\n1/2 medium yellow onion, chopped\n3 garlic cloves, chopped\n1/2 cup white wine (can substitute stock)\n2 tablespoons tomato paste\nA 14-ounce can of crushed tomatoes\n2 teaspoons Tabasco or other hot sauce\n1 teaspoon smoked paprika\n1 teaspoon salt\n1 teaspoon sugar\nMETHOD\n1 Roast the potatoes: Preheat oven to 375\xc2\xb0F. Toss the potatoes with 3 tablespoons of olive oil and salt well. Arrange in one layer in a casserole pan or rimmed baking tray and roast until browned, about 50 minutes.\n2 Saut\xc3\xa9 onions and garlic: While the potatoes are roasting, make the sauce. Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a medium pot set over medium-high heat. Saut\xc3\xa9 the chopped onions, stirring occasionally, for 4-5 minutes, or until they begin to brown on the edges. Add the garlic and saut\xc3\xa9 another 2 minutes.\n3 Make the sauce: Add the white wine to the pan and turn the heat to high. Boil on a high boil until the wine is reduced by half, then add the tomato paste and stir to combine. Add the crushed tomatoes, Tabasco sauce, salt, sugar and smoked paprika. Stir well and reduce the heat to a bare simmer. Let the sauce cook slowly while the potatoes roast. If you want, you can use a blender or an immersion blender to pur\xc3\xa9e the sauce until smooth.\n4 Toss potatoes with sauce, continue to roast: When the potatoes are well browned, toss with the tomato sauce and return to the casserole pan. Continue to roast until the tomato sauce dries out a bit on the potatoes and caramelizes, about 10 minutes.\nServe with the remaining tomato sauce as an appetizer or side dish.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Print\nSalmon Macaroni Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 20 minutesYield: Serves 4\nTip: add the macaroni to the salmon mayo mixture when it is still warm. That way it will absorb the flavors better.\nPrep the salad ingredients while the pasta water is heating and the macaroni cooking.\nINGREDIENTS\n1/2 pound (about 2 cups) dry macaroni pasta\nSalt\n2 (7-ounce) cans salmon\n1/2 cup mayonnaise (plus more to taste or for added smoothness)\n1 teaspoon mustard\n1 teaspoon lemon zest\n1 Tbsp lemon juice\n1/3 cup chopped shallots, red onions, or green onions (with onion greens)\n2 Tbsp chopped fresh parsley\n1 Tbsp chopped fresh dill (or 1/2 teaspoon dried dill)\n2 stalks celery, chopped\nTabasco to taste (we used about 10 drops)\nFreshly ground black pepper\nMETHOD\n1 Boil the macaroni pasta: Bring a pot of water (2 quarts) to a boil. Add 1 Tbsp salt. Add the dry macaroni pasta and cook, uncovered, in a rolling boil for about 10 minutes, or until the macaroni is al dente (slightly firm). Remove from heat, drain, rinse briefly in cold water (macaroni should be still warm after rinsing) and drain again.\n2 Mix salmon and other ingredients in a large bowl: In a large bowl mix the salmon, mayonnaise, mustard, lemon zest, and lemon juice. Mix in the shallots, parsley, dill, and celery.\n3 Stir in drained, warm macaroni: Mix in the cooked macaroni while it is still warm. Add Tabasco and freshly ground black pepper to taste. As the macaroni absorbs the mayonnaise, you may need to add some water to the salad to keep it from being dry. Adjust seasonings.\nChill before serving.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Save It Print\nSausage, Pepper, and Potato Bake Recipe\nPrep time: 25 minutesCook time: 1 hourYield: 4 servings (or 6 with other side dishes)\nINGREDIENTS\n3 tablespoons olive oil, separated\n1 1/2 pounds Yukon gold potatoes (about 4 medium), washed and unpeeled\n1 teaspoon kosher salt, separated\n1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper, separated\n5 tablespoons balsamic vinegar\n2 teaspoons Dijon mustard\n1 tablespoon fresh rosemary, chopped\n1 teaspoon whole grain mustard\n1 clove garlic, peeled and crushed\n1/2 red bell pepper, thinly sliced\n1/2 yellow bell pepper, thinly sliced\n1/2 orange bell pepper, thinly sliced\n1/2 white onion, thinly sliced\n1 (14-ounce) package kielbasa (or Polish sausage), sliced into thin rounds about 1/4-inch thick\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat your oven to 400\xc2\xb0F and prep the pan. Pour 1 tablespoon of the olive oil into an 9x13 baking dish and use your hand, or a brush, to grease the bottom and sides of the dish. This oil will help create a crisp crust on the bottom of the baked potatoes.\n2 Prep and start baking the potatoes: Thinly slice the potatoes to about 1/8-inch thick; use a mandoline if needed. Try to keep the potato slices together as you cut as this makes it easier to assemble them in the dish.\nFan the potatoes slightly in the dish, overlapping them like a fallen set of dominoes in the pan and creating four rows of potatoes. Sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon of kosher salt and an 1/8 teaspoon of the black pepper.\nBake the potatoes for 30 minutes.\n3 Make the vinaigrette: Combine the vinegar, 2 tablespoons olive oil, both mustards, rosemary, garlic, and the remaining salt and pepper in a glass jar with a tight-fitting lid (or in a bowl).\nShake the ingredients together vigorously until combined. If you\xe2\x80\x99re making the dressing in a bowl, use a whisk or an immersion blender to combine. Set this aside.\n4 Add the peppers, onions, and sausage to the dish: Carefully remove the dish of potatoes from the oven and evenly arrange the peppers, then the onions, and lastly, the sausage, on top of the potatoes.\nGive the dressing another vigorous shake and pour evenly over the top of the casserole.\n5 Bake the dish: Return the dish to the oven and bake for an additional 30 minutes, or until a knife inserted into the middle of a potato offers no resistance.\n6 Cool and serve: Remove the dish from the oven and cool for 5 minutes before serving. Leftovers will keep in a covered container for up to two days in the fridge.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nCheesy Baked Hot Dogs Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 30 minutesYield: 6 hot dogs; serves 2 adults and 2 kids\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the hot dogs:\n6 all-beef hot dogs\n6 hot dogs buns, top cut\n3/4 to 1 cup grated cheddar cheese\n1/2 white onion, diced\nSweet pickle relish\nKetchup\nFor the Dad Add - quick giardiniera:\n1/2 cup diced dill pickles\n1/2 cup diced spicy pickled cauliflower\n1/4 cup diced banana peppers\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat oven to 400\xc2\xb0F.\n2 Sear the hot dogs: In a medium skillet, add the hot dogs and cook over medium heat until they are starting to blister on all sides, 4 to 5 minutes. Don\xe2\x80\x99t overcook them.\n3 Assemble the hot dogs: Place the seared hot dogs in the buns\xe2\x80\x94top cut hot dog buns work best\xe2\x80\x94in a large baking dish. Top with grated cheese and diced white onion.\n4 Bake the hot dogs: Bake the hot dogs for about six minutes, or until the cheese is melted and the hot dog buns are toasted. The onions will soften slightly, but might have a bit of crunch to them, which is good.\n5 Serve the hot dogs: Remove the hot dogs from the oven and top with ketchup, relish, or the Dad Add giardiniera.
