b"Save It Print\nSmothered Turkey Wings Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 2 hours, 40 minutesYield: Serves 6\nYou'll need the turkey wing tips to make turkey stock for the gravy. If your turkey wings didn't come with the tips, use an extra turkey wing (drumette and flat) for making the stock.\nINGREDIENTS\nTurkey Wings:\n6 whole turkey wings (about 5 pounds), or 7 turkey wings without the tips\n1 Tbsp extra virgin olive oil\nSalt\nStock:\n2 Tbsp extra virgin olive oil\n1 carrot, chopped\n1 half onion, chopped\n1 celery rib, chopped\n3 cups water\n1/2 teaspoon salt\nGravy:\n3 Tbsp butter\n3 Tbsp flour\n3 cups of turkey stock (that you make in step...)\n1/2 teaspoon yellow mustard\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n1/4 teaspoon pepper\n1/2 teaspoon dried thyme\n1/4 cup cream\n  METHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Prep the turkey wings: Use poultry sheers or a sharp knife to separate each turkey wing into 3 segments\xe2\x80\x94drumette, flat, and tip. Set aside the tips for making stock.\n2 Slow roast the turkey wings: Place turkey wing drumettes and flats, skin side up, onto a rimmed baking sheet or roasting pan. Toss with olive oil. Sprinkle with salt.\nCover with aluminum foil and put into a 275\xc2\xb0F oven for 2 1/2 hours.\n3 Make the stock: While the turkey wing drumettes and flats are roasting, make stock with the tips. Heat 2 Tbsp olive oil in a medium, thick-bottomed pot on medium high heat. Add the turkey wing tips and let them brown on all sides.\nAdd the chopped carrot, onion, and celery, and saut\xc3\xa9 them for a few minutes with the wings.\nAdd 3 cups of water, enough to cover the wings and vegetables, and salt. Bring to a boil on high heat, then reduce to a low simmer on the lowest setting. Cover and let simmer while the wings roast in the oven, a couple of hours.\n4 Strain the stock: When the wings are close to being done, strain the stock so you can start making the gravy. Remove and discard the largest solids from the pot. Then strain the rest of the stock through a fine mesh strainer. Reserve the stock for the next step.\n5 Make the gravy: Make a roux by melting 3 Tbsp butter in a medium sized, thick-bottomed pot, on medium heat. Add the flour and whisk to combine. Let the roux cook and bubble for a minute or so.\nSlowly whisk in the turkey stock you made in steps 3 and 4, whisking constantly to break up any lumps.\nWhisk in the mustard, salt, pepper, and thyme. Whisk in the cream. Let simmer on low heat to thicken.\n6 Broil the wings to brown them: After 2 1/2 hours of slow cooking in the oven, the turkey wings should be fall apart tender (if not, you can leave them in longer until they are).\nRemove the foil and place the wings on a rack a few inches under the broiler. Broil for 5 minutes or so, until the wing skin gets somewhat browned.\n7 Scrape the wing roasting pan drippings into the gravy: You don't have to do this, but it will add even more flavor to your gravy. If the drippings are really stuck to the pan, place the roasting pan on your stovetop and turn on the burners under the pan.\nAdd a cup of water to the pan and use a metal spatula to scrape up the drippings. Pour them off into the pot with the gravy.\nTo serve, pour the gravy over the wings. Serve with a side of mashed potatoes, root vegetables, or cauliflower.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nBroccoli Cheddar Mac and Cheese Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 40 minutesYield: Serves 4 to 6\nFor vegetarian option omit the Worcestershire sauce or use vegetarian Worcestershire sauce, and use vegetarian Parmesan.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 bunch of broccoli, cut into florets\nSalt\n2 cups dry elbow macaroni\n4 Tbsp butter\n3 Tbsp all purpose flour\n3 cups milk (low fat or whole)\n1/2 teaspoon dry mustard\nPinch of ground nutmeg\n1 1/2 teaspoons freshly grated black pepper\n1/4 teaspoon paprika\n1/2 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce\n2 cups (packed) grated sharp cheddar cheese (8 ounces), divided 1 1/2 cups and 1/2 cup\n1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Boil the pasta: Heat 4 quarts of water with 2 Tbsp salt in a large pot on high heat (for pasta). When the water comes to a boil, add the pasta and cook uncovered at a rolling boil for 2 minutes less than the time given on the pasta package instructions. (You want to cook the pasta al dente because it will continue to cook with the cheese mixture.) Rinse quickly in cold water to stop the cooking, drain and set aside.\n2 Steam the broccoli: While the pasta water is coming to a boil, steam the broccoli. Put a steamer rack in a pot with an inch of water. Bring to a boil. Add the broccoli florets, sprinkle with a little salt, and cover. Steam for 4 minutes. Then remove the broccoli from the pot to a bowl.\n3 Heat the milk: In a microwave or in a small pot on the stovetop, heat the milk until steamy. (Preheating the milk saves time in the next step when you are making the bechamel sauce.)\n4 Preheat oven broiler at 500\xc2\xb0F.\n5 Make roux with butter and flour: Melt 4 Tbsp butter in a thick-bottomed oven-safe pot on medium high heat. When the butter is melted and starts to foam sprinkle with 3 Tbsp of flour. Whisk to combine. Lower the heat to medium and cook for 1 to 2 minutes.\n6 Add milk and spices to roux: Pour in the hot milk and whisk vigorously to combine, breaking up any clumps of flour. Lower the heat to medium low and let cook, whisking frequently, until the sauce is smooth and thick enough to coat the back of a spoon.\nStir in the dry mustard, paprika, nutmeg, black pepper, Worcestershire sauce, and 1 teaspoon of salt.\n7 Whisk in cheeses: Whisk in 1 1/2 cups grated cheddar and the 1/2 cup of Parmesan cheese. Stir until the cheese is melted and the sauce is smooth.\n8 Stir in broccoli, top with cheese, broil: Stir in the broccoli and the pasta until well combined. Sprinkle the remaining 1/2 cup grated cheddar cheese on top and place under preheated broiler for 5 to 7 minutes until bubbly and lightly browned.\nAdd more salt and pepper to taste.\n  Hello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nChorizo Mac and Cheese Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 50 minutesYield: Serves 4\nWe used El Mexicano brand chorizo for this recipe, as it is very soft, almost like a p\xc3\xa2t\xc3\xa9. It integrates with the sauce better than other styles of Mexican chorizo.\nThis recipe makes a small casserole, you can easily double the ingredients for a large casserole.\nINGREDIENTS\n2 cups elbow macaroni\n1 cup milk\n1 teaspoon cornstarch\n4 ounces shredded cheddar cheese (about 1 cup)\n4 ounces shredded pepper jack cheese (about 1 cup)\n6 ounces Mexican chorizo\n1/2 cup minced red onion\n2 Tbsp flour\n2 teaspoons lime juice\n2 Tbsp breadcrumbs\n1 Tbsp butter\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Mix the cornstarch with the 2 cheeses in a bowl and set aside. The cornstarch will help prevent the cheese sauce from getting too stringy.\n2 Heat the milk: Put the milk into a small saucepan and heat until steamy. Keep warm while you are preparing the recipe, do not let boil.\n3 Cook the macaroni pasta: Put 2 quarts of water, salted with 1 Tbsp salt, into a large pot and heat to a boil. Once the water is at a full boil, add the macaroni to the pot. Return to a boil, and cook, uncovered, for about 2 minutes less than the macaroni package specifies, so that it is al dente, cooked, but still firm to the bite.\n4 Cook the chorizo and onion: While the water is heating and the macaroni cooking, prepare the chorizo cheese sauce.\nRemove chorizo from its casing and put into a medium thick-bottomed saucepan on medium high heat. When the chorizo begins to sizzle, reduce the heat to medium. Cook the chorizo, stirring often, for 2 minutes.\nAdd the minced red onion and cook the mixture until the onions soften, about 3-4 minutes.\n5 Drain macaroni, preheat oven: When the macaroni is cooked, but still a bit firm, drain it and set aside. Preheat oven to 375\xc2\xb0.\n6 Make the chorizo cheese sauce: Add the flour to the pot with the chorizo and mix well. Everything will clump up. Reduce the heat to medium-low and cook, stirring constantly and scraping the bottom of the pot, for 2 minutes.\nAdd the hot milk a tablespoon at a time, stirring constantly. When all the milk has been added, heat the mixture to a gentle simmer and cook for 2 minutes.\nMix the grated cheese into the chorizo milk sauce.\n7 Add the cooked macaroni to the chorizo cheese sauce. Stir in the lime juice.\n8 Bake: Pour the macaroni and cheese into a small casserole dish. Make sure the top is level. Dust the top with the breadcrumbs, then dot with the butter. Bake until the breadcrumbs are golden, about 20 to 25 minutes.\nIf you want, serve with chopped avocados, crema fresca, and chopped fresh cilantro.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nClassic Carrot Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n3 to 4 cups freshly grated carrots (from 4 to 6 medium-sized carrots)\n1/2 to 1 cup raisins (regular, golden, craisins or a mix)\n1 large apple, (peeled or not, your preference) cored and chopped\n1/4 to 1/3 cup mayonnaise\nMETHOD\nGently combine all ingredients in a medium sized bowl. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nSalisbury Steak with Mushroom Gravy Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 45 minutesYield: 4 servings\nServe with buttered noodles or mashed potatoes.\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the steaks:\n1 pound ground beef\n1/3 cup plain breadcrumbs\n1 large egg\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper\n2 tablespoons neutral-flavored oil cooking oil (I use avocado oil)\nFor the mushroom sauce:\n8 ounces crimini or brown mushrooms, sliced\n1 small yellow onion, sliced\n1 clove garlic, chopped\n2 tablespoons tomato paste\n1 1/2 teaspoons prepared yellow mustard\n1 1/2 cups low sodium beef broth\n2 teaspoons cornstarch\n1 tablespoon water\n2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley, for garnish (optional)\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Make the beef patties: In a mixing bowl, use your hands to mix together the ground beef, breadcrumbs, egg, salt, and pepper.\nDivide the mixture into four equal pieces, then use your hands to gently shape each piece into a 1/2-inch-thick patty.\n2 Sear the patties in a skillet: Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. When the oil is shimmering, sear the patties on one side for 3 minutes, then flip them with a thin, flexible spatula. Sear them on the other side for another 3 minutes.\nTransfer the patties to a plate.\n3 Cook the mushrooms, onions, and garlic: There should be a few teaspoons of fat left in the pan from cooking the patties, but add additional oil if needed. Still over medium heat, add the mushrooms, onions, and garlic to the skillet.\nCook, stirring often, until the mushrooms have given up their liquid and just begun to brown, 6 to 8 minutes.\n4 Stir in the liquids and braise the patties: Stir the tomato paste, mustard, and beef broth into the mushrooms and onions. Use a spoon to scrape up any brown bits from the skillet.\nReturn the patties to the skillet, spooning a bit of the cooking liquid, mushrooms, and onions over each one. Cover the skillet turn the heat down to low. Let the patties braise in the covered skillet for 30 minutes.\nWhile the patties are simmering, you can boil a pot of noodles, make mashed potatoes, and/or prepare any other vegetable quick side dishes.\n5 Thicken the cooking liquid into a gravy: Uncover the skillet and use a spoon to nudge the patties to the side of the skillet. In a small bowl, stir together the cornstarch and water. Stir in the cornstarch mixture and let it boil for about a minute, until the gravy has thickened, then turn off the heat.\n6 Serve the Salisbury steaks: Transfer the patties to plates and ladle the gravy over top. Sprinkle with chopped parsley, if you like, and serve hot with egg noodles or mashed potatoes alongside.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nItalian Sausage and Cabbage Stew Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 50 minutesYield: Serves 8 to 10\nWe use savoy cabbage for this recipe, but you could use regular cabbage, or even collard greens or dinosaur kale. If you want to make this stew vegetarian, leave out the sausage and double the beans.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil\n1 pound sweet Italian sausage, bulk, or removed from casings\n1 large yellow onion, half sliced and half minced\n2 garlic cloves, minced\n1 1/2 cups white wine\n1 15-ounce can of white beans (cannellini, Great Northern, or Navy), drained\n1 quart vegetable or chicken stock\n1 quart water\n1 teaspoon salt, more to taste\n1 large (2-pound) savoy cabbage, quartered, then sliced into 1/4-inch thick slices\n2 bay leaves\n1 cup chopped parsley, loosely packed\n1/2 cup to a cup of freshly grated Parmesan or pecorino cheese for garnish\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cook the sausage: Heat the olive oil on medium heat in a large (8-quart), thick-bottomed pot. Add the sausage, breaking it up into pieces as you put it into the pot in a single layer.\nWhen the sausage has cooked on all sides, remove it with a slotted spoon and set aside.\n2 Saut\xc3\xa9 onions, garlic: Add the minced onion (save the sliced onion for later) and saut\xc3\xa9 for 3-4 minutes, stirring often.\nOnce the onions give up some of their water, use a wooden spoon to scrape up any browned bits from the bottom of the pot.\nAdd the minced garlic and cook for another 1-2 minutes.\n3 Add wine, beans, boil, lower heat to simmer: Add the white wine and the beans and bring to a rolling boil. Reduce to a simmer. Cover and cook for 10 minutes. If you want, for a thicker base, use an immersion blender to blend some (or all) of the beans and onions.\n4 Add water, stock, salt, cabbage, sliced onion, bay leaves, sausage, then simmer: Add the water, stock, salt, cabbage, sliced onion half, bay leaves and browned sausage. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to a simmer. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes, then uncover and continue cooking until the cabbage is tender, about another 10-20 minutes.\nTo serve, sprinkle on chopped parsley and grated cheese.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nTurkey Stew with Root Vegetables Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 2 hours, 30 minutesYield: Serves 6 to 8\nSave time by prepping the root vegetables during the first stage of the stew's oven cooking.\nINGREDIENTS\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n3 pounds turkey thighs (preferred) or legs (skin on, bone in)\n1 medium-large yellow onion, peeled and roughly chopped (about 1 1/2 cups)\n2 stalks celery, roughly chopped (about 1 1/2 cups)\n2 teaspoons salt\n1 quart (4 cups) chicken, turkey, or vegetable stock\n2 medium carrots, peeled, 1/4 inch slices (about 1 1 /4 cups)\n1-2 medium turnips, peeled, 1/2 inch cubes\n1 medium rutabaga, peeled, halved, cut into 1/4 inch thick slices\n3 medium Yukon Gold potatoes, peeled and quartered\n1 teaspoon Herbes de Provence*\nFreshly ground black pepper\n*Herbes de Provence is a delightful French blend of herbs - Winter savory, thyme, basil, tarragon, and lavender flowers. If you don't have Herbes de Provence, you can substitute with an Italian herb mix.\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Brown the turkey thighs: Preheat oven to 300\xc2\xb0F. Heat olive oil on medium high heat in a Dutch oven on the stove top. Wash and pat dry turkey pieces. Working in batches if necessary, brown the turkey thighs, first skin side down, 2-3 minutes on each side. Sprinkle the thighs with a little salt as you brown them.\n2 Cook the onions and celery: Once the thighs have browned, remove them from the pan and set them in a bowl. Add the onions and celery to the pot. Cook for about 5 minutes or so, until the onions are translucent and starting to brown at the edges.\n3 Add turkey thighs, salt, half of the stock: Return the turkey thighs to the pot. Add 2 teaspoons of salt and half of the stock. Bring to a simmer, remove from the stove top and put in the oven, covered, for an hour and fifteen minutes.\n4 Add rest of vegetables and remaining stock: After an hour and fifteen minutes, remove from oven and add the rest of the vegetables\xe2\x80\x94carrots, turnips, rutabaga, and potatoes, the herbs, and the rest of the stock.\nReturn to the oven, covered, and cook until tender, another 45 minutes or more.\n5 Strip meat from turkey thighs, return to stew: Remove the turkey thighs from the stew and place in a bowl to cool. When cool enough to handle, strip the meat off the bones. Discard the bones and skin. Cut the meat into bite-sized pieces (1 1/2-inches or so chunks) and return to the pot.\nSprinkle with black pepper and add more salt to taste.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Print\nRotisserie Chicken Noodle Soup Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 20 minutesYield: 4 servings\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the soup:\n8 ounces egg noodles\n2 tablespoons olive oil\n1 cup white onion, diced (1 medium)\n1 cup celery, diced (about 2 stalks)\n1 cup carrots, diced (2 medium carrots)\n2 cloves garlic, minced\n4 cups chicken stock, homemade or store bought\n2 cups shredded chicken, from a store-bought rotisserie chicken\n1 tablespoon melted butter\nSalt and pepper, to taste\nFresh parsley, garnish\nCrackers, for serving\nDAD ADD: Soft-boiled eggs\n2 large eggs\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cook the noodles: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil and cook the egg noodles according to package directions. Strain and toss with butter.\n2 Meanwhile, cook the veggies: In a large pot, warm the olive oil over medium heat. Add onions, celery, and carrot. Cook for 4 to 5 minutes until vegetables soften. Then add garlic and season with salt and pepper. Cook for another minute.\n3 Simmer the stock and chicken: Add chicken stock and bring soup to a simmer. Stir in shredded chicken and simmer for a few minutes to combine flavors. Taste soup and season with salt and pepper.\n4 Make the soft-boiled eggs (if using): Add 1/2-inch of water to a medium pot over high heat. Cover and bring to a rapid boil. Add the eggs and cover. The water will not completely cover the eggs. That\xe2\x80\x99s okay. Return water to a rapid boil and cook eggs for 6 1/2 minutes.\nImmediately remove the pot from the heat and remove lid. Run the pot under cold water for 30 seconds to stop the cooking.\n5 Assemble the soup: Divide the egg noodles among the bowls and spoon in the soup. Once the eggs are cool enough to handle, peel them carefully and slide them into the bowl on top of the soup. Garnish with fresh parsley and serve with crackers.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b"Save It Print\nRed Beans and Rice Recipe\nYield: Serves 8\nIf you have access to ham hocks and not shanks, you may want to make up the difference in meat (hocks have much less meat) with sausage. Just take 1/2 pound of Andouille sausage, slice, brown first before adding to the beans with the ham shanks.\nIf you do not eat pork, you might try making this with smoked turkey sausage, in which case I would replace some of the water with chicken stock.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 lb dry small red beans\n1 1/2 to 2 lbs meaty ham shanks\n4 cups water\n4 cloves garlic, minced\n1 large onion, chopped (about 2 cups)\n1 1/2 cups chopped celery\n1 cup chopped green bell pepper\n1 Tbsp Worcestershire sauce\n2 teaspoons of Cajun or Creole seasoning (Tony Chachere's or Zatarains) or to taste*\nTabasco sauce**\nSalt and pepper to taste\nCooked white rice (from about 3 cups raw rice)\n*If you don't have access to packaged seasoning, just skip it and add some thyme (fresh or dried), a bay leaf (in with the beans and shanks in step 2), and a little paprika\n**We used a combo of Chipotle Tabasco sauce and regular Tabasco, could also use cayenne pepper\nMETHOD\n1 Soak the beans: Place dried beans in a large bowl and cover them with cold water by a couple of inches. Let soak for 8 hours or overnight. (You can quick soak them by putting them in a bowl and pouring boiling water over them, covering them by 2 inches, then letting them soak for two hours.) Drain.\n2 Cook beans with ham, garlic, onion, water: Place beans, ham shanks, garlic, chopped onion, and water in a large (8-quart) pot and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer and cover, simmer for 1 1/2 hours or until beans are tender.\n3 Remove ham shanks, separate meat from bones: Remove ham shanks from the pot to a dish. Let cool slightly then shred the meat away from the bones. Return the meat back to the pot.\n4 Add vegetables, seasonings, cook until thick: Add the celery, bell peppers, Worcestershire and seasonings. Cover and cook for another hour or until the mixture gets thick.\nSeason to taste with Tabasco sauce, salt and pepper.\nServe over rice.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nRotisserie Chicken Stroganoff Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 30 minutesYield: 4 to 6 servings\nINGREDIENTS\n12 ounces egg noodles\n4 tablespoons butter, divided\n1 cup diced onion\n8 ounces cremini mushrooms, sliced\n2 cloves garlic, minced\n2 tablespoons all-purpose flour\n1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce\n1/2 teaspoon salt, plus more to taste\nBlack pepper, to taste\n1 1/2 cups chicken stock\n1/2 cup sour cream\n2 heaping cups shredded rotisserie chicken (about 1 pound of meat)\nFresh parsley, garnish\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cook the noodles: Cook the egg noodles in salted water according to the package directions. Once the noodles are cooked, drain and return them to the pot with two tablespoons of butter, and toss to coat.\n2 Meanwhile, cook the onions and mushrooms: Melt the remaining two tablespoons butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onions and mushrooms and cook for 6 to 8 minutes until the vegetables have softened and are browned in spots.\nAdd the garlic and cook for a final 30 seconds, until the garlic is fragrant. Season with a pinch of salt and pepper.\n3 Make the sauce: Add the flour to the skillet and use a spatula to work the flour into the vegetables, forming a paste-like coating on the vegetables. Cook for a minute and then add the Worcestershire sauce, salt, and some freshly ground black pepper.\nSlowly add the chicken stock in 1/2-cup increments, stirring constantly to prevent lumps.\n4 Reduce the sauce and add the chicken and sour cream: Once your chicken stock has been added, let the sauce thicken for a few minutes and then stir in the shredded chicken. Remove the pot from the heat and add the sour cream, and stir to combine. Taste the sauce and season it with salt and pepper to your liking.\nReturn the pan to low heat and warm until the sauce is once again piping hot. (If you aren\xe2\x80\x99t serving the sauce immediately, you can keep the sauce warm on very low heat for a little while. Be careful as it will curdle over higher heat.)\nIf at any point the sauce gets too thick, thin it with a drizzle of cooking water from the pasta.\n5 Serve: Serve the stroganoff either by stirring the noodles straight into the sauce to combine everything, or portioning out the noodles onto individual plates and spooning the sauce over the top. Garnish with fresh parsley.\nIf you have leftovers, it\xe2\x80\x99s best to store the sauce and noodles separately and then reheat the sauce gently in a skillet with a few spoonfuls of water. You can microwave the noodles with a few spoonfuls of water and then combine everything. The leftovers will keep for a few days without a problem.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nChicken Thighs with Mushrooms and Shallots Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 25 minutesYield: Serves 3 to 4\nBe prepared for a little bit of splattering from browning the chicken. To avoid this you can dredge the chicken pieces first in a little flour. I wanted a gluten-free chicken dish so am not taking that step.\nYou can make this dish with skin-on chicken breasts, they will take less time to cook in the oven than thighs.\nEven if you don't eat the skin, please cook the chicken with the skin on in this recipe. The skin protects the chicken from drying out.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 Tbsp olive oil\n3 pounds skin-on, bone-in thicken thighs, trimmed of excess fat\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n1 pound cremini or button mushrooms (plus a couple sliced shiitake mushrooms if available for extra mushroom flavor)\n1/2 cup chopped shallots\n3/4 teaspoon dried tarragon (or 2 teaspoons chopped fresh tarragon)\n1/2 cup chicken stock\n1/2 cup dry white wine\n2 Tbsp heavy whipping cream\nFreshly ground black pepper\n1 Tbsp chopped fresh parsley\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat oven to 350\xc2\xb0F.\n2 Brown the chicken on the stovetop: Heat olive oil in a large wide skillet on medium high heat. Pat dry the chicken pieces and lay them skin-side down in the pan to brown. Sprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon of salt. Cook without moving the chicken (allowing them to brown) until they are golden brown, about 7-8 minutes.\n3 Bake the chicken in the oven: Place the chicken pieces skin-side up in a roasting pan. Roast in a 350\xc2\xb0F oven for 20 to 30 minutes, or until the internal temperature of the chicken is 165\xc2\xb0F. (Cooking time depends on the size of the chicken thighs, and how long you've cooked them in the skilled first.)\n4 Saut\xc3\xa9 mushrooms: While the chicken is roasting, thickly slice the mushrooms. Remove all but 1 Tbsp of the fat in the pan (do not put down the drain or you will clog your pipes). Heat the pan on medium high heat and add the mushrooms to the pan. Stir to coat with the fat in the pan.\n5 Add shallots and tarragon: Cook for a couple of minutes until the mushrooms begin to brown and release some of their water. When the mushrooms are glossy, add the chopped shallots and tarragon and stir. Cook for another minute.\n6 Add stock, wine, then cream: Add the stock and the white wine to the pan and increase the heat to high. Let the liquid reduce by half. Taste and if it needs salt, add 1/4 teaspoon or more of salt. Sprinkle with black pepper.\nStir in the cream. Lower temp to medium. Let simmer for a minute.\n7 Serve: To serve, place the mushroom shallot sauce in the bottom of a serving dish. Place the chicken pieces on top. If there are any drippings in the baking pan, pour them over the chicken. Sprinkle with parsley.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nSkillet Lemon Rosemary Chicken Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 25 minutesMarinating time: 1 hourYield: Serves 3 to 4\nWe are using fresh rosemary. Dried rosemary can get a bit "stick"-like, so I\'m not sure how well it would do as a substitute (if you try it with dry rosemary, please let me know how it works out for you in the comments!). I suggest that if you don\'t have fresh herbs, use half as much of a dry Italian herb mix.\nINGREDIENTS\n2 tablespoons fresh rosemary, chopped\nZest of one lemon (1 to 2 teaspoons)\n3 cloves of garlic, roughly chopped\n2 teaspoons kosher salt\n1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper\n1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil\n2 tablespoons lemon juice\n  2 to 2 1/2 pounds bone-in, skin-on chicken thighs (about 6 pieces)\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n4 cloves garlic, peeled and crushed\n3 or more shallots, peeled, halved (optional, can use 1/2-inch thick wedges of red onion, or skip)\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Make rub with the rosemary, zest, garlic, salt, and pepper: Place the rosemary, lemon zest, chopped garlic, salt, and pepper in a mini-chopper and pulse until well ground. (If you don\'t have a mini-chopper, just mince the rosemary and garlic very fine, and mix with the rest). Then add the tablespoon of olive oil and pulse again.\n2 Marinate chicken thighs with rosemary lemon rub: Place the chicken thighs in a (non-reactive) bowl and rub all over with the rosemary lemon herb rub. Arrange the thighs skin-side down and sprinkle with the lemon juice. Let marinate for an hour at room temperature, or chill several hours or overnight, and let sit at room temp for an hour before cooking.\n3 Preheat oven to 350\xc2\xb0F.\n4 Sear the chicken thighs: Heat 2 Tbsp olive oil in a cast iron (10 to 12-inch) or other large relatively stick-free oven-proof skillet (hard anodized aluminum will work well) on medium high to high heat.\nAs soon as the oil is shimmery hot, pat dry the chicken thighs with paper towels and lay them skin-side down in the pan.\nSear the thighs without moving them for 3-5 minutes or until nicely browned.\nTurn the thighs over in the pan so they are skin-side up. Remove the pan from heat.\n5 Arrange garlic and shallots between chicken thighs and roast in oven: Place garlic cloves and either shallots or onion wedges in between the chicken thigh pieces in the pan. Place in the oven and cook for 20 minutes or until the internal temperature of the chicken thighs reach 170\xc2\xb0F.\nRemove from oven.\nAs a safety note (having burned my hand in the past), I recommend rubbing an ice cube on the handle of the hot pan as a way to cook it down quickly. Then be sure you keep the handle covered with a pot holder so that someone (including yourself) doesn\'t inadvertently pick up the pan with the hot handle on their bare hands.\nServe with a side of rice, pasta, bread, or potatoes, or over a bed of baby arugula or spinach leaves for a low carb option.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nSpicy, Citrusy Black Beans Recipe\nCook time: 2 hoursBean soaking time: OvernightYield: Serves 8\nAdapted from a recipe in the Fields of Greens cookbook.\nINGREDIENTS\n4 cups dried black beans\n2 1/2 quarts (10 cups) water\n2-3 fresh sprigs oregano, or 1 tablespoon dried\n3 bay leaves\n6 small or 3 large sage leaves\n2 teaspoons salt\n4 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n2 yellow onions, chopped\n2 chopped peppers \xe2\x80\x93 bell pepper, Anaheim, or jalape\xc3\xb1o (your choice, depending on taste for heat), seeds, stems and ribs discarded\n6 cloves crushed garlic\n2 tablespoons Ancho red chili sauce, or chili powder or Tabasco to taste*\n1-2 teaspoons of pur\xc3\xa9ed chipotle in adobo, chipotle Tabasco, or chipotle powder (to taste)\n1 tablespoon cumin, (crushed whole toasted cumin seed is best, if possible)\n3 tablespoons frozen orange juice concentrate or 1/2 cup fresh orange juice\nJuice of 1 lime\n2 tablespoons rice wine vinegar\nChopped fresh cilantro for garnish\nMETHOD\n1 Soak the beans (optional): Rinse and sort the beans, discarding any stones or shriveled beans. You can soak the beans overnight in cold water (cover with several inches of water) OR pour enough boiling water over them to cover by a few inches and soak them for an hour OR skip the pre-soaking step.\nSoaking will speed up the cooking process. If you soak, discard the soaking liquid after soaking.\n2 Cook the beans: Add beans to a large pot with 2 1/2 quarts (10 cups) of water. Add oregano, bay leaves, and sage. Bring the beans to a boil and reduce heat to a simmer.\nCook until the beans are soft, but not quite done. The time will vary depending on how large, dry, or old your beans are, and if you have pre-soaked them, from anywhere from 30 minutes to an hour and a half.\n3 Saut\xc3\xa9 onions and peppers, add spices: While the beans are cooking, saut\xc3\xa9 onions and peppers in olive oil until soft. Add chili sauce, chili powder, and/or chili pur\xc3\xa9e, cumin, and garlic. Saut\xc3\xa9 until spices are fragrant.\n4 Fish out and discard the bay leaves, stems of oregano, and sage leaves from the pot of beans. Remove, but reserve, extra cooking liquid until there is about 1/2-inch of liquid above beans.\n5 Add the onion mixture and salt to the pot of beans. Cook another hour or so until thickened. Add reserved liquid if needed.\n6 Add half of the orange juice, and simmer. Adjust chili heat at this point \xe2\x80\x93 you may or may not want to add more of your chili paste.\nJust before serving, add remaining orange juice, lime juice, and vinegar. Salt to taste. Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro.\nServe with corn tortillas, and/or rice, sour cream, and salsa.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nBreaded and Baked Chicken Drumsticks Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 20 minutesYield: Serves 4-6\nRecipe adapted from a Deviled Drumsticks recipe in Bon Appetit, March 2001.\nINGREDIENTS\n1/4 cup mayonnaise\n1/4 cup Dijon or whole grain mustard\n2 teaspoons Worcestershire sauce\n3/4 cup dry breadcrumbs\n2 Tbsp finely chopped chives or green onion greens\nSalt\n6 large chicken drumsticks, about 1 1/3 lbs\nExtra virgin olive oil\nMETHOD\n1 Preheat oven, prepare pan: Place rack on upper third of oven. Preheat oven to 425\xc2\xb0F. Coat the bottom of a shallow roasting pan or baking sheet with a thin layer of olive oil.\n2 Prepare coatings: Mix together the mayonnaise, mustard, and Worcestershire sauce in a medium bowl. Mix together the breadcrumbs and minced chives in a separate medium bowl.\n3 Dip drumsticks in coatings: Sprinkle each drumstick with salt. One by one, dip each drumstick in the mayonnaise mixture, turning to coat. Then dip the drumstick in the breadcrumbs mixture, turning to coat. Place the drumsticks on the prepared roasting pan.\n4 Bake: Bake chicken at 425\xc2\xb0F for 20-25 minutes, until just cooked through, and juices run clear (not pink) when poked with a sharp knife.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nFettuccine Alfredo with Mushrooms Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 30 minutesYield: 4 servings\nTo Make in Advance: Cook sauce as directed. Cool and store in the fridge for up to two days. To reheat, add back to a medium pot along with 1/2 cup milk and gently reheat over medium-low heat, stirring constantly.\nINGREDIENTS\n8 ounces baby cremini mushrooms, sliced\n8 ounces small shiitake mushrooms, sliced\n1/4 cup butter\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n1/2 teaspoon black pepper\n3 tablespoons all-purpose flour\n2 cups whole milk\n1 1/2 cups grated Parmesan cheese\n1 pound fettuccine, spaghetti, or your favorite pasta\n1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley, to garnish\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cook the mushrooms: Melt the butter in a deep saut\xc3\xa9 pan over medium heat. Add the mushrooms and cook for 6 to 8 minutes until they have released their liquid and become tender. Season with salt and pepper (give one a taste!).\n2 Add the flour: Add the flour to the pot and stir it in to coat the mushrooms. The flour will form a paste on the mushrooms and the pan will look quite dry. Cook for a minute and turn heat down to low.\n3 Make the sauce: Slowly add the milk while stirring; the flour will dissolve in the milk. If any lumps of flour form, break them up against the side of the pan with the back of your spoon. Simmer for 1 to 2 minutes until the sauce has thickened slightly, and then add Parmesan cheese.\nLower the heat, cover, and keep warm until ready to serve, up to 10 minutes. If the sauce thickens too much before you\xe2\x80\x99re ready to serve, add a splash of milk to thin it out again.\n4 Make the pasta: Bring a large pot of salted water to a rolling boil and cook the pasta until al dente. Drain and set aside.\n5 Serve: Divide the pasta between plates and top with a generous serving of the sauce. Garnish with fresh parsley and serve.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nMom\xe2\x80\x99s Easy Macaroni Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: Serves 4\nPrep the ingredients while the pasta water is coming to a boil.\nThis recipe can easily be doubled or tripled.\nINGREDIENTS\n2 cups (about 1/2 pound) dry macaroni pasta (use rice or gluten-free pasta for gluten-free version)\nSalt\n1/4 cup chopped spring onion or green onion\n1/2 teaspoon lemon juice or vinegar\n1 hard boiled egg, chopped\n1 roasted red bell pepper, chopped\n1 tablespoon fresh chopped parsley\nA generous amount of mayonnaise (1/3 to 1/2 cup)\nSeveral pinches of paprika\nFreshly ground black pepper to taste\n  METHOD\n1 Cook the pasta: In at least 2 quarts of salted water (1 1/2 teaspoons of salt per quart of water), cook the pasta according to package directions until al dente\xe2\x80\x94still slightly firm. Remove from heat, drain and rinse with cool water until the pasta reaches room temperature.\n2 Soak the onions: While macaroni is cooking, put the chopped onions into a small bowl and sprinkle the lemon juice or vinegar, and a little water over them. This will take the edge off the onions.\n3 Assemble the macaroni salad: Combine cooked macaroni, onions, and all other ingredients in a large serving bowl. Adjust seasonings to taste.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nVegan Mushroom Barley Soup Recipe\nPrep time: 30 minutesCook time: 1 hour, 15 minutesYield: 6 to 8 servings\nINGREDIENTS\n1 ounce dried porcini or other dried mushrooms\n2 cups hot tap water\n1 1/2 pounds fresh mushrooms (button, shiitake, large or baby portobello, or a mix)\n3 tablespoons olive oil\n1 clove garlic, minced\n1 large onion, diced\n2 stalks celery, diced\n2 carrots, diced\n1 teaspoon salt\n1/2 teaspoon black pepper\n3/4 cup pearl barley\n1 medium Yukon Gold potato, cut into 1/2-inch chunks\n8 cups water, plus more if needed\n2 tablespoons soy sauce, plus more to taste\n2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar, plus more to taste\n1 bay leaf\n1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley\n1/4 cup chopped fresh dill\n3 ounces baby spinach (2 cups packed), tough stems removed\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Soak the dried mushrooms: In a bowl, combine the porcini or other dried mushrooms and the 2 cups hot water. Set aside for 30 minutes to soak.\nWith a slotted spoon, lift the mushrooms out of the bowl and transfer to a cutting board. Coarsely chop them. Strain the soaking liquid through a sieve lined with a paper towel to catch any grit and reserve.\n2 Prep the fresh mushrooms: Whip any dirt from the mushrooms with a damp paper towel. Remove the stems from all except the button mushrooms. Coarsely chop the large mushrooms and thinly slice the small mushrooms. Set aside.\n3 Cook the vegetables: In a large stock pot over medium heat, heat the oil. Add the garlic, onion, celery, carrots, salt, and pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes until the vegetables have softened.\nAdd the mushrooms, stir well, and continue cooking, stirring occasionally, for another 10 minutes. Add the potato and barley and cook, stirring, for 1 minute more.\n4 Add the liquids: Stir in the reserved mushroom soaking liquid, water, soy sauce, vinegar, bay leaf, half the parsley, and half the dill.\nBring to a boil, then lower the heat. Partially cover and simmer for 45 to 50 minutes, or until the barley and potatoes are both tender. If the mixture seems too thick at any point, add more water, 1/2 cup at a time.\n5 Finish the soup: Add the spinach and stir well. Cover the pot and let the spinach wilt for 2 minutes. Stir the soup and taste for seasoning. Add more salt, soy sauce, or balsamic vinegar, if you like. Sprinkle with the remaining parsley and dill. Ladle into bowls.\nLeftovers will keep refrigerated for up to a week, or frozen for up to 3 months.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nTuna Pasta with Tomato and Olives Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 20 minutesYield: Serves 4\nPrep the ingredients while the pasta water is heating. If you are subbing onions for the shallots, mince them and let them cook a few minutes before adding the garlic and red pepper flakes.\nIf you are using water-packed, not oil-packed tuna, add a couple more tablespoons of olive oil to the sauce. You may also want to add a minced anchovy.\nINGREDIENTS\n12 ounces short pasta (shells, macaroni, rigatoni)\nSalt for pasta water\n3 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil (plus 2 Tbsp if you are using tuna packed in water)\n1/4 cup chopped shallots (can sub onion)\n2  teaspoons minced garlic\n1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes\n2 5-ounce cans tuna packed in olive oil, drained\n1 14-ounce can crushed tomatoes\n1/4 cup chopped kalamata olives\n1 teaspoon capers\n1/2 teaspoon black pepper\n1/4 teaspoon salt (more to taste)\n1/4 cup shredded Parmesan\n1 Tbsp chopped fresh parsley\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Bring pasta water to a boil: Bring 4 quarts of salted water to a boil (add 1 Tbsp salt for every 2 quarts of water). While the water is heating, prep the ingredients and start the sauce.\n2 Saut\xc3\xa9 shallots, garlic, red pepper flakes: Heat 3 Tbsp of olive oil in a large saut\xc3\xa9 pan on medium heat. Once the oil is hot, add the chopped shallots, minced garlic, and red pepper flakes at the same time to the pan. Let cook for about 30 seconds.\n3 Add drained canned tuna: Drain the canned tuna and add it to the pan. If you are using tuna packed in water and not olive oil, add 2 or 3 more Tbsp of olive oil to the pan.\nBreak up any chunks of tuna with a fork or wooden spoon. Let simmer for a minute.\n4 Add tomatoes, olives, capers, salt, pepper: Stir in the crushed tomatoes, olives, capers, salt, and pepper.\nBring to a simmer and reduce heat to the lowest setting to gently cook while you cook the pasta.\n5 Cook pasta: Add dry pasta to the pot of boiling salted water. Cook uncovered at a vigorous full boil until al dente\xe2\x80\x94cooked, but still a little firm to the bite, about 13-14 minutes.\nBefore draining, remove a cup of the pasta water and set aside.\n6 Stir cooked pasta into sauce: Drain the pasta and stir into the sauce. Toss with grated Parmesan and chopped fresh parsley. If the pasta seems a little dry after a few minutes, add back in some of the reserved pasta water.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nBroccoli and Cheddar Quesadillas Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: 4 quesadillas (1 will serve two small kids)\nWe suspect you can prepare this with frozen broccoli, but we haven't tried it and we offer this caveat: Make sure you gently squeeze as much water out of the broccoli as possible once it's defrosted, and blot it with paper towels or a clean dish towel.\nINGREDIENTS\n2 cups broccoli florets\n12 ounces grated cheddar cheese (about 4 loosely-packed cups)\n4 large 12-inch flour tortillas\nVegetable oil, for tortillas\n1 medium avocado, sliced thin or chopped for serving\nSour cream, for serving\nDAD ADD: Quick Spicy Pico de Gallo\n1/2 red onion, minced\n1 ripe tomato, minced\n1 jalape\xc3\xb1o, seeded and minced\nFresh lime juice\nPinch of salt\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Blanch and chop the broccoli: Bring a medium pot of salted water to a boil. Add the broccoli and blanch until it\xe2\x80\x99s bright green and fork tender, about 3 minutes. Then drain the broccoli, let it cool slightly and chop it finely.\n2 Make the pico de gallo: If you\xe2\x80\x99re using the Dad Add, now would be a good time to chop that stuff up (highly recommended). Combine the minced ingredients in a bowl and set aside.\n3 Preheat a large skillet over medium-low heat. If you haven't already grated your cheese, do it now.\n4 Assemble and cook the quesadillas: Brush one tortilla lightly with vegetable oil on one side and add it to the warmed skillet, oiled side down. Sprinkle a loosely packed cup of grated cheese (about 3 ounces) on one half of the tortilla. Top with 1/2 cup of chopped broccoli.\nFold the tortilla over to cover the filling and form a half-circle. Cook the quesadilla for about 3 minutes per side until it\xe2\x80\x99s crispy and the cheese is melted.\nRepeat with making the other quesadillas. (Though if you\xe2\x80\x99re good\xe2\x80\x94and your skillet is large enough\xe2\x80\x94you can make two at a time in the same skillet!)\n5 Serve the quesadillas: Cut the quesadillas into triangular segments, and serve with sour cream, avocado, and the spicy pico!\nHello!
