b"Save It Print\nTuna Macaroni Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 20 minutesYield: Serves 4\nTuna packed in olive oil is more flavorful than tuna packed in water. If you can find it packed in oil, use that but don't drain it. If you have tuna packed in water, drain it, and add 2 to 3 tablespoons of extra virgin olive oil.\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the pasta:\n1 cup uncooked elbow macaroni\n1 teaspoon salt\n1 quart water\nFor the salad:\n1/2 cup chopped green onion, including green onion greens\n1 cup chopped red, orange, or yellow bell pepper\n1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley\n2 (5-ounce) cans tuna, packed in olive oil (if it's packed in water, drain and add 2 to 3 tablespoons of extra virgin olive oil)\n2 stalks celery, chopped (about 1 cup)\n2 tablespoons lemon juice\n1/4-1/3 a head lettuce (preferably iceberg lettuce), sliced first and roughly chopped into 2 inch long strips\n1/4 cup mayonnaise (more to taste)\n1/2 teaspoon sweet Hungarian paprika\nFresh ground pepper\nMETHOD\n1 Cook the macaroni: In a saucepan, add 1 cup of elbow macaroni to 1 quart of boiling water with an added teaspoon of salt. Cook at a rolling boil uncovered for about 10 minutes until the macaroni is just a little more cooked than al dente.\nRemove from heat, drain, and rinse with cold water.\n2 Prep the salad ingredients: While the macaroni is cooking, assemble the other ingredients. In a large bowl mix the green onion, bell peppers, parsley, tuna, celery and lemon.\n3 Combine the salad ingredients: Add the cooked and drained macaroni. Fold in the mayonnaise until well mixed. Add the paprika. Add fresh ground pepper to taste. (At this point you can make ahead and chill.)\n4 Serve: Fold in the lettuce gently and serve. The salad does not make good leftovers as the lettuce will eventually get soggy.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nCreamy Cheesy Turkey Enchiladas Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 45 minutesYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n1 Tbsp butter\n1 cup finely diced onion\n1/2 teaspoon ground cumin\n4 ounces cream cheese, room temperature\n3/4 cup cooked sweet potato (can sub cooked carrots, squash, or pumpkin)\n2 1/2 cups chopped cooked turkey meat\n1 teaspoon kosher salt\n1 cup heavy cream\n1 cup prepared tomatillo salsa verde\n1 1/2 cups grated Monterey Jack cheese\n8-10 flour tortillas, about 8-inches wide\n1/3 cup sliced black olives\n2 Tbsp sliced green onions, including greens\nEquipment needed\nA 9x13-inch casserole dish\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Saut\xc3\xa9 onions in butter, add cumin: Melt butter in small saucepan on medium high heat. Add the finely diced onion and saut\xc3\xa9 until golden and lightly browned. Stir the ground cumin into the onions and cook for a minute more. Remove from heat and let cool.\n2 Mix together the cream cheese, sweet potato, cooked chopped turkey, the cooked onions, and a teaspoon of salt with your (clean) hands in a medium bowl.\n3 Roll up tortillas with filling: Preheat oven to 350\xc2\xb0F. Butter the inside of a 9x13-inch casserole dish. Working one flour tortilla at a time, place about 1/4 to 1/3-cup of the filling mixture into the center of a tortilla, spreading it out in a line from one side to the other.\nRoll up the tortilla and place it seam-side down in the casserole dish. Repeat with the rest of the tortillas until the dish is filled.\n4 Add cream, salsa, cheese: Pour heavy cream over all of the enchiladas in the dish. Spread one cup of tomatillo salsa over the top of the enchiladas. Sprinkle with the grated jack cheese.\n5 Bake in a 350\xc2\xb0F oven, uncovered, for 25 minutes, or until the cheese is completely melted and the enchiladas are heated through.\n6 Sprinkle with olives and green onions: Remove from oven and sprinkle with sliced black olives and chopped green onions. Serve immediately.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nPasta Pomodoro with Shrimp Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 20 minutesYield: Serves 3 to 4\nTo safely defrost frozen shrimp, place in a bowl of ice water.\nINGREDIENTS\n1/2 pound angel hair pasta\n3/4 pound raw, peeled, deveined shrimp (medium sized)\n4 medium ripe tomatoes\n3 cloves garlic, minced\n1/3 cup torn fresh basil leaves\n3 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil (divided, 1 Tbsp and 2 Tbsp)\nSalt\nPepper\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Blanch and peel the tomatoes: Fill a large pot with 2 quarts of water. Bring to a boil. (You will be using this water to both blanch the tomatoes and boil the pasta.)\nCore the tomatoes and use a sharp knife to cut a small X into the bottom end of each tomato. When the water is boiling, use a slotted spoon to lower the tomatoes into the water.\nBlanch for no more than one minute, just enough to loosen the skins. Remove tomatoes with a slotted spoon to a bowl of icy water, saving the blanching water.\nPeel off the tomato skins from the tomatoes. Cut the tomatoes crosswise in half, and squeeze out most of the seeds and juices.\nChop the tomatoes into 1-inch pieces.\n2 Saut\xc3\xa9 the shrimp: Heat 1 Tbsp of olive oil in a large saut\xc3\xa9 pan on medium high heat. Add the shrimp to the pan and cook for 1 minute. Turn the shrimp over in the pan. Lower the heat to medium.\n3 Add garlic, tomatoes, basil: Add the garlic, cook a minute more. Add the chopped tomatoes and basil. Sprinkle with salt. Cook for a minute more and remove from heat.\n4 Cook the angel hair pasta: Add a tablespoon of salt to the water you used to blanch the tomatoes. Bring to a boil again. Add the angel hair pasta and cook for 3 minutes.\n5 Add cooked pasta to shrimp and tomatoes: Drain the pasta and immediately add to pot with the shrimp and tomatoes. Drizzle the pasta with 2 Tbsp of olive oil. Then stir the pasta in with the shrimp and tomatoes.\nServe immediately or at room temp.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nPasta with Tuna and Arugula Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: Serves 4\nWhile you are heating the pasta water, prep the ingredients.\nThis recipe requires tuna canned in olive oil. Tuna canned in water just doesn't work well with this recipe. If water canned tuna is your only option, drain it, and soak it in half a cup of good quality olive oil for an hour first.\nINGREDIENTS\n3/4 pound (12 ounces) dried fettuccine, spaghetti or linguine\n1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil\n2 cloves garlic, minced\n1/8 teaspoon hot red pepper flakes (more to taste)\n2 6-ounce cans tuna packed in olive oil, drained\nSalt\n5 to 8 ounces baby arugula\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cook pasta: Bring a large pot of salted water (1 Tbsp salt for every 2 quarts of water) to a rolling boil. Add the pasta, return to a rolling boil, and boil uncovered until the pasta is al dente, cooked, but still a little firm to the bite.\n2 Cook garlic and red pepper flakes in olive oil; add tuna, salt: While the pasta is cooking, heat the olive oil in a large skillet on medium-low heat. Add the garlic and hot pepper flakes and cook until garlic is fragrant.\nAdd the tuna and shred it into fine flakes with a fork. Season with salt. Keep warm over low heat.\n3 Set aside a cup of pasta water: Just before the pasta is ready, set aside 1 cup of boiling water. You'll need this to add back to the pasta dish to keep it from getting too dry.\n4 Combine pasta with tuna mixture, arugula, and some pasta water: Drain the pasta and depending on the size of your pan, either add it to the skillet with the tuna, or return the pasta to the pasta pot and add the tuna mixture to the pasta.\nAdd the arugula and use tongs to toss together with the pasta and tuna. Add some of the hot reserved pasta water to help loosen the pasta.\nThe arugula will wilt as you toss the pasta and tuna with it. Add more pasta water as needed.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b"Save It Print\nSanta Fe Pork and Black Bean Stew Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 2 hours, 10 minutesYield: Serves 4\nWe are using canned black beans in this recipe, but you could easily use dry beans if you cook them ahead. Here's how to make beans on the stovetop or in a pressure cooker.\nThis recipe makes a relatively small batch for a stew (serves 4). You can easily double the recipe to make a larger batch.\nINGREDIENTS\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n2 pounds of pork shoulder, trimmed of excess fat, cut into 1 1/2-inch cubes\n1 teaspoon kosher salt\n1 large onion, chopped (about 2 cups)\n4 cloves garlic\n1-2 jalape\xc3\xb1o chili peppers, less or more to taste, seeded, stems removed\n2 tablespoons cornmeal\n1 teaspoon ground cinnamon\n2 teaspoons ground cumin\n1 teaspoon dried oregano\n1/2 teaspoon cayenne (less or more to taste)\n1 1/2 tablespoons molasses\n1 red bell pepper, diced, about 3/4 cup\n2 long 1-inch wide strips of orange zest (optional)\n1 cup water\n1 15-ounce can black beans (we recommend Bush's or S&W premium), liquid included\nMore salt to taste\n1 to 2 limes\nCilantro for garnish\nMETHOD\n1 Sprinkle 1 teaspoon salt over the pork pieces and let sit while you prep the other ingredients.\n2 Brown the pork: Heat 2 Tbsp olive oil in a thick-bottomed stew pot on medium high heat. Add the pork pieces to the pot and brown them on all sides.\n3 Add the onions: Once the pork pieces have browned, add the chopped onions to the pot with the pork. Lower the heat to medium and cook until the onions are translucent, about 7-10 minutes more.\n4 Make garlic jalape\xc3\xb1o spice mixture: As the onions are cooking, work on the garlic spice mixture. Place the garlic and the jalape\xc3\xb1os in the bowl of a food processor and pulse until minced. Then add the oregano, cumin, cinnamon, cayenne, and cornmeal and pulse everything until ground.\n5 Add spice mixture to pork and onions: Once the onions are cooked, add the spice mixture to the pork and onions.\n6 Add molasses, bell pepper, zest, cover and cook: Add the molasses, bell pepper, orange zest (if using), and water to the pot. Bring it to a simmer and then reduce the heat to the lowest setting. Cover and let cook until the pork is completely tender, about 1 1/2 hours. Stir occasionally and scrape up any browned bits stuck to the bottom of the pot.\n7 Remove zest, add black beans: When pork is tender, remove the orange zest and add the black beans to the pot and cook for 20 minutes more on low heat.\n8 Remove from heat, and stir in the lime juice. Add more salt to taste.\nServe garnished with fresh cilantro. Great with warm corn tortillas.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nBuffalo Cauliflower Tacos with Ranch Sauce Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: 2 servings (2 tacos each)\nThis recipe is easily doubled.\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the tacos:\n2 cups cauliflower, chopped into bite-size pieces\n2 teaspoons neutral oil\nPinch of sea salt\n2 tablespoons cashew cream\n2 tablespoons Frank\xe2\x80\x99s Red Hot Sauce\n4 8-inch corn tortillas, warmed\nFor the cashew ranch sauce:\n2 teaspoons minced fresh, flat-leaf parsley\n2 teaspoons minced fresh chives\n1 teaspoon minced fresh dill\n1/4 teaspoon garlic powder\nPinch of salt\nPinch of pepper\n1/4 cup cashew cream\nFor serving:\n1/2 avocado, diced\n1 tablespoon chopped parsley, to garnish\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cook the cauliflower: Heat a skillet over medium heat and add the oil followed by the cauliflower. Cook, stirring frequently, until the cauliflower is tender and starting to brown, 8 to 10 minutes.\n2 Add the buffalo sauce: In a small bowl, combine the cashew cream with the hot sauce. Add to the pan with the cooked cauliflower and toss to coat the cauliflower. Add more hot sauce, if desired.\nRemove the pan from heat until ready to serve.\n3 Make the cashew ranch: Combine the parsley, chives, dill, garlic powder, salt, pepper, and cashew cream in a bowl. Stir to combine.\n4 Warm the tacos: In a dry skillet over medium-high heat, toast the tortillas one at a time until they are warm and show a few charred spots. Keep warm under a clean kitchen towel.\n5 Assemble the tacos: Divide the cooked cauliflower between the tortillas. Top with diced avocado, a drizzle of the cashew ranch, and some chopped parsley.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nAutumn Tabbouleh with Cauliflower, Carrots, and Golden Beets Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 20 minutesResting time time: 30 minutesYield: 4 to 6 servings\nThis salad is best if you can give it a full 30 minutes to rest before serving. It can also be made up to 3 days ahead and kept refrigerated.\nTo make this dish gluten-free, substitute quinoa for the bulgur. (Follow package directions to cook the quinoa.)\nINGREDIENTS\n1 cup bulgur wheat\n1/2 teaspoon kosher salt\n1/4 head medium cauliflower\n2 medium carrots, peeled and trimmed\n2 small golden beets, peeled and trimmed\n1/4 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice\n1 teaspoon kosher salt\n1/4 cup olive oil\n2 cups minced parsley\n1 bunch scallions, trimmed and minced\n1 tablespoon sherry vinegar\nGround black pepper or to taste\nSpecial Equipment:\nMandolin\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Make the bulgur: Bring 3 cups of water to a boil in a small saucepan. When the water boils, stir in the bulgur and salt. Cover the pan and remove from heat. Let the bulgur sit for 20 to 30 minutes or until tender. Strain bulgur with a mesh strainer, shaking to remove as much water as possible.\n2 Prep the vegetables: Break the cauliflower into large florets and carefully slice them 1/16-inch thick on a mandolin. Next, switch to a julienne blade and julienne 1/8-inch thick to julienne carrots and beets. (The vegetables can be shredded on a box grater or in a food processor, instead.)\n3 Marinate the vegetables: Combine the vegetables in a large serving bowl and toss with salt and lemon juice. Set aside 20 minutes to marinate, until crisp-tender.\n4 Finish the salad: To the bowl with the vegetables, add the olive oil, cooked bulgur, parsley, scallions, and sherry vinegar. Stir to combine. Taste and add salt, lemon juice, or olive oil as needed.\n5 Let stand 30 minutes before serving: Cover and let mixture marinate at room temperature for at least 30 minutes before serving to give the flavors time to combine. (If marinating longer, set in the fridge.)\nSalad will keep well covered in the fridge for 3 days.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nSt. Lucia Saffron Buns Recipe\nPrep time: 2 hours, 30 minutesCook time: 12 minutesYield: Makes 12 to 14 buns\nThis recipe makes 12 to 14 good sized buns. You can easily double the recipe. Note the cardamom is optional. I\'ve made these buns with and without a little cardamom and I  prefer them with. I\'m guessing it\'s more traditional without.\nINGREDIENTS\n3/4 cup milk (175 ml)\n1/2 teaspoon saffron threads\n1 teaspoon plus 1/4 cup (50 g) white, granulated sugar\nOne 1/4-ounce packet active dry yeast (check the expiration date on the package to make sure it\'s still good!)\n3 1/2 to 4 cups (490 g to 570 g) all purpose flour\n1/2 teaspoon kosher salt\nThe seeds from 3 cardamom pods, ground (optional)\n1/4 cup (1/2 stick, 4 Tbsp, 56 g) unsalted butter, softened\n1/4 cup of sour cream (or quark if available)\n2 large eggs\nRaisins\nGlaze\n1 egg, beaten\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Heat milk, saffron, sugar: In a small pot, heat the milk, saffron, and 1 teaspoon of sugar together until the milk is steamy. Remove from heat and stir to dissolve the sugar. Let cool until about 115\xc2\xb0F, or warm to the touch, but not hot.\n2 Sprinkle the yeast over the warm saffron-infused milk and let sit for 5 to 10 minutes until foamy.\n3 Whisk flour, sugar, salt, cardamom: In the bowl of a stand-up mixer* whisk together 3 1/2cups (490 g) of the flour, remaining 1/4 cup of sugar, salt and ground cardamom (if using).\n*You can make this recipe without a mixer, for me it\'s just a bit easier with one.\n4 Make a well in the center of the flour and add the yeast milk saffron mixture, the eggs, the butter, and the sour cream. Mix the ingredients until well incorporated.\n5 Knead the dough: Switch to the dough hook of your mixer (if using, otherwise knead by hand). On low speed start to knead the dough. Slowly add additional flour, a tablespoon at a time, kneading to incorporate after each addition. Do this until the dough is still a little sticky to the touch, but does not completely stick to your hands when you handle it.\n6 Let dough rise: Shape the dough into a ball and place in a large bowl. Cover with plastic wrap. (Note at this point you can make ahead and refrigerate overnight if you wish.)\nLet sit in a warm place for 1 to 2 hours, until the dough has doubled in size. (One way to tell that the dough is ready is that you poke your finger in it and it takes quite a bit of time for the indentation left by your finger to go away.)\n7 Form dough into S shapes: When the dough has doubled in size, gently press it down and knead it a couple of times. Break off a piece and form it into a ball about 2 inches wide (60 to 70 grams if you are weighing). Roll the ball out into a snake, about 14 inches long.\nThen Curl the ends in opposite directions, forming an "S" with spirals at each end. Place on a lined baking sheet and repeat with the rest of the dough.\n8 Let sit for second rise:  Cover with plastic wrap and place in a warm spot until the dough shapes double in size, 30 minutes to an hour.\n9 Brush with egg wash, place raisins on buns: Preheat oven to 400\xc2\xb0F (205\xc2\xb0C). Using a pastry brush, brush some beaten egg over the tops and sides of the uncooked buns. Place raisins in the centers of the "S" spirals.\n10 Bake: Place in the oven and bake at400\xc2\xb0F (205\xc2\xb0C) for about 10 to 11 minutes (turning halfway through cooking to ensure even browning), until the buns are golden brown.\nRemove from oven and let cool for 5 minutes before eating.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nChocolate Bourbon Cake Recipe\nYield: Serves 10 to 12\nAlthough this is a bundt pan recipe, you can also use the same amount of batter for 2 loaf pans (8 or 9 inch pans). Baking time will be less if you use loaf pans. Test at 55 minutes.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 cup (2 sticks) unsalted butter, more for greasing pan\n2 cups all-purpose flour, more for dusting pan\n5 ounces high quality, unsweetened dark chocolate\n1/4 cup instant espresso powder (can use instant coffee)\n2 tablespoons unsweetened natural cocoa powder\n1 cup bourbon whiskey (can use 1/2 cup), more for sprinkling\n1/2 teaspoon kosher salt\n2 cups white granulated sugar\n3 large eggs\n1 tablespoon vanilla extract\n1 teaspoon baking soda\n1/4 cup confectioners\xe2\x80\x99 sugar (powdered sugar), for sprinkling\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat oven, prepare bundt pan: Preheat oven to 325\xc2\xb0F. Butter and flour the inside of a large (10 cup) bundt pan.\n2 Melt chocolate: Melt chocolate in a microwave oven or in a double boiler over simmering water. Let cool. Put a cup of water on to boil.\n3 Mix instant espresso powder, cocoa powder, boiling water, bourbon, salt: Put instant espresso powder (or instant coffee) and cocoa powder in a large (at least 2 cup) glass measuring cup. Add enough boiling water to come up to the 1 cup measuring line. Mix until powders dissolve. Stir in the bourbon and salt. Set aside and let cool.\n4 Beat butter, add sugar, eggs, vanilla, baking soda, melted chocolate: Beat butter until fluffy (2-3 minutes on high using an electric mixer). Add sugar and beat a minute longer. Add the eggs one at a time, beating a minute after each addition. Add the vanilla extract, baking soda and melted chocolate.\n5 Alternate adding bourbon espresso mixture with flour: With the mixer on the lowest speed, beat in a third of the bourbon espresso cocoa mixture. When liquid is absorbed, beat in half of the flour (1 cup). Repeat additions, ending with bourbon mixture.\n6 Bake: Scrape batter into prepared bundt pan and smooth the top. Bake at 325\xc2\xb0F until a tester inserted into center of cake comes out clean, about 1 hour 10 minutes.\n7 Cool, sprinkle with whisky and powdered sugar: Move the cake to a rack. Gently un-mold after 15 minutes and sprinkle the cake with a little more bourbon whiskey. Let the cake cool completely before serving. Sprinkle powdered sugar through a mesh sieve over the cake before serving.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nEggnog Pound Cake Recipe\nPrep time: 25 minutesCook time: 55 minutesGlazing time: 10 minutesYield: Serves 16 to 20\nEggnog can be frozen if you don't have time to bake the cake and the eggnog is in danger of going sour.\nTo make the cake in a standard loaf pan, cut the ingredients in half (use 3 eggs), use a 5x9 or 4x8 loaf pan, and bake for about 50 minutes. It helps to line the loaf pan with buttered parchment paper. You'll only need about 1/3 of the glaze ingredients.\nINGREDIENTS\nCake:\n3/4 cup sweetened dried cranberries, chopped\n1 Tbsp orange zest\n4 Tbsp brandy (can sub orange juice or water)\n3 cups all-purpose flour\n2 teaspoons baking powder\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n1/2 teaspoon nutmeg\n1/4 teaspoon cinnamon\n1/4 teaspoon allspice\n1 cup (2 sticks) unsalted butter\n2 cups white granulated sugar\n5 large eggs, room temperature\n1 cup eggnog\n1 teaspoon vanilla extract\n2 to 4 Tbsp brandy for drizzling on the cake (optional)\nGlaze:\n1 to 2 Tbsp orange juice\n1 Tbsp brandy or dark rum\n1 cup powdered sugar\nMETHOD\n1 Soak the cranberries. Soak dried chopped cranberries and orange zest in brandy in a small bowl for 15 minutes.\n2 Preheat oven. Adjust rack to lower third of oven. Preheat the oven to 325\xc2\xb0F. Generously butter the inside of a 9 to 10 inch bundt pan.\n3 Mix dry ingredients. In a bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, salt, nutmeg, cinnamon, and allspice.\n4 Cream the butter and sugar. Using an electric mixer on medium speed, beat butter until creamy, 30-45 seconds. Add sugar and beat until light and fluffy, about 5 minutes. Scrape bowl with a rubber spatula occasionally as needed. Add eggs one at a time, beating 1 minute after each addition. Add the vanilla extract.\n5 Add dry ingredients and eggnog to butter sugar mixture. Remove the mixing bowl from the mixer and use a rubber spatula to gently add the dry ingredients in 4 additions, alternating with eggnog (begin and end with dry ingredients). Gently fold in orange zest, dried cranberries and any remaining brandy.\n6 Bake. Spoon the batter into the prepared bundt pan and spread evenly. Bake at 325\xc2\xb0F 55-60 minutes, or until cake springs back when touched lightly in the center and pulls away from the sides of the pan. You can also use a bamboo skewer and insert into the thickest part of the cake. If it comes out clean, it's done.\n7 Cool. Remove from oven and cool upright in the pan on a rack for 10 minutes. Invert cake onto a rack while the cake is still warm. Let cool completely.\n8 Prepare glaze. Once the cake has completely cooled, prepare glaze by whisking together powdered sugar, orange juice, and brandy. (You can sub the brandy with more orange juice or water if you want.)\nMake the glaze thick if you would like a thick, pronounced drizzle, or make it more thin if you want a glaze that is somewhat translucent.\n9 Glaze cake. Place cake on serving platter. Poke a few holes in the top and drizzle with brandy if you want. Use a spoon to stream the glaze onto the cake in back and forth motions to create a striped pattern. Or, if the glaze is thin enough, you can use a pastry brush to brush on the glaze.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nBest Fresh Apple Bundt Cake Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesCook time: 1 hourYield: Serves 12\nYou can also make muffins with this recipe. Standard muffin tins, 24 muffins, 25 minutes bake time.\nINGREDIENTS\nCake:\n1 1/2 cups vegetable oil\n2 cups of sugar\n3 eggs, slightly beaten\n3 cups of white flour\n1 1/2 teaspoon baking soda\n1 teaspoon vanilla\n1 teaspoon salt\n1 teaspoon cinnamon\n3 cups chopped, peeled apples (varieties that are good for baking - i.e. Granny Smith, Gravenstein, Fuji)\n1 cup of sweetened shredded coconut\n1 cup of chopped nuts - walnuts or pecans\nGlaze:\n1/2 stick sweet butter\n1 cup brown sugar\n3 tablespoons milk\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat oven to 350\xc2\xb0 F.\n2 Make the cake batter: Beat together the sugar and oil. Add the eggs. In a separate bowl, sift together the flour, baking soda, salt and cinnamon.\nAdd dry ingredients to oil sugar eggs mixture in thirds, beating to incorporate after each addition.\nMix in the vanilla, apples, coconut, and chopped nuts.\n3 Bake: Bake at 350\xc2\xb0F in a greased and floured bundt cake pan about 1 hour.\nTest around the centers with a long thin bamboo skewer or toothpick to make sure the cake is done.\n4 Cool and remove from pan: When cool enough to handle, gently remove from pan. Let sit on a rack to cool completely. If the dough has raised substantially around the middle areas of the bundt ring, you may need to use a bread knife to gently level off the cake so that it sits even.\n5 Glaze the cake: Blend glaze ingredients and cook until melted. Place the cake on its serving dish.\nPrick all around the top of the cake with a fork so that when the glaze is applied it easily seeps into the cake.\nUse a pastry brush to apply the glaze liberally around the surface areas of the cake, or use a spoon to dribble the glaze on the cake.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Print\nCaramel Apple Monkey Bread Recipe\nPrep time: 2 hours, 30 minutesCook time: 35 minutesYield: 12 to 15 servings\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the dough:\n1 1/4 cups (237 mL) whole milk, warmed (not hot)\n2 teaspoons active dry or instant yeast\n1/4 cup (50 grams) sugar, divided\n4 cups (560 grams) all-purpose flour\n1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt\n3 tablespoons (42 grams) unsalted butter, melted\nFor the apples:\n1 tablespoon (14 grams) unsalted butter\n1 medium sweet-tart apple, peeled and diced (about 1 1/2 cups; I used honeycrisp)\n1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon\nPinch kosher salt\nFor the caramel sauce:\n1 cup (200 grams) sugar\n1/2 cup + 2 tablespoons (118 mL) apple cider, divided\n2 tablespoons (28g) unsalted butter\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n2 tablespoons heavy cream\nTo assemble:\n1/2 cup (56 grams) unsalted butter\n1 cup (200 grams) sugar\n1 1/2 teaspoons ground cinnamon\nSpecial equipment:\nBundt pan\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Make the dough: Whisk the warmed milk with the yeast and 2 tablespoons of the sugar in a measuring cup. Set it to the side to become foamy.\nIn the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the dough hook, whisk together the remaining sugar, flour, salt, 3 tablespoons of melted butter. Add the yeast-milk mixture. Mix on low speed until a shaggy dough forms, then turn the mixer up to medium-low and knead for 10 minutes (set a timer!). When done, the dough should form a ball and spring back when you poke it.\n2 Let the dough rise for one hour, or overnight: Gather the dough into a ball with your hands and place into a greased bowl. Cover well with plastic wrap. Let the dough rise on the counter for 1 hour, until doubled in size, or place in the fridge to rise overnight. (The dough may not quite double in size if you\'re refrigerating overnight, but it should look risen and puffed.)\n3 Make the apples while the dough rises (or before assembling, if you\'ve chilled the dough overnight): Melt the butter for the apples in a medium skillet. Add the diced apples, cinnamon, and a pinch of salt. Cook over medium heat for about five minutes until the apples are just tender. Remove from the heat and set aside to cool. (The apples can be made up to a day ahead and kept refrigerated.)\n4 Make the caramel sauce: In a large saucepan, combine the sugar and 1/2 cup of the apple cider, and stir over low heat until the sugar has dissolved. Once the sugar has dissolved, stop stirring, increase the heat to medium-low, and bring the mixture to a boil.\nContinue to boil (without stirring!) until the sugar turns a deep golden caramel color, 320F to 330F. Remove from the heat and stir in the butter, followed by the salt, cream, and remaining 2 tablespoons of cider. Whisk until smooth. (Caramel sauce can be cooled and refrigerated for several days; warm briefly in the microwave or on the stovetop, until it\'s a "drizzle" consistency, before assembling.)\n5 Assemble the monkey bread: Grease a bundt pan well and set aside. Melt the butter needed for assembly. In a separate bowl, mix together the sugar and cinnamon.\nTear off walnut- or golf ball-sized pieces of dough and roll into balls between your hands, They don\xe2\x80\x99t have to be uniform! Dip each dough ball into the melted butter, roll in cinnamon sugar, and place in the bottom of the prepared bundt until there is a good layer on the bottom of the pan (using up about half the dough).\nSpoon all of the apples over the dough, followed by a third of the caramel sauce. Continue rolling the remaining dough and layering in the pan. Drizzle another third of the caramel sauce over the top. (Save the rest of the caramel sauce for serving).\n6 Let the monkey bread rise for 30 to 60 minutes: Cover the monkey bread with plastic wrap. Room temperature dough will take about 30 minutes to rise; dough that\'s cold from the fridge will take 30 to 60 minutes. Let the monkey bread rise until the top looks slightly puffed and pillowy.\n7 Preheat the oven to 350\xc2\xb0F.\n8 Bake the monkey bread: Uncover the bundt pan and transfer to a sheet pan (to catch butter drips!). Place in the oven and bake for 30 to 35 minutes. When done, the top should have risen slightly over the top of the pan and the bread should be a deep golden brown.\n9 Cool and serve! Cool the monkey bread in the bundt pan on a wire rack for 15 minutes. Place a serving plate over the pan, and using oven mitts, flip the pan over to unmold the monkey bread onto the plate.\nDrizzle with the remaining caramel sauce and serve. Be careful, the bread will still be hot!\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Save It Print\nChocolate Zucchini Cake Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesCook time: 50 minutesYield: Makes 10-12 servings\nINGREDIENTS\n2 1/2 cups regular all-purpose flour, unsifted\n1/2 cup natural, unsweetened cocoa\n2 1/2 teaspoons baking powder\n1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda\n1 teaspoon salt\n1 teaspoon cinnamon\n3/4 cup soft butter\n1 cup white granulated sugar\n1 cup brown sugar\n3 eggs, room temperature\n2 teaspoons vanilla extract\n2 teaspoons grated orange peel\n3 cups coarsely shredded zucchini (from about 1 pound of zucchini, or 3 medium zucchini)\n1/2 cup milk\n1 cup chopped walnuts or pecans\nGlaze (directions follow)\nGlaze:\n2 cups powdered sugar\n3 Tbsp milk\n1 teaspoon vanilla extract\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\nPreheat the oven to 350\xc2\xb0F (175\xc2\xb0C).\n1 Drain the shredded zucchini: Set the shredded zucchini to drain in a sieve over a bowl. If no moisture drains out and the zucchini feels dry, sprinkle some water over it and let the excess drain.\n2 Whisk together dry ingredients: Vigorously whisk together the flour, cocoa, baking powder, soda, salt, and cinnamon in a bow, and set aside.\n3 Mix wet ingredients: With a mixer, beat together the butter and the sugars until smooth. Add the eggs to the butter and sugar mixture one at a time, beating well after each addition. With a wooden spoon, stir in the vanilla, orange peel, and zucchini.\n4 Mix dry with wet ingredients to make batter: Alternately stir in the dry ingredients and the milk into the zucchini mixture, including the nuts with the last addition.\n5 Prep pan, add batter: Spray the inside of a 10-inch bundt pan or tube pan lightly with cooking spray (or grease with butter). Wipe off the excess. Pour in the batter and use a rubber spatula to level the top of the batter.\n6 Bake: Bake in the oven at 350\xc2\xb0F (175\xc2\xb0C) for about 50-55 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in the center comes out clean (test at 45 min).\nCool in pan 15 minutes; turn out on wire rack to cool thoroughly.\n7 Make glaze: Make the glaze by mixing together the glaze ingredients. You can easily do this by hand with a whisk or a spoon. If the glaze is too runny, add some more powdered sugar. If too thick, add more milk.\n8 Drizzle glaze over cake.\nCut in thin slices to serve.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Print\nClassic Vanilla and Chocolate Marbled Bundt Cake Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesCook time: 1 hourCooling time: 30 minutesYield: 1 bundt cake, 10 to 12 servings\n"Growing up in the Midwest, no potluck was complete without a marbled Bundt cake. My mom made them all the time, one of only two desserts that she was known for, so when I hosted a dessert potluck at a local nonprofit community center with the theme \xe2\x80\x9cLike Mom used to make!\xe2\x80\x9d I knew I had to replicate her Bundt cake. The secret to this recipe is the homemade chocolate syrup, which you make on the stove before adding it to the batter. Made with coffee and cocoa powder (and a touch of honey), it lends a rich, deep chocolate flavor because the cocoa blooms in the hot coffee. You don\xe2\x80\x99t necessarily taste the coffee or honey, but they both boost the chocolate goodness!" - Irvin\nText excerpted from MARBLED, SWIRLED, AND LAYERED \xc2\xa9 2016 by Irvin Lin. Reproduced by permission of Houghton Mifflin Harcourt. All rights reserved.\nINGREDIENTS\nTo grease the pan:\n1 tablespoon unsalted butter, at room temperature\n2 tablespoons all-purpose flour\nFor the chocolate syrup:\n1/2 cup (100 g) granulated sugar\n1/2 cup (55 g) natural cocoa powder (not Dutch-process)\n1/2 cup freshly brewed strong hot coffee\n1/4 cup (85 g) mild-tasting honey\n1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract\nFor the cake batter:\n2 cups (400 g) granulated sugar\n1 cup (225 g or 2 sticks) unsalted butter, at room temperature\n2 teaspoons vanilla extract\n4 large eggs, at room temperature\n1 teaspoon baking powder\n1 teaspoon baking soda\n1/2 teaspoon kosher salt\n2 3/4 cups (385 g) all-purpose flour\n1 cup buttermilk\n1 cup (210 g) semisweet chocolate chips\nFor the vanilla bean glaze:\n1 vanilla bean or 1 tablespoon vanilla extract\n1/4 cup whole milk\n2 to 2 1/2 cups (230 g to 290 g) powdered sugar\nFor decoration:\nChocolate pearls, chocolate shavings, or chocolate sprinkles (optional)\nSpecial equipment:\n12-cup bundt pan (I have this one)\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Grease the pan: Preheat the oven to 350\xc2\xb0F. Place the butter in a 12-cup Bundt pan and grease the pan with your fingers, making sure to grease all the nooks and crannies. Sprinkle the flour all over the pan and knock out the excess.\n2 Make the chocolate syrup: Combine the sugar, cocoa powder, coffee, and honey and in a small saucepan and cook over medium heat until the sugar has dissolved and the syrup starts to boil. Bring to a simmer, whisking to make sure there are no lumps. Remove from the heat and stir in the vanilla.\n3 Make the cake batter: Place the sugar and butter in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment. Beat on medium speed until the butter looks light in color and fluffy, about 2 minutes. Add the vanilla and mix until incorporated.\nAdd the eggs one at a time, beating until completely incorporated and scraping down the sides and bottom of the bowl between each addition. Add the baking powder, baking soda, and salt and beat until the dry ingredients are absorbed.\nAdd the flour in three additions and the buttermilk in two, alternating between the flour and buttermilk and ending with the flour. Beat until incorporated and scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl between each addition. Gently fold in the chocolate chips.\n4 Spoon one-third of the batter into a medium bowl and add the chocolate syrup. Stir to incorporate completely and set aside.\n5 Layer the batter in the bundt: Spoon half of the remaining vanilla batter into the prepared Bundt pan. Scrape the chocolate batter on top. Spread the remaining vanilla batter on top of the chocolate batter.\n6 Swirl the vanilla and chocolate layers: Insert a butter knife or chopstick into the batter and make \xe2\x80\x9cfigure eight\xe2\x80\x9d motions throughout the entire cake to marble the batter. You may want to sometimes dig deep to the bottom and sometimes lift up to make sure the batter really moves around. Just don\xe2\x80\x99t overmix the batters, or else they will blend together instead of marbling.\n7 Bake the bundt cake: Place the pan on a rimmed baking sheet. Bake until a toothpick or skewer inserted in the center comes out clean and the cake springs back when pressed down lightly, 50 to 60 minutes.\n8 Let cool in the pan on a wire rack for 20 to 30 minutes and then invert onto a serving plate while still warm. If the cake doesn\xe2\x80\x99t unmold, gently slip a very thin knife between the cake and the pan all the way around to loosen it and then try again.\n9 Make the vanilla bean glaze: Slice the vanilla bean lengthwise, if using, and scrape the seeds into the milk in a large bowl. Chop the bean in half and toss the pod in with the milk as well. Let steep in the refrigerator as the cake cools.\nOnce the cake has cooled completely (after about 2 hours), remove the vanilla bean from the milk and sift 2 cups powdered sugar into the milk. (If using the vanilla extract, add it to the milk right before sifting the powdered sugar; no need to steep it.) The glaze should be thin enough to pour, but thick enough to hold its shape on the cake, similar to honey in consistency. If the glaze is too thin, add more powdered sugar, 1 tablespoon at a time, until it reaches the desired thickness.\n10 Drizzle the glaze on top of the cake, making sure the glaze drips down the sides of the cake. [Emma\'s Tip: Tuck parchment paper under the cake while you drizzle to catch the drips, then remove once the icing is set.] If decorating with chocolate pearls, shavings, or sprinkles, sprinkle them randomly on the cake before the glaze dries.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b"Print\nLemon Poppy Seed Bundt Cake Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 1 hourYield: 10 to 12 servings\nYou'll need 6 to 8 lemons total for this recipe.\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the cake:\n3 cups (374g) all-purpose flour\n3/4 teaspoon baking powder\n1/2 teaspoon baking soda\n1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt\n1/4 cup (43g) poppy seeds\n1 1/2 cups (339g) unsalted butter, softened\n2 cups (400g) sugar\n3 tablespoons lemon zest (from 4 to 6 lemons)\n4 large eggs, at room temperature\n1/4 cup lemon juice (from about 2 lemons)\n1 cup buttermilk\nFor the lemon syrup:\n1/2 cup lemon juice (from about 4 lemons)\n1/2 cup (100g) sugar\nFor the lemon glaze:\n1 1/2 cups (170g) powdered sugar\n2 tablespoons lemon juice (from 1 lemon)\n1 to 2 tablespoons milk\nPinch of kosher salt\nSpecial equipment:\n10-cup bundt pan\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Prep the pan: Preheat the oven to 350\xc2\xb0F with a rack in the middle position. Generously spray a 10-cup capacity bundt pan with baking spray.\n2 Mix the dry ingredients: In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and poppy seeds.\n3 Make the batter: In the bowl of a stand mixer, beat the butter until creamy. Add the sugar and lemon zest, beat for 3 to 4 minutes, or until pale and fluffy. Scrape down the sides of the bowl and beat in the eggs one at a time, scraping the bowl after each addition.\nWhisk the lemon juice and buttermilk together in a measuring cup. With the mixer on medium-low, beat in a third of the flour mixture, followed by a third of the milk mixture. Continue to add the flour and milk, alternating between the two and scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed.\n  4 Bake the cake: Scrape the batter into the prepared pan and even the top. Tap the pan on the counter a few times to make sure the batter settles into the crevices of the pan.\nBake in the center of the preheated oven for 60 to 75 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center of the cake comes out clean and the top of the cake springs back to the touch.\n5 Cool the cake: Remove the cake from the oven and cool in the pan for 15 minutes before unmolding on a wire rack. The cake should still be warm.\n6 Make the syrup and drizzle over the cake: While the cake is cooling in the pan, make the lemon syrup. Combine the lemon juice and sugar in a saucepan and bring it to a boil over high heat. Boil until the sugar has dissolved, then remove from heat.\nBrush the syrup over the still-warm, unmolded cake. You should use up all the syrup. Cool completely before icing.\n6 Ice the cake: To make the icing, whisk the powdered sugar and lemon juice together, followed by 1 tablespoon of the milk and the salt. Whisk in additional milk as needed until the icing is thin enough to pour, but still holds a ribbon on the surface.\nSpoon the icing over the cooled cake. This cake keeps well, glazed or unglazed, at room temperature wrapped in plastic for 3 days. (If glazed, let the glaze set until dry to the touch before wrapping in plastic.)\n  Hello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b'Save It Print\nMrs. Adams\xe2\x80\x99 Delicious Pound Cake Recipe\nINGREDIENTS\n1 lb of Imperial margarine (sticks)**\n6 eggs (at room temperature)\n1 lb confectioners sugar\n3 cups cake flour\n2 teaspoons vanilla\nMETHOD\n1 Make the batter: Beat together the margarine and sugar until fluffy. Add the eggs one at a time and beat lightly, mixing in well after each addition. Add flour and mix well. Add vanilla before, during, and after adding the flour.\n2 Bake the cake: Pour batter into a stick-free or greased and floured bundt cake pan and bake for 1 to 1 1/2 hours on 325\xc2\xb0F. Begin watching the cake at 1 hour. The cake is done when a tester inserted into the center comes out clean. Cake should be cracked on top and golden brown.\n3 Cool: Cool for 5 minutes on a cake rack. Loosen the sides with a knife. Gently remove the cake from the pan while still warm.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Print\nChocolate Bundt Cake Recipe\nPrep time: 25 minutesCook time: 1 hour, 15 minutesYield: Serves 12 to 16\nThe baking temperature is lower than one would usually use for baking a cake\xe2\x80\x94275\xc2\xb0F.\nINGREDIENTS\n7 ounces bittersweet chocolate\n4 ounces (1 stick) butter (plus more for greasing the pan)\n1 3/4 cups of strong coffee\n1/4 cup bourbon whisky (if skipping the whisky, just use more coffee)\n3/4 teaspoon of salt (if using salted butter, reduce to 1/8 teaspoon of salt)\n2 cups all purpose flour\n1 teaspoon baking soda\n2 eggs\n1 1/2 cups sugar\n1 teaspoon vanilla extract\n3 Tbsp cocoa for dusting the bundt pan\n1 Tbsp powdered sugar for dusting the cake (optional)\nSpecial equipment:\nOne 2 1/2-quart capacity bundt pan (or two 4x8x2 loaf pans)\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat oven, prep bundt pan: Preheat oven to 275\xc2\xb0F. Grease inside of a 2-quart bunt pan with a thin layer of butter. Sprinkle cocoa over the butter. Set aside.\n2 Melt chocolate butter, coffee, bourbon, salt: Place a metal bowl over a saucepan filled with an inch or two of water, make sure that the water is not touching the bottom of the metal bowl. Place the chocolate, butter, coffee, bourbon, and salt in the metal bowl. Heat the saucepan to a low simmer. (Basically you are creating a double boiler to gently melt the chocolate mixture.)\nStir occasionally as the chocolate melts. Once the mixture is melted and smooth, remove the bowl from heat and let sit to cool for 15 minutes (you can chill in the refrigerator if you want to speed up this process.)\n3 In a medium bowl, vigorously whisk together the flour and baking soda.\n4 In a large mixing bowl, beat the eggs, sugar, and vanilla together until light and foamy (you can use a hand mixer for this, or a stand up mixer).\n5 Make batter: Once the chocolate mixture has cooled sufficiently, slowly whisk it into the egg sugar mixture. Then, stir in the flour mixture, a third at a time. Whisk until smooth. (The batter will be rather liquid-y. Don't worry about it.)\n6 Bake: Pour batter into the prepared bundt pan. Place on the middle rack of the preheated oven. Bake at 275\xc2\xb0F for 1 hour 15 minutes, until a tester inserted into the center comes out clean.\n7 Cool in the pan for 15 minutes, then gently remove from the pan and cool on a rack until completely cooled to room temperature.\n8 Sprinkle with powdered sugar: Transfer cake to a serving platter. Sprinkle with powdered sugar, if using. Slice with a serrated bread knife to serve. Serve with whipped cream or ice cream.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b'Save It Print\nHow to Grill the Best Burgers\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 5 minutesYield: 6 burgers\nThis recipe will make six burgers that are 1/3 pound each. The patties should be 4-inches across and 1-inch thick at the edges before cooking.\nI like hamburgers with a bit of a garlic kick, so if you prefer a subtler garlic flavor, feel free to reduce the amount to your liking or eliminate altogether.\nINGREDIENTS\n2 pounds 80/20 ground beef, cold\n4 cloves minced garlic\n2 tablespoons minced onion\n1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce\n1 3/4 teaspoons freshly ground pepper\n1 1/2 teaspoons salt\n6 hamburger buns\nButter for buns\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Make the burger mix: Put the cold ground beef in mixing bowl. Sprinkle the other ingredients evenly over top. Fold the meat over a few times to get everything incorporated. This entire process should only take about 30 to 45 seconds. Don\xe2\x80\x99t over handle the meat.\n  2 Shape the burger patties: Rather than forming the patties in your hand, form them on a tray. This makes it easier to shape the patties without over-handling or warming the meat. I like to use a cookie sheet lined with parchment paper, but any tray or platter will do.\nOn the tray, divide the meat into 6 equal parts (about 5 1/4 ounces each). Gently form each portion into a patty that is 4-inches across with 1-inch sides and a shallow depression in the middle (see photos below). You want the outer 1/2 inch of the patty to be slightly taller than the inside. This keeps the patty from shrinking too much and from puffing up in the center during grilling\nCover the patties with plastic wrap and transfer to the fridge while you heat up your grill and butter your buns.\n  3 Heat the grill: Heat a gas or charcoal grill to 450 to 500\xc2\xb0F, or hot enough that you can only hold your hand above the grill grates for about 1 second.\nButter the insides of all the buns and set them near the grill.\n4 Grill the burgers: Place patties on the grill over direct heat. Cook to your desired doneness:\nFor rare burgers, cook for 4 minutes total (125\xc2\xb0F)\nFor medium-rare burgers, cook for 5 minutes total (135\xc2\xb0F)\nFor medium burgers, cook for 6 to 7 minutes total (145\xc2\xb0F)\nFor well-done burgers, cook for 8 to 9 minutes total (160\xc2\xb0F)\nFlip the burgers at least once during cooking, or as often as you wish. Do not press down on the patties at any time.\n  5 Add the cheese and toast the buns: When you have about 1 minute left on the cooking time, add the cheese to the burgers and the buttered buns to the grill over indirect heat.\n6 Rest the burgers: Remove burgers and buns from grill and transfer to a clean platter. Let the burgers rest for 1 minute before serving.\n7 Serve: Serve with tomato jam, mayonnaise, bacon jam, garlic aioli, blue cheese sauce, saut\xc3\xa9ed mushrooms, Thousand Island, or the classic and always wonderful lettuce, tomato, pickles and red onion.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Print\nSpicy Turkey and Zucchini Burger Recipe\nPrep time: 25 minutesCook time: 25 minutesYield: Serves 4-6\nRecipe adapted from the cookbook Jerusalem by Yotam Ottolenghi and Sami Tamimi.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 pound ground turkey meat\nJust under 2 cups, lightly packed, coarsely grated zucchini (from about 2 to 3 small zucchinis or one medium zucchini)\n3 green onions, thinly sliced, onion greens included\n2 tablespoons chopped fresh mint (spearmint)\n2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro (tender stems included)\n1 clove garlic, crushed and minced\n1 teaspoon ground cumin\n1 teaspoon Kosher salt\n1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper\n1/2 teaspoon cayenne\n3 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\nSour cream sauce:\n1/4 cup sour cream\n1/3 cup plain Greek yogurt\n1 teaspoon grated lemon zest\n1 tablespoon lemon juice\n1/2 teaspoon minced garlic\n2 teaspoons extra virgin olive oil\n1/4 teaspoon salt\nPinch of freshly ground black pepper\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Make the sour cream sauce by placing all of the sauce ingredients in a bowl and stirring until combined. Chill until ready to use.\n2 Mix the turkey zucchini mixture: In a large bowl place the grated zucchini, sliced green onions, chopped mint, cilantro, and garlic, ground cumin, salt, pepper, and cayenne. Stir to combine.\nWith your hands, mix in the ground turkey until the zucchini mixture is well distributed through the ground turkey.\n3 Form patties: Use your hands to form 3 to 4 inch wide patties, placing them on a baking sheet. Note that the patties will be rather wet, so they may be a little tricky to handle.\n4 Fry gently: Heat 3 Tbsp of olive oil in a large frying pan on medium high heat. Once the oil is hot, lower the heat to medium.\nWorking in batches, place the patties in the pan. Let cook for about 5 minutes, then flip the patties over and cook for another 5 to 6 minutes.\nYou want them to brown and to gently cook all the way through. If the temperature is too high, they'll get browned on the outside but the inside will still be raw. So, cook them gently.\nIf the outsides are browned and the insides still aren't done, lower the heat and cook longer.\n5 Remove to paper-towel lined plate: Once the first batch of patties are done, remove to a paper towel-lined plate while you cook the second batch. Or you can keep the patties warm in a 200\xc2\xb0F oven.\nMakes 8 large patties or up to 18 small ones. Serve with the sour cream sauce.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b'Print\nHerbed Turkey Burger Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: Makes 8 turkey burgers\nGround turkey is typically much leaner than ground beef. In order to keep the burger from being too dry it helps to use ground dark meat from thighs and legs if you can get it. Adding a little olive oil to the mix helps, too.\nINGREDIENTS\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n1/2 medium red onion, minced\n4 minced garlic cloves\n2 pounds ground turkey meat, preferably from the legs and thighs\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n1 teaspoon black pepper\n1/2 cup loosely packed chopped parsley\n1 tablespoon minced fresh rosemary\n1 tablespoon minced fresh sage\n2 teaspoons chopped fresh thyme\nTo serve:\nBurger buns\nToppings like sliced onions, lettuce, sliced tomatoes, bacon, mayonnaise, mustard, relish, and/or ketchup\nMETHOD\n1 Saut\xc3\xa9 onions and garlic: Saut\xc3\xa9 the chopped onion in olive oil for 3 minutes over medium heat. Add the garlic and saut\xc3\xa9 for another 2 minutes, or until the garlic begins to brown. Remove from heat. Transfer the onions, garlic, and oil to a large bowl to cool down.\n2 Make the burger mix: Once the onions are cool to the touch, add the ground turkey, salt, pepper, and herbs into the bowl. Using your hands, gently mix everything until well combined. You want the herbs mixed in without overworking the meat (which would make the burgers tough).\n3 Form the meat into patties. Use your fingers to form a slight indentation in the middle of the patties. When burgers cook, the meat contracts from the edges. If the middle part is slightly thinner than the edges it will help the patties finish with a more even shape and less of a bulge in the middle.\n4 Cook the burgers: Cook on a hot grill or in a hot cast iron frying pan for 5 to 6 minutes per side, until cooked through (165\xc2\xb0F if using a meat thermometer).\nIf using a grill, first pre-heat the grill on high for 10 minutes and coat the grates with a little vegetable oil.\nIf using a frying pan, put a little oil in the pan first to help keep the burgers from sticking. A trick my mother uses when making burgers in a cast iron frying pan is to sprinkle the bottom of the pan with a little salt. The salt acts sort of like ball bearings, keeping the patties from sticking when you go to flip them.\n5 Serve the burgers: Toast the buns and serve the burgers with the accompaniments of your choice\xe2\x80\x94sliced onions, lettuce, sliced tomatoes, bacon, mayonnaise (especially good with mayo), mustard, relish, and/or ketchup.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b"Save It Print\nGrilled Beef and Mushroom Burger Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: Serves 3-4\nWe call for fresh shiitake mushrooms, but only because they are so much more flavorful than regular button mushrooms. Feel free to use whatever mushroom you want, buttons, cremini, morels, etc. Although this recipe calls for using a grill, you can easily pan fry them on your stovetop. I would recommend using a large cast iron pan for pan frying.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 pound ground beef\nA 1-ounce package of dried mushrooms (porcini, morels or other mushrooms)\n2 teaspoons Worcestershire sauce\n1/2 teaspoon kosher salt (add more if you like burgers a little saltier)\n1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper\n1/2 pound fresh shiitake mushrooms (can substitute button or cremini), sliced\n1 large onion, sliced thin (about 2 cups)\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\nSalt\n4-6 slices of Swiss cheese\nBurger buns\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Process the dried mushrooms in a food processor, or a clean coffee grinder (grind some raw rice to clean out coffee grinds), until ground into a powder. Remove any large mushroom pieces that didn't grind down, a few small pieces will be fine.\n2 Make the burger mixture: In a large bowl, use your clean hands to gently mix together the meat, salt, mushroom powder, black pepper and Worcestershire sauce. Mix just until everything is mostly combined, a minute or two. Do not overwork the meat mixture or it will become tough and meatloaf-like.\n3 Form into patties: Shape the meat into 3-4 patties, using about a quarter to a third of a pound per patty, creating a slight indentation at the centers of the patties (this will help keep the patties fairly flat when they cook, as the sides tend to contract more than the center).\n4 Saut\xc3\xa9 the mushrooms, then the onions: Prepare your grill for high, direct heat. While the grill is heating up, heat a large saut\xc3\xa9 pan over high heat for 1 minute. Add the mushrooms and dry-saut\xc3\xa9 them until they release their water, about 2-3 minutes.\nAdd the onions and the olive oil, toss to combine and continue to saut\xc3\xa9 over high heat 1 minute. Add salt to taste and cook until the onions soften and begin to brown. Turn off the heat and place in a bowl.\n5 Grill the burgers on high, direct heat to the desired doneness, between 5-8 minutes per side, depending on the thickness of the burgers and how hot your grill is.\n6 Add the cheese: When the burgers are almost done, lay the Swiss cheese over them and allow the cheese to melt.\n7 Grill the buns: Paint the burger buns with a little olive oil and toast them on the griddle or grill grates.\n8 Assemble the burgers: To assemble, put a burger on the bun and top with the saut\xc3\xa9ed onions and mushroom mixture.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nPortobello Mushroom Burger Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesCook time: 20 minutesYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n4 portobello mushroom caps\nExtra virgin olive oil\nOne 8-ounce jar of sun-dried tomatoes in oil\n8 ounces of baby spinach\n1 red onion, sliced into 1/4-inch rounds\nSalt\nMayonnaise\n4 hamburger buns\nMETHOD\n1 Prepare your grill for high, direct heat.\n2 Wilt the baby spinach: While the grill is heating, if you wish, saut\xc3\xa9 the baby spinach in a tablespoon of olive oil and a sprinkle of salt in a large saut\xc3\xa9 pan on medium high heat, just until the spinach wilts, then remove to a plate.\nThe gently wilted spinach will stay on the portobello mushroom burger better than raw spinach, which tends to fall off.\nOr you can use raw baby spinach. Your choice.\n3 Clean mushrooms and brush with oil: Wipe the mushrooms clean with a damp paper towel. If you are working with whole mushrooms, slice off the stems (you can use for another purpose, chopped and saut\xc3\xa9ed or for making stock.)\nPaint the tops of the mushroom caps with some of the oil from the sun-dried tomatoes.\n4 Grill onion rounds, mushroom caps, buns: Scrape the grill grates clean. Using a folded up paper towel dipped in olive oil, wipe down the grill grates to oil them.\nBrush the onion rounds with some olive oil and place them on the grill.\nPlace the mushroom caps on the grill, top side down first. Sprinkle with a little salt. Grill the mushroom caps and the onion rounds for 4-5 minutes per side.\nGrill the burger buns, cut side down, for about 1/2 to 1 minute, until lightly toasted.\n5 Assemble: To assemble, spread some mayonnaise on each bun. Put a portobello mushroom cap on the bottom, then layer on the spinach, sun-dried tomatoes, and finally some onion. Serve at once.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nBlue Cheese Burgers Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 10 minutesPattie chilling time: 30 minutesYield: Makes 4 burgers\nHere's a tip, although you might be tempted to go with extra lean hamburger meat for this burger, given all the cheese, I don't recommend it, unless you want blue cheese flavored dry burgers.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 pound ground beef (16-20%)\n1 tablespoon Dijon mustard\n2 cloves minced garlic\n2 green onions, chopped\n1/2 cup (about 2 ounces) crumbled blue cheese\n1 egg\n1 tablespoon water\nSalt and freshly ground black pepper\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Gently mix ground beef with the other ingredients: Put ground beef, mustard, garlic, onions, blue cheese, water, egg, and a sprinkling of salt and pepper into a large bowl. Use your hands to gently mix the ingredients together until just incorporated. Do not over-mix.\n2 Shape into patties and chill: Shape into patties, about 1/2 inch thick and larger than your bun. Refrigerate at least 30 minutes or until you are ready to cook.\n3 Prepare charcoal or gas grill for cooking over high direct heat. Using tongs and a folded up paper towel dipped in vegetable oil, oil the grill grates. Make sure grill is hot and well oiled before laying down the patties.\n4 Season and grill the burgers: Season patties with salt and pepper. Place the patties on the clean, well-oiled grill grate. Grill the burgers for about 5 minutes per side. Do not press down on the burgers while cooking.\nIf you don't have a grill, you can use a grill pan or a cast iron frying pan for the burgers.\nServe on hamburger buns with lettuce and mayonnaise.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nDanish Pork Burgers Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 20 minutesYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n1 pound ground pork\n1 red onion, finely diced\n16 saltine crackers, crumbled\n1/2 cup whole milk\n2 eggs, lightly beaten\n1 teaspoon kosher salt\n1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper\nVegetable oil for cooking\nDijon mustard for serving\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Make the ground pork mixture: Using your hands to combine, mix together the pork, saltines, onion, eggs, milk, salt, and pepper in a large bowl.\n2 Fry the patties: Lightly brush a large, nonstick frying pan with vegetable oil. Heat the pan on medium high. Divide the pork mixture into 8 equal portions.\nWorking in batches, drop each portion into the hot pan, spacing them as not to crowd the pan.\nPat them down with the back of a spoon to form them into patties. Cook the patties, turning once, for 4 to 5 minutes per side, until golden brown.\nServe the pork burgers with Dijon mustard.\n  Hello! All photos and content are copyright protected.
