Leftovers can be kept, covered, for 2 to 3 days at room temperature.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b"Save It Print\nTriple Ginger Gingerbread Cake Recipe\nPrep time: 30 minutesCook time: 55 minutesYield: 9 to 16 slices\nThis is a cake that benefits from time. When the cake is cool wrap it up in plastic wrap and wait 24 hours to allow the flavors to intensify.\nIf you can't find candied ginger, you can simply substitute more fresh ginger.\nGINGERBREAD LOAF: A loaf pan can also be used for this recipe. Simply place foil over the top at 25 minutes, and then increase the continuing baking time by 5 to 10 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. I find, however, that a loaf pan often results in slightly crispier, more well-done crust.\nINGREDIENTS\n1/2 cup (1 stick) unsalted butter\n1/2 cup water\n1/2 cup molasses, unsulphured\n1/2 cup honey (preferably a dark variety such as buckwheat, avocado or wildflower)\n1/2 cup dark brown sugar (can substitute light brown)\n2 large eggs, room temperature\n1 tablespoon fresh ginger, peeled and finely grated\n1 tablespoon candied ginger, minced\n2 cups all-purpose flour\n1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda\n1 1/2 teaspoon ground ginger\n1 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n1/4 teaspoon ground cloves\n1/8 teaspoon nutmeg\nMETHOD\n1 Preheat oven, prep baking dish: Preheat oven to 325\xc2\xb0F. Butter and lightly flour an 8x8 or 9x9 baking dish. Fit a piece of parchment or baking paper inside and allow some to hang off the sides (this will make it easier to lift the cake out of the pan later). Lightly butter and flour the paper as well.\n2 Melt butter with molasses, honey, water, brown sugar: In a medium saucepan over medium heat place the butter, molasses, honey, water, and brown sugar. Stir to melt the butter. Do not allow to simmer or boil.\nOnce the butter is melted take the pot off the heat and allow to cool to room temperature. Be sure to stir the mixture every so often as the the sugar and fat will form skin on the surface.\n3 Add eggs, grated and candied ginger: Once the butter mixture is at room temperature whisk the eggs, grated ginger, and candied ginger into the molasses mixture. Set aside.\n4 Whisk flour, baking soda, and spices:  Whisk together the flour, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, ginger, cloves, and nutmeg.\n5 Add the flour to the molasses mixture in three or four additions and whisk until it just comes together.\n6 Bake: Pour into the prepared pan and bake for 35 minutes. Loosely place a piece of foil over the top and bake for another 15 to 25 minutes or until a tester comes out clean.\n7 Cool: Cool on a wire rack for ten minutes, then lift the cake out of the pan and continue to cool on the rack.\nYou can serve this fresh out of the oven, but the flavor is much better if you give it a day to sit and allow the spices to intensify the cake.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b"Save It Print\nHummingbird Cake Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 50 minutesYield: Serves 12 to 16\nThe cream cheese frosting recipe can be cut in half if you prefer less frosting. If so, apply sparingly so there is enough to cover the entire cake.\nFeel free to use any favorite liquor, such as Grand Marnier, Triple Sec, Cognac, Armagnac, Brandy or even Bourbon. Or, simply omit the liquor and use 2 tsp vanilla extract.\n  INGREDIENTS\nFor the cake:\n3 cups all-purpose flour\n2 teaspoons baking powder (make sure your baking powder is still fresh!)\n1/2 teaspoon baking soda\n1 teaspoon salt\n1 teaspoon ground cinnamon\n1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg (optional)\n3 large eggs\n2 cups granulated white sugar\n1 cup canola oil\n2 teaspoons vanilla extract\n1 (8 ounce) can crushed pineapple, with juice\n2 cups mashed bananas (from 3 to 5 bananas)\n1 cup finely chopped pecans\nFor the cream cheese frosting:\n1 pound cream cheese, softened\n1 cup (2 sticks) unsalted butter, softened\n2 pounds (32-ounces) powdered sugar\n1 teaspoon vanilla extract\n1 tablespoon Cointreau or other liquor (see Recipe Note)\n1 cup roughly chopped pecans, for topping (optional, toasted)\nEdible flowers for garnish (optional)\nSpecial equipment:\n3 9-inch cake pans\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat the oven to 350\xc2\xb0 F. Butter and flour three 9-inch round cake pans.\n2 Whisk together dry ingredients: In a large bowl, vigorously whisk together the dry ingredients: flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, cinnamon, and nutmeg (optional).\n3 Whisk together oil, sugar, eggs, then stir in pineapple, bananas, vanilla, 1 cup of pecans: In a separate bowl, whisk the canola oil, sugar, and eggs together until combined. Stir the pineapple, bananas, vanilla and one cup of the chopped pecans into the egg mixture and mix (do not beat).\n4 Fold wet ingredients into dry: Using a wooden spoon or spatula, fold the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients until just combined (do not over-mix).\n5 Pour into cake pans and bake: Pour the batter into the three prepared cake pans, taking care to divide evenly. Bake at 350\xc2\xb0F on center racks of oven for 20 to 25 minutes, or until a toothpick or knife inserted in the center comes out clean.\n6 Cool: Allow the cakes to cool in the pan on wire racks for 10 minutes.  After 10 minutes, run a knife around the edges and remove the cakes from the pans.  Cool completely on wire racks before frosting.\n7 Make the frosting: Beat the softened butter and cream cheese in a large bowl with an electric mixer. With the mixer on low speed, add the powdered sugar in small amounts until all is incorporated, then add the Cointreau and vanilla and beat until the frosting is light and fluffy.\nNote: Do not add the powdered sugar while the mixer is set on a high speed, or you will create a snowy mess of sugar all over your kitchen. (Please do not ask me how I know this.)\n8 Frost the cake: Place one layer, top down, on a large plate or cake stand (this creates a smooth surface on the top and results in a more level cake). Spread frosting evenly over the first layer, then repeat with the second and third layers, then frost the sides.\n3 Sprinkle with chopped pecans: Sprinkle the top completely with the remaining cup of chopped pecans (toasted or un-toasted). Alternatively, press the chopped pecans onto the sides of the cake and leave the top simply frosted.\nThis cake is best served the day it's made and can be kept, assembled and frosted, for a few hours before servings. If you need to serve it the next day or if you have leftovers, cover the cake as well as possible and refrigerate it. Remove it from the fridge and let it come up to room temperature for an hour or two before serving.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Print\nApple Coffee Cake Recipe\nPrep time: 25 minutesCook time: 30 minutesYield: Serves 6\nINGREDIENTS\n2 cups (280 g) all purpose flour\n2 teaspoons baking powder\n1 teaspoon salt\n1/4 cup (50 g) of white granulated sugar plus 2 Tbsp sugar\n1 teaspoon ground cinnamon\n10 Tbsp unsalted butter (140 g), room temperature\n2 eggs, beaten\n1 cup (235 ml) whole milk\n1 medium tart green apple, cored, peeled and sliced into 1/4-inch thick slices\nStreusel topping:\n4 Tbsp brown sugar\n4 Tbsp flour\n1/4 teaspoon cinnamon\n1 Tbsp butter, cut into small cubes\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat oven, prepare pie dish: Preheat the oven to 375\xc2\xb0F (190\xc2\xb0C). Grease a 9-inch pie pan (can use a springform pan or square baking pan)\n2 Whisk flour, baking powder, salt: In a medium bowl, whisk vigorously together the flour, baking powder, and salt.\n3 Make cinnamon sugar: In a separate small bowl, mix 2 Tbsp of the sugar with the cinnamon, set aside.\n4 Beat butter and sugar, add eggs, add flour mixture and milk: Using an electric mixer, beat the butter with the remaining 1/4 cup sugar. Beat in the eggs until blended. Add the flour mixture in three additions, alternating with the milk, beating after each addition until just combined.\n5 Pour batter into baking dish, top with apple slices, cinnamon sugar: Pour half of the batter in the bottom of the baking dish. Lay the apple slices on the batter so they just cover the batter (you may have to overlap some slices). Sprinkle the apples with the cinnamon-sugar mixture. Spread the rest of the batter over the apples.\n6 Top with streusel topping: In a small bowl mix together the brown sugar, flour, and cinnamon for the streusel topping. Sprinkle over the cake and dot with butter.\n7 Bake: Bake the cake at 375\xc2\xb0F (190\xc2\xb0C) for 30-35 minutes or until it is golden brown and a tester inserted into the center comes out clean.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b"Print\nPineapple Upside Down Cake Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 1 hour, 20 minutesYield: Makes 12 to 14 servings\nIf you don't have a high-sided 10-inch cake pan, you might try making this in a springform pan. Line the inside with foil so the caramel doesn't leak, and bake on a rimmed baking sheet just in case it does.\nMy dad's alternative caramel topping: 1 3/4 cups granulated sugar, 1/4 cup light corn syrup, 1/2 cup water, 1/4 cup butter. Combine sugar, corn syrup, and water in a medium saucepan. Heat on medium until all sugar is dissolved. Boil until syrup becomes warm amber in color (5 to 10 minutes). Remove from heat. Add 1/4 cup butter, carefully as it will foam up a bit. Swirl the pan so that the butter is all incorporated, stirring with a wooden spoon if necessary. Pour out into cake pan. Continue with recipe as noted.\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the topping:\n1 cup (200g) of firmly packed dark brown sugar\n1/2 cup (1 stick) unsalted butter\n1 can (20 oz) of pineapple slices (Dole brand works best)\nFor the cake:\n1 1/2 cups (200g) all-purpose flour\n6 tablespoons (55 g) cake flour\n6 tablespoons ground almonds (from about 2 oz or 56g of blanched almonds)\n3/4 teaspoon baking powder\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n1 3/4 cups (350g) of sugar\n1 cup (2 sticks) unsalted butter at room temperature\n4 large eggs\n3/4 teaspoon vanilla extract\n3/4 cup sour cream\nOptional:\n8 candied or maraschino cherries\nSpecial equipment:\n10-inch non-stick cake pan\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Grease the pan with butter: Generously grease (with butter) a 10-inch diameter non-stick cake pan with at least 2-inch high sides.\n2 Make caramel topping: Heat brown sugar and butter in a medium sized saucepan on medium heat until sugar dissolves and the mixture is bubbly,  several minutes. (After sugar melts, don't stir.)\n3 Pour into pan, top with pineapple slices: Pour the caramel mixture into the pan. Arrange pineapple slices in a single layer on top of the caramel mixture.\n4 Preheat oven to 325\xc2\xb0 F.\n5 Make cake batter: Whisk the flours, ground almonds, baking powder, and salt in a large mixing bowl.\nIn a separate bowl, use an electric mixer to beat the sugar and butter together until light. Add eggs one at a time, beating after each addition. Beat in the vanilla.\nAdd dry ingredients alternately with sour cream in 2 additions each, beating well after each addition.\n6 Pour cake batter over caramel and pineapple in pan. Spread the cake batter over the pineapple and caramel so that it is smooth on top.\n7 Bake: Bake the cake at 325\xc2\xb0F until a tester inserted into the center comes out mostly clean (internal temperature of about 205\xc2\xb0F if you have an instant read thermometer), about 1 hour.\n8 Turn out cake: Cool cake in pan on a rack for 5 minutes. Turn the cake out onto a platter, after the cake has cooled for 5 minutes, and while the cake is still warm.\nIf some of the topping sticks to the cake pan (it often does), just scoop it out with a butter knife and patch the cake.\n9 (Optional) Add cherries: If you want to add candied or maraschino cherries for decoration, just put one in the center of each pineapple round.\nServe warm or at room temperature.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b'Save It Print\nChocolate Bourbon Cake Recipe\nYield: Serves 10 to 12\nAlthough this is a bundt pan recipe, you can also use the same amount of batter for 2 loaf pans (8 or 9 inch pans). Baking time will be less if you use loaf pans. Test at 55 minutes.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 cup (2 sticks) unsalted butter, more for greasing pan\n2 cups all-purpose flour, more for dusting pan\n5 ounces high quality, unsweetened dark chocolate\n1/4 cup instant espresso powder (can use instant coffee)\n2 tablespoons unsweetened natural cocoa powder\n1 cup bourbon whiskey (can use 1/2 cup), more for sprinkling\n1/2 teaspoon kosher salt\n2 cups white granulated sugar\n3 large eggs\n1 tablespoon vanilla extract\n1 teaspoon baking soda\n1/4 cup confectioners\xe2\x80\x99 sugar (powdered sugar), for sprinkling\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat oven, prepare bundt pan: Preheat oven to 325\xc2\xb0F. Butter and flour the inside of a large (10 cup) bundt pan.\n2 Melt chocolate: Melt chocolate in a microwave oven or in a double boiler over simmering water. Let cool. Put a cup of water on to boil.\n3 Mix instant espresso powder, cocoa powder, boiling water, bourbon, salt: Put instant espresso powder (or instant coffee) and cocoa powder in a large (at least 2 cup) glass measuring cup. Add enough boiling water to come up to the 1 cup measuring line. Mix until powders dissolve. Stir in the bourbon and salt. Set aside and let cool.\n4 Beat butter, add sugar, eggs, vanilla, baking soda, melted chocolate: Beat butter until fluffy (2-3 minutes on high using an electric mixer). Add sugar and beat a minute longer. Add the eggs one at a time, beating a minute after each addition. Add the vanilla extract, baking soda and melted chocolate.\n5 Alternate adding bourbon espresso mixture with flour: With the mixer on the lowest speed, beat in a third of the bourbon espresso cocoa mixture. When liquid is absorbed, beat in half of the flour (1 cup). Repeat additions, ending with bourbon mixture.\n6 Bake: Scrape batter into prepared bundt pan and smooth the top. Bake at 325\xc2\xb0F until a tester inserted into center of cake comes out clean, about 1 hour 10 minutes.\n7 Cool, sprinkle with whisky and powdered sugar: Move the cake to a rack. Gently un-mold after 15 minutes and sprinkle the cake with a little more bourbon whiskey. Let the cake cool completely before serving. Sprinkle powdered sugar through a mesh sieve over the cake before serving.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nApplesauce Spice Cake Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 30 minutesCooling time: 15 minutesYield: Serves 6 to 8\nThis cake is also great topped with Cream Cheese Frosting!\nRecipe adapted from Kitchen Sense by Mitchell Davis.\nINGREDIENTS\n1/2 cup (1 stick) unsalted butter, room temperature\n2 cups all-purpose flour\n1 teaspoon baking soda\n1 teaspoon cinnamon\n1/2 teaspoon ground allspice\n1/2 teaspoon grated nutmeg\n1/4 teaspoon ground cloves\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n1 cup sugar\n3 large eggs\n1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract\n1 cup applesauce\n1/4 cup plain yogurt diluted a bit with milk, or 1/4 cup of buttermilk\n1/2 cup of chopped walnuts\n1/2 cup raisins\nMETHOD\n1 Preheat oven, prepare pan: Preheat oven to 375\xc2\xb0F. Butter and flour an 8-in square baking pan, set aside.\n2 Combine dry ingredients: Vigorously whisk together the flour, baking soda, cinnamon, allspice, nutmeg, cloves, and salt. Set aside.\n3 Make batter: In an electric mixer, beat butter until light, add sugar and beat until fluffy. Add the eggs, one at a time, beating to incorporate after each addition. Add the vanilla and the applesauce and beat until smooth.\n4 Mix in half of the dry ingredients. Just before they are blended, add the thinned yogurt (or buttermilk). Then mix in the rest of the dry ingredients and the nuts and raisins, until completely incorporated. Do not over-mix.\n5 Bake: Pour out the batter into your prepared cake pan. Place in the middle rack of the 375\xc2\xb0F oven and bake for 25-35 minutes, until done.\nThe cake should spring back to the touch, and a tester or thin skewer should come out clean after being inserted in various spots in the middle of the cake.\nRemove the cake from the oven. Let cool for 15 minutes. Then invert to cool completely on a rack.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nEggnog Pound Cake Recipe\nPrep time: 25 minutesCook time: 55 minutesGlazing time: 10 minutesYield: Serves 16 to 20\nEggnog can be frozen if you don't have time to bake the cake and the eggnog is in danger of going sour.\nTo make the cake in a standard loaf pan, cut the ingredients in half (use 3 eggs), use a 5x9 or 4x8 loaf pan, and bake for about 50 minutes. It helps to line the loaf pan with buttered parchment paper. You'll only need about 1/3 of the glaze ingredients.\nINGREDIENTS\nCake:\n3/4 cup sweetened dried cranberries, chopped\n1 Tbsp orange zest\n4 Tbsp brandy (can sub orange juice or water)\n3 cups all-purpose flour\n2 teaspoons baking powder\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n1/2 teaspoon nutmeg\n1/4 teaspoon cinnamon\n1/4 teaspoon allspice\n1 cup (2 sticks) unsalted butter\n2 cups white granulated sugar\n5 large eggs, room temperature\n1 cup eggnog\n1 teaspoon vanilla extract\n2 to 4 Tbsp brandy for drizzling on the cake (optional)\nGlaze:\n1 to 2 Tbsp orange juice\n1 Tbsp brandy or dark rum\n1 cup powdered sugar\nMETHOD\n1 Soak the cranberries. Soak dried chopped cranberries and orange zest in brandy in a small bowl for 15 minutes.\n2 Preheat oven. Adjust rack to lower third of oven. Preheat the oven to 325\xc2\xb0F. Generously butter the inside of a 9 to 10 inch bundt pan.\n3 Mix dry ingredients. In a bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, salt, nutmeg, cinnamon, and allspice.\n4 Cream the butter and sugar. Using an electric mixer on medium speed, beat butter until creamy, 30-45 seconds. Add sugar and beat until light and fluffy, about 5 minutes. Scrape bowl with a rubber spatula occasionally as needed. Add eggs one at a time, beating 1 minute after each addition. Add the vanilla extract.\n5 Add dry ingredients and eggnog to butter sugar mixture. Remove the mixing bowl from the mixer and use a rubber spatula to gently add the dry ingredients in 4 additions, alternating with eggnog (begin and end with dry ingredients). Gently fold in orange zest, dried cranberries and any remaining brandy.\n6 Bake. Spoon the batter into the prepared bundt pan and spread evenly. Bake at 325\xc2\xb0F 55-60 minutes, or until cake springs back when touched lightly in the center and pulls away from the sides of the pan. You can also use a bamboo skewer and insert into the thickest part of the cake. If it comes out clean, it's done.\n7 Cool. Remove from oven and cool upright in the pan on a rack for 10 minutes. Invert cake onto a rack while the cake is still warm. Let cool completely.\n8 Prepare glaze. Once the cake has completely cooled, prepare glaze by whisking together powdered sugar, orange juice, and brandy. (You can sub the brandy with more orange juice or water if you want.)\nMake the glaze thick if you would like a thick, pronounced drizzle, or make it more thin if you want a glaze that is somewhat translucent.\n9 Glaze cake. Place cake on serving platter. Poke a few holes in the top and drizzle with brandy if you want. Use a spoon to stream the glaze onto the cake in back and forth motions to create a striped pattern. Or, if the glaze is thin enough, you can use a pastry brush to brush on the glaze.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nBest Fresh Apple Bundt Cake Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesCook time: 1 hourYield: Serves 12\nYou can also make muffins with this recipe. Standard muffin tins, 24 muffins, 25 minutes bake time.\nINGREDIENTS\nCake:\n1 1/2 cups vegetable oil\n2 cups of sugar\n3 eggs, slightly beaten\n3 cups of white flour\n1 1/2 teaspoon baking soda\n1 teaspoon vanilla\n1 teaspoon salt\n1 teaspoon cinnamon\n3 cups chopped, peeled apples (varieties that are good for baking - i.e. Granny Smith, Gravenstein, Fuji)\n1 cup of sweetened shredded coconut\n1 cup of chopped nuts - walnuts or pecans\nGlaze:\n1/2 stick sweet butter\n1 cup brown sugar\n3 tablespoons milk\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat oven to 350\xc2\xb0 F.\n2 Make the cake batter: Beat together the sugar and oil. Add the eggs. In a separate bowl, sift together the flour, baking soda, salt and cinnamon.\nAdd dry ingredients to oil sugar eggs mixture in thirds, beating to incorporate after each addition.\nMix in the vanilla, apples, coconut, and chopped nuts.\n3 Bake: Bake at 350\xc2\xb0F in a greased and floured bundt cake pan about 1 hour.\nTest around the centers with a long thin bamboo skewer or toothpick to make sure the cake is done.\n4 Cool and remove from pan: When cool enough to handle, gently remove from pan. Let sit on a rack to cool completely. If the dough has raised substantially around the middle areas of the bundt ring, you may need to use a bread knife to gently level off the cake so that it sits even.\n5 Glaze the cake: Blend glaze ingredients and cook until melted. Place the cake on its serving dish.\nPrick all around the top of the cake with a fork so that when the glaze is applied it easily seeps into the cake.\nUse a pastry brush to apply the glaze liberally around the surface areas of the cake, or use a spoon to dribble the glaze on the cake.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nLemon Blueberry Ricotta Pound Cake Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesCook time: 1 hour, 5 minutesYield: Serves 10 to 12\nTo quickly bring eggs to room temperature, place them in a bowl of warm water for a few minutes.\nMake sure your baking powder is fresh! Baking powder older than 6 months tends to go flat.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 3/4 cups (250 g) all purpose flour\n2 teaspoons baking powder\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n3/4 cup (1 1/2 sticks) unsalted butter, room temperature\n1 cup (8 ounces, 230 g) ricotta cheese, left to stand at room temperature for a few minutes to take the chill off\n1 1/2 cups sugar (300 g)\n3 large eggs, room temperature\n1 teaspoon vanilla extract\n1 tablespoon lemon zest\n1 1/2 cups (140 g) blueberries\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat oven to 325\xc2\xb0F (160\xc2\xb0C). Prepare a 9x5-inch loaf pan, smearing the inside with butter.\n2 Whisk the dry ingredients: In a medium bowl, vigorously whisk together the flour, baking powder and salt.\n2 Toss blueberries with flour: Rinse the blueberries and toss them with a little flour to lightly coat them (this will help keep them from sinking to the bottom of the cake).\n3 Mix wet ingredients and sugar for batter: Use an electric mixer (you can mix by hand but will get better results if you use an electric mixer) to beat together the butter, ricotta, and sugar, on high speed, for 3 minutes, until pale and fluffy.\nAdd the eggs one at a time, mixing on medium speed for one minute after each addition.\nMix in the lemon zest and vanilla extract. Don't worry if the batter looks a little curdled at this point. It isn't curdled; it just looks that way.\n4 Add dry ingredients, then blueberries: Remove the bowl from the mixer and stir in the dry ingredients in 3 or 4 additions, until just incorporated. Do not over mix. Stir in the blueberries.\n5 Pour the batter into the prepared loaf pan, smoothing out the top with a rubber spatula. Place on a baking sheet on the middle oven rack of the oven. (This will help moderate the temperature at the bottom of the pan.)\n6 Bake: Bake at 325\xc2\xb0F (160\xc2\xb0C) for 1 hour 10 minutes to 1 hour 20 minutes, or until a tester inserted into the center comes out mostly clean, or if you press on the center with your fingers and lift up, the cake surface gently bounces back.\nAfter the first 40 minutes of baking you may want to put a sheet of aluminum foil over the top of the pan to keep it from browning further.\n7 Cool: Remove from oven and let cool for 15 minutes in the pan. Then run a dull knife around the edge of the cake to make sure it is separated from the pan.\nGently remove the cake from the pan and let cool completely on a wire rack. Let cook completely before slicing.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nChocolate Chip Pumpkin Bread Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 1 hour\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the topping:\n3 tablespoons sugar\n1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon\nFor the bread:\n2 cups (280 g) all-purpose flour\n2 1/4 teaspoons baking powder\n3/4 teaspoon kosher salt\n1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon\n1 cup (244 g) pumpkin pur\xc3\xa9e\n1 1/4 cups (250 grams) granulated sugar\n2 large eggs\n1/2 cup (125 ml) whole milk (2% is also fine)\n1/2 cup (113 g) unsalted butter, melted\n2 teaspoons vanilla extract\n1/2 cup mini chocolate chips, plus more for topping\nSpecial equipment:\n9-x-5-inch loaf pan\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat the oven to 350\xc2\xb0F. Butter or spray a 9-x-5-inch loaf pan.\n2 Mix the topping: Whisk 3 tablespoons of sugar and 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon together in a small bowl. Set aside\n3 Mix the dry ingredients: Combine the flour, baking powder, kosher salt, and cinnamon in a large mixing bowl.\n4 Make the batter: In a separate medium-sized mixing bowl, whisk together the pumpkin, sugar, eggs, milk, melted butter, and vanilla extract until well combined. Pour the pumpkin mixture into the flour mixture and fold to combine. Fold in the mini chocolate chips.\n5 Transfer the batter into the loaf pan. Tap the pan a few times on the counter to remove air bubbles, then smooth the top with a spatula. Sprinkle with cinnamon sugar and more mini chocolate chips.\n6 Bake the bread: Bake for 50 to 60 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center of the bread comes out clean. Remove from the oven and cool in the pan on a cooling rack for 20 minutes before removing and cooling completely.\nWrap up any leftovers with foil or plastic wrap and store on the counter. The bread will keep for several days.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nSnowman Chocolate Icebox Cake Recipe\nPrep time: 30 minutesChilling time: 4 hoursYield: About 12 servings\nFor best success when whipping cream, chill the beater and the bowl ahead of time. Did you forget? Fill the bowl with ice water and place the beaters in it. Swirl it around for a few seconds, drain, and dry the bowl.\nYou can design this cake any size you want. Just cut the circle guides to fit your serving plate.\nIf you prefer, you can assemble this icebox cake in loaf pans lined with plastic wrap. When ready to serve, turn them out onto a platter and cover with whipped cream.\nINGREDIENTS\n4 cups heavy whipping cream\n1/4 cup sugar\n1 teaspoon vanilla extract\n3 (9-ounce) packages chocolate wafer cookies (I like Nabisco Chocolate Wafers)\nCandy for decorations, such as peppermint sticks, Dots, mini-marshmallows, licorice sticks, Junior Mints, and pretzel logs\nSpecial equipment:\nA large platter or baking sheet\nParchment paper\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cut parchment circles for guides: Cut 1 6-inch circle and 1 8-inch circle out of baker\xe2\x80\x99s parchment. Place them on a platter with the small one on top and the bottom directly underneath.\n 2 Whip the cream: In a chilled mixer bowl with chilled beaters, beat the cream, sugar and vanilla until soft peaks form. Be careful not to over whip.\nPlace a small dab of whipped cream beneath each parchment paper circle on your plater to hold them in place.\n3 Make the cookie stacks and arrange them on the platter: Spread about a teaspoon of whipped cream on each cookie. Stack 4 to 5 cookies together and set them, standing upright on their edges, on the edge of one circle (see photo, below). Continue to sandwich the cookies and stack them all around the circle and in the middle until the circle is covered. Repeat process to assemble the second circle.\n4 Ice the cake with the remaining whipped cream: Use a spatula to spread the cream on the tops and sides of the circles to make the snowman/woman/person.\n5 Refrigerate the cake: Chill the cake for at least 4 hours or overnight.\n6 Decorate the cake with candies: Decorate the cake shortly before serving, especially if you are using candy that might soften or bleed color into the whipped cream as it sits (like dots or some hard candies).\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Print\nSour Cream Chocolate Cake Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesCook time: 55 minutesYield: one 9x13 cake (10 to 12 servings)\nBe sure to let the cake cool completely before spreading the top with frosting.\nINGREDIENTS\n2 cups all purpose flour (250g)\n1 3/4 cups granulated sugar (360 g)\n3/4 cup dark cocoa powder (70 g)\n2 teaspoons baking soda\n1 teaspoon kosher salt\n2 large eggs\n1 cup sour cream\n3/4 cup canola oil\n2 teaspoons vanilla extract\n1 cup strong piping hot coffee\n1 batch chocolate or cream cheese frosting\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat the oven to 300\xc2\xb0F. Butter and flour a 9x13 cake pan.  Set aside.\n2 Sift the dry ingredients: In a large bowl, sift together flour, sugar, cocoa powder, and baking soda. Whisk in the kosher salt.\n3 Whisk the wet ingredients: In a medium bowl, whisk together eggs, sour cream, canola oil and vanilla extract until it looks homogenous and creamy.\n4 Combine the wet and dry ingredients: Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients. Stir together with a stiff spatula. The batter will be thick like frosting.\n5 Add the coffee: Pour in the piping hot coffee. The batter will look like mud pies in a muddy lake. Keep stirring until all the liquid is incorporated and it is a homogenized cake batter.\n6 Bake the cake: Pour the batter into the prepared pan. Place in the oven and bake for 50 to 55 minutes or until a toothpick poked in the center comes out clean.\n7 Cool the cake: Take the cake out of the oven and set it on a baking rack to cool. After about 30 minutes spread the frosting on top.\nCut and serve the cake straight from the pan like it\xe2\x80\x99s 1983 and you\xe2\x80\x99re rockin\xe2\x80\x99 your favorite knee-high tube socks with the yellow stripe. Aw, yeah!\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Save It Print\nBittersweet Chocolate Cake Recipe\nPrep time: 30 minutesCook time: 1 hour, 30 minutesYield: Makes 20 small, but quite rich, servings\nINGREDIENTS\n12 large eggs, separated (see how to separate eggs)\n2 cups (400 g) granulated sugar\n14 ounces (400 g) bittersweet or semisweet chocolate, grated or cut into small pieces\n4 Tbsp (60 ml) water (or more if needed)\nA pinch of salt\n3 1/2 sticks (3/4 lb plus 4 Tbsp, or 400 g) unsalted butter, softened\n2 teaspoons orange zest\n1 cup (135 g) all purpose flour, sifted\nPowdered sugar\nSpecial equipment:\nA 9-inch or 10-inch springform pan\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat oven, prepare springform pan: Preheat oven to 325\xc2\xb0F. Prepare a rack in the center of the oven. Place a baking sheet in a rack below it (to catch any drippings or spill-overs).\nGenerously butter the sides and bottom of a 9-inch or 10-inch springform pan. Add a few tablespoons of sugar and gently shake so that all the sides and bottom of the pan are coated with sugar. Tap out excess sugar.\n2 Beat egg yolks with sugar: Beat egg yolks with the granulated sugar until they are thick and pale yellow and form a ribbon when they fall from the beater, about 2 to 3 minutes on medium speed of an electric hand mixer.\n3 Melt chocolate: Make a double boiler by heating an inch of water to a bare simmer in a saucepan, and place a metal bowl on top of it. Make sure that the bottom of the metal bowl is not touching the water below.\nPlace chocolate and 4 Tbsp of water together in the top metal bowl of the double boiler.\nSlowly melt the chocolate over barely simmering water, whisking it until smooth. If the chocolate gets too thick, and looks like it will firm up, whisk in a tablespoon more of water.\nWhisk in a pinch of salt.\nLet cool until just warm to the touch.\n4 Make batter base: Slowly fold the warm chocolate into the egg mixture, gently stirring while you add the chocolate. Stir in the softened butter. Stir in the grated orange peel. Stir in the sifted flour. Mix thoroughly but gently.\n5 Incorporate beaten egg whites: Beat the egg whites until stiff. (See this wonderful explanation of whisking egg whites taken from La Bonne Cuisine de Madame Sant-Ange.)\nStir one third of the beaten egg whites in to the chocolate egg mixture to thin it. Gently fold in the remaining beaten egg whites, a third at a time until the egg whites are completely incorporated. Be careful at this stage not to over-mix.\n6 Bake: Pour the batter into your prepared springform pan. The batter will come close to the top of the pan. Set the pan on the middle rack of your oven and bake at 325\xc2\xb0F for 1 hour and 20 minutes, or until a cake tester comes out clean, or a digital thermometer inserted into the center reaches 200\xc2\xb0F (93\xc2\xb0C).\nDo not worry if the top of your baked chocolate cake has cracks in it! As the cake cools the top will settle and the cracks will close.\n7 Cool: Cool on a rack for 15 minutes, then remove the outer rim. Allow the cake to cool completely before removing the bottom of the pan. Refrigerate.\n8 When ready to serve, sprinkle with powdered sugar.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nCalamari Stewed with Tomatoes Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 1 hour, 20 minutesYield: Serves 4-6\nYou can buy frozen, cleaned squid in the freezer section of many grocery stores. Defrost by placing in refrigerator overnight, or in a bowl of ice water. This recipe does call for an anise-flavored liquor, which you can leave out if you want, but the dish will be better with it in.\nINGREDIENTS\n2 pounds cleaned calamari (squid), tubes sliced into rings and tentacles roughly chopped\n4 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n1 sliced onion\n1 fennel bulb, chopped\n3 garlic cloves, chopped\n2 tablespoons tomato paste\n1/4 cup Sambuca or other anise-flavored liquor\n1 cup red wine\n1 28-ounce can of crushed tomatoes\nSalt and pepper\n1/2 cup parsley, chopped\n1/4 cup fennel fronds, chopped\nMETHOD\n1 Saut\xc3\xa9 onions, fennel, garlic: Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. When the oil is hot, add the onions and fennel. Stir to coat with oil and saut\xc3\xa9, stirring occasionally, until it begins to color, about 5-6 minutes. Sprinkle some salt over it.\nAdd the garlic cloves and tomato paste and stir well to combine. Cook this for another 2-3 minutes, stirring once or twice.\n2 Add the red wine, stir well, and increase the heat to high. Boil until the liquid is reduced by half.\n3 Add the Sambuca or other anise-flavored liquor, and the crushed tomatoes.\n4 Stir in the calamari and bring the pot to a gentle simmer. Simmer for at least 1 hour. After an hour, taste a piece of calamari; It should be tender. If it\xe2\x80\x99s not, keep simmering. Check for tenderness every 15 minutes afterward.\n5 Season to taste with salt and pepper: Once the calamari is tender, taste the stew for salt and pepper, adding if needed. Add the chopped parsley and fennel fronds. Stir well to combine and serve.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nFrutti di Mare Seafood Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesCook time: 20 minutesYield: Serves 6-8\nBe sure to follow the steps in order, so all the seafood is properly cooked and the broth becomes nice and flavorful.\nINGREDIENTS\nPoaching Broth:\n4 cups water\n1 cup white wine or chicken stock\n2 teaspoons salt\n2-3 bay leaves\n1 teaspoon cracked black pepper\n1 small onion, roughly chopped\nSalad:\n2 celery stalks\n1 large yellow or orange bell pepper\n1 pound tomatoes\n1/2 cup chives\n1 pound small cocktail shrimp\n1 pound small clams in shell\n1/2 pound bay scallops\n1/2 pound calamari, cut into rings\n1/4 cup high-quality extra virgin olive oil, or more to taste\nJuice of 1-2 lemons\nSalt and black pepper to taste\nMETHOD\n1 Make poaching broth: Put all the poaching broth ingredients together in a medium pot, cover and bring to a boil. Turn off the heat to let the flavors steep while you cut the veggies.\n2 Prep salad vegetables: While the poaching broth is steeping, dice the yellow pepper, seed and dice the tomatoes and slice the celery stalks very thin. Chop the chives. Juice the lemons and remove any seeds. Put the diced peppers, tomatoes and celery into very large bowl. Most cocktail shrimp are pre-cleaned and cooked, so you you can put them in the bowl, too.\n3 Poach the clams: Bring the poaching broth back to a boil and add all the clams. Boil 3-4 minutes, or until the clams all open up. As soon as you see each clam open, fish it out and set it aside. Remove the meat and put in the bowl with the veggies.\n4 Poach the scallops: Turn off the heat and put the scallops in the poaching water. Cover the pot and let stand for 3-4 minutes. Fish out the scallops and put into the bowl.\n5 Poach the calamari rings: Bring the broth to a boil once more. Add the calamari rings and boil 30 seconds to 1 minute, then pour the contents of the pot into a strainer set over a bowl. You can save the broth or discard it. Pick out all the calamari rings and add to the bowl.\n6 Dress the salad: To finish, add the olive oil and a little salt and half the lemon juice. Mix well and taste. Add more olive oil, lemon and salt until you get the flavors you want: The salad should be glistening with oil, briny and tart with lemon. Finally, mix in the chives and chill. This salad is better a few hours after it's made.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b"Save It Print\nCambodian Coconut Shrimp Soup Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: Serves 6\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the lemongrass paste\n3 stalks lemongrass (or the zest of 1 lime and 1 lemon, plus additional lime juice to taste)\n1 (3-inch) piece fresh turmeric (or substitute 1 tablespoon ground turmeric)\n1 (3-inch) piece fresh ginger\n1 shallot\n4 cloves garlic\n2 makrut lime leaves, finely sliced (optional)\nFor the soup:\n1 can (14-ounce) full-fat coconut milk, do not shake\n2 1/2 cups flavorful stock (fish, chicken, or vegetable)\n1 tablespoon fish sauce, such as Red Boat, plus more as needed\n1 tablespoon brown sugar\n3 medium zucchini, cut into 1-inch chunks\n8 ounces French green beans (haricots verts), trimmed and halved\n1 1/2 cups (9 ounces) cherry tomatoes, halved\nSalt, to taste\n2 pounds shrimp, peeled and deveined\n1 large handful Thai basil leaves\nTo serve:\nCooked rice\nLime wedges\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Make the lemon grass paste: Peel away and discard the top outer layer of tough, fibrous leaves from the lemongrass, leaving the tender, lighter-colored inside layers. Cut this tender part into thin slices. Also peel and slice the turmeric, ginger, shallot, and garlic cloves.\nCombine the lemongrass, turmeric, ginger, shallot, garlic, and lime leaves in a blender or food processor and process until the ingredients are finely chopped. Scrape down the sides of the blender as necessary. Set the paste aside.\nThis paste can be prepared in advance and kept refrigerated for up to a week.\n2 Separate the coconut cream from the milk: Do not shake the can of coconut milk. Open the top, and you should see a thick layer of coconut cream on top. Spoon this out of the can and transfer to a stock pot. Reserve the watery milk on the bottom.\nIf you don't see a clear layer of cream on top, then just add all the coconut milk at once.\n3 Cook the coconut cream and lemongrass paste: Over medium-high heat, bring the coconut cream to a simmer. Add the lemongrass paste and cook, stirring, for 1 to 2 minutes, or until the mixture is thick and fragrant.\nAdd the remaining coconut milk from the can, the stock, fish sauce, and brown sugar. Bring to a simmer.\n4 Cook the vegetables and shrimp: Add the zucchini and green beans to soup. Simmer for about 8 minutes, or until the vegetables are just barely tender.\nAdd the shrimp and the tomatoes, and cook for 3 to 4 minutes, or until pink and opaque. Stir in the basil leaves. Taste the soup and add additional salt, fish sauce, or brown sugar to taste.\n5 Serve: Ladle into bowls, and serve with rice and lime wedges. Leftovers will keep refrigerated for about 5 days.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nSide Porch Sangria Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesYield: About 8 servings in a 2-quart pitcher\nFrom Maggie Hoffman: "Sangria just calls out for experimentation, and there\xe2\x80\x99s no reason to feel tethered to a ho-hum mix of wine and fruit. In this fruity-but-bitter rendition, Dorothy Elizabeth of Straylight in New York brings out the juicy flavors of Sauvignon Blanc by adding fresh grapefruit juice and citrusy Aperol, bracing Campari, and rich Italian vermouth. Boxed or bottled apricot juice rounds out the drink. For a lighter version, I like to top off the mix with a splash of chilled seltzer."\nReprinted with permission from Batch Cocktails: Make-Ahead Pitcher Drinks for Every Occasion by Maggie Hoffman, copyright \xc2\xa9 2019. Published by Ten Speed Press, an imprint of Penguin Random House.\nINGREDIENTS\n1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons Aperol\n1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons Campari\n1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons Carpano Antica Formula sweet vermouth\n1 (750 ml) bottle chilled dry white wine (such as Sauvignon Blanc)\n1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons chilled apricot juice (such as Looza or Ceres)\n1/2 cup fresh grapefruit juice\nTo serve:\nGrapefruit, sliced into quarter-moons\nFresh apricots, pitted and sliced (optional)\nChilled seltzer or club soda (optional)\nMETHOD\n1 Up to 8 hours before serving, make the batch: Pour Aperol, Campari, vermouth, and chilled wine into a 2-quart pitcher.  If not serving immediately, seal well, covering with plastic wrap if needed, and refrigerate.\n2 Up to 2 hours before serving, add the juices: Stir chilled apricot juice into pitcher mix. Prepare and add grapefruit juice, then stir and reseal, returning pitcher to refrigerator if not serving immediately.\n3 Serve: To serve, add grapefruit and apricot slices, if desired, and stir well. Fill pitcher with ice, and stir gently until outside of pitcher is cool. Serve immediately in ice-filled rocks glasses or wine glasses. Offer chilled seltzer to top off the drink, if desired.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nFrozen Siesta Cocktail Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesChill time: At least four hoursYield: 2 frozen cocktails\nChilling the drink mix in advance helps the cocktails stay cool without the need for more ice, which can dilute the flavors if added to excess. If you don't have a high-powered blender, use crushed ice.\nIf you double the drink recipe, split it into two batches to avoid overfilling your blender. You\xe2\x80\x99ll use a ratio of 10 ounces mix to 3 cups ice in each one.\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the simple syrup:\n1/3 water\n1/3 cup sugar\nFor the cocktail:\n4 ounces blanco tequila\n1 1/2 ounces chilled 1:1 simple syrup\n1 1/2 ounces Campari\n1 1/2 ounces fresh lime juice\n1 1/2 ounces fresh grapefruit juice\n3 cups ice\nLime wedge and 2 tablespoons kosher salt, for rimming the glass\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Make the simple syrup: Mix 1/3 cup warm water and 1/3 cup sugar in a small mason jar. Seal well and shake until completely dissolved. Refrigerate until well chilled, and up to 1 week.\n2 Assemble the cocktail, then freeze: Combine tequila, chilled simple syrup, Campari, lime juice, and grapefruit juice in a resealable container. Seal well and place in freezer for at least 4 hours, and up to 1 day.\n3 Rim the glasses: Place kosher salt on a small plate. Rub a lime wedge around the rims of 2 rocks glasses, then dip the rims in salt. Place glasses in the freezer to chill.\n4 Blend the cocktail: When ready to serve, add the chilled cocktail mix and 3 cups of ice to a blender. Process until smooth, about 25 seconds. Pour into rimmed glasses and serve immediately. Enjoy!\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"

Let sit for 30 seconds, and then strain into a cocktail glass or, if you prefer, an old fashioned glass with ice.\n2 Garnish: Garnish with orange peel.\nHello! Add ice and stir for 30 seconds. Allow to sit for 30 seconds, and then strain into a rocks glass with ice. Garnish with orange peel.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. b"Save It Print\nEasy Peanut Butter Fudge Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 10 minutesCooling Time time: Cooling TimeYield: 64 squares\nYou'll get the best results if you stick with commercial brands of peanut butter (Jif, Skippy, Peter Pan). Natural peanut butter has a tendency to separate, and it can sometimes interfere with how the fudge sets up.\nHave your lined baking pan ready to go before you start and work fast once you remove the saucepan from the heat. As the fudge starts to cool, it can become difficult to work with.\nINGREDIENTS\n1/2 cup whole milk\n6 regular-sized marshmallows (NOT mini or jumbo marshmallows, certified gluten-free if needed)\n3/4 cup (150 g) white granulated sugar\n3/4 cup (165 g) packed light brown sugar\n2 teaspoon vanilla extract\n1/2 teaspoon kosher salt\n1 1/2 cups (420 g) smooth peanut butter (not natural peanut butter, see Recipe Note)\nSpecial equipment:\n8-inch square baking pan\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Prepare the baking pan: Lightly spray an 8x8-inch baking pan with cooking oil. Line with parchment paper.\n2 Warm the milk and marshmallows: Place the milk and the marshmallows in medium pan. Turn the heat to medium low and gently heat the milk. Stir constantly until the marshmallows have melted. If the milk starts to foam up too much, reduce the heat.\n3 Stir in the sugars, followed by the remaining ingredients: Once the marshmallows have melted, add both sugars and continue to cook on medium low heat while stirring until the sugars have dissolved and the liquid is smooth. Add the vanilla, salt, and peanut butter. Stir until smooth and incorporated into the batter.\n4 Pour the hot fudge into the prepared pan: Once the fudge batter is smooth and uniform, immediately pour it into the prepared pan and smooth out with spatula or butter knife.\n5 Cool overnight: Let the fudge cool to room temperature in the pan, then chill in the fridge overnight.\n6 Cut the fudge: The next day, lift the fudge from the pan using the parchment paper and cut into 1-inch squares.\nStore in an airtight container. The fudge keeps for about a week at room temperature or 2 to 3 weeks refrigerated.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nSpaghetti with Clams Recipe\nCook time: 30 minutesYield: Serves 3 to 4\nAlmost all of the alcohol will boil off from the wine in this recipe as you cook it, leaving just the flavor. If you want to sub the wine for something else, you can just add water with a teaspoon or two of lemon juice.\nDo all of the prep work while the water is coming to a boil.\nINGREDIENTS\n1/2 pound (8 ounces) spaghetti pasta (can up to 3/4 pound of pasta if needed)\nSalt for pasta water\n3 Tbsp extra virgin olive oil\n3 to 4 cloves garlic, minced (about a heaping tablespoon)\nPinch of red chili pepper flakes\n2 6-ounce cans minced clams (including the liquid)\n1/2 cup dry white wine\n1 teaspoon lemon zest\n2 Tbsp chopped fresh parsley\nFreshly ground black pepper to taste\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Heat salted water, do prep: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil (1 Tbsp of salt for every 2 quarts of water). While the water is heating, prep the garlic, lemon zest, and parsley.\n2 Cook the spaghetti: Add the spaghetti to the boiling water, set your timer for 2 minutes less than the recommended time (so you can be assured that you are cooking the pasta al dente).\nCook the spaghetti uncovered in vigorously boiling water. While the spaghetti cooks, prepare the clam sauce.\n3 Saut\xc3\xa9 garlic, chile flakes: Heat 3 Tbsp of olive oil in a saut\xc3\xa9 pan on medium heat. Add the minced garlic and the red chili pepper flakes. Cook for 30 seconds to a minute, until the garlic just is on the edge of browning.\n4 Add wine, clam juice, reduce: Add the white wine to the pan. Open the cans of clams and squeeze out the clam juice from the cans into the pan as well.\nRaise the temperature to high and let boil sauce the sauce reduces as the spaghetti cooks. (Put pan on largest burner on high heat to help the sauce reduce more quickly.)\n5 Add chopped clams, parsley, lemon zest: About the same time the spaghetti is finishing its cooking, the sauce should be reduced by about two-thirds. There should be about 1/4 to 1/3 cup of liquid still in the pan.\nAdd the chopped clams, and return to a simmer. Then stir in the minced parsley and the lemon zest.\n6 Toss cooked spaghetti with the clam sauce: When the pasta is done to the point of al dente (cooked but still a little firm when you bite), drain it and place it in a serving bowl. Pour the sauce over the spaghetti and toss to combine. Sprinkle with freshly ground black pepper to taste.\nServe with a little more fresh parsley sprinkled over the top. Serve immediately.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nSalmon Macaroni Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 20 minutesYield: Serves 4\nTip: add the macaroni to the salmon mayo mixture when it is still warm. That way it will absorb the flavors better.\nPrep the salad ingredients while the pasta water is heating and the macaroni cooking.\nINGREDIENTS\n1/2 pound (about 2 cups) dry macaroni pasta\nSalt\n2 (7-ounce) cans salmon\n1/2 cup mayonnaise (plus more to taste or for added smoothness)\n1 teaspoon mustard\n1 teaspoon lemon zest\n1 Tbsp lemon juice\n1/3 cup chopped shallots, red onions, or green onions (with onion greens)\n2 Tbsp chopped fresh parsley\n1 Tbsp chopped fresh dill (or 1/2 teaspoon dried dill)\n2 stalks celery, chopped\nTabasco to taste (we used about 10 drops)\nFreshly ground black pepper\nMETHOD\n1 Boil the macaroni pasta: Bring a pot of water (2 quarts) to a boil. Add 1 Tbsp salt. Add the dry macaroni pasta and cook, uncovered, in a rolling boil for about 10 minutes, or until the macaroni is al dente (slightly firm). Remove from heat, drain, rinse briefly in cold water (macaroni should be still warm after rinsing) and drain again.\n2 Mix salmon and other ingredients in a large bowl: In a large bowl mix the salmon, mayonnaise, mustard, lemon zest, and lemon juice. Mix in the shallots, parsley, dill, and celery.\n3 Stir in drained, warm macaroni: Mix in the cooked macaroni while it is still warm. Add Tabasco and freshly ground black pepper to taste. As the macaroni absorbs the mayonnaise, you may need to add some water to the salad to keep it from being dry. Adjust seasonings.\nChill before serving.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nSardine Rillettes Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesYield: Makes about 1 cup. Serves 6 to 8 as an appetizer.\nRecipe adapted from and published with permission of Dorie Greenspan, author of Around My French Table.\nINGREDIENTS\nTwo 3 3/4 ounce cans of sardines, packed in olive oil, drained\n2 1/2 ounces of Neufch\xc3\xa2tel cheese or cream cheese\n1/4 cup minced shallots (or minced red onions that have soaked in lemon juice for a few minutes)\n1-2 scallions (green onions), white and light green parts only (about 3 inches from root), halved lengthwise and thinly sliced lengthwise\n1/4 cup lime juice or lemon juice, or to taste\n2-3 Tbsp minced fresh herbs such as chives, parsley, or dill\nPinch of cayenne\nSalt and freshly ground black pepper to taste\nMETHOD\n1 Prep the sardines: Remove the sardines from the cans. Using a small, sharp knife, carefully open each one down the belly and back, folding them open to expose the backbone. Remove and discard the bones. Cut away and discard any tails. Set aside.\n2 Mix the cream cheese, shallot, scallion, herb mixture: Place the cream cheese or Neufch\xc3\xa2tel in a medium bowl. Fold and stir with a rubber spatula until smooth. Add the shallots, scallions, fresh herbs, and most of the lime or lemon juice, mixing into the cheese with the spatula.\n3 Mash the sardines into the cheese: Add the now boneless sardines to the cheese mixture. Use a fork to smash the sardines and stir into the cheese. Add cayenne, salt, and pepper to taste. Add more lime or lemon juice to taste.\nEither serve immediately (Dorie suggests chilling at least 2 hours, but I haven't found that necessary), or chill. Can make up to two days ahead if you carefully cover with plastic wrap so there is no exposure to air, and chill.\nServe on crackers, bread, celery sticks, or as a stuffing for cherry tomatoes.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b"Save It Print\nBest Ever Tuna Salad Sandwich Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesYield: Makes 1 to 2 sandwiches, depending on the size of the sandwich\nIf you are using canned tuna packed in water, drain it and add in 1 tablespoon of good quality extra virgin olive oil.\nIf you are using canned tuna packed in olive oil, you can use as is, without draining it. Or, if you don't like the oil the tuna is packed in, you can drain it, and add back in 2 teaspoons of your favorite extra virgin olive oil.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 (5 or 6-ounce) can tuna fish\n1/3 cup cottage cheese\n2 tablespoons mayonnaise\n1/4 cup finely chopped red onion\n1 celery stalk, finely chopped (about 1/2 cup)\n1 tablespoon capers\n1 tablespoon lemon juice\nA pinch or two of dill\n2 tablespoons minced fresh parsley\n1 teaspoon Dijon mustard\n2 slices bread, lightly toasted\nLettuce and sliced tomatoes (optional)\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Mix: In a medium bowl, mix all of the ingredients until combined.\n2 Serve: Serve tuna salad on toast, either open faced, or in a regular sandwich with lettuce and tomatoes. For a low carb option, serve on sliced lettuce.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nPasta with Tuna and Capers in White Wine Sauce Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 20 minutesYield: Serves 2\nYou can easily dress up this recipe with a few more ingredients - chopped garlic added at the end of the onion cooking, chopped tomatoes and/or olives in with the tuna, lemon zest to serve, etc.\nINGREDIENTS\nSalt\n4 ounces bow tie (farfalle), linguini, or spaghetti pasta\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil (plus more)\n1/2 medium onion, chopped\nPinch chili pepper flakes\n1 (6-ounce) can tuna packed in olive oil, drained\n1 tablespoon capers\n1/4 teaspoon salt\n1/4 cup dry white wine\n2 tablespoons chopped flat leaf parsley\nFreshly ground black pepper\nMETHOD\n1 Cook the pasta: Bring a large pot of water to a boil, add salt (1 1/2 teaspoons for every quart of water), return to a boil. Add the pasta and cook according to package directions until cooked through, but still firm (al dente).\n2 Cook the onions and chili pepper flakes: While the water is coming to a boil and the pasta is cooking, prepare the rest of the recipe. In a large, wide saut\xc3\xa9 pan, heat a couple tablespoons of olive oil on medium heat. Add the chopped onion and chili pepper flakes and cook until translucent, about 5 minutes or so.\n3 Mix in the canned tuna, the capers, and the salt. Add the wine, bring to a simmer then lower the heat to low. Cook for 10 minutes or longer, while the pasta is cooking. If the mixture begins to dry out, add a little more wine.\n4 Add the drained pasta to the tuna mixture: When the pasta is ready, drain it and add it in to the pan with the tuna. Toss to mix.\nDrizzle on a bit more olive oil over it all, then add the chopped parsley and a few grinds of black pepper to taste.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nEnglish Muffin Tuna Melts Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: 8 tuna melts\nINGREDIENTS\nDAD ADD: Quick Pickled Veggies:\n1 medium carrot\n5 radishes\n1/2 pickle\n3 to 4 tablespoons pickle juice\nFor the Tuna Melts:\n1 stalk celery, minced\n1/4 cup minced red onion\n2 tablespoons minced red pepper\nJuice of 1/2 lemon\n2 cans (about 10 total ounces) albacore tuna, oil or water packed\n1/8 teaspoon salt\n1/8 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper\n1/3 cup mayonnaise\n4 whole English muffins\n8 slices Swiss cheese\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 DAD ADD! Make the pickled veggies: Peel and slice the carrot in half down its length and then into thin half-coins. Slice the radishes in half and then slice into half-coins as well. Do the same with the pickle.\nStir the vegetables together with 3 tablespoons of pickle juice to coat. Set aside for a few minutes while you make the tuna melt muffins. Taste, and add more pickle juice if needed.\n2 Preheat oven to 400\xc2\xb0F.\n3 Make the tuna mixture:  In a medium bowl, stir together minced celery, onion, red pepper, salt, pepper, and tuna. Fold in the mayo last.\n3 Prep the tuna melts:  Spread out English muffin halves on a baking sheet. Add half a slice of Swiss cheese to the bottom of each muffin. Top each muffin with about two tablespoons of tuna salad mix. Top with second half of cheese.\n4 Bake: Bake the tuna melts for 12 to 15 minutes until muffins are browned around the edges and the cheese is melted.\n5 Serve: Serve while warm with pickled veggies on the side (optional).\nPrepared tuna melts don\xe2\x80\x99t keep well, but the tuna salad mix keeps well for a few days in the fridge, and you can make the muffins on demand.\nHello! b'Print\nAvocado Tuna Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesYield: Makes enough tuna salad for 2 sandwiches\nINGREDIENTS\n1 5-ounce can tuna, preferably packed in olive oil, drained\n1/2 ripe avocado, roughly chopped\n1/2 cup minced celery\n1/4 cup minced red onion\n1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil\n2 teaspoons lemon juice\n1 teaspoon lemon zest\n2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro or parsley\n1/2 teaspoon kosher salt\nFreshly ground black pepper\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Mix: Place all of the ingredients in a medium bowl. b'Save It Print\nWhite Bean and Tuna Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n1 cup of chopped red onions or shallots\nThe zest and juice of 1 lemon or 2 limes (can sub a tablespoon or two of cider vinegar)\n2 five to six ounce cans of tuna packed in olive oil\n2 15-ounce cans of cannellini or Great Northern white beans, rinsed and drained\n1/2 cup (loosely packed) of chopped parsley or arugula, or 2 tablespoons thinly sliced mint\nA few splashes of Tabasco sauce, or 1 minced Serrano chile or 1 teaspoon red chile flakes\n1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper\nSalt and more extra virgin olive oil to taste\nMETHOD\n1 Sprinkle some of the lemon juice over the chopped onions while you prepare the other ingredients. This will take some of the oniony edge off the onions.\n2 Combine ingredients in a bowl: Drain the oil from the tuna and put the tuna into a large bowl. Add the beans to the tuna and gently stir to combine.\nAdd the onions, herbs, black pepper, lemon zest and lemon juice and mix to combine. Add Tabasco or chili to taste.\nIf the salad needs more acid, add a little more lemon juice. If the salad seems a little dry, add a little bit of extra virgin olive oil. Add salt to taste.\n3 Chill before serving. This salad will last several days in the fridge, tightly covered.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected.
