Sprinkle 1/3 cup of grated Parmesan cheese.\nPlace another third of the eggplant rounds over the cheese. Spread 1 cup of the sauce over the eggplant rounds. Layer the rest of the sliced mozzarella over the sauce. Sprinkle with 1/3 cup of grated Parm.\nAdd the remaining eggplant in a single layer on top of the cheese. Top with the remaining sauce and the remaining Parmesan.\n7 Bake: Bake uncovered at 350\xc2\xb0F for 35 minutes. Remove from oven and let sit for 10 minutes before cutting into to serve.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nCreamy Baked Mac and Cheese Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesCook time: 25 minutesYield: 6 to 8 servings\nServing a crowd? Feel free to double this recipe and bake it in a 9x13 dish.\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the topping:\n2 tablespoons melted unsalted butter\n2/3 cup plain panko breadcrumbs\n1/4 cup shredded Parmesan\n1/4 teaspoon salt\n1/8 teaspoon smoked paprika\nPinch cayenne pepper\nFor the macaroni:\n10 ounces elbow macaroni pasta or cavatappi\n1 tablespoon kosher salt\n1 tablespoon unsalted butter\nFor the sauce:\n4 ounces cream cheese\n10-ounce brick of cheddar cheese, shredded (about 3 cups thickly shredded cheddar cheese)\n2 1/2 cups whole milk\n1/2 teaspoon white pepper\n1/2 teaspoon kosher salt\n1/2 teaspoon mustard powder\n1/4 teaspoon turmeric powder\nGarnish:\nMinced parsley or chives (optional)\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Prepare the pan and heat the oven: Butter an 8x8 pan and set aside. Preheat the oven to 350\xc2\xb0F.\n2 Make the topping: In a small bowl, melt 2 tablespoons of butter. Add panko, Parmesan, salt, smoked paprika, and cayenne pepper. Set aside.\n3 Boil the pasta: Bring a pot of water to a boil over medium high heat. Add the macaroni and salt. Cook until the pasta is firm-tender, or al dente. Usually, this takes about a minute or two less than the cook time recommended on the box.\n4 Drain and butter the pasta: Drain the pasta into a colander. Add 1 tablespoon butter to the same pot you boiled the pasta in. Add the drained pasta back to the pan and stir to coat. Remove from heat. You\xe2\x80\x99ll get back to it later.\n5 Make the sauce: In a large, high sided skillet set over medium heat, add the cream cheese, 1 cup of milk, and all of the spices. Break apart and smash the cream cheese with a spatula as it begins to soften and melt. Once the cream cheese is in pieces the size of a nickel or smaller, whisk the mixture until it\xe2\x80\x99s homogeneous and thickened, about 4 to 5 minutes.\n6 Add the remaining milk and cheddar cheese: Whisk the remaining 1 1/2 cups of milk into the sauce. Add the cheddar cheese one cup at a time, whisking continuously. Make sure each cup is incorporated before adding the next.\n7 Add the pasta to the sauce: Once the sauce is thick like heavy whipping cream and homogeneous, add the pasta. Stir to coat. It will look soupy. That\xe2\x80\x99s what you want. Transfer the mixture to the buttered 8x8 pan. Smooth the top.\n8 Top with panko and bake: Sprinkle the panko mixture over the top of the mac and cheese. Place in oven for 20 to 25 minutes until the top is golden brown and the cheese sauce is bubbling around the edges. Cool briefly before serving.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Print\nTurkey Tetrazzini Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesCook time: 1 hour, 15 minutesYield: Serves 4 to 6\nINGREDIENTS\n12 ounces mushrooms, sliced (about 4-5 cups)\n8 Tbsp unsalted butter, divided 3 Tbsp, 4 Tbsp, and 1 Tbsp\n1/4 cup all-purpose flour\n12 oz egg noodles, spaghetti, linguini or other pasta\n1 1/2 cups of milk\n1/4 cup whipping cream\n2 cups chicken broth\n1/4 cup dry sherry (or vermouth or dry white wine)\n3 cups coarsely chopped cooked turkey\n1 cup peas\n2/3 cup freshly grated Parmesan (divided into 1/3 and 1/3 cups)\n1/3 cup shredded Swiss cheese\n2 Tbsp lemon juice\nSalt and Pepper\nGround nutmeg (optional)\n1/3 cup fine fresh bread crumbs (or panko)\nFreshly chopped parsley for garnish (optional)\nMETHOD\n1 Preheat oven and heat water for pasta: Preheat oven to 375\xc2\xb0F. Start heating 2 to 3 quarts of water for the pasta. Add 1 teaspoon of salt for each quart of water.\n2 Saut\xc3\xa9 mushrooms: Cook the mushrooms in 3 Tbsp of the butter over medium-high heat, stirring, until all of the liquid the mushrooms give off has evaporated, 5-7 minutes. Set aside.\n3 Make a roux with flour and butter: In a large, heavy saucepan, melt 4 Tbsp of butter. Stir in the flour, and cook the mixture over low heat, stirring, for 3 minutes.\n4 Add pasta to boiling water: About now, put the pasta into the boiling water you've heated. Follow the package directions and cook until al dente. While the pasta is cooking continue on with the recipe.\n5 Make the sauce: Into the saucepan with the butter and flour, slowly whisk in the milk, cream, chicken broth, and the sherry. Bring to a simmer and cook over medium-low heat, stirring constantly, for about 5 to 8 minutes.\n6 Assemble the casserole: When the pasta is ready, drain it. In a large bowl combine the pasta, the sauce, the mushrooms, the turkey, and the peas. Stir in 1/3 cup of the Parmesan and the 1/3 cup of Swiss cheese. Stir in the lemon juice. Add salt and pepper to taste.\nNote that if you have been using unsalted butter, and/or unsalted or low sodium stock, you will need to add more salt than you might expect. Just keep sprinkling it in until it is seasoned to your taste.\nAdd a pinch of ground nutmeg if using, again to taste. Transfer the mixture to a buttered 3-quart casserole.\n7 Make breadcrumb Parmesan topping: In a small bowl combine well the remaining 1/3 cup Parmesan and the breadcrumbs. Sprinkle the mixture evenly over the tetrazzini, and dot the top with the remaining 1 tablespoon butter, cut into bits.\n8 Bake: Bake the Tetrazzini at 375\xc2\xb0F in the middle rack of the oven for 30 to 40 minutes, or until it is bubbling and the top is golden.\nGarnish individual servings with chopped parsley.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b'Print\nBiscuits and Gravy Casserole Recipe\nPrep time: 25 minutesCook time: 35 minutesYield: 12 servings\nThe cornstarch in the biscuit dough reduces the gluten content to help keep the biscuits light and fluffy.\nIf you have White Lily Flour, use 2 1/2 cups of White Lily flour instead of all-purpose, and omit the cornstarch.\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the biscuits:\n2 1/4 cups (315 g) all-purpose flour (see Recipe Note)\n3 tablespoons cornstarch\n1 tablespoon baking powder\n3/4 teaspoon kosher salt\n1/2 cup unsalted butter, cold\n1 cup buttermilk, cold\nFor the gravy:\n1 tablespoon olive oil\n1/2 pound sliced mushrooms\n1/4 cup chopped yellow onions\n1 pound breakfast pork sausage\n6 tablespoons all-purpose flour\n1/2 teaspoon ground sage\n1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper\n1/8 teaspoon ground nutmeg\n3/4 teaspoon kosher salt\n2 1/2 cups milk, preferably whole\nFor topping:\n1 tablespoon unsalted butter, melted\nSpecial equipment:\n2-quart glass or ceramic baking dish, rectangular or square\n2 1/2-inch biscuit cutter\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat the oven to 400\xc2\xb0F.\n2 Make the biscuit dough: Combine the flour, cornstarch, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl. Cut the butter into 1/2-inch chunks and sprinkle it over the dry ingredients. Using a pastry blender, a butter knife, or a fork, cut the butter into the dry ingredients until most of it is the size of peas. Don\xe2\x80\x99t overwork it; you want to leave some of the butter in chunks.\nAdd the buttermilk and toss the mixture with a spatula until it starts to look shaggy, and most of the buttermilk has been absorbed. It won\xe2\x80\x99t form a dough yet; that\xe2\x80\x99s OK.\n3 Bring the dough together: Turn out the contents of the bowl onto a clean surface dusted with a little flour. Gather the dough together with your hands into a mound, then roll it out until it is about 10-inches wide. Again, don\xe2\x80\x99t worry if the dough is crumbly!\n4 Fold the dough to create flaky layers: Use a spatula (like the kind you use to make fried eggs) or bench scraper and flip 1/3 of the dough over from the left to the center. Then flip the other side over that side. You\xe2\x80\x99re basically folding the dough over like a letter.\nRotate the dough 90-degrees and roll it out again to about a 10-inch square. It will start to feel more like a dough and less crumbly at this point, but there will still be some loose chunks. Just press them back into the dough if they fall out, and resist the urge to add more liquid.\nRepeat the process of rolling out and folding two more times. By the fourth time, the biscuit dough will hold together and feel like actual dough.\n5 Cut the biscuits: Roll out the dough to a 10-inch square that\xe2\x80\x99s roughly 1/2 inch thick. Using a 2 1/2-inch biscuit cutter, cut out 16 circles. When you press down to cut out the dough, don\xe2\x80\x99t twist the biscuit cutter, which will \xe2\x80\x9cseal\xe2\x80\x9d the edges of the dough. Instead, just cut straight down, so the biscuit will rise and be as flaky as possible.\n5 Bake the bottom layer of biscuits: Set aside 12 of the biscuit rounds. Place the remaining 4 biscuit rounds on the bottom of a 2-quart glass or ceramic casserole dish. Cut up the remaining scraps of dough and jigsaw-puzzle the remaining dough into the bottom of the casserole dish, making sure to cover the bottom in a single layer.\nPlace on a rimmed baking sheet (for ease of removal from the oven and to catch any drips). Bake in the oven for 15 minutes or until the top of the biscuits start to look dry but not brown at all. (There might be a slight darkening around the edges, but don\xe2\x80\x99t be alarmed if the biscuits still look pale white.)\n6 Meanwhile, make the gravy: While the bottom biscuits are baking, make the gravy by placing the oil, mushrooms, and onions in a large saut\xc3\xa9 pan. Cook on high heat, stirring constantly, until the mushrooms start to soften, and the onions start to look translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the sausage, breaking it up with a wooden spoon or spatula, and cook until the sausage starts to brown, about 5 minutes.\nKeep the heat on high, and add the flour, sage, black pepper, nutmeg, and salt to the pan. Stir until the ingredients are absorbed. Pour in the milk, reduce heat to medium, and cook, continuing to stir until the liquid has started to bubble and thicken, about 3 to 7 minutes. You\xe2\x80\x99re now ready to assemble the casserole!\nIf the first layer of biscuits isn\xe2\x80\x99t done baking, lower the heat on the gravy to a simmer until the biscuits are done. If you still need time to finish the gravy, but the biscuits are done\xe2\x80\x94remove the casserole dish from the oven, and let it sit on the counter or stovetop while you finish the gravy.\n7 Assemble and bake the casserole: Once the gravy has thickened and the first layer of biscuits is done baking, pour or spoon the gravy over the biscuit layer in the casserole dish. Place the 12 reserved biscuits over the gravy and brush the top of the biscuits with the melted butter.\nReturn the dish to the oven and bake until the biscuits are golden brown and the gravy is bubbling and thick, about 18 to 23 minutes.\n8 Cool and serve: Let cool 10 minutes before serving warm from the casserole dish.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Save It Print\nFrench Toast Casserole Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 40 minutesChill time: overnight (optional)Yield: 6 to 8 servings\nMake-ahead instructions: Assemble the casserole through Step 4, cover well, and refrigerate overnight. The next day, uncover, drizzle the casserole with the topping, and bake. Baking time will be slightly longer.\nThis casserole reheats well, though the chunks of bread on the top will gradually lose some crunch. The best way to reheat it is to bake it in the oven at 350F for 10 to 15 minutes to warm through and re-crisp the top.\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the casserole:\n1 large loaf good-quality French loaf, sourdough, ciabatta, or challah (enough to yield 10 cups of chunks of bread)\n1/2 cup (45g) chopped pecans\n5 large eggs\n1 1/2 cups whole milk\n1/4 cup (50g) granulated sugar\nZest from one medium orange (optional)\n1/2 teaspoons ground cinnamon\n1/4 teaspoon salt\nFor the topping:\n4 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted\n3 tablespoons (40g) dark brown sugar\n1 teaspoon ground cinnamon\nPinch of salt\nOptional toppings for serving:\nDried cranberries\nPowdered sugar\nMaple syrup\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat the oven to 375F (190C). Place an oven rack in the center position.\n2 Slice the bread into 1-inch slices and then cut them into 1-inch cubes. You can also tear the bread apart with your hands. Leave the crusts on.\n3 Layer the bread and pecans in a baking dish: Lightly grease a 2-quart (if you want thicker slices) or 3-quart baking dish (if you want thinner slices) with cooking spray or butter. Add enough bread cubes to cover the bottom. Sprinkle a few tablespoons of pecans on top. Continue layering the bread chunks and pecans.\n4 Prepare and add the custard: In a small bowl, whisk the eggs together. Add the milk, sugar, orange zest, 1/2 teaspoon of cinnamon, and salt, and mix well. Pour the egg and milk mixture evenly over all the bread chunks. (I found it easier to pour the mixture into a large measuring cup with a spout first before pouring the mixture over the bread.)\nAt this point, the casserole can be baked right away, or covered and refrigerated overnight.\n5 Drizzle with topping: In another bowl, mix the melted butter with the brown sugar, 1 teaspoon cinnamon, and a pinch of salt. Using a spoon, drizzle the mixture evenly over all the bread chunks.\n6 Bake the casserole for 35 to 45 minutes. I baked mine for about 38 minutes. Leave the casserole in the oven longer if you want the chunks of bread on the top to be more brown and crunchier.\n7 Remove the casserole from the oven and let it cool for about 10 minutes before serving. Sprinkle dried cranberries and dust powdered sugar on top, if you like. Serve with maple syrup at the table.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nBeef Noodle Casserole Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 1 hourYield: Serves 8\nINGREDIENTS\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n1 medium white onion, peeled and chopped, about 1 1/2 cups\n1 bell pepper, seeded, ribs removed, finely chopped, about 1 cup\n3 cloves garlic, minced, about 1 tablespoon\n1 28-ounce can whole peeled or crushed tomatoes\n1 1/2 pounds ground beef\nSalt\n4 ounces mushrooms, sliced\n12 ounces egg noodles\n1 1/2 cups frozen corn, defrosted\n1 15-ounce can of black olives, strained and chopped\n8 ounces cheddar cheese, grated\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat oven and start heating water: Pre-heat the oven to 350\xc2\xb0F and start to heat a large pot of salted water (1 Tbsp salt, 2 quarts water) for cooking the egg noodles.\n2 Make tomato sauce base: Heat 1 Tbsp of oil on medium high heat in a large, heavy bottomed pot or skillet. Add the onions and bell pepper and saut\xc3\xa9 until softened, about 4 minutes. Add garlic and cook for a minute more.\nAdd the tomatoes, breaking them up with your fingers or a knife if you are using whole canned tomatoes. Bring to a simmer and let cook for 10 minutes. Lower the heat to warm.\n3 Brown the ground beef: In a separate skillet, add 1 Tbsp of oil and heat to medium-high. Working in batches, so you do not crowd the pan, add the ground beef, breaking it up with your fingers as you add it to the pan.\nDo not stir the ground beef, but let it sit and cook for a minute or two until it browns on one side.\nSprinkle a little salt over the meat while cooking.\nOnce browned on one side, turn the pieces over to get the other side browned. Once the meat is mostly browned (can still be rare in the center), remove the beef from the pan and add to the tomato onion mixture.\n4 Saut\xc3\xa9 the mushrooms: Add the mushrooms to the same pan that you had used for browning the beef, and saut\xc3\xa9 the mushrooms in the remaining oil and beef drippings. Once browned, add the mushrooms to the beef and tomato mixture.\n5 Cook the egg noodles: While the mushrooms are cooking, add the egg noodle pasta to the boiling water. Cook as directed, about 4-5 minutes. Strain when cooked, but still a little firm (al dente).\n6 Add everything to casserole dish: Add the cooked egg noodles to a large  (3 quart) casserole dish. (If your casserole dish isn't big enough, you may need to use 2 casserole dishes.)\nStir in the tomato beef mixture. Stir in the corn, chopped olives, and about two thirds of the cheese.\n7 Bake: Sprinkle remaining cheese on top of casserole. Place in the oven. Bake uncovered at 350\xc2\xb0F for 30 minutes.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Print\nVegetarian Spinach and Mushroom Lasagna Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesCook time: 1 hour, 45 minutesYield: Serves 8-10\nThe first thing I do to start making this recipe is to get a big pot of salted water heating for the pasta, and defrost the spinach. While this is happening you can prep the mushrooms and cheeses.\nUse high quality tomato sauce for best results.\nIf fresh basil is not available for layering in the casserole, add 2 teaspoons of dried basil to the sauce.\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the sauce:\n1 1/2 pound cremini mushrooms, roughly chopped\n1/2 pound shiitake mushrooms, roughly chopped\nSalt\n1 generous cup chopped onions\n1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil plus more for keeping the noodles from sticking to each other\n4 cloves garlic, chopped (about 4 teaspoons)\n1 (6-ounce) can tomato paste\n2 cups tomato sauce\n1 (28-ounce) can crushed tomatoes (such as Muir Glen with basil)\n1 cup water\n1 tablespoon dried thyme\n1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes\n1 tablespoon sugar\nFor the lasagna:\n2 (10-ounce) boxes frozen chopped spinach, thawed and squeezed in clean towel of excess moisture\n1 pound lasagna noodles (16 to 20 noodles)\n1 (15-or-16-ounce) container of ricotta cheese\n1/4 cup chopped fresh basil\n1/4 pound pecorino cheese (or Parmesan), grated (about 1 cup)\n1 pound shredded mozzarella cheese (about 4 cups)\nSpecial equipment:\n 1 large casserole pan, preferably 10x15-inches\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Saut\xc3\xa9 the mushrooms: Place mushrooms in a large (6 to 8 quart) saut\xc3\xa9 pan on high or medium high heat. Stir them with a wooden spoon or shake the pan from time to time. You may hear them squeak.\nSprinkle salt over the mushrooms. The mushrooms will sizzle and then start to release water. (Note that you are not adding fat at this point to the pan; this method of cooking mushrooms in their own moisture is called "dry saut\xc3\xa9ing.)\nOnce the mushrooms start to release water into the pan, stir in the chopped onions. Cook until the mushrooms are no longer releasing moisture and the mushroom water has boiled away, about 5 minutes more.\n2 Make the sauce: Add the olive oil to the mushrooms and stir to coat. Saut\xc3\xa9 the mushrooms and onions for about a minute. Add the garlic and cook for another minute.\nStir in the tomato paste, cook for a minute longer. Reserve 1 cup of the tomato sauce (it will go in the bottom of the casserole dish), and put the remaining cup of tomato sauce into the pot with the mushrooms.  Add the large can of crushed tomatoes and one cup of water.\nStir in the thyme, sugar, and red pepper flakes. (If you are using dried basil instead of fresh, add it now.) Bring to a simmer, then lower the heat and simmer on a low simmer, for 20 minutes.\n3 Boil and drain the lasagna noodles: Once the sauce is simmering, salt the boiling pasta water, and add the dry lasagna noodles to the boiling water.  (The water should be at a vigorous, rolling boil.) Stir gently, making sure that the noodles are not sticking to each other. Set the timer for 8 minutes, or however long is indicated on the package of the noodles. Cook uncovered on a high boil.\nWhen the noodles are ready (al dente, cooked through but still firm to the bite), drain the noodles in a colander, and rinse them to cool them with cold water.  As you rinse them, gently separate them with your fingers so they don\'t stick to each other.\nPrepare a couple large cookie sheets or baking sheets by spreading a tablespoon of olive oil over the baking sheets.\nPlace the lasagna noodles on the sheets, gently coating them with a bit of that olive oil, and spreading them out. This will help keep them from sticking to each other while you finish the sauce and prepare the layered casserole.\n4 Assemble the lasagna: Turn off the heat on the stovetop for the sauce. Preheat the oven to 350\xc2\xb0F.\nSpread the one cup of reserved tomato sauce over the bottom of a large (preferably 10x15-inch) casserole dish. (If your casserole dish is smaller, you may need to add another layer as you go through this step.)\nPlace a layer of lasagna noodles down over the tomato sauce, slightly overlapping. (For our 10x15-inch dish, we ultimately fit 3 layers of 6 noodles each, with 2 extra noodles on which to nosh.)\nSprinkle half of the ricotta cheese over the noodles, and half of the defrosted, drained, and squeezed out spinach over the ricotta.\nSprinkle half of the mozzarella cheese over the spinach, and just a quarter of the pecorino cheese.\nThen spoon 1/3 of your mushroom sauce over the mozzarella. Sprinkle half of the fresh basil over the sauce.\n5 Repeat layers: Repeat the layering process. Place a second layer of noodles over the sauce. Spread the remaining ricotta, spinach, and mozzarella over the noodles. Sprinkle another quarter of the pecorino along with the mozzarella. Top with another third of the mushroom sauce and the remaining fresh basil.\nLayer your final layer of lasagna noodles over the sauce. Spread the remaining sauce over the lasagna noodles, and sprinkle with the remaining pecorino or parmesan cheese.\n6 Cover with foil and bake: Pull out a sheet of aluminum foil large enough to cover the casserole dish. Spread a little olive oil over the inside of the piece of foil (the side that will have contact with the lasagna). Place the foil over the casserole dish and crimp the edges.\nBake at 350\xc2\xb0F for 25 minutes, then remove the foil and bake uncovered for an additional 25 minutes.\nTake the lasagna out of the oven when done and let it rest 10 minutes before cutting to serve. Once made, the lasagna will last a week in the fridge.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Print\nBroccoli Cheddar Casserole Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 55 minutesYield: Serves 5 as a main course, 10 as a side\nPrep your ingredients while you are heating the blanching water to save time.\nSave your broccoli stems! You can use vegetable peeler to peel them, then slice and eat like celery.\nINGREDIENTS\n2 pounds (900g) broccoli, stems removed (can use vegetable peeler to peel, then slice and eat like celery) and crowns cut into florets (about 8 cups of broccoli florets)\n2 strips thick-cut bacon (about 2 ounces), cut crosswise into 1/4-inch wide strips\n5 large eggs, beaten\n1/3 cup (43g) all-purpose flour\n1/2 cup (118 ml) heavy cream\n1 cup (236 ml) whole milk\n2 to 3 teaspoons freshly ground black pepper (1 to 2 teaspoons if using fine ground black pepper)\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n2 teaspoons Dijon mustard\n8 ounces (225g) cheddar cheese, grated\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Blanch the broccoli florets: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil (1 Tbsp salt for 2 quarts of water). Add the broccoli florets and boil for 3-5 minutes or until just tender enough so that a fork can easily pierce the floret, but still firm. Strain and rinse with cold water to stop the cooking.\n2 Cook the bacon: While the water in step one is coming to a boil, cook the bacon pieces on medium heat in a frying pan until lightly browned, but not crisp. Remove to a plate lined with paper towels to absorb the excess fat. Set aside.\n3 Make the egg mixture: Preheat oven to 425\xc2\xb0F (220\xc2\xb0C). Butter a 2 1/2 quart casserole dish. In a bowl, whisk the eggs into the flour, then whisk in the cream and milk. Add the black pepper (more or less to taste), salt, and mustard. Mix in about a third of the cheese.\n4 Assemble the casserole: Place the blanched broccoli florets in the casserole dish, sprinkling about a third of the cheese over the broccoli florets as you lay them down. Sprinkle the bacon pieces over the broccoli.\nPour the egg, cream, milk, cheese mixture over the broccoli, moving the broccoli pieces a bit so that the mixture gets into all the nooks and crannies. Sprinkle the casserole with the remaining cheese.\n5 Bake for 25 to 40 minutes, or until set. Once the top has browned, you may want to tent with aluminum foil to keep from burning.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Save It Print\nSausage Breakfast Casserole Recipe\nPrep time: 25 minutesCook time: 1 hourYield: Serves 6 to 8\nBread that is a little bit dry will hold up better in the casserole and provide more structure, which is why breakfast casseroles tend to call for "day old" bread. If your bread is fresh or soft, after you cube it, spread it out on a sheet pan and put it in a 200\xc2\xb0F oven for 10 to 12 minutes.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 pound Italian pork sausage\n10 large eggs, beaten\n4 cups whole milk\n1 teaspoon dry mustard\n1/4 teaspoon onion powder\n1 teaspoon kosher salt\nFresh ground pepper to taste\n5 cups cubed day old bread (we recommend rustic French or Italian loaf), cut into 3/4-inch to 1 inch-wide cubes\n2 cups shredded sharp cheddar cheese\n1/2 cup sliced mushrooms (optional)\n1/2 cup peeled, cored, chopped tomatoes (optional)\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Brown the sausage: Heat a skillet on medium. Break up the sausage into chunks and cook, working in batches if need be, until cooked on all sides. As you cook the sausage, you can break up the larger chunks into smaller crumbles (which are easier to distribute evenly over the casserole).\nWhen lightly browned, remove from pan to a paper towel lined plate to absorb any excess fat.\n2 In a large bowl whisk together the eggs, milk, dry mustard, onion powder, salt and pepper.\n3 Assemble the casserole: Place the cubed bread in a well-buttered 9x13 inch baking pan. Sprinkle with cheese. Sprinkle with chopped tomatoes and mushrooms, if using. Top with the browned crumbled sausage, distributing it evenly. Pour the egg milk mixture evenly over the bread and cheese.\n4 Cover and chill, if making ahead: At this point, the casserole can be covered and chilled in the fridge until ready to bake and serve, up to overnight.\nIf baking immediately, let the casserole sit for 10 minutes before putting in the oven (to give the bread a chance to absorb the milk-egg mixture.\n5 Bake the casserole: When ready to cook, preheat the oven to 325\xc2\xb0F. Bake uncovered for about one hour. Tent with foil if the top begins to brown too quickly.\n6 Serve: Let the casserole cool for about 10 minutes before serving. Leftovers will keep in the refrigerator for about a week.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nPastel\xc3\xb3n (Puerto Rican Plantain \xe2\x80\x9cLasagna\xe2\x80\x9d) Recipe\nPrep time: 30 minutesCook time: 30 minutesYield: 6 to 8 servings\nINGREDIENTS\n4 ripe plantains, about 3 to 3 1/4 pounds\n1/2 cup vegetable oil\n1 pound ground beef (preferably ground round) or ground turkey\n1 teaspoon adobo seasoning blend\n1 1/2 teaspoons saz\xc3\xb3n flavoring blend, store-bought or homemade, optional\n1 small white onion, minced (about 1 cup)\n1 green bell pepper, minced (about 1 cup)\n1 tablespoon recaito flavoring base (store-bought or homemade), or 2 tablespoons chopped cilantro\n6 pimento-stuffed green olives, sliced\n1 teaspoon capers\n1 teaspoon dried oregano\n1 cup tomato sauce\n2 cups Monterey jack, cheddar, or mozzarella cheese, divided\n2 large eggs\n1/2 teaspoon baking soda\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat the oven to 350\xc2\xb0F. Lightly grease a 10x10 casserole dish (for a thicker pastel\xc3\xb3n) or 9x13 casserole dish (for a thinner pastel\xc3\xb3n) with nonstick cooking spray or butter.\n2 Prepare the plantains: Cut off both ends from the plantain, then use the tip of your knife to cut a slit down the back. Using your two thumbs, remove the peel from the plantain and discard the peel.\nOnce you\xe2\x80\x99ve peeled all the plantains, slice each one in half down the length. Separate the two halves and flip them onto their flat sides to create a stable base. Place your palm flat on top of the plantain, and use a sharp knife to slice parallel to the cutting board and cut the plantains into very thin slices (about 1/4-inch thick). Set aside.\n(Alternatively, you can use a mandoline to slice the plantains thinly, but be careful because the plantains are soft and the mandoline is sharp!)\n  3 Fry the plantains: In a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil to 300\xc2\xb0F over medium heat (check the temperature with a candy thermometer or instant-read thermometer). Line a plate with paper towels to drain the plantains after frying, and set next to the stove.\nPlace four or five slices of plantains into the oil and fry for about 1 1/2 minutes on each side, or until the plantains have a browned slightly. Remove from the skillet to the paper-lined plate to drain. Continue frying the remaining plantains.\n4 Cook the beef: Drain all but 1 tablespoon of oil from the pan you used to fry the plantains. Return the pan to the stove and heat over medium-high heat. Add the ground beef and season with the adobo and saz\xc3\xb3n.\nContinue to cook the meat, breaking it up into crumbles, for 6 minutes or until browned. Drain the meat by pouring it into a colander, but leave a bit of the grease in the pan to cook the vegetables.\n5 Cook the vegetables: Return the empty pan to the heat and cook the onions, bell pepper, and recaito for 3 minutes or until glossy. Add the olives, capers, and dried oregano, and cook for 2 more minutes.\n6 Finish the filling: Return the ground beef to the pan with the vegetables, along with the tomato sauce, and then stir to combine. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then remove the pan from the heat.\n7 Assemble the pastel\xc3\xb3n: Cover the bottom of the casserole dish with a single layer of the fried plantain strips. Spoon a 1-inch layer of the ground beef mixture onto the plantains. Top with 1/2 cup of shredded cheese. Repeat with another layer of plantains, meat, and cheese (reserve the remaining 1 cup of cheese). Top with a final layer of plantains.\n   8 Add the egg layer: In a small bowl, whisk together the eggs and baking soda until frothy. Pour this mixture over the plantains.\n9 Bake the pastel\xc3\xb3n, uncovered, for 25 minutes. Remove from the oven and top with the remaining cup of cheese. Return the dish to the oven and cook for an additional five minutes, until the cheese has melted.\n10 Cool and serve: Remove the pastel\xc3\xb3n from the oven. Allow it to cool for at least fifteen minutes before slicing and serving, which helps it maintain its shape when sliced.\nLeftovers can be stored, covered, in the refrigerator for up to three days. To reheat, cut a portion and place either in the microwave or the oven until warmed through.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nLasagna Bolognese Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 4 hours, 30 minutesYield: Serves 8\nINGREDIENTS\nBolognese Sauce:\n2 ounces diced pancetta, finely chopped\n1 medium Spanish onion or yellow onion, finely chopped\n1 stalk celery, finely chopped\n1 carrot, finely chopped\n4 tablespoons unsalted butter\n11 ounces ground beef\n4 ounces ground pork\n4 ounces ground Italian sausage\n1 freshly ground clove\nDash of freshly ground cinnamon\n1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper\n2 pounds peeled and chopped tomatoes (or one 28-oz can whole peeled tomatoes)\n1 cup whole milk\n1/2 teaspoon sea salt\nB\xc3\xa9chamel Sauce:\n2 cups whole milk\n1/4 cup unsalted butter\n1/4 cup all-purpose unbleached flour\nLasagna:\nEnough lasagna noodles to make four layers in a 13x9-inch baking pan with the lasagna pieces overlapping each other a little bit.\nRecommended 16 sheets of De Cecco brand Italian lasagna noodles.\n1 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\nPREPARE THE BOLOGNESE MEAT SAUCE\n1 Make the soffritto: Combine pancetta, onion, celery, and carrot in saut\xc3\xa9 pan with butter and cook over medium heat until onion turns pale gold.\n2 Add the beef, pork, sausage to the soffritto, and increase the heat to high; cook until browned.\nSprinkle with the ground clove, cinnamon, and pepper.\n3 Stir in tomatoes, bring to a simmer and reduce the heat to medium. Cook over medium heat for 15 minutes. If you are using whole canned tomatoes, break them up as you add them to the sauce.\n4 Add milk and season with sea salt. Then turn down the heat and let simmer for 2 and 1/2 hours. Stir at least every 20 minutes. Whenever the sauce simmers down to the point that it is sticking to the bottom of the pan, just add 1/4 cup of water and scrape up the browned bits from the bottom and continue to cook.\nMAKE THE B\xc3\x89CHAMEL SAUCE\n5 Make the roux: Heat the milk until almost boiling in a heavy bottomed sauce pan.\nIn a separate pan melt the unsalted butter with the flour over low heat. Stir rapidly with a spoon. Cook this for 1 minute and then remove from the heat. (See Wikipedia on B\xc3\xa9chamel Sauce for more information on this sauce.)\n6 Slowly add half the milk to the roux: Slowly add half the hot milk to your butter and flour mixture. During this process stir constantly.\n7 Add remaining milk, thicken the sauce: Return the milk, butter, flour mixture to low heat until the sauce begins to thicken. Add the remaining milk slowly while stirring working it into the thickened sauce. Continue to stir until it comes to a boil.\n8 Season, stir: Season with some sea salt, and continue stirring until the right consistency has developed. If any lumps form, beat them out rapidly with a whisk until they dissolve. Remove from heat.\nPREPARE THE LASAGNA\n9 Cook the lasagna noodles: Preheat oven to 375\xc2\xb0F. Cook the lasagna according to instructions. About 8 minutes in 6 quarts of boiling salted water. Drain, rinse with cold water.\nLay the individual lasagna noodles out on kitchen towels, not touching, so they do not stick together while you layer the casserole.\n10 Layer the lasagna: Spread a little olive oil around the inside of a 13x9-inch baking pan. Make sure your baking pan is non-reactive - pyrex or stainless steel. Do not use an aluminum pan as it will react with the acidity of the sauce and ruin the flavor.\nPut a layer of lasagna noodles down first. Layer on a third of the bolognese sauce, then a third of the bechamel sauce.\nSprinkle with grated Parmesan. Repeat two more times. Top with a final layer of noodles and sprinkle with grated Parmesan.\n11 Bake: Tent the casserole with aluminum foil. Put lasagna into the middle rack of a pre-heated 375\xc2\xb0F oven. Bake for 20-30 minutes, until the top begins to get lightly browned.\nRemove from oven and let cool 5-10 minutes before serving.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nMake Ahead Mashed Potatoes Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 1 hour, 10 minutesYield: Serves 6 to 8\nNote on freezing: If you freeze and then defrost, you may need to stir up the mashed potatoes before baking. See above for more detailed freezing and reheating instructions.\nINGREDIENTS\n4 to 5 pounds potatoes (russets, yukon gold or a combination), peeled and cut into 2-inch chunks\nSalt\n3 garlic cloves, peeled and whole\n1 small sprig fresh rosemary\n3 tablespoons unsalted butter, divided 2 tablespoons and 1 tablespoon\n8 ounces cream cheese (full fat), room temperature\n1/2 cup plain or greek yogurt (or sour cream)\n1/4 teaspoon fresh minced rosemary\n2 teaspoons kosher salt\n1/8 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper\nChives for garnish\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cook the potatoes: Place peeled cut potatoes in a large saucepan, cover with an inch of cold water. Add 2 teaspoons of salt to the water. Add the garlic cloves and rosemary sprig.\nHeat on high to bring to a boil, then reduce to low, cover to maintain a simmer until the potatoes are just cooked through, about 10 to 12 minutes.\nOnce potatoes are done, drain the potatoes. Discard the rosemary sprig, save the garlic cloves with the potatoes.\n2 Mash the potatoes and garlic cloves: While the potatoes are still hot, use either a potato masher or a potato ricer to roughly mash the potatoes and the garlic cloves in a large bowl.\nA ricer will yield fluffier, less gluey, mashed potatoes.\n3 Mix in cream cheese and yogurt: In a large upright mixer (or if you have strong arms, you can do this by hand), add the riced or roughly mashed potatoes into the mixer bowl, along with 2 tablespoons of butter, the softened cream cheese, and the yogurt.\nMix on low to start, then increase the speed to medium and mix just until everything is well incorporated. (Don't overmix!)\nStir in the minced rosemary, the salt and pepper. Taste and add more salt and pepper if needed.\n4 Place in casserole dish: Butter generously the inside of a 2-quart casserole dish. Add the mashed potatoes, and spread out in an even layer. Dot with the remaining 1 Tbsp butter.\nAt this point, you've done the make-ahead part of the recipe. You can cover with plastic wrap and chill until ready to bake. You can make up to 2 days ahead. (Or you can freeze for up to 2 weeks ahead; see headnotes for more detailed freezing and reheating instructions.)\n5 Bake: When ready to make, remove from refrigerator and let sit for an hour to come to room temperature. Bake at 350\xc2\xb0F for 30 to 45 minutes, until the top is lightly browned.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b"Save It Print\nChile Relleno Casserole Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 1 hour, 15 minutesYield: Serves 8\nFeel free to play around with the stuffing, Mexican chorizo is great for this, but we've also used hot Louisiana pork sausage. Or you can skip the pork all together and just use a jack cheese stuffing. Note that this casserole serves 8; you can easily cut the ingredients in half and use an 8x8 dish for the casserole.\nINGREDIENTS\n8 poblano chiles\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n1 cup chopped onion\n4 cloves garlic, minced (about 4 teaspoons)\n1 28-ounce can tomatoes\nSalt\n1 pound Mexican chorizo (or other spicy sausage)\n1 cup Cotija cheese, crumbled (can sub feta)\n1 teaspoon fresh oregano, minced\nOne dozen eggs\n1/3 cup flour\n1 teaspoon baking powder\n1 1/2 cup Monterey jack or mild cheddar cheese, shredded\nSpecial equipment:\nA 9x13-inch baking dish\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Char the whole poblano chiles: The first step is to char the outside skin of the poblano chiles. The easiest way to do that is directly over the flame of a gas burner (see How to Roast Chiles over a Gas Flame).\nYou can also do that over a grill, or in a broiling pan under a broiler (don't use a thin baking sheet or it will warp under the high heat). Just put the chiles close enough to the heating element so they char and blister on the surface.\nTurn the chiles so that they get completely blackened all around. Place the blackened chiles in a bowl and cover with a plate or damp towel. Let the chiles steam in their own heat for several minutes.\n2 Saut\xc3\xa9 onion, garlic, add tomatoes, salt, and simmer: While the chilies are cooling, heat olive oil in a large saut\xc3\xa9 pan, on medium high heat. Add the chopped onion and cook until translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for a minute more.\nAdd the tomatoes (break up any whole tomatoes before adding to the pan). Add a pinch of salt. Bring to a simmer and lower the heat to low. Gently simmer for 15-20 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside.\n3 Peel the blackened skin off the poblanos: Carefully peel and discard the blackened skin off of the chilies. Cut off the stem ends. Carefully remove the seed pod without tearing the chiles (which you will stuff later).\n4 Cook the chorizo: Put the Mexican chorizo in a large frying pan and set the heat to medium high. Break up the chorizo with the edge of a metal spatula as you cook it. Cook until cooked through, about 4 minutes.\n5 Spread tomato sauce over bottom of baking dish: Preheat oven to 375\xc2\xb0F. Spread the tomato sauce over the bottom of an 9x13 inch baking dish. The tomato sauce should be the consistency of a thin spaghetti sauce. If it is too thick, thin it out with a little water.\n6 Make stuffing: In a large bowl, mix together the stuffing of the cooked chorizo, cotija, and oregano.\n7 Stuff chiles with chorizo mixture and place on top of tomato sauce in the baking dish.\n8 Whisk eggs, flour, baking powder, salt: In a large bowl, vigorously whisk the eggs. Whisk in the flour, baking powder, and a pinch of salt.\n9 Sprinkle chiles with cheese and pour egg mixture over them: Sprinkle chiles with half of the jack or cheddar cheese. Pour egg mixture over chiles and sprinkle with remaining cheese.\nAt this point you can make ahead and chill for several days. Add 10 minutes to cooking time in the next step if you make ahead and chill.\n10 Bake: Bake at 375\xc2\xb0F until top starts to brown and the eggs are set but still soft, about 30 minutes.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b"Save It Print\nChicken and Rice Casserole Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 1 hour, 10 minutesYield: Serves 6 (with leftovers)\nThis recipe assumes the rice requires about 1 1/2 cups liquid per cup of rice to cook. Some rice varieties, such as brown rice, require more liquid (and a longer cooking time). Adjust recipe accordingly.\nIf you are avoiding cooking with alcohol, skip the sherry and deglaze the pan with a 1/4 cup extra of chicken stock.\nDepending on how salted your stock is, you may need to more generously salt this dish. You can always salt to taste at the table.\nStovetop Method: To cook the casserole on the stovetop use a large saut\xc3\xa9 pan with a tight cover, cook on low when all is assembled. Cook it low enough to keep a simmer, but not so high that you burn the rice.\nINGREDIENTS\n2 1/2 pounds boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into 1 to 1 1/2 inch pieces, patted dry\nSalt and pepper\n4 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n1 medium onion, chopped\n2 cloves garlic, minced\n1/2 pound cremini or button mushrooms, sliced\n1/4 cup dry sherry or white wine\n1 1/3 cups chicken stock (See Recipe Note)\n1/2 cup sour cream\n1/4 cup cream\n1 cup uncooked white rice, medium or long grain\n1 1/2 teaspoon salt\n1 teaspoon each of Italian seasoning and poultry seasoning (or 2 teaspoons of one of these herb mixes, or 2 tablespoons chopped fresh herbs such as rosemary, sage, thyme, and basil)\n1/2 teaspoon paprika\n2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley\nSpecial equipment:\n9 x 13-inch casserole dish\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat oven to 375\xc2\xb0F.\n2 Brown the chicken: Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large saut\xc3\xa9 pan on medium high or high heat (hot enough to brown but not burn). Season the chicken pieces all over with salt and pepper.\nWorking in batches, brown the chicken pieces on both sides, about 1 to 2 minutes per batch. Add a little more olive oil if needed with every batch.\nRemove chicken pieces and set aside in a bowl. The chicken does not have to be cooked through, only browned.\n3 Saut\xc3\xa9 the onions and garlic: In the same saut\xc3\xa9 pan add 1 tablespoon olive oil. Lower the heat to medium, add the onions, and cook until translucent, about 3 minutes.\nAdd the garlic; cook 30 seconds more. Remove onions and garlic to a shallow 9x13 casserole dish.\n4 Saut\xc3\xa9 the mushrooms: Raise heat to medium high and add the sliced mushrooms. Dry saut\xc3\xa9 the mushrooms (don't add butter or oil), allowing them to brown lightly and release some of their moisture. Add the mushrooms to the casserole dish.\n5 Make the sauce: Add 1/4 cup dry sherry or dry white wine to the pan to deglaze it, scraping off the browned bits from the bottom.\n(At this point, if you are making ahead, reduce the sherry to 1 tablespoon and pour off into the casserole dish. Refrigerate cooked onions, garlic, mushrooms, and browned chicken pieces until you are ready to make the casserole.)\nLet the sherry reduce to about 1 tablespoon, then add the chicken stock, and remove from heat. Stir in 1 1/2 teaspoons salt, the cream, and the sour cream.\n6 Assemble the casserole: Add the uncooked rice to the casserole dish. Then pour the stock, sherry, cream, and sour cream mixture over the rice.\nAdd the Italian and poultry seasonings (or fresh herbs) and paprika to the dish.\nStir the rice, onion, mushroom, and herb mixture so that they are evenly distributed in the casserole dish.\nPlace the chicken pieces on top of the rice mixture (in a single layer if you can, they will be crowded).\n7 Bake:  Cover the casserole dish tightly with aluminum foil. Bake in a 375\xc2\xb0F oven for 45 minutes and then remove foil.\nIf the casserole still has too much liquid, let it cook a few minutes more, uncovered, until the excess liquid has evaporated away.\n8 Serve: Sprinkle with fresh parsley before serving.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b"Save It Print\nTater Tot Breakfast Casserole Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 35 minutesYield: 8 servings\nINGREDIENTS\n12 ounces ground pork breakfast sausage\n6 ounces (1 1/2 cups) shredded cheddar cheese, plus extra to sprinkle over top\n8 large eggs\n1/2 cup (whole) milk\n1 teaspoon kosher salt\n1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper\nOne 32-ounce bag frozen tater tots\nThinly sliced chives, for serving\nSpecial equipment:\n12-inch cast iron skillet, or other oven-safe skillet\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat the oven to 350\xcb\x9aF.\n2 Cook the sausage: Warm a 12-inch oven-safe skillet over medium heat, and add the sausage. Cook, breaking it apart with a wooden spoon, until browned and cooked through, 5 to 7 minutes. Remove the pan from heat.\n3 Assemble the casserole: Whisk together the eggs, milk, salt and pepper in a medium bowl.\nSpread the sausage into an even layer over the bottom of the skillet. Sprinkle with the shredded cheese, and pour the egg mixture over the top.\nArrange the frozen tater tots over the egg mixture in concentric circles, starting with a row around the rim of the pan and working your way in, or vice versa. (You won't use the entire bag; reserve remaining tater tots for another use.)\n4 Bake the casserole. Bake until the eggs have fully set and the cheese has melted, 35 to 40 minutes. If desired, sprinkle some additional cheese over top and bake an extra minute or two, until the cheese has melted.\n5 Serve: Let the casserole cool slightly before cutting into wedges. Sprinkle with some sliced chives and serve. Leftovers will keep for about 5 days.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b"Save It Print\nSlow Cooker Chicken and Rice Casserole Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 2 hours, 30 minutesYield: Serves 6\nThe basmati rice we are using in this recipe usually needs 3 cups of liquid for 2 cups of rice. For this recipe we are only adding 1 1/2 cups of liquid because the chicken and other ingredients will release moisture while the casserole cooks.\nIf you are using rice that requires a different amount of liquid to cook, you'll need to experiment for the right amount of liquid to reduce.\nAlso, different slow cookers come to temperature at different rates, and have tighter or looser lids. So you will likely need to experiment with the timing as well as the amount of liquid. Your slow cooker may require adding more liquid to keep the rice from drying out.\nINGREDIENTS\n2 pounds bone-in, skin-on chicken thighs (or 1 1/2 pounds boneless, skin-on chicken thighs)\nKosher salt\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n4 cups sliced yellow onion, 1/4-inch thick slices, sliced root to tip (about 2 large onions)\n1 teaspoon ground cumin\n1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon\n4 teaspoons finely chopped garlic (about 4 cloves)\n2 cups raw basmati long grain rice\n1 cup diced canned (or fresh) tomatoes\n1/2 cup frozen peas (optional)\n1 1/2 cups chicken stock\n3/4 teaspoon black pepper\n2 bay leaves\nSpecial equipment:\n6-quart slow cooker, preferably with a metal insert\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Salt the chicken: Sprinkle salt (about 2 teaspoons) on both side of the chicken thighs, and let them sit while you prep and cook the onions.\n2 Saut\xc3\xa9 the onions, garlic, spices: Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large saut\xc3\xa9 pan on high heat. When the oil is shimmery hot, but not smoking, add the sliced onions and cook until lightly browned, stirring frequently, about 6 minutes.\nLower the heat to medium and stir in the ground cumin and cinnamon. Let cook for a minute. Add the garlic and cook for half a minute more. Place cooked onions and garlic into the bowl of a slow cooker. (Do not wipe down the saut\xc3\xa9 pan.)\n3 Brown the chicken thighs: Heat the saut\xc3\xa9 pan on medium. Add the chicken thighs, skin-side-down in the pan. Let cook on medium heat until the skin is well-browned and much of the chicken fat from the skin has rendered out (about 10 to 12 minutes).\nTurn the chicken pieces over and brown the skinless side for 4 to 5 minutes more.\n4 Combine everything in the slow cooker: While the chicken is cooking, add the raw long grain rice into the slow cooker with the onions, stir to combine. Stir in the diced tomatoes, peas (if using), stock, pepper, bay leaves. Stir in 1 1/2 teaspoons of salt.\nWhen the chicken has finished browning, place the chicken pieces skin-side up in the pot.\n5 Slow cook for 2 to 3 hours on the high setting of your slow cooker. The timing depends on your particular slow cooker. My All-Clad model with a metal bowl heats up very quickly and only takes 2 hours to cook this dish. Slow cooker models with a ceramic bowl heat up much more slowly and probably would take 3 hours to cook.\nI suggest checking about halfway through the cooking time to see how the rice is cooking. If it is drying out (could be your lid isn't tight fitting, or the rice just needs more water), add another half cup to cup of water.\nFluff the rice with a fork to serve. Add more salt to taste.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nBaked Chicken Marinara Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 35 minutesYield: Makes 6 servings\nINGREDIENTS\nSauce:\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n3 shallots, peeled, finely chopped\n4 garlic cloves, finely (about 4 teaspoons)\n1 28-ounce can crushed tomatoes\n2 teaspoons dried oregano\n1/4 teaspoon dried crushed red pepper flakes\n1/2 cup chopped fresh basil\nChicken:\n3/4 cup breadcrumbs\n3/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese\n1/2 cup all purpose flour\n2 large eggs, beaten\n9 boneless chicken thighs (skinless or skin-on, your preference), if large pieces, then cut in half\n4 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n3/4 cup grated mozzarella cheese\nMETHOD\n1 Make the sauce: Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in heavy large saucepan over medium heat. Add the shallots and saut\xc3\xa9 until tender, about 4 minutes. Add the garlic and cook a minute more.\nAdd the tomatoes, oregano, and crushed red pepper flakes. Simmer until sauce thickens, about 10 minutes. Stir in the basil and season to taste with salt and pepper. Set aside.\n2 Bread the chicken pieces: Combine the grated Parmesan and the breadcrumbs in a shallow bowl. Put the flour in another separate bowl, and the beaten eggs in another bowl.\nDredge each piece of chicken first in the flour, then dip in the beaten eggs, and then dredge in the breadcrumb mixture.\n3 Preheat oven to 350\xc2\xb0F.\n4 Brown the chicken on the stovetop: Heat 4 Tbsp of olive oil in heavy large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.\nWorking in batches if necessary, add chicken and saut\xc3\xa9 until golden brown and cooked through, about 4 minutes per side.\n5 Bake the chicken with the sauce and cheese: Place chicken pieces on an oven-proof serving dish. Spoon sauce over chicken pieces. Sprinkle with Mozzarella cheese.\nBake for 10 minutes at 350\xc2\xb0F, or microwave on high heat for 10-20 seconds, just until the cheese has melted.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nGreen Bean Casserole from Scratch Recipe\nPrep time: 45 minutesCook time: 20 minutesYield: 8 to 10 servings\nMake-ahead: Store the fried onions in an airtight container at room temperature and refrigerate the prepared filling. Wait to top the casserole with the onions until just before baking. Cooking time may be slightly longer.\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the fried onions:\n1 red onion, thinly sliced\n1 1/2 cup buttermilk\n1 cup all-purpose flour\n1 cup Panko crumbs\n2 tablespoon mixed dried herbs - parsley, dill, thyme, whatever you want!\nSalt, for seasoning\nVegetable oil, for frying\nFor the casserole:\n2 pounds green beans, trimmed and cut into 2-inch lengths\n1/4 cup (1/2 stick) regular salted butter\n1 pound crimini or button mushrooms, trimmed and sliced\n3 cloves garlic, minced\n2 teaspoons fresh thyme (or 1 teaspoon dried thyme)\n2 to 3 tablespoons all-purpose flour\n1 1/4 cup half-and-half\n1 1/4 cup low sodium chicken broth\n1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Prepare the onions for frying: In a bowl, combine the sliced red onions and the buttermilk. Toss to coat the onions, then place them in the fridge for at least 15 minutes.\nIn another small bowl, whisk together flour, panko, and dried mixed herbs.\n2 Heat the oil for deep-frying: Fill a Dutch oven or other deep pot with about 2 inches of vegetable oil, and heat to 375F, or until shimmering but not smoking (lower the heat if you start to see wisps of smoke). To check that the oil is hot enough, toss in a pinch of panko mixture; if it starts to bubble and fry, you\xe2\x80\x99re ready to go.\nSet a baking sheet lined with paper towels near the stove to drain the fried onions.\n3 Deep-fry the onions: Working in handfuls, lift the onions from the buttermilk and toss them in the flour/panko mixture.\nGently lower the coated onions into the hot oil and fry until deep golden brown. Lift the onions from the oil with a heat-proof slotted spoon or tongs, and place on the paper towels to drain.\n4 Preheat the oven to 375F. Set a strainer over your sink and prepare a bowl with ice water.\n5 Blanch the green beans: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the green beans and boil for 5 to 6 minutes until just tender, but still slightly crisp.\nDrain and then shock the green beans in the bowl of cold water to stop the cooking process. When cool, drain again and set aside.\n6 Cook the mushrooms: Melt the butter in a large skillet and add in the mushrooms. Season with salt and cook until softened and tender. Add in the garlic and thyme.\n7 Make the creamy sauce: Sprinkle the flour over the mushrooms and stir until the mushrooms are coated. Stir in the half-and-half and the chicken broth.\nBring the mixture to a simmer and allow the sauce to thicken. Stir in the Parmesan cheese and green beans.\n8 Assemble and bake the casserole: Transfer the creamy green bean and mushroom mixture to a 3-quart or 9x13 casserole dish. Scatter the fried onions over top, and bake in the oven for 15 to 20 minutes, until the casserole is bubbling. Serve hot.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nCheesy Funeral Potatoes From Scratch Recipe\nPrep time: 35 minutesCook time: 45 minutesYield: 8 servings\nAdapt this recipe to suit your time, needs, and preferences: frozen shredded potatoes can be substituted for fresh, and canned cream of chicken soup can be substituted for homemade.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 1/2 pounds Russet potatoes (about 3 large or 4 small potatoes)\n8 tablespoons of butter, divided\n1/2 large onion, finely chopped (about a cup)\n1/3 red bell pepper, finely chopped (about a 1/2 cup)\n2 cups homemade cream of chicken soup (store-bought will also work)\n2 cups shredded mild cheddar cheese\n1 cup sour cream\n1 1/4 teaspoon salt, divided\n1 teaspoon fresh ground black pepper\n1 1/2  cups panko bread crumbs\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat the oven to 350\xc2\xb0F. Butter an 8x8 baking dish.\n2 Parboil the potatoes: Scrub the potatoes clean, but leave the skins on. Place them in a large pot and cover with water. Bring to a boil. Allow to boil for about 10 minutes.\nTurn off heat and let the potatoes sit in the hot water for another 10 minutes. When ready, you should be able to pierce the potatoes with a fork, but still feel slight resistance. Drain the potatoes and set aside until cool enough to handle.\nIf making the potatoes ahead, cool to room temp, cover, and store in fridge for up to 3 days.\n3 Meanwhile, cook the onions and peppers: In a medium skillet, melt 5 tablespoons butter, cook the onions and bell pepper until the onions are soft and translucent, about 6 minutes. Set aside.\n4 Peel and shred the potatoes: Once the potatoes are cool enough to handle, score them along their equator with a paring knife. Twist each side in opposite directions to remove skin. The skin should pull off easily. If any bits of skin remain, trim them off with a knife.\nShred the potatoes using a food processor fitted with the shredder disk, or shred them by hand using the large holes on a cheese grater.\n5 Assemble the casserole: Transfer shredded potatoes to a large bowl, and mix with the cooked onions, pepper, cream of chicken soup, cheddar cheese, sour cream, 1 teaspoon of salt, and pepper.\nStir until thoroughly combined. Spread into casserole dish.\n6 Toast the breadcrumbs: In the same pan where you cooked the onions, melt remaining 3 tablespoons of butter over medium heat. Add the panko and remaining 1/4 teaspoon of salt. Stir to coat.\nToast panko, stirring frequently, until it takes on a golden hue, about 5 minutes. Sprinkle evenly over the top of the potatoes.\n7 Bake at 350\xc2\xb0F for 45 minutes. When done, the potatoes should be bubbling around the edges, and the panko top will be golden.  \n8 Cool for 10 minutes, then spoon onto plates.  \nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nSalsa Verde Chicken Bake Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 30 minutesYield: Serves 4\nWhile the chicken is cooking, prepare some rice or quinoa to serve with the chicken. The recipe produces a lot of sauce which will go well with the sides.\nYou could easily make this with boneless, skinless chicken thighs as well. You may need to cook them just a few minutes longer than the breasts.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 1/4 to 1 1/2 pounds boneless skinless chicken breasts\n1 3/4 cups (1 15-ounce jar) tomatillo salsa verde\n4 ounces grated Monterey jack and/or pepper jack cheese\n1/2 cup chopped fresh cilantro (optional)\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat oven to 350\xc2\xb0F.\n2 Cut chicken breasts and line baking dish with them: Cut the chicken breasts into halves.\nLine a 1 1/2 to 2 quart casserole baking dish with the chicken pieces. Try to cover the bottom as completely as you can with the chicken.\n3 Cover the chicken pieces with the salsa verde. Cover completely, there should be no exposed chicken or it will dry out.\n4 Bake in a 350\xc2\xb0F oven for 25-30 minutes. If you have a meat thermometer, use it. The chicken should be removed from the oven when the internal temperature of the breast meat reaches 150\xc2\xb0F.\n5 Sprinkle cheese over the chicken, increase the oven heat to 400\xc2\xb0F and return to the oven for another 5-10 minutes, enough time for the cheese to melt and the sauce to get bubbly.\nRemove from oven. Serve immediately. Spoon over cooked rice or quinoa. Sprinkle with chopped fresh cilantro. Serve with tortilla chips for crunch if you would like.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Print\nBagel Breakfast Casserole with Sausage, Egg, and Cheese Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesCook time: 45 minutesYield: 8 servings\nINGREDIENTS\n6 (20-ounce package) everything bagels\n7 large eggs\n2 1/2 cups half-and-half\n1 teaspoon kosher salt\n1/8 teaspoon black pepper\n1/2 tablespoon vegetable oil\n1 pound breakfast sausage (I used sage-flavored)\n1 red bell pepper, diced (about 1 cup)\n1 small yellow onion, peeled and diced (about 1 cup)\n2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley, divided\n3 cups (8 ounces) sharp cheddar cheese, shredded and divided\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Prep the oven: Preheat your oven to 350\xc2\xb0F, then lightly grease or butter a 13\xe2\x80\x9dx 9\xe2\x80\x9d casserole dish.\n2 Prep the bagels: Using a serrated bread knife, cut each bagel into bite-size pieces. I like to cut the bagel in half (from top to bottom) and then cut each half into fourths. Try to cut the bagel into pieces that are no larger than an inch.\n3 Make the egg mix and combine with the bagels: In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs, half-and-half, salt, and pepper until no yolk is visible and the mixture is smooth.\nAdd the cut bagels to the egg mixture and, using a large spoon or spatula, toss to coat the bread in the liquid. Set this to the side to allow the bread to soak while you brown the sausage.\n3 Cook the sausage, onion, and pepper: Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat until it begins to shimmer (this should take about a minute).\nAdd the breakfast sausage to the pan and begin to brown it. Break up the sausage into small chunks with a wooden spoon until the sausage is about the size of pistachios. It should not look minced.\nOnce the sausage has cooked through and browned (about 5 minutes), create a well in the center of the pan using your spoon. Add the diced peppers and the onions. Stir them with the sausage and cook the mixture for an additional 3 to 4 minutes, or until the veggies are glossy and soft.\nDrain any excess fat by straining the mixture in a colander, then allow the mixture to cool for 5 minutes. This is a great time to shred your cheese if you haven\xe2\x80\x99t already.\n4 Combine the sausage, bagel and egg mixture. Once your sausage mix has cooled slightly, add it to the bagel and egg mixture. Add 1 tablespoon of the parsley and 2 cups of the cheddar cheese. Toss the ingredients together to combine evenly.\n5 Assemble the casserole: Pour the mixture into the prepared casserole dish and cover with aluminum foil.\nMake-ahead step: At this point, you can place the dish into the refrigerator overnight and bake in the morning. Once you\xe2\x80\x99re ready to bake, remove the casserole dish twenty minutes prior to baking, then proceed as follows.\n6 Bake the casserole: Bake, covered with foil, in the preheated oven for 20 minutes and then carefully remove the pan from the oven and remove the foil.\nReturn the pan to the oven and bake for an additional 25 minutes or until the middle is no longer jiggling, and the surface has browned.\n7 Cool and serve: Remove the pan from the oven and immediately top with the remaining cheese and parsley. Allow the casserole to cool for 10 minutes prior to serving.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Save It Print\nChicken with Creamy Cassis Sauce Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 20 minutesYield: Serves 3 to 4\nINGREDIENTS\n4 boneless, skinless chicken breast halves or cutlets (about 1 1/4 pounds)\n1/3 cup flour\nSalt\nFreshly ground black pepper\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n1/3 cup dry white wine\n1/4 cup cr\xc3\xa8me de cassis (or a teaspoon of Dijon)\n1/4 cup heavy cream\n2 tablespoons unsalted butter\nMETHOD\n1 Dredge chicken: Rinse the chicken breasts and pat dry with paper towels. Dredge them in flour, shake off the excess flour and season with salt and pepper.\n2 Brown chicken on both sides: Heat oil in a large skillet on medium high. Place the chicken breasts in the skillet and cook, turning once, until both sides are golden brown and the chicken is just cooked through, about 10 minutes.\nTransfer the chicken to a platter, cover with foil to keep warm.\n3 Make sauce: Discard excess fat in the skillet. Add the wine and deglaze, scraping up the browned bits. Boil the wine down for half a minute, add the cr\xc3\xa8me de cassis and the cream.\nContinue to boil down the mixture until it is reduced by a third. Whisk in the butter. Add salt and pepper and spoon over chicken breasts to serve.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nAir Fryer Crispy Cauliflower Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 12 minutesYield: Serves 6\nTo cook without an air fryer: Preheat the oven to 350\xcb\x9aF. Spread the cauliflower florets out on a baking sheet and bake for 20-30 minutes, or until cauliflower is crisp. Rotate the cauliflower once during baking so they cook evenly.\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the blue cheese dip:\n1/4 cup Greek yogurt\n1/4 cup mayonnaise\n1/4 cup crumbled blue cheese\nPinch of ground black pepper\nDash of hot sauce\nFor the crispy cauliflower:\n1 head cauliflower\n1 teaspoon kosher salt\n1/2 teaspoon chili powder\n1/2 teaspoon garlic powder\n2 large eggs + 1/4 cup water\n1 cup breadcrumbs\nNonstick spray, for air fryer\nSpecial equipment:\nAir Fryer\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Make the blue cheese dip: Stir together ingredients in a medium bowl. Keep in fridge until needed.\n2 Prepare the cauliflower: Cut the cauliflower into florets. It\xe2\x80\x99s okay to have a few different sizes, but try to make sure there are no florets bigger than about 1 1/2 inches.\n3 Bread the cauliflower: In a medium bowl toss florets with salt, chili powder, and garlic powder. In a separate small bowl, add eggs and water and whisk together. Add the egg mixture to the bowl with the cauliflower and toss to coat. Once the cauliflower is coated with the egg mixture, toss with breadcrumbs and coat well.\n3 Air-fry the cauliflower: Spray the basket of an air fryer with nonstick spray and place as many cauliflower florets in the basket as will fit in a single layer. Return the basket to the fryer and cook at 350\xcb\x9aF for 7 minutes. Then flip the florets and fry for another 7 minutes.\nRepeat until all cauliflower is done.\n4 Serve! Serve cauliflower immediately once all batches are done, or serve on a rolling basis as the batches come out of the fryer. Cauliflower is best right out of the fryer! Serve with the blue cheese dip as an appetizer or side dish.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nRoasted Cauliflower Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 30 minutesYield: Serves 4\nThis recipe is more of a method than a precise recipe with exact amounts. Sprinkle as much or as little Parmesan cheese as you want.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 head cauliflower, cut into florets\n2 to 3 cloves garlic, peeled and chopped\n1 tablespoon lemon juice (or about half a lemon)\nExtra virgin olive oil\nCoarse salt and freshly ground black pepper\nFreshly grated Parmesan cheese\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat oven, prepare pan: Preheat oven to 400\xc2\xb0F (205\xc2\xb0C). Lightly oil a large roasting pan or baking sheet, or line with aluminum foil.\n2 Prep the cauliflower:  Place the cauliflower florets in a bowl. Toss with minced garlic. Sprinkle with lemon juice. Drizzle with olive oil and toss so that the florets are lightly coated with oil.\n3 Spread on roasting pan and sprinkle with salt and pepper: Spread the florets out into a single layer on the roasting pan. Sprinkle with salt and pepper.\n4 Roast until lightly browned: Roast the cauliflower at 400\xc2\xb0F (205\xc2\xb0C), uncovered, for 25 to 30 minutes, or until the tops are lightly brown. Use a fork to test for doneness; the tines should easily pierce the cauliflower when done.\n5 Sprinkle with Parmesan: Remove the cauliflower from the oven and sprinkle generously with Parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nHow to Make the Best Cauliflower Pizza Crust\nPrep time: 30 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: 1 11-inch pizza (8 slices)\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the cauliflower pizza crust:\n2 cups cauliflower florets (7 ounces), cut into 1/2-inch pieces\n1/2 cup corn flour (or masa harina) (57 g)\n1 large egg\n2 tablespoons olive oil\n1/4 teaspoon Morton kosher salt\n2 tablespoons cornstarch\n5 ounces grated Parmesan cheese\nSuggested toppings:\n1/2 cup tomato sauce, homemade or store-bought\n4 ounces fresh or shredded mozzarella cheese\nSliced tomatoes, basil, pepperoni, ham, pineapple, mushrooms, and/or olives (enough to lightly coat the cheese)\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat oven: Place the oven rack in the upper-middle position and preheat the oven to 475\xc2\xbaF.\n2 Process the dough: Add cauliflower florets, corn flour, egg, olive oil, and salt to a food processor. Process on high speed, scraping down the bowl every 30 seconds, until a smooth and sticky puree if formed\xe2\x80\x94about 3 minutes total.\nAdd the cornstarch and process on high speed for 30 seconds. Add Parmesan cheese and pulse until just combined, 5 to 6 pulses.\n3 Shape the crust: Lightly grease a piece of parchment paper with olive oil. Transfer pizza dough to the paper. Lightly sprinkle more corn flour on top.\nUse your hands to press and shape the dough into a 10-inch circle, then use a rolling pin to gently roll out the dough to about 11-inch circle. Dust the dough with more corn flour as needed to prevent sticking while shaping and rolling.\n4 Par-bake the crust: Bake the crust for 10 minutes. Remove the crust from the oven and allow it to cool for 3 minutes, and then run a spatula underneath the crust to carefully remove and then transfer to a wire rack set inside a baking sheet. Discard the parchment.\n5 Add toppings: Spread the pizza sauce over the crust, leaving a 1/2-inch border. Place the cheese and tomatoes (or other toppings) on top.\n6 Bake the pizza: Bake until the cheese is melted and pizza edges are golden and lightly crisp, 5 to 7 minutes.\n7 Serve: Garnish pizza with fresh basil leaves, sprinkle with salt and black pepper.\nLeftovers will keep for about a week. To reheat, place on a foil-lined baking sheet and cook at 375\xc2\xbaF until the cheese is melted and the crust is warm and crisp, 5 to 7 minutes.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nRoasted Curried Cauliflower Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 25 minutesYield: Serves 4 to 6\nIf you don't have yellow curry powder, you can substitute with a mix of ground cumin, ground turmeric, ground ginger, and ground coriander. The turmeric is what gives yellow curry powder its yellow color. Watch out, it stains!\nINGREDIENTS\n1 large (or 2 small) head(s) cauliflower, cored, broken into large-ish florets, florets sliced into 1/2-inch slices\n1/2 onion, peeled, thickly sliced, root to tip\n4 cloves garlic, sliced\n2 Tbsp lemon juice\n1/3 cup (80 ml) extra virgin olive oil\n1 1/2 teaspoons yellow curry powder\n1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat oven, line baking pan with foil: Pre-heat oven to 425\xc2\xb0F (220\xc2\xb0C) with a rack on the top third of the oven. Line a large rimmed baking with foil.\n2 Whisk together garlic, lemon juice, oil, curry, cinnamon, salt: Put the garlic, lemon juice, olive oil, curry powder, cinnamon, salt, and pepper in a large bowl. Whisk vigorously until well combined.\n3 Coat floret slices with curry mixture:  Add the cauliflower and onion slices to the bowl with the curry and toss to coat. Spread the cauliflower and onion slices on the baking sheet in a single layer.\n4 Roast in oven: Roast in oven at 425\xc2\xb0F (220\xc2\xb0C) for 25 to 30 minutes until well browned. Check halfway through the cooking, and rotate the pan for more even cooking.\nServe immediately or at room temperature.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nCauliflower Cheddar Soup Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesCook time: 40 minutesYield: Serves 6 to 8\nINGREDIENTS\n2 Tbsp butter\n2 cups sliced onion\n1 1/2 cups sliced celery (about 2 to 3 ribs)\n1/2 cup sliced carrot (1 small carrot)\n1 1/2 Tbsp minced garlic\n2 Yukon gold potatoes, peeled and thinly sliced, about 1 1/2 to 2 cups\n6 cups chicken stock\n6 cups roughly chopped cauliflower (see How to Cut and Core Cauliflower)\n2 bay leaves\n1 1/2 teaspoons fresh thyme leaves, or 1 teaspoon dried thyme\n1 teaspoon kosher salt\n1/8 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper\n1 1/2 cups grated sharp cheddar cheese (about 6 ounces)\n1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Saut\xc3\xa9 the onions, celery, carrots, garlic: Heat butter in a large 5- to 6- quart Dutch oven or thick bottomed pot on medium high heat. Add the onions, celery, and carrots.\nCook for 5 to 8 minutes until the onions are softened. Add the minced garlic and cook a minute more.\n2 Add the potatoes, stock, cauliflower, bay leaves, thyme, salt and black pepper. Heat on high and bring the stock to a simmer. Lower the heat to maintain a simmer. Partially cover and cook for 12 to 15 minutes, or until the vegetables are completely tender.\n3 Pur\xc3\xa9e until smooth: Remove from heat and remove the bay leaves. Either using an immersion blender or a standing blender, pur\xc3\xa9e the soup mixture until completely smooth.\n4 Add the cheddar cheese and Worcestershire: Slowly add the grated cheddar cheese, continuing to pur\xc3\xa9e the soup as you add the cheese, until completely blended. Stir in the Worcestershire sauce.\nAdd more salt and pepper to taste, if needed.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nCauliflower Chickpea Curry Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 30 minutesYield: Serves 4 to 6\nFor those of you who simply cannot tolerate cilantro, I would recommend slicing some arugula and adding that to the curry as it cooks, or toss with fresh chives or thinly sliced onion greens. It won't be the same, but the greens will help brighten the dish.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil or vegetable oil\n2 teaspoons of yellow curry powder\n1 medium yellow onion, cut in half and then sliced across the grain (about 1 1/2 cups sliced onion)\n1-inch piece of ginger root, peeled and grated (1 teaspoon grated)\n1 1/2 cups cooked chickpeas (garbanzo beans) (a 15-ounce can, rinsed and drained)\n1 head cauliflower, cored, florets separated (see How to Cut and Core Cauliflower)\n1 15-ounce can of whole, peeled tomatoes\n1 teaspoon Kosher salt\n1/8 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper\n1 bay leaf\n1/2 cup water\n1/2 cup (packed) roughly chopped cilantro (leaves and young stems)\n2 teaspoons minced fresh mint leaves\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Saut\xc3\xa9 curry powder and onion: Heat the oil in a thick-bottomed pot (with lid) on medium heat. Add the curry powder to the oil and let cook for a minute until fragrant.\nAdd the sliced onion, toss with the curried oil. Let cook until softened about 6 to 8 minutes.\n2 Add ginger, chickpeas, tomatoes, cauliflower, bay leaf, salt, pepper, water: Once the onions have softened, add the ginger and the chickpeas, toss to coat with everything.\nAdd the tomatoes, shredding the whole tomatoes with your fingers as you add them to the pot. Include any tomato juice from the can.\nAdd the cauliflower florets, the salt, pepper, bay leaf, and water.\n3 Simmer until cauliflower is cooked through: Bring to a simmer. Lower the heat and cover. Cook 15 to 18 minutes until the cauliflower is cooked through and tender.\n4 Toss with cilantro and mint to serve: Remove from heat. Toss with fresh chopped cilantro and minced mint.\nServe with rice or rice pilaf. If you want dollop a little sour cream or plain yogurt over it (non-vegan option).\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Print\nAutumn Tabbouleh with Cauliflower, Carrots, and Golden Beets Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 20 minutesResting time time: 30 minutesYield: 4 to 6 servings\nThis salad is best if you can give it a full 30 minutes to rest before serving. It can also be made up to 3 days ahead and kept refrigerated.\nTo make this dish gluten-free, substitute quinoa for the bulgur. (Follow package directions to cook the quinoa.)\nINGREDIENTS\n1 cup bulgur wheat\n1/2 teaspoon kosher salt\n1/4 head medium cauliflower\n2 medium carrots, peeled and trimmed\n2 small golden beets, peeled and trimmed\n1/4 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice\n1 teaspoon kosher salt\n1/4 cup olive oil\n2 cups minced parsley\n1 bunch scallions, trimmed and minced\n1 tablespoon sherry vinegar\nGround black pepper or to taste\nSpecial Equipment:\nMandolin\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Make the bulgur: Bring 3 cups of water to a boil in a small saucepan. When the water boils, stir in the bulgur and salt. Cover the pan and remove from heat. Let the bulgur sit for 20 to 30 minutes or until tender. Strain bulgur with a mesh strainer, shaking to remove as much water as possible.\n2 Prep the vegetables: Break the cauliflower into large florets and carefully slice them 1/16-inch thick on a mandolin. Next, switch to a julienne blade and julienne 1/8-inch thick to julienne carrots and beets. (The vegetables can be shredded on a box grater or in a food processor, instead.)\n3 Marinate the vegetables: Combine the vegetables in a large serving bowl and toss with salt and lemon juice.
