If you feel more comfortable taking the chicken off the heat at a higher internal temperature, please feel free to do so.\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the brine:\n4 cups water\n1/4 cup Diamond Crystal kosher salt (or 3 tablespoons sea salt or Morton's kosher salt)\nFor the chicken:\n1 1/2 to 2 pounds boneless skinless chicken breasts\n3 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil (plus more olive oil for the grill)\n1 1/2 teaspoons paprika\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Brine the chicken breast: In a large bowl, whisk the salt in the water to dissolve. Add the chicken breasts to the brine. Put in the refrigerator and chill for 30 minutes.\n2 Prepare your grill: Arrange your grill so that one side is for high direct heat, and the other side is cooler. Alternatively, you can use a grill pan, set over medium-high heat.\n3 Coat chicken with oil and paprika: Remove chicken breasts from brine and pat dry. Coat with olive oil, and sprinkle evenly with paprika.\n4 Grill the chicken breasts: Brush some olive oil on the grill grates. Place chicken breasts on the hot side of the grill (or on the grill pan). Let the chicken grill, undisturbed, until the pieces start getting some grill marks (you can lift up one to check).\nWhen the chicken pieces have browned on one side, turn them over, and move them to the cooler side of the grill. Cover, and let them finish cooking.\nRemove chicken from grill when the internal temperature of the chicken reaches 155\xc2\xb0F.\n5 Let the chicken breasts rest: Cover the breasts with foil. The chicken will continue to cook in its residual heat while it rests. Let it rest 5 to 10 minutes before cutting and serving.\nServe with grilled peppers, pineapple salsa, or just a squeeze of lime!\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b"Save It Print\nChicken Tikka Masala Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 20 minutesYield: 4 to 6 servings\nLeftover chicken tikka masala tastes phenomenal the next day because the spices develop more flavor overnight.\nAvoid using Greek yogurt if possible for this recipe. If it's all you can find, buy the Greek yogurt with the highest fat content you can find and mix it with a little whole milk to get the consistency of regular yogurt. This will give the sauce some insurance against separating.\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the chicken:\n1 1/4 pounds boneless skinless chicken breasts, thighs, or a mix\n6 tablespoons plain whole milk yogurt\n1/2 tablespoon grated ginger\n3 cloves of garlic, minced\n1 teaspoon cumin\n1 teaspoon paprika\n1 1/4 teaspoons salt\nFor the tikka masala sauce:\n2 tablespoons canola oil, divided\n1 small onion, thinly sliced (about 5 ounces, or 1 1/2 cups sliced)\n2 teaspoons grated ginger\n4 cloves garlic, minced\n1 tablespoon ground coriander\n2 teaspoons paprika\n1 teaspoon garam masala\n1/2 teaspoon turmeric\n1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper\n1 (14-ounce) can crushed fire-roasted tomatoes (regular crushed tomatoes work, too)\n6 tablespoons plain whole milk yogurt\n1/4 to 1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper\n1/2 teaspoon salt\nCooked rice, to serve\nCilantro, to garnish\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Prepare the chicken: Trim chicken thighs of any extra fat. Chop into bite-sized pieces about 1/2 to 1-inch wide. Place the chicken thigh pieces to a medium bowl.\nAdd the yogurt, ginger, garlic, cumin, paprika and salt. Using your hands, combine the chicken with the spices until the chicken is evenly coated.\n2 Marinate the chicken: Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and let the chicken marinate in the fridge for at least 45 minutes or as long as overnight. (Marinating for 4 to 6 hours is perfect.)\n3 Cook the chicken: In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of canola oil over medium-high heat. Add the chicken thigh pieces and cook for about 6 to 7 minutes, until they\xe2\x80\x99re cooked through. Transfer to a plate and set aside.\n4 Toast the spices: Wipe down the pan you used to cook the chicken. Heat remaining canola oil over medium heat. Add the onions and cook for 5 minutes, until softened, stirring often.\nAdd the grated ginger, minced garlic, coriander, paprika, garam masala, turmeric, black pepper, salt, and cayenne. Let the spices cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds to a minute.\n5 Make the sauce: Add the crushed tomatoes to the pan with the spices and let everything cook for 4 minutes, stirring often. Add the yogurt and stir to combine.\n6 Simmer the sauce: Reduce the heat to medium-low and let the sauce simmer for another 4 minutes. Add the chicken pieces to the pan and coat with sauce.\n7 Serve: Serve over cooked basmati rice and garnish with cilantro.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nHerbes de Provence Skillet Chicken with Potatoes and Greens Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 35 minutesMarinade time: 2 hoursYield: 4 to 6\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the marinade:\n1 1/2 pounds boneless skinless chicken tenders, tenderloin, or thinly sliced chicken breasts\n1 1/2 tablespoons herbes de Provence\n1 1/4 teaspoons Kosher salt\n1 teaspoon freshly ground pepper\nZest of one lemon\n1 1/2 tablespoons lemon juice\n3 cloves minced garlic\n2 tablespoons olive oil\nFor the vegetables:\n2 teaspoons olive oil\n3 tablespoons butter, divided\n1 1/2 pounds B-sized or baby potatoes\n1/2 yellow onion\n1/2 teaspoon Kosher salt\nA few cracks of freshly ground pepper\n2 handfuls (2 packed cups) Swiss chard or spinach\n1/3 cup halved pimento-stuffed Spanish olives\n1 teaspoon red wine vinegar\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Label the bag: Use a sharpie to write the date and title of the recipe on a gallon-sized zip top bag so you can easily find it on SimplyRecipes.com when you want to cook it. Alternatively, write the cooking instructions on the bag, and date it.\n2 Combine the ingredients: Roll down the opening of the bag a little just so you don\xe2\x80\x99t accidently get raw chicken juices on the outside of the zip top. Add the chicken, spices, zest, lemon juice, garlic and olive oil.\nRemove as much air as possible and seal the bag. Smoosh the chicken around so it\xe2\x80\x99s coated in the marinade.\n3 Lay the chicken flat in the freezer and freeze for up to 6 months:\nAlternatively, you could skip the freezer and let it marinade in the fridge for a couple of hours and up to two days, then cook it according to the directions below.\n 4 Thaw the chicken before cooking: When ready to cook, take the chicken out of the freezer in the morning before you go to work, and it will be ready to cook by the end of the day.\n5 Prepare the vegetables: If the b-sized potatoes are larger than a golf ball, quarter them; if they are smaller just half them. Slice the onion. Wash the Swiss chard, remove the stems and chop them. Then cut the leaves into strips about an inch thick. Cut the olives in half.\n  6 Cook the chicken: Set a large skillet over medium heat add 2 teaspoons of olive oil and 1 tablespoon butter. Once the oil shimmers and the butter melts, add the chicken and any marinade in the bag.\nIf any chicken is folded up, unfold it so it lays flat in the pan. Cook the chicken for 2 minutes, then flip it.\n7 Add the vegetables: Add the potatoes, onion, and 1/4 cup water to the pan with the chicken. Cover with a lid. Let everything simmer together for about 10 minutes.\n8 Finish the potatoes and make the sauce: Remove the chicken to a plate (leaving the vegetables in the skillet) and tent with foil. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter, 1/4 teaspoon of salt and a few cracks of freshly ground pepper to the skillet. Stir the potatoes, cover and cook for another 10 minutes.\nTurn the heat up to medium high to reduce the liquid and finish cooking the potatoes uncovered. This should take about 2 to 3 minutes depending on how much liquid is in the pan.\nWhen you can easily pierce the potatoes with a fork, add the chard leaves and chopped stems, olives, and red wine vinegar. Toss gently until the greens are just wilted.\n9 Serve: Nestle the chicken back into the pan. Bring the whole thing over to the table and serve.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nClassic Baked Chicken\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 50 minutesYield: Serves 4\nEven if you intend to eat the baked chicken without its skin, leave the skin on for baking because it prevents the chicken pieces from drying out while they bake.\nIf you bought a whole chicken to start with, the chicken may have come with the neck and gizzards (often in paper in the cavity of the chicken). Use the chicken back and these giblets to make stock for gravy. Chop up the back a little, and put the back, gizzard, and neck into a small saucepan and cover with water by a half inch or so. Bring to a simmer and let simmer while your chicken is baking. Then strain and use the stock for making a richly flavored gravy.\nINGREDIENTS\nOne 3 to 4 pound chicken, cut into 8 parts (2 breasts, 2 thighs, 2 legs, 2 wings), excluding the back\nExtra virgin olive oil\nKosher salt\nFreshly ground black pepper\n1/2 cup low sodium chicken stock (see Recipe Note) or white wine for the gravy (optional)\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Trim and salt the chicken: Trim the chicken pieces of excess fat. Pat the chicken pieces dry with a paper towel. Sprinkle all sides with salt. Let the chicken pieces sit for 15 to 20 minutes to take the chill off.\n2 Preheat the oven to 400\xc2\xb0F (205\xc2\xb0C).\n3 Prep the chicken: Pat the chicken pieces dry with a paper towel. Rub olive oil over the chicken pieces and on the bottom of the roasting pan.\nSprinkle the chicken pieces all over with black pepper and a little more salt.\nArrange the chicken pieces in the pan so that all the pieces are skin-side up, and the largest pieces (the breasts) are in the center of the pan.\nDon't crowd the pan; allow room in between the pieces.\n4 Bake the chicken: Bake (uncovered) in the oven for 30 minutes at 400\xc2\xb0F (205\xc2\xb0C). This initial high heat will help brown the chicken.\nThen lower the heat to 350\xc2\xb0F (175\xc2\xb0C) and bake for and additional 10-30 minutes more until the juices run clear (not pink) when poked with a sharp knife or the internal temperature of the chicken breasts is 165\xc2\xb0F (74\xc2\xb0C), and of the thighs is 170\xc2\xb0F (77\xc2\xb0C) when tested with a meat thermometer.\nIf the chicken isn't browning well enough, place the chicken under the broiler for the last 5 minutes of cooking, until browned sufficiently.\n5 Let it rest: Remove from oven and transfer the chicken to a serving dish. Tent with aluminum foil and let rest for 5 to 10 minutes before serving.\n6 Make gravy: If you would like to make gravy with the drippings from the chicken, place the roasting pan with all its drippings on the stovetop and set the burner to medium heat.\nUse a metal spatula to scrape up the stuck drippings from the bottom of the pan. When the pan is hot, pour in some white wine or chicken stock to help loosen the drippings from the pan.\nTransfer the drippings and stock/wine mixture to a saucepan and heat on medium high until reduced to your desired thickness.\nIf you want the gravy even thicker, you can make a slurry with a little cornstarch or flour (a teaspoon) and water (1/4 cup), and add that to the gravy while it cooks.\n7 Serve: Serve with steamed rice, mashed potatoes, or Spanish rice.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nItalian Skillet Chicken with Spinach, Tomatoes, and Onions Recipe\nPrep time: 12 minutesCook time: 25 minutesYield: 4 to 6\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the marinade\n1 1/2 pounds boneless skinless chicken tenders, tenderloin, or thinly sliced chicken breasts\n1 tablespoon dried oregano\n2 1/2 teaspoons dried thyme\n1 1/2 teaspoons Kosher salt\n1 teaspoon dried basil\n1 teaspoon freshly ground pepper\nZest from 1 lemon\n3 tablespoons lemon juice, from about 1 lemon\n3 cloves garlic, minced\n2 tablespoons olive oil\nFor the vegetables\n2 teaspoons olive oil\n1 pint cherry tomatoes\n1 medium red onion\n2 large handfuls spinach, about 2 packed cups\n1 teaspoon capers\n1 tablespoon butter\nCrusty bread, to serve\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Label the bag: Use a sharpie to write the date and the title of the recipe on a gallon-sized zip top bag so you can easily find it on SimplyRecipes.com when you want to cook it. Alternatively, write the cooking instructions on the bag.\n2 Combine the ingredients: Roll down the opening of the bag a little just so you don\xe2\x80\x99t accidently get raw chicken juices on the outside of the zip top. Add the chicken, spices, zest,  lemon juice, garlic and olive oil.\nRemove as much air as possible and seal the bag. Smoosh the chicken around so it\xe2\x80\x99s coated in the marinade.\n3 Lay the chicken flat in the freezer and freeze for up to 6 months.\nAlternatively, you could skip the freezer and let it marinade in the fridge for a couple of hours and up to two days, then cook it according to the directions below.\n4 Thaw the chicken before cooking: Take the chicken out of the freezer in the morning before you go to work, and it will be ready to cook by the end of the day.\n5 Prepare the onion: Peel and trim the stem ends of the onion, but leave the stem intact so it can keep the onion layers together. Slice the onion in half. Then slice each half into 5 wedges leaving a little stem with each one.\n6 Cook the chicken: Set a large skillet over medium heat add 2 teaspoons of olive oil. Once the oil shimmers, add chicken and any marinade in the bag. If any chicken is folded up, unfolded it so it lays flat in the pan. Cook the chicken for 2 minutes, then flip it.\n7 Add the vegetables: Add the onion wedges, tomatoes, and capers. Cover with a lid. Let everything simmer together for 12 to 15 minutes. The tomatoes should be soft, and the onions dull in color.\n8 Check the chicken: Check the chicken to see if it\xe2\x80\x99s cooked through by cutting a piece open. If the juices run clear, and you don\xe2\x80\x99t see any pink the chicken is ready. Use a fork to remove the chicken to a plate and tent with foil.\n9 Finish the sauce: Turn the heat up to medium high. Add 1 tablespoon butter to the sauce. Stir it in and let the sauce reduce uncovered for about 2 minutes. Add the spinach stir to coat a couple of times until the spinach has wilted.\n10 To serve: Nestle the chicken back into the pan, and season to taste with salt and pepper.\nBring the skillet to the table. Spoon up chicken, vegetables and sauces into shallow bowls or plates. Serve with crusty bread to sop up the sauce.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Print\nQuick Chicken Pho Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 30 minutesYield: Serves 2\nFrom Andrea:\n"Great for pho beginners, this recipe is also terrific for cooks in a hurry. It involves less than 45 minutes, during which you\xe2\x80\x99ll doctor up store-bought broth so it says, \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m pho-ish.\xe2\x80\x9d\nThe keys to this streamlined approach include toasting spices and dry saut\xc3\xa9ing the ginger and green onion, which help to extract flavor fast. Poaching the chicken in the broth adds savory depth. You\xe2\x80\x99ll practice some fundamental pho techniques that you can apply elsewhere, too. Choose a broth that tastes like chicken, such as Swanson brand, which is less fussed up and easy to manipulate. You need two 14.5-ounce (411 g) cans or one 32-ounce (907 ml) carton."\nReprinted with permission from The Pho Cookbook: Easy to Adventurous Recipes for Vietnam\xe2\x80\x99s Favorite Soup and Noodles by Andrea Nguyen, copyright \xc2\xa9 2017. Published by Ten Speed Press, an imprint of Penguin Random House LLC.\nINGREDIENTS\n3/4-inch (2 cm) section ginger\n2 medium-large green onions\n1 very small (.5 oz | 15 g) bunch cilantro sprigs\n1 1/2 teaspoons coriander seeds\n1 whole clove\n3 1/2 to 4 cups (840 ml to 1 l) low-sodium chicken broth\n2 cups (480 ml) water\n6 to 8 ounces (180 to 225 g) boneless, skinless chicken breast or thighs\nAbout 1/2 teaspoon fine sea salt\n5 ounces (150 g) dried narrow flat rice noodles\n2 to 3 teaspoons fish sauce\nAbout 1/2 teaspoon organic sugar, or 1 teaspoon maple syrup (optional)\nPepper (optional)\nOptional extras: Bean sprouts, mint sprigs, Thai basil, cilantro leaves, lime wedges, thinly-sliced chili peppers\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Prepare the broth ingredients: Peel then slice the ginger into 4 or 5 coins. Smack with the flat side of a knife or meat mallet; set aside. Thinly slice the green parts of the green onion to yield 2 to 3 tablespoons; set aside for garnish. Cut the leftover sections into pinkie-finger lengths, bruise, then add to the ginger.\nCoarsely chop the leafy tops of the cilantro to yield 2 tablespoons; set aside for garnish. Set the remaining cilantro sprigs aside.\n2 Toast the broth ingredients: In a 3- to 4-quart (3 to 4 l) pot, toast the coriander seeds and clove over medium heat until fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes. Add the ginger and green onion sections. Stir for about 30 seconds, until aromatic.\n3 Add the broth and bring to a simmer: Slide the pot off heat, wait 15 seconds or so to briefly cool, then pour in the broth.\nReturn the pot to the burner, then add the water, cilantro sprigs, chicken, and salt. Bring to a boil over high heat, then lower the heat to gently simmer.\n4 Remove the chicken from the broth once cooked: After 5 to 10 minutes of simmering, the chicken should be firm and cooked through (press on it and it should slightly yield).\n5 Continue to simmer the broth without the chicken for another 15 to 20 minutes (for a total of 30 minutes simmering time).\n6 Shred the chicken: Transfer the chicken to a bowl, flush with cold water to arrest the cooking, then drain. Let cool, then cut or shred into bite-size pieces. Cover loosely to prevent drying.\n[Emma\'s note: If the chicken isn\'t quite cooked through when you begin to shred it, just split it into a few pieces and put it back in the broth for another few minutes until cooked through. The split pieces will quickly cook through.]\n7 Soak the rice noodles in hot water until pliable and opaque. Drain, rinse, and set aside.\n8 Strain the broth: When the broth is done, pour it through a fine-mesh strainer positioned over a 2-quart (2-liter) pot; line the strainer with muslin for superclear broth. Discard the solids. You should have about 4 cups.\nSeason with fish sauce and sugar (or maple syrup), if needed, to create a strong savory-sweet note.\n9 Finish the pho: Bring the strained broth to a boil over high heat. Put the noodles in a noodle strainer or mesh sieve and dunk in the hot broth to heat and soften, 5 to 60 seconds. Lift the noodles from the pot and divide between the 2 bowls. [Emma\'s note: I didn\'t find it necessary to soften my noodles any further. I just added them to the bowls and poured the hot broth over top. However, dunking them in the broth would make them more flavorful!]\nLower the heat to keep the broth hot while you arrange the chicken on top of the noodles and garnish with the chopped green onion, cilantro, and a sprinkling of pepper. Taste and adjust the broth\xe2\x80\x99s saltiness one last time. Return the broth to a boil and ladle into the bowls. Enjoy with any extras, if you like.\n[Emma\'s note: I just left the broth at a low simmer during this last step, rather than bringing it to a boil again. I thought it was plenty hot!]\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Save It Print\nSweet and Sour Chicken Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n1 pound of boneless and skinless chicken thighs or breasts, cut into 1" chunks\n1 egg white\n1/2 teaspoon kosher salt (1/4 teaspoon table salt)\n2 teaspoons cornstarch\n1 10-ounce can pineapple chunks (reserve juice)\n1/4 cup juice from the canned pineapple\n1/4 cup white vinegar\n1/4 cup ketchup\n1/2 teaspoon kosher salt (1/4 teaspoon table salt)\n2-3 tablespoons brown sugar\n1 tablespoon + 1 teaspoon cooking oil\n1 red bell pepper, cut into 1 inch chunks\n1 yellow bell pepper, cut into 1 inch chunks\n1 teaspoon grated fresh ginger\nMETHOD\n1 Coat chicken with egg white, salt, and cornstarch: In a bowl, combine the chicken with the egg white, salt and cornstarch. Stir to coat the chicken evenly. Let sit for 15 minutes at room temperature or up to overnight in the refrigerator.\n2 Make sweet sour sauce: Whisk together the pineapple juice, vinegar, ketchup, salt, and brown sugar.\n3 Stir-fry chicken: Heat a large frying pan or wok over high heat until a bead of water instantly sizzles and evaporates. Pour in the 1 tablespoon of cooking oil and swirl to coat. It\'s important that the pan is very hot.\nAdd the chicken and spread the chicken out in one layer. Let the chicken fry, untouched for 1 minute, until the bottoms are browned.\nFlip and fry the other side the same for 1 minute. The chicken should still be pinkish in the middle. Dish out the chicken onto a clean plate, leaving as much oil in the pan as possible.\n4 Stir fry bell pepper and ginger: Turn the heat to medium and add the remaining 1 teaspoon of cooking oil. Let the oil heat up and then add the bell pepper chunks and ginger. Fry for 1 minute.\n5 Add pineapple, sweet sour sauce, let simmer, add chicken: Add the pineapple chunks and the sweet and sour sauce. Turn the heat to high and when the sauce is simmering, add the chicken pieces back in.\nLet simmer for 1-2 minutes, until the chicken is cooked through. Timing depends on how thick you\'ve cut your chicken. The best way to tell if the chicken is done is to take a piece out and cut into it. If it\'s pink, add another minute to the cooking.\nTaste the sauce and add more brown sugar if you\xe2\x80\x99d like.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nMango Chicken Curry Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 1 hourYield: Serves 6\nMangoes that are slightly unripe, on the firm side, will hold up better in this recipe, but won't be as sweet as ripe mangoes. So, if you use firm, less than perfectly ripe mangoes, you may need to balance the recipe with more sugar or raisins. If you use sweet mangoes, you may need to balance the recipe with a little more vinegar.\nI highly recommend using full-fat coconut milk for this recipe (or any recipe that calls for coconut milk). Low fat coconut milk doesn't taste good. If you must use low fat coconut milk, add 2 Tbsp of heavy whipping cream to the recipe at the end.\nINGREDIENTS\n2 tablespoons vegetable oil\n1 large onion, chopped (1 1/2 to 2 cups)\n1/2 red bell pepper, chopped\n2 garlic cloves, minced\n2 tablespoons fresh minced ginger\n2 tablespoons yellow curry powder\n1/2 teaspoon ground cumin\n2 mangos, peeled and diced\n2 tablespoons cider vinegar or white vinegar\n1  13.5-ounce can (full-fat) coconut milk\n1 1/4 pound skinless boneless chicken thighs or breasts, cut into 1-inch pieces\n1/3 cup golden raisins (optional)\nSalt and pepper\nCilantro for garnish\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cook onions, bell pepper, garlic, ginger, spices: Heat oil in a large saut\xc3\xa9 pan over medium heat. Add onions and bell pepper cook, stirring occasionally, until soft, about 5 minutes.\nAdd the garlic and ginger and cook for another minute.\nAdd the curry powder and cumin, cook for a few more minutes. The spices will absorb some of the oil, so if anything begins to stick too much to the bottom of the pan, add a little more oil to the pan.\n2 Add the vinegar, coconut milk, and one of the two chopped mangoes to the pan. Increase the heat and bring to a boil, then lower the heat to maintain a low simmer for about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.\n3 Pur\xc3\xa9e sauce: Remove pan from heat. Scoop the sauce into a blender. Pur\xc3\xa9e the sauce, pulsing until smooth. Return the sauce to the pan.\n4 Add chicken pieces and raisins to the pan. Return to a low simmer. Cover the pan and let cook for 8-10 minutes. Chicken should be just cooked through. Use a knife to cut open the largest piece to check.\n5 Add remaining chopped mango to the pan. Stir in the cream, if using. Let cook at a very low temperature for another minute or two, uncovered. Do not let boil! Or the cream may curdle.\n6 Adjust seasonings: If a little too sweet, add a little more vinegar. If not sweet enough, you can add a dash of sugar. Add salt and pepper to taste.\nServe over rice. Garnish with cilantro.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b"Print\nEasy Chicken Parmesan Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 40 minutesYield: Serves 4\nYour sauce will only be as good as your tomatoes, so use a good quality canned tomato! We like Muir Glen brand crushed tomatoes (fire roasted or with basil), or Italian San Marzano tomatoes.\nGrating the onion will create smaller onion pieces and release more of the onion's juices, and is faster than chopping.\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the sauce:\n1/2 large yellow onion, grated (don't cut onion in half, just grate half of a whole onion), about 3/4 cup of grated onion\n1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil\n2 medium garlic cloves, minced\n1 (28-ounce) can crushed tomatoes\n1 teaspoon dried oregano\nPinch red pepper flakes\nPinch sugar\nFor the chicken:\n4 chicken breast cutlets (1 1/4 to 1 1/2 pounds)\nSalt\n2 large eggs\n1 cup breadcrumbs, Panko or homemade\n1 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese\n1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil\n2 tablespoons fresh basil leaves, thinly sliced\n8 ounces mozzarella cheese, sliced\nTo serve:\nCooked spaghetti, or sub rolls\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Start the sauce: Heat the olive oil in a saucepan on medium-high heat. Add the onions and saut\xc3\xa9 for 2 to 3 minutes. Add the minced garlic. Cook until fragrant, about a minute more.\nThen add the crushed tomatoes, oregano, red pepper flakes, and sugar. Bring to a simmer; reduce the heat to maintain the simmer. Cook, uncovered while you prepare the chicken (about 10 to 12 minutes).\n2 Preheat oven to 400\xc2\xb0F.\n3 Pound cutlets thin: Place the chicken cutlets one at a time between two layers of plastic wrap or wax paper. Use a meat hammer, mallet, rolling pin, or even a heavy empty wine bottle to pound or roll the chicken pieces to an even thickness of 1/4 to 1/2-inch. Sprinkle salt on both sides of the cutlets.\n4 Prepare breadcrumbs and eggs for dredging: In a shallow bowl (large enough to dredge the cutlets), mix together the breadcrumbs, 1/2 cup Parmesan, and pinch of salt. In separate shallow bowl, whisk together the eggs.\n5 Dredge cutlets and brown them: Heat 1/4 cup olive oil in a large saut\xc3\xa9 pan on medium-high heat until the oil is shimmering (not smoking) and a piece of breading dropped into it sizzles.\nWorking one cutlet at a time, dip the chicken cutlet into the egg mixture and then into the breadcrumbs. Working in batches as to not crowd the pan, place the dredged cutlets into the pan.\nLower the heat to medium and gently fry the chicken cutlets until they are golden brown on each side, about 3 to 4 minutes per side.\n6 Prep the chicken for the oven: Spread enough tomato sauce to thickly coat the bottom of a 9x13 casserole pan or baking dish. Once the cutlets are browned on both sides, arrange them on top of the tomato sauce in the baking dish.\nSpoon tomato sauce over each of the cutlets. Sprinkle the tops with sliced basil. Then lay slices of mozzarella over each cutlet and sprinkle with the remaining 1/2 cup of Parmesan cheese.\n7 Bake: Bake in the oven at 400\xc2\xb0F for 10 to 12 minutes, or until the mozzarella begins to brown.\n8 Serve: Serve with pasta and the remaining sauce, or in a large roll.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b'Save It Print\nClassic Chicken Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesPoaching chicken time: 20 minutesYield: Serves 4\nWe are poaching boneless skinless chicken breasts in salted water for this salad. You could also use any leftover cooked chicken meat, with or without the skin.\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the salad:\n1 pound boneless, skinless (raw) chicken breasts, cut into 2 1/2-inch chunks (or 2 to 3 cups cooked chicken meat)\n2 stalks celery, chopped\n1/2 red bell pepper, seeded and chopped\n4 to 6 green olives, pitted and minced\n1/4 cup chopped red onion\n1/2 to 1 whole apple, cored and chopped\n1/3 head iceberg head lettuce, sliced and chopped\nFor the dressing:\n5 tablespoons mayonnaise\n1 tablespoon plum preserves, or any sweet berry preserve (or a lesser amount of honey)\n2 teaspoons fresh squeezed lemon juice\nSalt and pepper to taste\nMETHOD\n1 Poach the chicken (skip if using already cooked chicken): Bring a pot with 2 quarts of well salted water (1 tablespoon salt) to a boil. Add the chicken breast (cut into large chunks) and return the water to a simmer. Then turn off the heat, and cover the pot. Let the chicken sit for 15 minutes (time it) or more while you prepare everything else.\n2 Make the dressing: Prepare the chicken salad dressing in a large bowl. Mix together the mayonnaise, preserves, and lemon juice. Taste for the proper balance of sweetness and acidity. The salad dressing should not be too sweet, nor too sour.\nAdd more preserves or lemon juice until you have reached the balance you want. Add salt and pepper to taste.\n3 Mix in the chopped celery, bell pepper, olives, red onion, and apple.\n4 Dice the chicken, mix with dressing and vegetables: Remove the chicken from the poaching water and dice it. (Or dice already cooked chicken if that is what you are using for this salad.) Mix it in with the dressing and vegetables.\n5 Add lettuce: At this point you can make ahead. When ready to serve, fold in the sliced and chopped iceberg lettuce.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nChicken Scampi with Angel Hair Pasta Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: 2 to 4 servings\nINGREDIENTS\n1/2 pound angel hair pasta\n2 tablespoons unsalted butter\n2 tablespoons olive oil\n1/2 pound boneless, skinless chicken cutlets\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper\n4 cloves garlic, minced\n1/8 teaspoon (a pinch) crushed red pepper flakes\n1/2 cup dry white wine, such as Sauvignon Blanc\nZest and juice of 1 lemon, plus more lemon wedges for serving (about 1 tablespoon of zest and 3 tablespoons of juice)\n1/4 cup chopped parsley\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Make the pasta: Cook the pasta in a large pot of salted boiling water, according to package instructions or until al dente. Scoop out about a cup of the pasta cooking water and set it aside. Drain the pasta.\n2 Cook the chicken:  Meanwhile, melt the butter with the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Pat the chicken dry and season both sides with the salt and a few grinds of fresh black pepper. Add the chicken to the skillet and cook about 2 minutes per side, until golden brown and cooked through.\nTransfer the chicken to a cutting board to rest, leaving the fat in the pan.\n3 Make the sauce: Add the garlic and red pepper flakes to the skillet and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the wine and lemon juice, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom of the pan, and simmer until reduced by about half, 3 to 5 minutes.\n4 Finish the pasta: Add the cooked pasta, lemon zest, parsley, and 1/2 cup of the reserved pasta water to the skillet and toss to combine. If it seems too dry or like the sauce isn't coating the pasta, stir in some more of the reserved pasta cooking water.\nCut the chicken into slices and toss with the pasta. Serve with extra lemon wedges for squeezing over the scampi.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b"Save It Print\nBuffalo Chicken Dip Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 30 minutesYield: 6 to 8 servinces\nMake sure your cream cheese has softened to room temperature before making this recipe; this makes it easier to mix with the other ingredients.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 8-ounce package cream cheese, softened\n2/3 cup sour cream\n2/3 cup mayonnaise\n2 cups shredded cheddar or mozzarella\n1/2 cup hot sauce, Frank's Buffalo Wing Sauce or any other favorite hot sauce\n1 tablespoon dried parsley\n1 teaspoon dried dill\n3 cloves garlic, minced\n1 1/2 teaspoon granulated onion\n1 teaspoon salt\n1 teaspoon black pepper\n1 pound cooked chicken breast, shredded\n1/2 cup blue cheese crumbles, to top (optional)\n1/4 cup cilantro, to top\nVegetable sticks, crackers, or sliced baguette, to serve\nSpecial equipment:\n9-inch pie or tart pan, 9-inch square baking dish, or other similarly sized baking dish\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Warm the oven to 350F with a rack in the middle position.\n2 In the bowl of a stand mixer with a paddle attachment, combine the cream cheese, the sour cream, and mayonnaise. Mix them together until smooth, stopping the mixer to scrape down the sides if necessary. Mix in the cheese, hot sauce, dried herbs, garlic, granulated onion, salt, and pepper. Mix again until completely incorporated.\n3 Add the shredded chicken. Mix on low until combined.\n4 Bake until bubbly: Pour the mixture into a 9-inch pie pan, 9-inch square baking dish, or other baking dish. Bake for 30 minutes, or until the mixture is bubbling. Sprinkle the blue cheese crumbles and cilantro over the top, and serve with immediately with vegetable sticks, crackers, or sliced baguette.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Print\nSkillet Chicken Puttanesca Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 20 minutesYield: 4 servings\nThe anchovy fillets in this recipe are highly recommended. They add a savory, somewhat salty depth and hardly any fishiness.\nYou can double the recipe easily if you have a larger skillet.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 can (28 ounces) whole peeled tomatoes, with their juices\n4 anchovy fillets, coarsely chopped (optional)\n1 cup pitted Kalamata or other black olives, coarsely chopped\n1/4 cup capers\n1 teaspoon crushed red pepper, or more to taste\n3 tablespoons chopped fresh oregano\n4 skinless, boneless chicken breasts (about 3 pounds)\n1/2 teaspoon salt, or more to taste\n1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper, or more to taste\n3 tablespoons olive oil, divided\n2 cloves garlic, finely chopped\nExtra sprigs fresh oregano, for garnish\nCrusty bread, to serve (skip if serving gluten-free)\nSpecial equipment:\n12-inch skillet with a lid\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Prep the tomato sauce: Pour the tomatoes into a bowl and crush with your hands or with a wooden spoon until you have uneven 1-inch pieces (you can also use scissors to snip the tomatoes into small pieces).\nMix in the anchovies, olives, capers, red pepper, and 2 tablespoons of the oregano to the bowl. Set aside.\n2 Sear the chicken: Sprinkle the chicken all over with salt and black pepper. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil until hot.\nAdd the chicken and cook without disturbing for 3 minutes, or until browned. If you are using a cast-iron or stainless steel skillet, do not turn until the chicken moves easily without prodding.\nTurn and cook the other side for 3 minutes. Transfer to a plate.\n3 Make the sauce: In the skillet over medium heat, heat the remaining 1 tablespoon oil. Add the garlic and cook, stirring, for 1 minute.\nAdd the tomato mixture \xe2\x80\x93 be careful since the juices will splutter when you add them to the pan. Cook for 1 minute or until the spluttering stops. Stir well, turn down the heat, and simmer for 5 minutes. Taste for seasoning and add more salt, black pepper, or red pepper, if you like.\n4 Add the chicken and finish the sauce: Add the chicken breasts and any juices to the skillet and spoon a little sauce over top.\nCover the pan and simmer for 5 to 8 minutes, or until a meat thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the chicken registers 165F.\n5 Serve: Serve straight from the skillet or transfer to a serving platter. Sprinkle the remaining 1 tablespoon oregano over the top and garnish with oregano sprigs. Serve with plenty of crusty bread.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b"Print\nAvgolemono Soup Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 25 minutesYield: Serves 6-8\nEither rice or orzo pasta are fine here, so use whichever you prefer. And be sure to dice the chicken breast pretty small -- about 1/4 inch cubes -- so the meat cooks through in just a few minutes.\nINGREDIENTS\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n1 cup chopped onion\n5 cups chicken stock, plus 1 cup water\n1/2 cup orzo or rice\n1 pound skinless chicken breast, diced\nSalt\n3 tablespoons lemon juice\n3 eggs\nFresh parsley for garnish\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Saut\xc3\xa9 onions: Heat the olive oil in a medium pot and saut\xc3\xa9 the onions over medium-high heat until they are soft and translucent, 4-5 minutes.\n2 Cook orzo or rice: While the onions are cooking, bring another pot of salted water to a boil and add the orzo or rice.\n3 Add chicken stock to onions: When the onions are ready, add the chicken stock and water and bring to a bare simmer.\n4 Drain orzo or rice, add to stock and onions: When the orzo or rice is nearly done \xe2\x80\x94 firm, but mostly cooked \xe2\x80\x94 drain the boiling water and add the pasta or rice to the chicken broth.\n5 Add the diced chicken breast to the pot. Let this cook 5-8 minutes, then taste the soup for salt.\n6 Temper eggs: Beat the eggs in a bowl. Whisking constantly, add the lemon juice to the eggs. You will need to temper the eggs before you add the egg-lemon mixture to the soup. It takes both hands to do this.\nWith one hand, whisk the egg-lemon mixture vigorously. With the other, slowly pour in a ladle's worth of hot broth.\nDo this at least twice, and you can add as many ladle's worth of broth as you want to the mixture.\n7 Whisk tempered eggs into soup and serve: Turn the heat off the soup. Whisk the soup with one hand while you pour the hot egg-lemon mixture in with the other.\nServe at once, garnished with parsley.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b'Print\nParmesan Chicken Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: Serves 4-6\nNote that the color of your roasting pan may make a difference in your results. A dark roasting pan (as pictured) may impart more heat and may brown the bottom of the chicken more.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 clove garlic, minced (1 teaspoon)\n1 stick butter (1/2 cup or 1/4 pound), melted\n1 cup dried bread crumbs\n1/3 cup grated Parmesan cheese (or 2/3 cup if you are using a Microplane zester)\n2 Tbsp chopped fresh parsley\n1/4 teaspoon salt\n1/4 teaspoon garlic salt (can sub regular salt)\nA large pinch of Italian seasoning (herb mix)\n1/8 teaspoon ground black pepper\n2 lbs of skinless, boneless, chicken meat, cut into 1-inch to 2-inch wide pieces\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat oven to 450\xc2\xb0F.\n2 Pat chicken pieces dry: Pat the chicken pieces dry with paper towels. Patting the chicken pieces dry will help the chicken pieces have crispy breading when baked.\n3 Prepare melted butter and breadcrumbs: In a small bowl, stir the minced garlic into the melted butter. In another bowl mix together the breadcrumbs, Parmesan, parsley, salt, garlic salt, Italian seasoning, and pepper.\n4 Dredge chicken pieces in butter and Parmesan mixture: Piece by piece, dip the chicken pieces into the garlic melted butter, and then dredge into the Parmesan breadcrumb mixture to coat.\nNote that if your chicken pieces are cold, they may cause the melted butter to thicken, leaving too much butter sticking the chicken pieces. If you see this happening, just reheat the butter.\n5 Place chicken on roasting dish: Place coated chicken pieces on to a 9x13 (or larger) roasting dish. Try to leave a little room between each piece. (You may need to use more than one roasting pan.) Drizzle with remaining garlic butter.\n6 Bake: Bake uncovered at 450\xc2\xb0F 15 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through and juices run clear. Note that the chicken will get much more browned on the bottom side than on the top.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b"Print\nHow to Poach Chicken, the Quick and Easy Way\nCook time: 15 minutesYield: 1-4 cooked chicken breasts\nOne 12-ounce (raw) chicken breast will give you roughly 2 cups shredded chicken.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 to 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts (roughly 12 ounces each)\n1 teaspoon salt\nOptional seasonings: smashed garlic, bay leaf, peppercorns, sliced ginger, sliced lemons or oranges, sliced onions or celery, fresh rosemary, fresh thyme\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Place the chicken in a single layer in the bottom of a pan. It's ok if the pieces overlap a little.\n2 Cover with an inch of water. Add the salt and any seasonings you'd like to use.\n3 Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. As the water comes to a boil, foam will start to collect on the surface. If you're planning to use the cooking liquid for something else, you can skim the foam off the surface. Otherwise, it's fine to just leave it.\n4 Cover and simmer for 8 to 15 minutes: Once boiling, reduce the heat to low and cover the pan. Cook for 8 minutes, then begin checking the chicken to see if it's done. Thin cutlets will cook in about 8 minutes; large chicken breasts will need up to 15 minutes.\nThe chicken is done when it registers 165F in the thickest part of the meat with an instant read thermometer. You can also cut into the chicken to see if it's cooked through. Continue cooking and checking the chicken every minute or so until the chicken is cooked.\n5 Cool briefly, then shred or slice: Remove the chicken from the broth and place on a plate or cutting board. When cool enough to handle, shred or slice the chicken, as needed. Use immediately, or cool completely and refrigerate for up to 5 days. Shredded or sliced chicken can also be frozen for up to 3 months.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b'Save It Print\nCreamy Dijon Mustard Chicken Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 20 minutesYield: Serves 3 to 4\nINGREDIENTS\n1 to 1 1/4 pound boneless, skinless chicken breasts\nSalt\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil + more for lightly coating chicken\n1 tablespoon butter\n1 cup sliced shallots\n1/2 cup dry white wine (can sub chicken stock)\n1/2 cup water\n4 tablespoons Dijon mustard, smooth, whole grain, or a mixture of both\n1 teaspoon dried thyme\n1/4 cup heavy cream\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cut chicken breasts and pound thin: Remove chicken breasts from package and sprinkle with salt. Remove the tenderloin from each breast and set aside. Cut each chicken breast into 3 pieces, approximately the same size. Coat with just a little olive oil.\nPlace the breast pieces between two pieces of plastic wrap or parchment paper and use a mallet, empty wine bottle, or rolling pin to pound the chicken pieces to an even thinness of about 1/4 inch. Repeat with the tenderloin pieces.\n2 Lightly brown the chicken cutlets: In a large, heavy-bottomed saut\xc3\xa9 pan, heat the olive oil on medium high to high heat. Stir in the butter. When the butter is foamy, add the chicken pieces to the pan. Do not crowd the pan, if necessary work in batches.\nLightly brown chicken on one side, turn over and brown the other side. Do not overcook the chicken. The pieces are thin and they will cook quickly. Remove the chicken pieces from the pan and set aside while you make the sauce.\n3 Cook the shallots: Add sliced shallots to the pan. Lower the heat to medium. Stir to coat with the remaining fat in the pan. Cook until softened, about 5 to 6 minutes.\n4 Make the sauce: Add white wine to the pan and increase the heat to high. When most of the wine has evaporated, add the water, the mustard, and the dried thyme. Simmer until reduced by half.\n5 Add chicken back to pan, drizzle in cream: Reduce the heat to low. Add the chicken back to the pan and coat with the sauce. Remove the pan from heat and drizzle in the cream. Taste and adjust seasonings, adding more salt if necessary.\n6 Serve: Serve with egg noodles, rice, mashed potatoes, pur\xc3\xa9ed celery root or parsnips, or serve alone or with vegetables for low carb version.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Print\nGrilled Cilantro Lime Chicken Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 10 minutesMarinating time: 30 minutesYield: Serves 4-6\nThe lime is the predominant flavor in this chicken recipe. We've paired it with cilantro. You could also try it with chopped arugula instead, or minced ginger, some garlic, or mint.\nWe pound the chicken breasts to an even thickness and then chill them before grilling. Chilled, even-thickness chicken breasts will be less likely to overcook in the time it takes to get grill marks.\nINGREDIENTS\n2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breasts\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil for the marinade, plus more for grilling\nGrated zest from 2 limes\nJuice from 2 limes (about 1/4 cup)\n3 tablespoons chopped cilantro\n1/2 teaspoon sugar\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n1/4 teaspoon black pepper\nLime wedges, fresh sprigs of cilantro, and slices of avocado, to serve\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Pound chicken breasts to even thickness: Place the chicken breasts between two piece of plastic wrap or wax paper and pound to an even thickness with a meat mallet or rolling pin.\n2 Marinate the chicken: Mix the olive oil, lime zest, lime juice, cilantro, sugar, salt, and pepper together in a large bowl. Add the chicken and massage the marinade into the chicken. Cover and chill for at least 30 minutes, and up to 4 hours or overnight.\n3 Preheat Grill: Preheat a gas or charcoal grill for medium-high heat grilling, or until you can hold your hand about an inch over the grates for 1 second.\n4 Grill the chicken: Remove the chicken breasts from the refrigerator. Remove them from the marinade and pat them dry with paper towels. Coat the chicken breasts with some olive oil.\nSoak a paper towel in a little more oil and use tongs to wipe the grill grates.\nWhen the grill is hot, place the chicken breasts on the grill. Grill for a few minutes on each side, until just cooked through.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b'Print\nSalsa Verde Chicken Bake Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 30 minutesYield: Serves 4\nWhile the chicken is cooking, prepare some rice or quinoa to serve with the chicken. The recipe produces a lot of sauce which will go well with the sides.\nYou could easily make this with boneless, skinless chicken thighs as well. You may need to cook them just a few minutes longer than the breasts.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 1/4 to 1 1/2 pounds boneless skinless chicken breasts\n1 3/4 cups (1 15-ounce jar) tomatillo salsa verde\n4 ounces grated Monterey jack and/or pepper jack cheese\n1/2 cup chopped fresh cilantro (optional)\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat oven to 350\xc2\xb0F.\n2 Cut chicken breasts and line baking dish with them: Cut the chicken breasts into halves.\nLine a 1 1/2 to 2 quart casserole baking dish with the chicken pieces. Try to cover the bottom as completely as you can with the chicken.\n3 Cover the chicken pieces with the salsa verde. Cover completely, there should be no exposed chicken or it will dry out.\n4 Bake in a 350\xc2\xb0F oven for 25-30 minutes. If you have a meat thermometer, use it. The chicken should be removed from the oven when the internal temperature of the breast meat reaches 150\xc2\xb0F.\n5 Sprinkle cheese over the chicken, increase the oven heat to 400\xc2\xb0F and return to the oven for another 5-10 minutes, enough time for the cheese to melt and the sauce to get bubbly.\nRemove from oven. Serve immediately. Spoon over cooked rice or quinoa. Sprinkle with chopped fresh cilantro. Serve with tortilla chips for crunch if you would like.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Save It Print\nInstant Pot Chicken Adobo and Rice Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 45 minutesYield: 4 to 6 servings\nWe don\'t recommend using chicken breasts for this recipe as they tend to become too dry.\nNancy prefers a 1:2 ratio of vinegar to soy sauce, but I like the tanginess of a 1:1 version, too. Tweak the quantities of the ingredients to suit your own tastes!\nThe sauce for this recipe is rich with rendered chicken fat. If you\'d prefer a less fatty sauce, you can either use a fat separator to use skim off the fat, or cook the dish with boneless skinless chicken thighs.\nThis recipe works best in a 6-quart pressure cooker. If you are using a larger pressure cooker, double the quantities of vinegar, soy sauce, and sugar or add 2/3 cup water then reduce the sauce after cooking.\nStovetop Instructions: Simmer the chicken in the sauce in a covered soup pot or Dutch oven for 40 minutes, until tender. Cook the rice in a separate pot.\nINGREDIENTS\n3 to 3 1/2 pounds bone-in, skin-on chicken legs and thighs (or 1 1/2 to 2 pounds boneless skinless chicken thighs)\n1 medium yellow onion, sliced\n4 garlic cloves, chopped\n1/3 cup soy sauce (use low sodium soy sauce for less salt, or tamari for gluten-free)\n3 tablespoons white vinegar (or rice vinegar for a milder flavor)\n1 tablespoon brown sugar\n1 teaspoon black peppercorns\n3 dried bay leaves\n1 1/2 cups long grain white rice\n1 1/2 cups water\nThinly sliced green onions, to garnish the rice (optional)\n  Special equipment:\n6-quart pressure cooker (I use an Instant Pot)\nRaised steam rack\nWire strainer\nSmall stainless steel bowl\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Combine the chicken and sauce ingredients in the pressure cooker. Stir or use your hands to evenly coat the chicken pieces in the sauce.\nNestle a raised steam rack in with the chicken pieces, making sure all of its legs are touching the bottom of the pot.\n2 Rinse the rice: Rinse the rice in a wire mesh strainer, let it drain for a minute or so, then combine it with the 1 1/2 cups of water in a small (1 \xc2\xbd-quart) stainless steel mixing bowl.\nPlace the bowl of rice and water on top of the steam rack in the pot. It should just fit inside the pot, so it will not touch the lid when the pot is closed.\n3 Cook the chicken and rice. Place the lid on the pressure cooker. Make sure the pressure regulator is set to the \xe2\x80\x9cSealing\xe2\x80\x9d position. If you are using an Instant Pot, select the \xe2\x80\x9cPoultry\xe2\x80\x9d or \xe2\x80\x9cManual\xe2\x80\x9d program, then adjust the time to 15 minutes. If your pressure cooker does not have a \xe2\x80\x9cPoultry\xe2\x80\x9d program, set it manually to \xe2\x80\x9cHigh Pressure\xe2\x80\x9d for 15 minutes. For stovetop pressure cookers, cook for 12 minutes at high pressure.\nIt will take about 20 minutes for your pressure cooker to come up to pressure, and then the actual cooking will begin. Total time from the time you seal the pressure cooker to the finished dish is about 45 minutes (including a 10-minute natural pressure release).\n4 Release the pressure: When the cooking program ends, let the pressure release naturally for at least 10 minutes, then perform a quick pressure release by moving the pressure release knob from \xe2\x80\x9cSealing\xe2\x80\x9d to \xe2\x80\x9cVenting.\xe2\x80\x9d\n5 Fluff the rice: Wearing a pair of heat-proof mitts, remove the bowl of rice and the steam rack from the pot. Fluff the rice with a fork.\n6 Check the temperature of the chicken: Use an instant read thermometer to take the temperature of a piece of chicken at its thickest part. It should read at least 165\xc2\xbaF.\nIf the chicken isn\'t 165\xc2\xbaF yet, reset the pressure cooker and select the "Poultry" or "Manual" setting for another minute or two. It will take much less time to come up to pressure the second time since the food is already hot.\n7 Finish the sauce and serve: Transfer the chicken to a serving dish.\nIf you\'d like, you can reduce the sauce to concentrate the flavor using your pressure cooker\xe2\x80\x99s \xe2\x80\x9cSaut\xc3\xa9\xe2\x80\x9d setting for 15 minutes.\nStrain the sauce to catch the bay leaves, peppercorns, and any bones that might have fallen from the chicken. If you prefer a less fatty sauce, use a fat separator to separate the sauce and the fat, or wait for the fat to float to the top and then skim it off.\nDrizzle some of the sauce over the chicken and serve the rest alongside.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Print\nOne-Pot Chicken and Rice Soup Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 30 minutesYield: 6 to 8 servings (makes about 3 quarts)\nSkip the salt if using salted stock or broth. Taste the soup at the end and add more salt if needed.\nThis recipe calls for a classic mirepoix of carrots, onions, and celery for the vegetable base, but you can make this recipe your own by adding different vegetables, like fennel or cubes of butternut squash.\nINGREDIENTS\n2 bone-in chicken breasts, skin removed (1 to 1 1/2 pounds)\n1 cup long-grain white rice, like basmati\n2 celery ribs, diced small\n2 medium carrots, peeled and diced small\n1 onion, diced small\n2 cloves garlic, peeled but left whole\n1 teaspoon salt, plus more to taste (see Recipe Note)\n1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper\n2 quarts unsalted or low-sodium chicken stock\nJuice of 1/2 lemon (about 3 tablespoons)\nChopped fresh parsley, for serving\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Assemble the soup and bring to a simmer: Combine the chicken, white rice, celery, carrots, onions, garlic, salt, and pepper in a large pot. Add the chicken stock and bring to a boil over high heat.\nOnce the soup is boiling, reduce the heat to keep the soup at a gentle simmer.\n2 Simmer for about 25 minutes: As the soup simmers, skim off any foam that collects on the surface with a spoon. Continue to simmer until the rice and vegetables are tender, about 25 minutes. Remove the soup from heat.\n3 Shred the chicken and make the garlic paste: Remove the chicken and garlic cloves using a slotted spoon or tongs. Transfer the chicken breasts to a bowl and shred with two forks. Discard the bones. Return the shredded chicken to the pot.\nSmash the garlic cloves into a paste against a cutting board using a fork or the flat of your knife. Stir the paste back into the soup.\n4 Season and serve: Stir the lemon juice into to the soup, and taste. The soup should taste rich, barely salty, and with just a hint of lemon. Add more salt or lemon juice as needed until it tastes good to you.\nDivide among bowls and sprinkle with some parsley for serving.\nLeftovers will keep for about a week refrigerated, or up to 3 months frozen.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b"Save It Print\nRestaurant-Style Poached Chicken Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: Serves 2\nThis recipe is designed for chicken breasts, but you can also do this with turkey breast, pork tenderloin or a meaty fish such as halibut.\nYou can double this recipe, but if you do, use a larger pot and double the amount of poaching water.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 skinless chicken breast (1/2 pound)\n2 Tbsp lemon juice\nA couple pinches of salt\nA couple pinches of a dried herb of your choice - tarragon, oregano, basil, rosemary, or thyme, or some other seasoning such as cumin or paprika\nPlastic wrap*\n*Use a good quality plastic wrap that can withstand some heat. Look for packaging that indicates you can use the plastic wrap in a microwave oven. If it can handle a microwave oven, it will hold up in boiling water.\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Trim the fat and coat chicken pieces in lemon juice, salt, and herbs: Trim all the fat from the chicken breast and slice it lengthwise. In a small bowl mix the lemon juice, salt, and herbs.\nAdd the chicken pieces and coat all over with the lemon juice mixture.\nLet the chicken pieces sit in the lemon juice while you heat the water in the next step.\n  2 Bring a pot of water (2 1/2 quarts of water, 4 quart pot) to a high simmer.\n3 Roll up the chicken in plastic wrap: Roll out a long sheet of plastic wrap at least twice as long as the chicken breast slices. Place 1 chicken strip on the plastic wrap, in the middle. Roll up the chicken in the plastic wrap tightly.\n  Compress as much air out of the chicken as you can as you roll it. Once the chicken is rolled up, rotate it on your cutting board or counter several times to tighten the cylinder even more. Tie the loose ends of the plastic wrap together in a double knot. Repeat with the second chicken strip.\n  4 Poach the chicken in the hot water: Once the water has reached a high simmer, turn off the heat (keep the pot on the burner though) and drop the rolled-up chicken cylinders in the pot. Cover the pot and let the chicken steep for 15 minutes.\nThe chicken should be cooked through by then. (If for some reason the chicken is not cooked through, for example if you are using larger than called for breasts, or if you are using frozen chicken that hadn't quite defrosted before starting cooking, you can always put the chicken back in the poaching liquid for a few more minutes.)\n  5 To serve, snip off the tied ends of the plastic wrap, and unwrap. Note that there will be some juice inside the plastic wrap with the chicken, which has lots of flavor. So you might want to unwrap the chicken pieces over a bowl or something to catch the juice, which you can then pour over the chicken if you want. Or serve the chicken with a sauce of your choice.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b"Print\nChicken Florentine Pesto Pasta Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 20 minutesYield: Serves 6-8\nWe've used fresh spinach in this recipe, but you could easily use frozen. Just defrost and drain.\nINGREDIENTS\n12 ounces dried short pasta (bowties, penne, gemelli, etc)\n4 chicken breast cutlets (1 to 1 1/2 pounds total)\nSalt\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n1 medium onion, chopped, about 1 cup\n3 garlic cloves, minced\n1/2 cup white wine or stock\n8-16 ounces of fresh spinach*, washed, long stems removed and chopped\nBlack pepper\n1/4 cup heavy whipping cream\n1/4 cup (or more) pesto\n*To wash spinach, fill up a clean sink basin with cold water and let the spinach soak in the water. Move it around a bit to loosen any dirt. Fresh spinach is usually pretty dirty, so you may need to do a couple of soakings. Remove the spinach and shake off excess water. Lay the spinach leaves down on a clean towel and pat dry.\nMETHOD\n1 Start cooking the pasta: Bring a large pot of salted water (add enough salt so that the water tastes salty) to a boil. Add the dried pasta and cook until al dente.\n2 Cook the chicken: While preparing the pasta, cook the chicken. Sprinkle the chicken breasts with salt, heat the olive oil in a saut\xc3\xa9 pan and brown the chicken breasts on both sides over medium-high heat. They don't need to be cooked all the way through, just browned. Remove the chicken from the pan and set aside.\n3 Saut\xc3\xa9 onions: Add the chopped onion to the pan and saut\xc3\xa9 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally. While the onions cook, slice the chicken into strips. Put any pieces that are cooked all the way through in one pile, and put the ones that still need a little cooking in another pile.\n4 Add garlic, then white wine or stock: When the onions are just beginning to brown, add the garlic and cook another minute. Add the white wine or stock and boil vigorously until the liquid is reduced by half.\n5 Add spinach, chicken: Add the spinach and the undercooked pieces of chicken to the pan. Using tongs, turn them over to coat them with the juices in the pan. Continue to cook, turning and stirring often, until the spinach is wilted and the chicken cooked through, about 2 minutes.\n6 Combine chicken, spinach, pesto, pasta, cream: Turn off the heat and add some black pepper, the pile of cooked chicken pieces and the pesto. Stir to combine. Drain the pasta put it in a large bowl. Add the cream to the saut\xc3\xa9 pan and stir well to combine. Add the contents of the pan to the bowl with the pasta and mix well. Serve at once.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b"Print\nChicken Milanese Recipe\nPrep time: 30 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: 4 servings\nLook for Panko crumbs in the Asian foods section of your grocery store, though they are also sometimes near the other packaged breadcrumbs. You can also order online.\nServe with a simple tossed salad, like this Kale Caesar Salad\nINGREDIENTS\n4 large skinless boneless chicken breasts (1 1/2 pounds, 680 g)\n1 1/2 cups (190 g) all-purpose flour\n1 teaspoon salt\n1/2 teaspoon ground pepper\n3 large eggs\n2 cups (144 g) Panko breadcrumbs\n8 tablespoons (120 ml) olive oil, or more if needed\n1 lemon, cut into wedges, for serving\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Prepare the chicken: Set aside any smaller breasts or cutlets that are 1/2-inch thick. Set larger breasts on a cutting board. Hold the top of the chicken steady with one hand and hold a sharp knife parallel to the table in the other hand, then butterfly the breast in half like opening a book (watch your fingers!). Cut all the way through to make two thin pieces.\nContinue with the remaining large breasts. Pat them dry with paper towels. Set them on a rimmed baking sheet.\n2 Pound the chicken: Set one of the chicken breast slices between 2 sheets of plastic wrap. Use a meat mallet or small heavy pan to pound the breast to flatten it \xe2\x80\x93 six or so good whacks should do it.  Continue with the remaining breasts, returning them to the baking sheet.\n2 Set up an assembly line for coating the chicken: In a pie pan or shallow bowl, place the flour, 1/2 teaspoon of the salt, and pepper. Stir thoroughly. In another pie pan or shallow bowl, beat the eggs with the remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt. In a third pie pan or bowl, place the Panko.\nSet the pan of chicken on the counter. Set the flour next to it on the right. Set the egg to the right, then the Panko as the last thing in the row.\n3 Coat the chicken: With tongs, dip one slice of chicken in flour, making sure both sides are coated and shaking the excess into the bowl. Next, coat the chicken in egg and lift it up so the excess falls back into the bowl. Finally, transfer to the Panko and coat both sides.\nReturn the chicken to the baking sheet. Continue with the remaining breasts until they are all coated.\n3 Cook the chicken in batches: Heat the oven to 250F with a baking sheet on a middle rack. Set a heavy 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat.\nAdd enough of the olive to the pan to make a 1/4-inch layer (about 4 tablespoons). Heat until the oil shimmers and flows; when hot, a piece of Panko thrown in the oil should sizzle.\nAdd 3 pieces of chicken in a single layer and cook without moving for 4 minutes, or until the bottoms are golden. Turn and brown the other sides for another 4 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through.\n4 Keep the chicken warm: Transfer the finished chicken to the oven so they stay warm while you cook the remaining breasts. Cook the remaining breasts, adding more oil to the pan as needed to keep it coated.\n5 To serve: Serve right away with lemon and a green salad.\nIf making ahead, let the cooked chicken cool completely on a parchment-lined baking sheet, then store in the fridge. If you're planning on reheating in a few hours, you can leave them on the baking sheet. Otherwise, layer them in an airtight container with parchment between the layers, and refrigerate for 1 to 3 days.\nTo reheat, let the chicken cutlets sit out for half an hour to lose their chill, then warm in a 400F oven for 8 to 10 minutes or until piping hot and crispy.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b"Print\nFirecracker Chicken Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 45 minutesYield: 4 servings\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the sauce:\n1/2 cup buffalo sauce, like Frank's\n3/4 cup brown sugar\n2 teaspoons apple cider vinegar\n1/4 teaspoon salt\n1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes\nFor the chicken:\n2/3 cup cornstarch\n1 teaspoon salt\n1 teaspoon black pepper\n1 1/2 pounds boneless skinless chicken breasts or thighs, cut into 1-inch cubes\n3 large eggs\n1/2 cup vegetable oil\nTo serve:\nCooked rice\nFresh scallions, just the green ends, chopped\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat the oven to 400\xc2\xb0F and prep the sauce. Stir together the sauce ingredients in a medium bowl and set aside.\n2 Prep the chicken: In a bowl or large plastic bag, combine the cornstarch, salt, and pepper. Add chicken and toss to coat well.\nWhisk together the eggs in a medium mixing bowl. Line a plate with paper towels. Arrange everything near your stove.\n3 Fry the chicken on the stovetop: In a large, deep skillet or wok, warm the vegetable oil over medium-high heat until a flick of water sizzles on contact.\nAs soon as the oil is hot, transfer the coated chicken to the bowl with the eggs and toss to coat well. Scoop out the chicken pieces with a slotted spoon, allowing any excess egg to drain off, and transfer the chicken to the skillet in an even layer.\nCook for about 3 minutes per side until a crust forms and the chicken is a light tan color. The chicken will not be cooked through at this point.\n4 Sauce the chicken: When chicken is done, remove it from the skillet with a slotted spoon and transfer it to the plate lined with paper towels to drain off any excess oil.\nTransfer to a 9x13 baking dish. Add sauce and toss to combine.\n5 Bake the chicken: Bake chicken for 25 to 30 minutes, stirring halfway through to ensure even cooking. When the chicken is done, it should be cooked through and the sauce will thicken and turn into a glaze coating the chicken.\n6 Serve: Serve chicken with cooked rice garnished with scallions.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b"Print\nGreek Lemon Chicken Skewers with Tzatziki Sauce Recipe\nPrep time: 25 minutesCook time: 7 minutesMarinating time: 30 minutesYield: Serves 3 to 4\nINGREDIENTS\n1 1/4 pound boneless, skinless chicken breasts, trimmed of excess fat\n1 teaspoon salt\n2 tablespoons plain yogurt\n2 cloves garlic, minced (about 2 teaspoons)\n1 tablespoon minced fresh oregano (or 1 1/2 teaspoons dried oregano)\n1/8 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper\n1 teaspoon lemon juice\n1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil plus more for the grill\n2 lemons, thinly sliced\nTzatziki:\n1 cup plain yogurt\n2 cloves of garlic, minced (about 2 teaspoons)\n1/2 teaspoon kosher salt\n1/8 teaspoon black pepper\n1 tablespoon lemon juice\n1 cucumber, peeled\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Soak the skewers: If using bamboo or wooden skewers, place them in water to soak while you prepare the recipe. You'll need either 4 flat skewers or 8 regular round skewers.\n2 Cut chicken breasts, marinate: Cut the chicken breasts into 1 1/2 to 2 inch chunks. Place in a bowl and sprinkle with salt. Add the yogurt, minced garlic, oregano, pepper, lemon juice, and olive oil to the bowl with the chicken, stir to combine. Marinate for 30 minutes to an hour.\n3 Make yogurt tzatziki sauce: While the chicken is marinating, make the tzatziki. In a medium bowl stir to combine the yogurt, minced garlic, salt, pepper, and lemon juice.\nGrate the cucumber with the large holes of a box grater. Place in a strainer and press with your hands to squeeze out excess moisture. Add the grated cucumber to the yogurt mixture.\n4 Thread skewers with chicken and lemon slices: Prepare your grill for direct high heat. While the grill is heating, prepare the skewers. Use either flat bamboo or metal skewers or double up regular bamboo skewers so that the chicken is easier to turn on the grill. Thread the chicken pieces onto the skewers with a lemon slice folded over like a taco between each piece of chicken.\n5 Grill: When the grill is ready brush the grill grates with a little olive oil (use a paper towel folded over several times and dipped in olive oil, hold with tongs). Brush some olive oil over the chicken skewers as well. Place the chicken skewers directly over the hottest part of the grill and cover the grill.\nAllow to sear on one side (about 2 to 3 minutes), then turn the chicken skewers over to the other side, cover and cook 2 to 3 minutes more, until the chicken is browned and just cooked through.\nRemove from grill and serve immediately with tzatziki sauce.\n  Hello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b"Print\nChicken Curry in a Hurry Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 20 minutesYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n1 1/2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast cutlets*\nSalt\n3 teaspoons your favorite yellow curry powder or combination of curry spices (such as garam masala)\n1 Tbsp coconut oil or extra virgin olive oil\n1 medium-large onion, thinly sliced crosswise (about 2 cups\n1/3 cup golden raisins (optional), placed in a bowl and covered with water to plump them\nFreshly ground black pepper\n1 cup sour cream or a mixture of plain full-fat yogurt (or Greek yogurt) and whipping cream or sour cream\nMinced fresh cilantro and toasted slivered almonds (optional) for garnish\n*The cutlets should be about 1/2-inch thick. If you are starting with full chicken breasts, cut them in half horizontally, or pound them to 1/2-inch thickness with a meat hammer between two layers of wax paper.\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cut the chicken cutlets and rub them with curry powder: Cut the chicken breast cutlets in half or into thirds or quarters to make smaller serving pieces (they'll cook more quickly too). Sprinkle them on both sides lightly with salt (about 1/4 teaspoon).\nSprinkle with 1 teaspoon of the curry powder, lightly rubbing the curry powder into the chicken on all sides.\n2 Saut\xc3\xa9 the onions, with raisins and curry powder: Heat the oil in a large skillet on medium high heat. When the oil is hot, add the onions. Cook until translucent, stirring occasionally, about 5 minutes. Sprinkle with salt and pepper while the onions are cooking.\nDrain the raisins from the water and add them to the onions.\nLower the heat to medium and sprinkle the onions with the remaining 2 teaspoons of curry powder. Continue to cook for another minute or two.\n3 Saut\xc3\xa9 the chicken: Push the onions to one side of the skillet. Place the chicken pieces in the pan in a single layer. Cook 2-3 minutes on each side, until lightly browned and just cooked through. Remove the chicken pieces to a plate. (Bunch them together so they retain their heat.)\n4 Add sour cream or yogurt: Add the sour cream and/or yogurt mixture and stir over medium-low heat until the mixture has heated through. If the sauce is too thick, you can add a little water to thin it.\nIf you are using yogurt, or low-fat sour cream, be careful not to let the mixture simmer or it may curdle!\nReturn the chicken to the skillet (and any juices from the plate the chicken has been resting on), turn over the pieces in the sauce. When all is heated through, it's ready to serve.\nGarnish with cilantro and toasted slivered almonds and serve alone or over rice.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b"Save It Print\nChicken Breasts with Mustard Cream Sauce Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 25 minutesYield: 4 servings\nINGREDIENTS\n4 skinless, boneless chicken breasts (about 1 1/2 pounds total)\nSalt and pepper, to taste\n1/4 cup all-purpose flour\n1 1/2 tablespoons unsalted butter\n1 1/2 tablespoons oil\n1 cup white wine\n1 cup heavy cream\n1 rounded teaspoon Dijon mustard\n3 tablespoons capers, rinsed well\n2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Heat the oven to 350F. Place a baking sheet near the stove, ready for the chicken.\n2 Prepare the chicken: Season the chicken breasts on both sides with salt and pepper.\nPour the flour onto a large plate and dredge the chicken breasts until well coated. Shake off the excess.\n3 Brown the chicken: In a large skillet over medium high-heat, heat the butter and oil. When the butter has melted and looks foamy, add the chicken. (Work in batches if your pan isn't big enough so that you don't crowd the pan.)\nBrown the chicken for 3 minutes per side, or until golden.\n4 Finish the chicken in the oven: Transfer the chicken to the baking sheet and place in the oven for 5 minutes (longer if the chicken breasts are thick), or until a thermometer inserted into the thickest part of a breast registers 165 degrees.\nIf the chicken is done before the sauce, transfer it to a serving platter and tent it loosely with foil to keep warm.\n5 Make the sauce: While the chicken finishes cooking, return the skillet to medium heat and add the wine. Be careful since the oil in the pan will sputter a little when you add the wine. Cook for 5 minutes, or until the wine is reduced by about half.\nAdd the cream and simmer for 2 to 3 minutes, or until the sauce coats the back of a spoon.\nStir in the mustard, capers and parsley, reserving a little parsley for sprinkling over top. Taste and add more salt and pepper, if you like.\n6 Serve the chicken: Place each chicken breast on a plate, drizzle with the sauce, and sprinkle with the remaining parsley.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nBaked Chicken Parmesan Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 30 minutesYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\nSauce:\n1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil\n2 garlic cloves, peeled, finely chopped (about 2 teaspoons)\n1 can (28 oz) crushed tomatoes (we use Muir-Glen)\n1/2 teaspoon dried basil (or 1 Tbsp of chopped fresh basil)\n1/4 teaspoon dried oregano (or 1 teaspoon of chopped fresh oregano)\n1/4 teaspoon sugar\nSalt and ground black pepper to taste\nChicken:\n3 tablespoons Dijon mustard\n1 tablespoon white-wine vinegar\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n1/2 teaspoon black pepper\n1 1/2 pounds chicken breast cutlets (or skinless boneless chicken breasts or thighs that have been pounded to a 1/4-inch thickness)\n1 cup of breadcrumbs (panko or homemade)\n1 cup finely grated Parmesan cheese\n3 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Make the sauce: Heat the olive oil in a large saucepan on medium high heat. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds.\nStir in the crushed tomatoes, basil, oregano, sugar, a pinch of salt and pepper. Bring to a simmer.\nContinue to simmer until sauce thickens a bit and flavors meld, about 10-12 minutes. Taste sauce, adjust seasoning if necessary, cover and keep warm.\n2 Preheat oven to 450\xc2\xb0F. Line a baking sheet with foil, parchment, or Silpat. While the sauce is simmering, prepare the chicken in the next steps.\n3 Make the coating: In a large bowl whisk together the mustard, vinegar, salt, and 1/4 teaspoon of pepper.\nAdd the chicken cutlets to the mixture and coat well on both sides.\n4 Dredge the chicken: In another bowl, mix together the breadcrumbs, grated Parmesan, and 1/4 teaspoon of black pepper. Mix well and stir in the melted butter. Transfer to a shallow plate.\nDredge the chicken pieces in the breadcrumb mixture, gently pressing the breadcrumbs into the chicken cutlets. Place dredged chicken on the lined baking sheet.\n5 Bake: Bake at 450\xc2\xb0F on the center rack of the oven until cooked and golden brown, about 15 minutes.\n6 Serve: Serve with a side of rice, noodles or pasta. Ladle sauce with the chicken.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nChicken Bacon Roulades Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 1 hour, 10 minutesYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n4 shallots, thinly sliced (about 1 cup sliced shallots)\n1/2 pound of bacon slices (thinly sliced, not thick cut)\n4 skinless boneless chicken breasts (about 1 1/2 pounds total)\nLemon pepper seasoning to taste (or ground black pepper with a little lemon zest)\n1 ounce grated Parmesan (about 1/3 cup)\n1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil\n1 clove of garlic, minced (1 teaspoon)\n1/3 cup dry white wine\n2 tablespoons butter\n1 1/2 tablespoons flour\n1 1/4 cups chicken broth\n1/4 cup heavy cream\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cook the bacon: Working in batches, cook the bacon over medium heat in an ovenproof thick-bottomed skillet, until lightly browned but not crisp (still flexible). Remove cooked bacon to a paper towel-lined plate.\n2 Cook the shallots: Lower the heat to low and add the shallots to the pan with the rendered bacon fat. Cook over low heat until softened. Use a slotted spoon to remove cooked shallots to a bowl, leaving remaining fat in the pan.\n3 Pound the chicken breasts thin: Place the chicken breasts between two sheets of plastic wrap and use a mallet or meat pounder (or rolling pin) to pound the chicken breasts thin, to an even thickness of about 1/8-inch.\n4 Top chicken breasts with bacon, lemon pepper, shallots, Parm: Sprinkle the chicken breasts with lemon pepper (or regular ground black pepper with a little lemon zest) and salt.\nPlace 2 to 3 bacon slices in the middle of each chicken breast, lengthwise. Sprinkle with shallots and grated Parmesan.\n5 Roll up each chicken breast like a cigar, using the plastic wrap to help you tighten the roll, and tuck in the ends to hold in the filling. Remove the plastic wrap. Use toothpicks to hold the edges of the chicken roulade together.\n6 Brown the roulades on all sides, then cook in oven: Preheat oven to 300\xc2\xb0F. Add a tablespoon of olive oil to the fat in the skillet and heat on medium high. When the pan is hot, add the chicken roulades to the pan and brown on all sides.\nMove the skillet to the 300\xc2\xb0F oven and cook until the roulades are cooked through, about 20 minutes.\n7 Tent with foil to keep warm: When the chicken roulades are cooked through, remove them from the oven to a plate, tent with aluminum foil to keep warm.\nNote that the skillet is very hot! Keep a pot holder draped over the handle once it's back on the stove.
