(At this point, whenever I take a handled pot out of a hot oven, I cool down the handles with ice cubes so that someone doesn't inadvertently try to pick up the pan with their unprotected hands.)\n8 Make the sauce: Pour off any excess fat from the pan (not down the drain, or you'll clog your drain). Pour wine into the hot skillet to deglaze the pan. Heat on medium high heat and use a metal spatula to scrape up any browned bits. Boil the wine down until it has reduced to just a tablespoon.\nReduce the heat to medium low. Add the minced garlic to the pan and swirl in the butter. Cook for a minute, then add the flour and cook, stirring, for a minute more.\nAdd the broth and the cream to the roux and whisk. Simmer, whisking, for two minutes.\nPour the sauce through a sieve into a saucepan and keep warm on the stove.\n9 Slice the roulades and serve with sauce: Remove the toothpicks that have been holding the roulades together. Cut the roulades into 1/2-inch thick slices. To serve, place some sauce on each plate and top with roulade slices.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nChicken with Creamy Mushroom Sage Sauce Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 20 minutesYield: Serves 4\nFor extra mushroomy flavor, include a few shiitake mushrooms with the cremini or button mushrooms.\nINGREDIENTS\n3 tablespoons butter\n1/2 cup chopped shallots\n8-10 ounces cremini or button mushrooms, thickly sliced\nA couple shiitake mushrooms, thinly sliced\n1 teaspoon chopped fresh parsley\n1 cup dry vermouth or dry white wine (such as Sauvignon Blanc)\n2/3 cup heavy whipping cream (light cream may curdle, so use heavy cream)\n3 tablespoons chopped fresh sage\n1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil\n1 1/4 to 1 1/2 pounds chicken breast cutlets, or skinless, boneless chicken breasts pounded to an even 1/4 inch to 1/3 inch thickness\nSalt and freshly ground black pepper\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cook the shallots and mushrooms: Melt the butter in a large saut\xc3\xa9 pan on medium high heat. Add the shallots and saut\xc3\xa9 for one minute.\nAdd the mushrooms and parsley and saut\xc3\xa9 for 7-10 more minutes, or until the mushrooms have browned. If you are using unsalted butter, sprinkle on a pinch of salt.\n2 Make the sauce: Add the vermouth and deglaze the pan, scraping up any bits that may be sticking to the bottom of the pan.\nStir in the cream. Bring to a simmer and cook for 3 to 5 minutes, or until the sauce is thick enough to coat the back of a wooden spoon.\n3 Cook the chicken cutlets: While the sauce is simmering, heat the olive oil in another large saut\xc3\xa9 pan on medium high heat. Sprinkle salt and pepper over both sides of the chicken breast cutlets.\nAdd cutlets to pan and cook for about 3 minutes on each side, until browned and cooked through.\n4 Finish the sauce and serve: Stir the sage into the sauce, and season to taste with salt and pepper. Pour the sauce over the chicken.\nServe alone or with a vegetable (for low carb version) or with rice, mashed potatoes, or pasta (use gluten-free pasta for gluten-free version). Garnish with chopped fresh parsley.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Print\nStuffed Herbed Chicken with Boursin Cheese Recipe\nYield: Serves 2-4\nWe are using chicken breasts instead of already cut chicken cutlets for this recipe because when we pound the breasts thin, they will spread out sufficiently for us to roll them up.\nINGREDIENTS\nIngredients\n2 skinless, boneless chicken breasts, 1/2-pound each\nFresh basil leaves (or other green - beet green, swiss chard, spinach), enough to cover each chicken breast\n2 Tbsp finely chopped toasted walnuts\n2.5 oz Boursin garlic and herb cheese (or 2.5 oz of herbed cream cheese recipe, see below), room temperature\n1/3 cup breadcrumbs\n3 Tbsp grated Parmesan cheese\n1 egg, beaten well\nSalt\nPepper\nHerbed Cheese\n2.5 oz cream cheese, softened\n1 garlic clove, minced\n3 teaspoons fresh parsley, minced\n3 teaspoons fresh chives, minced\nA pinch of cayenne\n1/4 teaspoon freshly cracked black peppercorns\nA pinch salt\nMETHOD\n1 Pound the chicken breasts to 1/4 inch thickness: Preheat oven to 350\xc2\xb0F. Put each chicken breast between two layers of plastic wrap, on a chopping board, and use a meat mallet to pound until 1/4-inch thick.\n2 Blanch the basil: Dip each basil (or other bitter green) leaf in boiling water, drain and set aside.\n3 Mix walnuts into Boursin or cheese mixture: If you are not starting with Boursin herbed cheese, make your own by mixing together the Herbed Cheese ingredients mentioned above. Mix the walnuts into the cheese mixture, set aside.\n4 Layer chicken with cheese and basil, roll up: Lay the chicken breasts flat, season each side with salt and pepper. Spread the cheese-walnut mixture over each breast, covering the surface of the breasts. Layer on the basil leaves. Starting at the shortest end of the chicken breast, roll up as tightly as possible and tuck in the ends to form a neat roll. Secure each breast with 2 toothpicks.\n5 Dredge in flour, egg, and breadcrumbs: Put flour, beaten egg, and breadcrumbs combined with the Parmesan cheese on to 3 separate flat dishes. Dredge each chicken breast roll first in the flour, then the egg, and finally the Parmesan bread crumbs. (Skip this step if you are going low carb and/or gluten-free.)\n6 Bake: Transfer chicken breasts to a greased baking dish, seam side down. Bake at 350\xc2\xb0F for 40-50 minutes, depending on the size of the breast, until the internal temperature is 165\xc2\xb0F, the juices run clear, and the chicken is slightly browned.\nLet rest for 5 minutes before serving.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Print\nChicken and Apples in Honey Mustard Sauce Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 25 minutesYield: Serves 4\nThe sauce this recipe produces is fairly mild. If you would like a more intensely honey-mustard sauce, double up on the apple cider/mustard/honey mixture and skip the broth.\nPlease do NOT use red delicious apples for this recipe. That variety of apple simply does not cook well.\nINGREDIENTS\n1/2 cup sweet apple cider\n1 1/2 teaspoons cornstarch\nSalt\nFreshly ground black pepper\n1 tablespoon honey\n2 tablespoons Dijon mustard\n1/2 cup flour, for dredging\n1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breasts\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n2 small unpeeled apples, cored and cut into eighths (use Fuji, Granny Smith, Jonathan, Jonagold, Pippin, or McIntosh apples, good cooking apples)\n1/2 cup chicken broth\nFresh parsley for garnish\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Whisk apple cider, cornstarch, mustard, honey, salt and pepper (to taste) in a bowl. Set aside.\n2 Salt the chicken well and dust in flour. Shake off the excess.\n3 Brown the chicken breasts and apple slices: In a large non-stick skillet, heat the oil on medium to medium high heat. Once the oil is hot add the chicken breasts to the pan. Cook until well browned on one side, about 3-4 minutes.\nTurn chicken, add apples, and cook until the chicken has browned on the other side.\n4 Add broth cider mixture, cover and simmer: Add chicken broth and cider mixture to the pan and bring to a boil. Turn the heat down to low, cover the pot and simmer until chicken is tender, about 15 minutes.\n5 Reduce sauce: With slotted spoon, remove chicken and apples to serving plates. Increase the heat of the pan to high and simmer the sauce for a minute or two until it thickens.\nSpoon sauce over chicken and apples and sprinkle with parsley.\nServe with rice or noodles.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Save It Print\nSkillet Chicken with Cheesy Orzo and Zucchini Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 30 minutesYield: 4 to 6 servings\nIf you want to trade in the zucchini for 2 cups of small broccoli florets or peas, both are good options.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 to 2 tablespoons olive oil, as needed\n2 pounds boneless, skinless chicken breasts (4 to 6 pieces)\n1 medium yellow onion, chopped (about 1 cup chopped)\n1 1/2 cups dried orzo\n2 medium zucchini, cubed (about 2 cups cubed)\n2 teaspoons minced fresh thyme\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n3 cups chicken broth\n1 cup half-and-half (or whole milk)\n1/2 cup grated cheddar\n1/2 cup grated fontina or Havarti\nMETHOD\n1 Sear the chicken: In a very large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of the olive oil over medium-high heat. Season the chicken on both sides with salt and pepper.\nSear the chicken for about 4 minutes on each side, or until browned but not cooked through. (It should still be just barely pink in the center, if you want to cut into one of the pieces to test.) Transfer the chicken to a plate and set aside.\n2 Cook the onions and add the orzo: Reduce the heat to medium and add the remaining tablespoon of olive oil if needed (if there is still about a tablespoon of oil left in the pan, skip it).\nAdd the onions and saut\xc3\xa9 for 2 minutes until they start to become tender. Add the orzo and stir for another minute to coat it with the oil and onions.\n3 Add the zucchini and stock, and simmer: Stir in the zucchini, thyme, and 1/2 teaspoon of salt. Add the chicken broth, raise the heat to medium-high and allow the liquid to come to a simmer, about 3 minutes, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom.\nStir in the half-and half and bring it to a simmer, about 2 minutes. Cover the pan, lower the heat and simmer gently for about 8 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the orzo is almost tender. Much of the liquid will be absorbed, but it should still be fairly runny at this point.\n4  Add the cheese and chicken: Sprinkle in the cheeses in batches, stirring after each addition until the cheese is all melted. Taste the orzo after all the cheese is added and add additional salt if needed.\nTuck the browned chicken into the top of orzo mixture, and drizzle over top any juices that accumulated from the chicken as it rested.\nCover the pan and simmer for another 3 to 5 minutes, until the chicken is cooked through (165\xc2\xb0F with a digital thermometer) and the orzo and zucchini are tender. The orzo mixture will have thickened slightly, but should still be quite saucy, like a very loose risotto.\n5 Serve immediately: Serve the chicken and orzo hot from the pan.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nGrilled Moroccan Chicken Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 15 minutesMarinating time: 2 hoursYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n1/2 cup plain yogurt\n1 Tbsp lemon juice\n1/2 cup chopped fresh cilantro\n1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil\n2 cloves garlic, minced\n1 1/2 teaspoons ground cumin\n1 teaspoon paprika\n1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper\n1 1/2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breasts\nMETHOD\n1 Marinate the chicken: Mix the marinade ingredients (yogurt, lemon juice, cilantro, olive oil, garlic, cumin, paprika, cinnamon, salt, and pepper) together in a medium sized bowl.\nAdd the chicken pieces to the bowl and thoroughly coat with the marinade.\nCover with plastic wrap and chill in the refrigerator from 2 hours to overnight.\n2 Grill the chicken: Heat your grill on high heat if you are using a gas grill, or prepare coals for direct heat if you are using charcoal. Allow for one side of the grill to be the "cool" side. If you do not have a grill you can use a cast-iron grill pan on your stove.\nGrill the chicken breasts over direct high heat a couple of minutes on one side. Then turn them over and move them to the cool side of the grill. Cover and cook for a few minutes more, until the chicken is cooked through.\n(The easiest way to test for doneness is with your fingertips. See The Finger Test to Check the Doneness of Meat. Or use a meat thermometer, remove the meat from the grill when the internal temperature of the chicken breast reaches 165\xc2\xb0F.)\nTake care not to overcook, as chicken breasts can easily dry out.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nBroccoli, Chicken, and Almond Saut\xc3\xa9 Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 20 minutesYield: Serves 4\nThe amounts are estimates, adjust to your taste.\nINGREDIENTS\n1/2 pound to 3/4 pound boneless skinless chicken breasts\nKosher salt\nExtra virgin olive oil\nYour favorite spice rub for grilling (optional)\n1 pound broccoli florets\n1/4 teaspoon chile flakes (more to taste)\n1/3 to 1/2 cup toasted almonds, roughly chopped\n1 teaspoon dark sesame oil\nFreshly ground black pepper\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Put salted water on to boil: Put a 2 quart pot of salted water (about 1 Tbsp of salt) on to boil. While the water is heating, start the chicken cooking in the next step.\n2 Season the chicken breasts: Place the chicken breasts in a bowl and sprinkle seasoning on all sides. Use at a minimum some salt. Or if you have a favorite spice rub, you can use that too.\n3 Sear and slice the chicken breasts: Heat a grill pan, or prepare a grill, for high, direct heat. (If you don't have a grill pan or grill, use a cast iron skillet, and only season the chicken with salt.)\nRub some olive oil all over the chicken breasts. Grill the breasts for a few minutes on each side to get some nice char marks, then lower the temperature to low and leave on the grill until the breasts are just almost cooked through.\nThey'll cook a little longer in the saut\xc3\xa9 pan, so they can still be a little pink in the middle at this point.\nRemove from pan or grill, set aside for a minute, then thinly slice.\n4 Blanch broccoli florets: Once the chicken has cooked and the water is boiling, add the broccoli florets to the salted boiling water. Allow the water to come back to a boil, and once boiling again, let cook for about 1 minute. Drain.\n5 Stir-fry chili flakes, broccoli, chicken, toasted almonds: Heat a tablespoon of olive oil in a large saut\xc3\xa9 pan on high heat. Add the red chili flakes. Once the red chili flakes are sizzling, add the broccoli florets, sliced grilled chicken, and toasted almonds.\nDrizzle dark sesame oil over the broccoli and chicken, sprinkle with salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste. Toss and cook until all of the chicken pieces are no longer at all pink in the center, a minute or two.\nServe immediately.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b"Save It Print\nChicken Prosciutto Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 25 minutesYield: Serves 6-8\nINGREDIENTS\n2 lbs chicken cutlets\nFreshly ground black pepper\n1 stick (1/2 cup) unsalted butter\n8-12 whole fresh sage leaves\n1/2 pound very thinly sliced prosciutto\n2 eggs, beaten\n8 thin slices Italian Fontina cheese (about 2 oz)\nSauce:\n1 cup dry white wine (like a Sauvignon blanc)\n1 Tbsp minced fresh sage\n1/2 stick unsalted butter, chilled\nMETHOD\n1 Pound chicken cutlets to 1/8-inch thickness: Put the chicken cutlets between two sheets of plastic wrap or wax paper and pound to an even thickness of about 1/8-inch. Sprinkle with freshly ground black pepper.\n2 Fry sage leaves in butter: Melt butter in a large saut\xc3\xa9 pan on medium heat. Once the butter starts to foam, add the sage leaves to the pan and cook them for a minute or two, turning them half way through the cooking. Remove them from the pan.\n3 Place one or two fried sage leaves on each chicken cutlet and wrap with a thin layer of prosciutto.\n4 Dip cutlets in beaten egg, cook in pan: Prepare a shallow bowl with the beaten eggs. Check that the foaming butter in the pan is golden and not browned. (If it has browned too much, start over with new butter, melting it until it foams.)\nWorking in batches so that you don't crowd the pan, dip each prosciutto-wrapped chicken cutlet in beaten egg and place it in the pan.\nCook them for a couple minutes on each side, until just cooked through. Remove from the pan.\n5 Cover with slice of cheese, then broil: Preheat the oven broiler. Arrange the chicken cutlets on a baking sheet and cover each cutlet with a slice of cheese. Place under the broiler just until the cheese melts, about a minute.\n6 While the chicken is under the broiler make the sauce: Pour out the butter from the pan. Increase the heat to high and add the wine to the pan, deglazing the pan. Boil the wine until it has reduced almost by half.\nAdd the minced sage and cook for a minute longer. Stir in the chilled butter.\nPour the sauce around the chicken cutlets to serve.\n  Hello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b"Print\nChicken Minestrone with Basil Pesto Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesCook time: 25 minutesYield: 8 to 10 servings\nUse leftover chicken for this recipe, or quickly poach a few chicken breasts: How to Poach Chicken Breasts, the Quick and Easy Way.\nLeftover soup will keep for up to 5 days in the fridge. It also freezes well, and can be frozen for up to 3 months.\nVegetarian Variation: Skip the chicken, and add cubes of potatoes and some thinly sliced cabbage. Use vegetable broth in place of chicken broth.\nINGREDIENTS\n2 tablespoons olive oil\n1 large yellow onion, diced small\n3 ribs celery, diced small\n3 medium carrots, diced small\n2 small (12 ounces) zucchini, diced small\n1/2 teaspoon salt, plus more to taste\nBlack pepper, to taste\n1 can (15 ounces) cannellini beans, drained and rinsed, or 1 1/2 cups cooked white beans\n1 can (28 ounces) whole San Marzano tomatoes, with juices\n6 cups chicken stock or water\n1/2 cup small pasta, such as small shells, ditalini, or ancini di pepe,\n2 handfuls (8 ounces) green beans, trimmed and cut into 1-inch lengths\n3 cups cooked, shredded chicken\n1 cup pesto, homemade or store-bought\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cook the vegetables: In a large soup pot over medium heat, heat the oil. Add the onion, celery, carrots, zucchini, and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes, or until the vegetables begin to soften.\n2 Crush the tomatoes in a bowl: Pour the tomatoes and their juices into a bowl. Using your hands, a dinner fork, or a potato masher, crush the tomatoes into small pieces.\n3 Simmer the soup: Add the beans, crushed tomatoes and stock or water to the pot and bring to a simmer.  Cook for about 8 minutes. Add the green beans and the pasta and continue to cook for 8 to 10 minutes, or until the pasta is tender. Stir in the shredded chicken and cook for another minute, or until the soup is hot all the way through.\nTaste the soup and add more salt and black pepper to taste.\nIf you haven't already done so, make your pesto while the soup simmers.\n4 Serve the soup: Ladle the soup into bowls and garnish with a few spoonfuls of pesto.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b'Save It Print\nTeriyaki Chicken Breasts Recipe\nCook time: 30 minutesYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n3/4 cup soy sauce* (or mix tamari** and water in equal proportions to make 3/4 cup)\n3/4 cup sake\n3/4 cup mirin\n4 Tbsp sugar\nA 1-inch piece of ginger, grated fine\n4 skinless, boneless chicken breasts, about 1 1/4 to 1 1/2 pounds total (set out for 30 minutes to come to room temp)\n2-3 Tbsp sesame seeds\n*Use gluten-free soy sauce for gluten-free version.\n**If you are using tamari instead of soy sauce, use half as much, as tamari is more concentrated than soy sauce.\nMETHOD\n1 Gently simmer chicken in sauce made with sake, mirin, soy sauce, sugar, ginger: Mix the grated ginger, sugar, soy sauce, sake and mirin in a pot and bring to a boil. Add the chicken breasts, return to a simmer, then lower the heat to the lowest possible setting (warm if you can), on your smallest burner, and cover.\nThe idea is to cook the chicken as gently as possible, below a simmer. Cook for 20 minutes.\nIf you are working with somewhat large chicken breasts, you may need to cook them longer, or cut them in half before cooking.\n2 Toast sesame seeds: While the chicken is poaching, toast the sesame seeds in a dry pan until they begin to brown. Move to a small bowl and set aside.\n3 Set aside chicken, cover with foil: Remove the chicken breasts from the teriyaki sauce, set on a plate and wrap with foil.\n4 Reduce sauce: Bring the sauce back to a boil and boil vigorously until the sauce is reduced to a syrup, about 8-10 minutes. Keep an eye on the sauce, stirring it occasionally.\n5 Slice chicken, cover with sauce, sprinkle with sesame seeds and serve: To serve, slice the chicken breasts, cover with the teriyaki sauce and sprinkle sesame seeds on them. Serve with plain white rice.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nMediterranean Chicken Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 25 minutesYield: Serves 4\nThere are lots of uses for this basic salad. Try mixing some cooked pasta in with it.\nOr placing a spoonful into boats of endive lettuce. Endive tastes particularly good with this salad, so it would also work just to chop some up and add it to the chicken salad.\nYou could also stuff an avocado half with it, or stuff fresh tomatoes.\nINGREDIENTS\n1/2 cup minced red onion\n2 tablespoons red wine vinegar\n1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breasts\nSalt\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n1 tablespoon capers\n3/4 cup mixed pitted deli olives, sliced\n1 pinch of red chile flakes\n1 tablespoon chopped fresh oregano or basil (or both!)\n2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley\nBlack pepper to taste\nOptional:\nEndive lettuce for appetizer boats, or chopped to add to the salad\nButter lettuce for lettuce cups\nFusilli pasta, about 1/4 pound dry for one batch of the salad (use gluten-free pasta for gluten-free option)\nMETHOD\n1 Marinate the onion in vinegar: Mix the minced onion with the vinegar in a bowl and set aside. This quick pickling will take the edge off of the onions.\n2 Poach the chicken: Bring 1 1/2 quarts of water to a boil and add about 2 tablespoons of salt. Cut the chicken breasts in half crosswise and place them in the water. Reduce the heat to low and let the chicken cook very gently, at barely a simmer, for 10-15 minutes, until just cooked through.\n3 Combine the other salad ingredients: While the chicken is cooking, mix the olive oil, capers, olives, chile flakes, and oregano in a large bowl.\n4 Dice or shred the chicken: When the chicken is done, place it on a cutting board to cool. Add the onions to the bowl with the olives. Once the chicken has cooled enough to handle, cut it into dice or shred it.\n5 Combine chicken, parsley, with other salad ingredients: Gently mix the chicken and parsley in with the olives. Add salt and black pepper to taste. Serve warm, at room temperature, or chilled.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Print\nHerbed Chicken Tenders with Tomato Sauce Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 25 minutesSoaking time: 15 to 30 minutesYield: Serves 4 to 6\nYou can make a substitute for buttermilk by adding a tablespoon and a half of lemon juice or vinegar to 1 1/2 cups of milk and letting the mixture stand for 10 minutes.\nA mixture of dried herbs often used in Italian cooking such as marjoram, thyme, rosemary, savory, sage, oregano, and basil\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the chicken tenders:\n2 pounds chicken tenders (about 12 pieces)\n1 1/2 cups buttermilk (See Recipe Note)\n1 cup breadcrumbs\n2 tablespoons Italian seasoning herbs (See Recipe Note)\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n2 tablespoons butter, melted\nFor the tomato dipping sauce:\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n1/4 cup minced onion\n1 chopped garlic clove\n1 tablespoons tomato paste\n1 15-ounce can tomato sauce or crushed tomatoes\n1 teaspoon salt\n1 teaspoon sugar\nMETHOD\n1 Soak tenders in buttermilk for 15 to 30 minutes. While the tenders are soaking, make the tomato dipping sauce.\n2 Make the tomato dipping sauce: Heat the olive oil in a pot over medium-high heat. Saut\xc3\xa9 the onions, stirring often, until translucent, about 3 minutes. Add the garlic and cook another minute.\nAdd the tomato paste, mix well and cook for 1 to 2 minutes more. The tomato paste should darken to a brick-red color.\nAdd the tomato sauce or crushed tomatoes, salt and sugar and bring to a boil. Cook this for 5 minutes if using tomato sauce, 10 minutes if using crushed tomatoes.\n3 Blend the dipping sauce: Put the sauce into a blender and pur\xc3\xa9e until smooth. Hold your hand over the blender lid to keep it from popping off, and start the blender at a low setting and work up to the highest.\nThe sauce will keep in the fridge for up to a week.\n4 Heat oven to 500\xc2\xb0F. Line a sheet pan with foil and set an oven-safe metal cooking rack inside. Baking the tenders on this rack will help get them crispy on all sides.\n5 Coat the tenders with breadcrumbs: Mix together the breadcrumbs, Italian seasoning, and salt in a shallow bowl. One by one, remove the chicken tenders from the buttermilk and place in the bowl with breadcrumbs, coating them on all sides with the breadcrumbs.\nPlace on the wire rack set inside the sheet pan, spaced slightly apart.\n6 Bake the tenders: Drizzle a little melted butter over each chicken tender. Place the pan in the oven and bake for about 12 minutes, until the chicken is cooked through and the pieces are lightly browned.\n7 Serve with a bowl of the sauce for dipping.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b"Save It Print\nBBQ Chicken Burrito Bowl Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 10 minutesYield: 4 servings\nIf you're making this for lunch, assemble the bowls in a lunch container, but pack the lettuce and salsa separately. Heat the bowls, then add top with the lettuce and salsa.\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the BBQ sauce (or substitute 3/4 to 1 cup bottled sauce):\n1 cup ketchup\n1/2 cup tomato sauce\n2 tablespoons distilled white vinegar (apple cider vinegar also works)\n2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce\n1 tablespoon honey (light brown sugar or maple syrup also works)\n2 1/2 teaspoons paprika\n1/2 teaspoon granulated garlic\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n1/4 teaspoon ground cumin\nFor the burrito bowls:\n1 pound (450g) chicken breasts (or substitute 2 cups cooked, shredded chicken)\n4 cups chicken broth or water, for cooking the chicken\n1 cup uncooked brown rice (or substitute 3 cups cooked rice)\n1 1/4 cup fresh or frozen corn kernels\n1 15-ounce (425g) can black beans, drained and rinsed\n6 to 8 romaine lettuce leaves, chopped into strips\n1 cup pico de gallo or your favorite salsa\n1 cup shredded cheddar or monterey jack cheese, optional\nCrushed tortilla chips, for topping\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\nDo-ahead steps:\n1 Make the barbecue sauce (or substitute 3/4 to 1 cup bottled sauce): Mix all of the ingredients for the BBQ sauce (ketchup through cumin) in a saucepan and heat over medium heat. When the sauce starts bubbling, reduce the heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes, stirring frequently. (This sauce splatters everywhere once it heats up. Be prepared to wipe down your stovetop and countertops after making this!) Remove from heat.\nYou should have about 1 2/3 cups of sauce.  The sauce will keep for 1 to 2 weeks refrigerated.\n2 Cook the chicken (or substitute 2 cups shredded cooked chicken): Place the chicken breasts in a 4-quart or larger pot with a lid and pour the chicken broth over top. The chicken should be covered by about an inch; add additional broth or water if needed. Place over high heat and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for 10 minutes. Check that the chicken is cooked through and registers 165F in the thickest part. Cook another few minutes if needed. Use tongs to transfer the cooked chicken breasts to a cutting board to cool briefly.\nWhen the chicken is cool, shred the meat into bite-sized pieces. Refrigerate in an air-tight container for up to 5 days.\n3 Cook the rice (or substitute 3 cups cooked rice): Combine the rice with 1/2 teaspoon of salt and 2 cups of water (or enough to cover by about an inch). Bring to a simmer over medium heat, then lower the heat and cover. Cook until the rice is tender, 35 to 45 minutes (or according to package instructions). Check occasionally and add more water if the pan seems dry before the rice is cooked.\nCool the cooked rice, and then transfer to a storage container. Refrigerate for up to 5 days.\n  To assemble the burrito bowls:\n1 Mix the chicken with the barbecue sauce: Warm the barbecue sauce for a few minutes in a small pan or skillet over medium-high heat. Add the shredded chicken and stir to coat with the barbecue sauce. Leave the chicken in the pan until it has warmed through, about 2 to 3 minutes. Turn off heat.\n2 Warm the corn and beans: Heat the corn and black beans together or separately in a pan or skillet over medium-high heat for 2 to 3 minutes. Add a pinch of salt to your corn and beans and turn off heat.\n3 Warm the rice in the microwave or on a pan. If you are using the microwave, pour the rice into a large bowl and cover it with a damp paper towel. Microwave the rice on high for about 1 minute. Check to see if the rice has warmed through. If it is still cold in some spots, give everything a stir and continue microwaving at 15-second intervals, until the rice is heated to your liking.\n4 Assemble the burrito bowls: Divide the rice, chicken, corn, beans, romaine lettuce, and pico de gallo into 4 bowls. Top with cheese, if using, and then crush a few tortilla chips on top of each bowl for extra crunch.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b"Save It Print\nMaple-Glazed Chicken with Caramelized Onions and Pears Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 45 minutesYield: 4 servings\nIf you don't have an oven-safe skillet, transfer the cooked onions and pears to a baking dish in Step 4, place the chicken on top, and bake.\nINGREDIENTS\n4 skinless, boneless chicken breasts (1 1/2 to 2 pounds total)\n1 teaspoon salt, divided, plus more to taste\n1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper, divided, plus more to taste\n2 tablespoons olive oil\n2 tablespoons butter\n1 large Spanish or yellow onion, halved and thinly sliced\n2 large ripe firm-fleshed pears (like Bartlett), or 3 smaller pears\n2 tablespoons maple syrup\n1 tablespoon Dijon mustard\n3 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley\nSpecial equipment:\n1 large cast iron skillet, or other oven-safe skillet\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Brown the chicken: Heat the oven at 450\xc2\xb0F. Sprinkle the chicken with 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.\nHeat the olive oil in the skillet over medium-high heat. When it is hot, add the chicken and cook without disturbing for 3 to 5 minutes, until the underside is golden. Turn and cook the other sides for 3 to 5 minutes more, until the other side is golden. Transfer chicken to a large plate.\n2 Cook the onion: Melt the butter in the skillet over medium heat. Add the onion, 1/2 teaspoon of salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Cook, stirring often, for 8 minutes, or until the onion starts to brown.\n3 Prep and cook the pears: While the onions cook, peel and core the pears. Cut into quarters (large pears can be cut into 6 pieces.)\nMove the onions to the center of the pan. Add the pears, cut sides down, around the edge. Cook for 4 minutes or until the pears brown on the bottom. Stir the onions occasionally.\nTurn the pears and cook the other cut sides for 3 minutes more. Stir the onions occasionally.\n4 Return the chicken to the skillet and glaze: Gently stir the pears and onions together and flatten them slightly to create a bed for the chicken. Place the chicken on top of the pears and onions. Tip in any pan juices from the plate into the skillet.\nIn a small bowl, stir together the maple syrup and mustard. Spread the glaze over the chicken breasts with a spoon.\n5 Bake the chicken: Transfer the skillet to the oven and cook for 20 to 25 minutes, or until the glaze is browned, the pears are tender when pierced, and the chicken is cooked through. A meat thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the breasts should register 165\xc2\xb0F.\n6 Serve the chicken: Divide the pears and onions between plates, add a chicken breast, and sprinkle with parsley.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nChipotle Grilled Chicken with Avocado Sandwich Recipe\nYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n3 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n1 tablespoon lime juice\n1/2 teaspoon chipotle chile powder (less or more depending on how much heat you want)\n1 pound boneless skinless chicken breasts (about 2 breast halves)\n4 small slices of Monterey Jack cheese\n4 sets of hamburger buns\n1 avocado, peeled, seeded and sliced\nIceberg or lettuce of preference\nMayonnaise\nMETHOD\n1 Make the marinade: In a shallow bowl, stir together the olive oil, lime juice, and chipotle chile powder.\n2 Pound chicken breasts to even thickness: Place the chicken breasts between two sheets of wax paper. Use a meat pounder to pound the breasts to an even thickness of about 1/2 inch. Cut off excess fat. If you are starting with 2 half-pound chicken breast halves, cut each one in half so that you have 4 pieces (to better fit the buns).\n3 Marinate the chicken: Place the chicken breasts in the marinade, turning to coat. Cover with plastic wrap. Let marinate for at least 15 minutes, preferably an hour.\n4 Grill the chicken breasts and buns: Heat your grill on high heat if you are using a gas grill, or prepare coals for direct heat if you are using charcoal. You can also use a cast-iron grill pan on your stove if you do not have a grill.\nGrill the chicken pieces a couple minutes on each side, until cooked through. Once you have cooked the chicken pieces on one side and flipped them, add a slice of cheese to the chicken. Cover the grill for half a minute to melt the cheese.\nToast the buns on the grill as well.\n5 Assemble: Assemble the sandwiches - bun bottom, chicken with melted cheese, avocado and lettuce, mayonnaise on the top bun.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nChicken, Mushrooms, and Tomatoes with Port Wine Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 20 minutesYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n4 chicken boneless breast halves (with skin or without)\nSalt and pepper to taste\n6 whole cloves garlic\n2 tablespoons butter\n1/4 pound of cremini mushrooms, halved or quartered if large\n3 tablespoons finely chopped shallots\n1/4 cup Port wine\n4 small (3/4 pound) plum tomatoes, cored and quartered, or 3/4 pound cherry tomatoes, cut in half (about 2 cups)\n2 tablespoons chopped parsley (for garnish)\nMETHOD\n1 Salt the chicken: Sprinkle the chicken breasts on both sides with salt and pepper.\n2 Boil the garlic: Drop the garlic into a small saucepan of boiling water, cook for 5 minutes, and set aside. When cool, peel of the skins.\n3 Brown the chicken: Heat the butter in a heavy skillet and add the chicken pieces. Cook over medium high heat for about 1 minute, or until lightly browned on one side. Turn and cook for about 1 minute on the second side.\n4 Add the mushrooms and cook, turning chicken occasionally, for about 2 minutes.\n5 Add the shallots and the garlic cloves to the pan. Add the Port wine, tomatoes, salt and pepper to taste. Cover and cook for 10 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through )a thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the breast registers 165\xc2\xb0F).\nTransfer the chicken, mushrooms, and tomatoes to a warm platter.\nIf the sauce is thin, cook it down for a minute or two. Pour onto chicken and sprinkle with chopped parsley.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nZucchini Noodle Chicken Pesto Bowl Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 20 minutesYield: Serves 2\nINGREDIENTS\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n1/2 pound boneless skinless chicken breast(s)\nSalt\n1/4 teaspoon paprika\n2 medium large zucchini (a little more than a pound)\n2 garlic cloves, sliced\n1/4 cup prepared basil pesto\nHandful of cherry tomatoes, cut in half\nSeveral fresh basil leaves, thinly sliced, for garnish\nSpecial equipment:\nVegetable spiralizer, like Ali Maffucci's Inspiralizer\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cook the chicken breast(s): Sprinkle both sides of the chicken breast(s) with a little salt and the paprika. Heat 1 Tbsp of olive oil on high heat in a large saut\xc3\xa9 pan. Place the chicken breast(s) in the pan and cook for a minute or two on each side, until well browned.\nLower the heat to low and cover the pan, cook for 2 to 5 more minutes (depending on the thickness of the breast) until the chicken is just cooked through.\nRemove the chicken from the pan and let it rest while you make the zucchini noodles.\n2 Make zucchini noodles: Use a spiralizer to make zucchini noodles with the zucchini.\n3 Saut\xc3\xa9 the zucchini noodles, garlic: Add another 1 Tbsp of olive oil to the pan you used to cook the chicken and heat it on high heat.\nAdd the zucchini noodles and the sliced garlic and saut\xc3\xa9, stirring often, until the noodles begin to wilt. Sprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon of salt while you cook the zoodles.\nWhen they are just barely cooked and if they are releasing moisture, remove them to a colander placed over a bowl to drain.\n4 Slice or cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces.\n5 Toss zucchini noodles with pesto: Place the zucchini noodles in a serving bowl and toss with basil pesto.\nServe the zucchini noodles in bowls topped with chicken, tomatoes, and sliced fresh basil leaves.\n  Hello! b'Save It Print\nChinese Smashed Cucumber Chicken Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesResting time: 30 minutesYield: 4 servings\nFor a vegan version, substitute 1 block cubed tofu for the chicken.\nTwo poached chicken breasts will make enough for this recipe. See: How to Poach Chicken Breasts.\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the salad:\n2 large English cucumbers or other thin skinned cucumbers, such as Persian or Japanese (2 to 2 1/2 pounds)\n1 teaspoon salt\n1 pound (about 2 cups) shredded cooked chicken, cold from the fridge\n2 tablespoons sesame seeds, to serve\nCilantro leaves, to serve (optional)\nDried red chili flakes, to serve (optional)\nFor the dressing:\n1/4 cup rice vinegar\n2 tablespoons soy sauce, tamari, or coconut aminos\n2 tablespoons honey\n2 teaspoons finely grated ginger\n1 clove garlic, minced\n1/4 cup chopped cilantro\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Smash the cucumbers: Wash cucumbers well and pat dry. Use the flat edge of a large knife or cleaver to smash the cucumbers in several places along their length. The cucumbers should split into several strips.\nUse your hands to break the cucumbers into bite-sized pieces.\n2 Salt and drain the cucumbers: Transfer the cucumber pieces to a colander and place the colander inside a large bowl. Sprinkle with 1 teaspoon salt and toss gently so all the pieces are salted evenly.\nRefrigerate for 30 minutes. As they sit, the salt will draw moisture from the cucumbers, which will collect in the bottom of the bowl.\n3 Make the dressing: Whisk together rice vinegar, soy, honey, ginger, minced garlic, and cilantro. Chill in the fridge while cucumbers are draining.\n4 Assemble the salad: Transfer the cucumbers to a serving bowl. Add the shredded chicken and dressing. Toss to combine and dress the salad. Taste and add an extra splash of vinegar or soy sauce if needed.\nDivide between serving plates and top with sesame seeds, dried chili, and more cilantro. Serve immediately. (Leftovers do not keep well.)\n  Hello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Print\nGrilled Chicken Nachos Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 10 minutesYield: Serves 4-8\nINGREDIENTS\nNachos:\n8 ounces tortilla chips\n2 cups finely grated cheddar cheese\n1 cup chopped cooked chicken meat (a rotisserie chicken is great for this)\n1/4 cup BBQ Sauce\nSour Cream BBQ Sauce:\n1/2 cup sour cream\n1/4 cup BBQ Sauce\nExtras (all optional):\n1 tomato, chopped\n1/4 red onion, chopped\n1 jalapeno, thinly sliced\n1/2 bunch cilantro, chopped\n1/2 avocado, chopped\nYou\'ll need:\n2 15x12-inch sheets of heavy duty aluminum foil\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat grill and prep ingredients: Preheat your grill for high direct heat. While the grill is heating, prep the ingredients.\n2 Mix BBQ sauce with chicken: Mix the cooked chicken with the BBQ sauce and set aside.\n3 Make sour cream BBQ sauce: Mix the sour cream with BBQ sauce and set aside.\n4 Make foil boats: Take the sheets of aluminum foil and crimp the sides so that you have "boats".\n5 Assemble nachos: Arrange a layer of tortilla chips over the bottom of the foil. It\'s okay if some of the chips overlap, but all chips should have some exposure at the top. Sprinkle with most of the cheese (reserve some to go on top of the chicken).\nSprinkle the BBQ sauce coated cooked chopped chicken over the chips. Sprinkle with remaining cheese.\n6 Grill: Place nacho boats on pre-heated grill, cover and cook for 5 to 10 minutes, until the cheese is melted and the chips are lightly browned at the edges.\nIf your grill doesn\'t have a cover (as in a campfire), either make a large foil packet to put the nachos in, or tent the foil boats with another piece of foil. Some of the nachos prepared this way may not be as crispy, but they\'ll still be great.\n7 Serve: To serve, drizzle with sour cream BBQ sauce and sprinkle with extras such as chopped tomato, red onion, jalape\xc3\xb1o, and/or cilantro.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Save It Print\nChipotle Salsa Baked Chicken Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 35 minutesYield: Serves 6\nThis casserole produces a lot of sauce! Use it to spoon over rice or pasta, or for dipping tortilla chips.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 15-ounce can fire roasted tomatoes (or canned whole or crushed tomatoes if fire roasted are not available)\n1/4 cup chopped red onion\n1 clove garlic, chopped\n1/2 cup, packed, chopped fresh cilantro\n2 chipotle chili peppers in adobo, plus 1 teaspoon adobo sauce (less or more to taste)\n1 teaspoon lime juice\n1 teaspoon kosher salt\n1 1/2 pound boneless, skinless chicken breasts (or thighs), trimmed of excess fat, cut into 3-inch wide pieces\n4 ounces grated or sliced Monterey jack cheese\nServe with or over\nAvocados\nMore chopped cilantro\nSour cream\nCorn or flour tortillas\nRice\nPasta\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Make the salsa: Place tomatoes, onion, garlic, cilantro, chipotle peppers and adobo, lime juice and salt in a blender or food processor. Pulse a few times so there are no more large chunks of anything, but not so much so that the salsa is completely smooth.\n2 Spread salsa over chicken: Preheat the oven to 350\xc2\xb0F. Place the chicken pieces in a casserole dish, just large enough to fit them all in a single layer (about 8x10-inches).  Spread the chipotle salsa over the chicken pieces, turning the chicken pieces to coat them all over with the salsa.\n3 Bake, layer with cheese, bake again: Cover with aluminum foil and bake for 25 minutes (30 minutes for thighs). Remove the foil, and sprinkle or layer the cheese over the chicken. Bake uncovered for 10 minutes more.\nServe over rice, pasta, or with tortillas on the side, along with chopped avocado, more cilantro, crema fresca or sour cream.\nVariation: This is a bake-in-the-oven recipe. You could easily adapt the recipe to the stovetop this way:  sear the chicken pieces first in a little olive oil, remove the chicken, add the onions to the pan, cook them till soft, add the garlic and chiles, cook a little longer, add the tomatoes, lime juice, cilantro, and salt, then add the chicken, coat the chicken with the sauce, bring to a low simmer, cover, cook for 25 minutes, sprinkle with cheese, cover and cook for a few more minutes until the cheese is melted.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Print\nChicken with Goat Cheese and Arugula Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n4 chicken breasts (about 1 1/2 lbs total), tenders removed, breasts pounded thin\nSalt\nGround black pepper\n1 large bunch arugula (about 4 ounces, trimmed)\n4 oz of soft goat cheese (chevre) broken into small pieces\n1-2 tablespoons butter or extra virgin olive oil\nWooden Toothpicks\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Pound chicken breasts thin: Preheat oven to 425\xc2\xb0F. Pound the breasts thin to make them thin enough for rolling. To do this place a piece of plastic wrap over the chicken breast. Use the smooth side of the meat pounder to pound the piece thin.\n2 Layer arugula and cheese on cutlets: Season the chicken pieces with salt and pepper. On a clean work surface lay cutlets flat, smooth side down. Layer with arugula leaves and pieces of goat cheese in the center.\n3 Roll up and secure with toothpicks: Starting with the narrowest ends, roll up the chicken cutlets into a tight roulade and seal with toothpicks to keep from unrolling.\n4 Brown chicken roulades on all sides Heat the oil on medium high in a large cast iron pan (or other non-stick oven-proof skillet). Place the chicken roulades in the pan and brown on all sides.\n5 Finish in oven: Place the skillet in the oven and cook until the chicken is cooked through, about 10 to 12 minutes. Remove pan from oven (take care to not touch pan handle with bare hands!) and remove the chicken from the pan.\n6 Cover with foil and let rest for 5 minutes. Remove the toothpicks from the chicken and slice the roulades into rounds to serve.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Save It Print\nChicken with Creamy Cassis Sauce Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 20 minutesYield: Serves 3 to 4\nINGREDIENTS\n4 boneless, skinless chicken breast halves or cutlets (about 1 1/4 pounds)\n1/3 cup flour\nSalt\nFreshly ground black pepper\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n1/3 cup dry white wine\n1/4 cup cr\xc3\xa8me de cassis (or a teaspoon of Dijon)\n1/4 cup heavy cream\n2 tablespoons unsalted butter\nMETHOD\n1 Dredge chicken: Rinse the chicken breasts and pat dry with paper towels. Dredge them in flour, shake off the excess flour and season with salt and pepper.\n2 Brown chicken on both sides: Heat oil in a large skillet on medium high. Place the chicken breasts in the skillet and cook, turning once, until both sides are golden brown and the chicken is just cooked through, about 10 minutes.\nTransfer the chicken to a platter, cover with foil to keep warm.\n3 Make sauce: Discard excess fat in the skillet. Add the wine and deglaze, scraping up the browned bits. Boil the wine down for half a minute, add the cr\xc3\xa8me de cassis and the cream.\nContinue to boil down the mixture until it is reduced by a third. Whisk in the butter. Add salt and pepper and spoon over chicken breasts to serve.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nInstant Pot Chicken Tortilla Soup Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 45 minutesYield: Serves 6\nINGREDIENTS\n2 tablespoons olive oil\n2 cloves garlic, chopped\n1 medium yellow onion, diced\n1/2 teaspoon kosher salt\n4 cups chicken broth\n1 (4-ounce) can fire-roasted diced green chilies\n1 (15-ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained\n1 1/2 cups corn kernels (fresh or frozen)\n1 (14.5-ounce) can fire-roasted crushed tomatoes\n1 pound chicken tenders or thighs, boneless and skinless\nFor the corn tortilla strips:\n6 street taco-sized corn tortillas\n1 tablespoon avocado oil or olive oil\n1/2 teaspoon kosher salt\nTo garnish:\n3/4 cup shredded Monterey Jack or Mexican blend cheese\n1 large avocado, sliced\n1/2 cup fresh chopped cilantro\n1 lime, cut into 6 wedges\nSpecial equipment:\nInstant Pot\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Saut\xc3\xa9 the onions and garlic: Select the \xe2\x80\x9cSaut\xc3\xa9\xe2\x80\x9d setting on your pressure cooker and heat the olive oil. Add the garlic, onion, and salt and saut\xc3\xa9 for about 3 minutes until the onion begins to soften.\n2 Add the remaining soup ingredients: Add the chicken broth, using a wooden spoon or spatula to scrape up any browned bits from the bottom of the pot. Stir in the green chilies, black beans, corn, tomatoes, and chicken.\n3 Cook the soup: Cancel the \xe2\x80\x9cSaut\xc3\xa9\xe2\x80\x9d program to reset your pressure cooker. Place the lid on the pressure cooker. Make sure the pressure regulator is set to the \xe2\x80\x9cSealing\xe2\x80\x9d position. Select the \xe2\x80\x9cPressure Cook\xe2\x80\x9d or \xe2\x80\x9cManual\xe2\x80\x9d setting and set the cooking time for 10 minutes at high pressure. (The pot will take about 15 minutes to come up to pressure before the cooking program begins.)\n4 While the soup cooks, make the tortilla strips: Preheat a toaster oven, air fryer, or oven to 350\xc2\xb0F. Pour the oil into a bowl large enough to toss the tortilla strips. Cut the tortillas into 1/4-inch strips, then toss them in the bowl with the oil.\nBake or air fry the tortillas until they are golden and slightly browned around the edges, about 7-9 minutes. Right when you take the strips out of the toaster oven or air fryer, sprinkle them with the salt. Set aside to cool.\n5 Release and serve or keep warm: When the cooking program ends on the Instant Pot, let the pressure release naturally for at least 15 minutes. The pot will default to its \xe2\x80\x9cKeep Warm\xe2\x80\x9d setting. You can serve the soup right away or leave it for up to 10 hours.\n6 Shred the chicken: Once the pressure has released, open the pot. Use tongs to transfer the cooked chicken to a cutting board. Use a pair of forks to shred the chicken, then add it back to the soup and stir to combine. Taste for seasoning, adding more salt if you like.\n7 Serve the soup: Ladle the soup into bowls. Top each bowl with shredded cheese, sliced avocado, and cilantro. Serve with wedges of lime and tortillas alongside.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nChicken Mulligatawny Soup Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 45 minutesYield: Serves 4 to 6\nINGREDIENTS\n2 tablespoons butter\n1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil\n1 large onion, chopped (about 2 cups)\n2 ribs celery, chopped (about 1 cup)\n2 carrots, chopped (about 1 cup)\n2 bay leaves\n4 teaspoon yellow curry powder\n1 1/4 pound (570 g) boneless, skinless chicken thighs, trimmed of visible fat\n2 cups (475 ml) chicken stock\n2 cups (475 ml) water\n1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt (or 1 teaspoon sea salt)\n1/4 cup uncooked basmati rice\n2 tart apples, cored, peeled, and chopped (about 2 cups)\n1/4  (60 ml) cup heavy whipping cream\n1/4 cup (60 ml) plain yogurt for garnish\n1 tablespoon minced chives for garnish\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Saut\xc3\xa9 onions, celery, carrots in olive oil and butter, add bay leaves, curry powder: Heat butter and olive oil on medium high heat in a large (4 to 5 quart), thick-bottomed pot. Add the onions, celery, and carrots. Cook for 5 minutes until just starting to soften. Add the bay leaves. Add the curry powder and mix to coat.\n2 Add chicken, stock, salt: Add the chicken thighs and stir to coat with the curry mixture. Add the stock and water to the pot. Add the salt. Bring to a simmer and reduce the heat to maintain a simmer. Cover and cook for 20 minutes.\n3 Remove chicken, let cool to touch: Remove the chicken pieces from the pot. (They should be just cooked through. If not, return them to the pot for another 5 minutes or so, until they are cooked through.) Place on a cutting board and allow to cool to the touch.\n4 Add rice, apples: Add the rice and the chopped apples to the soup. Return to a simmer on high heat, then lower the heat to maintain a low simmer. Cover and cook for 15 minutes, or until the rice is cooked through.\n5 Shred the chicken, return to soup, add cream: While the apples and rice are cooking in the soup, shred the chicken, discarding any tough bits. Once the rice and apples in the soup are cooked, add the chicken back to the pot. Heat for 5 minutes more. Then stir in the cream.\nServe with yogurt and chives.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nBasil Chicken Coconut Curry Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 25 minutesYield: Serves 4\nWe use chicken thigh meat because of the deeper flavor, but you can use chicken breast meat if you prefer.\nThis is a mild curry. You can increase the heat with more cayenne. Please note that jalape\xc3\xb1os vary greatly in heat.  Check the spiciness of your jalape\xc3\xb1os and adjust the recipe to taste.\nNote that what we usually buy labelled "curry powder" is just a spice mix, made up of various spices, like those in the following ingredients, including a good portion of turmeric, which gives the curry powder its yellow color. Feel free to experiment a little with the spices listed here to get the taste you like the best.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 teaspoon salt\n1/2 teaspoon ground coriander\n1/2 teaspoon cumin\nA small pinch of ground cloves\n1/4 teaspoon cinnamon\n1/4 teaspoon ground cardamom\n1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper\n1/4 to 1/2 teaspoon cayenne, or more to taste\n1/2 teaspoon turmeric\n1 lb skinless, boneless chicken thighs, cut into 1 1/2-inch chunks\n1 large onion, sliced root to tip\n5 cloves garlic, minced\n1 Tbsp finely chopped fresh ginger\n1-2 jalape\xc3\xb1o peppers, seeded and minced\n2 Tbsp canola oil, rice bran oil or ghee\n1 14-oz can coconut milk\n1 Tbsp lime juice, or to taste\n12-20 fresh basil leaves, torn roughly\nHot cooked rice for serving\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Mix the spices: In a small bowl, mix together the salt, ground coriander, cumin, ground cloves, cinnamon, ground cardamom, black pepper, cayenne and turmeric. Set aside.\n2 Saut\xc3\xa9 onions, jalape\xc3\xb1os, ginger, garlic, spices: In a wok or deep saut\xc3\xa9 pan, heat the oil over high heat. The moment the oil begins to smoke, add the onions and jalape\xc3\xb1os and toss to coat in oil. Sear the vegetables for 3 minutes, stirring only enough to keep them from burning, but still allowing the onions to sear.\nAdd the ginger, garlic and spice mixture and toss to combine, cook for 1 minute.\n3 Add coconut milk, chicken, simmer:  Add the coconut milk and chicken. Stir the mixture so that the chicken pieces are coated in the coconut milk. Bring to a simmer, reduce the heat, cover and cook for 20 minutes.\n4 Add basil, lime juice: When the chicken is tender, turn off the heat and add the basil and lime juice. Add more lime juice and salt to taste and serve over rice.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nChicken Curry in a Hurry Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 20 minutesYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n1 1/2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast cutlets*\nSalt\n3 teaspoons your favorite yellow curry powder or combination of curry spices (such as garam masala)\n1 Tbsp coconut oil or extra virgin olive oil\n1 medium-large onion, thinly sliced crosswise (about 2 cups\n1/3 cup golden raisins (optional), placed in a bowl and covered with water to plump them\nFreshly ground black pepper\n1 cup sour cream or a mixture of plain full-fat yogurt (or Greek yogurt) and whipping cream or sour cream\nMinced fresh cilantro and toasted slivered almonds (optional) for garnish\n*The cutlets should be about 1/2-inch thick. If you are starting with full chicken breasts, cut them in half horizontally, or pound them to 1/2-inch thickness with a meat hammer between two layers of wax paper.\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cut the chicken cutlets and rub them with curry powder: Cut the chicken breast cutlets in half or into thirds or quarters to make smaller serving pieces (they'll cook more quickly too). Sprinkle them on both sides lightly with salt (about 1/4 teaspoon).\nSprinkle with 1 teaspoon of the curry powder, lightly rubbing the curry powder into the chicken on all sides.\n2 Saut\xc3\xa9 the onions, with raisins and curry powder: Heat the oil in a large skillet on medium high heat. When the oil is hot, add the onions. Cook until translucent, stirring occasionally, about 5 minutes. Sprinkle with salt and pepper while the onions are cooking.\nDrain the raisins from the water and add them to the onions.\nLower the heat to medium and sprinkle the onions with the remaining 2 teaspoons of curry powder. Continue to cook for another minute or two.\n3 Saut\xc3\xa9 the chicken: Push the onions to one side of the skillet. Place the chicken pieces in the pan in a single layer. Cook 2-3 minutes on each side, until lightly browned and just cooked through. Remove the chicken pieces to a plate. (Bunch them together so they retain their heat.)\n4 Add sour cream or yogurt: Add the sour cream and/or yogurt mixture and stir over medium-low heat until the mixture has heated through. If the sauce is too thick, you can add a little water to thin it.\nIf you are using yogurt, or low-fat sour cream, be careful not to let the mixture simmer or it may curdle!\nReturn the chicken to the skillet (and any juices from the plate the chicken has been resting on), turn over the pieces in the sauce. When all is heated through, it's ready to serve.\nGarnish with cilantro and toasted slivered almonds and serve alone or over rice.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nChicken Peanut Curry Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 45 minutesYield: Serves 6-8\nINGREDIENTS\n3 pounds boneless, skinless chicken pieces (or you can use bone-in for added flavor), cut into 1 1/2 inch wide chunks or strips\n2/3 cup all purpose flour\n4 tablespoons yellow curry powder\n1 1/2 teaspoons sea salt\n1/2 teaspoon freshly ground peppercorns\n1/3 cup extra virgin olive oil\n2 tablespoons fresh ginger, minced\n2 tablespoons garlic, minced\n2 serrano chili peppers, seeded, de-veined, minced\n4 cups chicken broth\n2/3 cup peanut butter (if using freshly ground peanuts, add 2 teaspoons of sugar)\n1 teaspoon ground coriander seeds\n8 green onions, chopped, greens included\n1/3 cup each finely chopped mint and cilantro\n3 tablespoons lime juice\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Coat chicken pieces in seasoned flour: Rinse chicken and pat dry. In a large bowl, combine the flour, curry powder, salt and pepper. Toss the chicken pieces to coat.\n2 Saut\xc3\xa9 chicken pieces: Heat oil in a large, heavy pot or Dutch oven on medium high heat. Add chicken pieces in batches, being careful to not crowd the pan. Cook 2-4 minutes per side, or until the coating sets and browns a little. Remove the chicken from the pot as it cooks and set aside in a bowl.\n3 Build curry base with ginger, garlic, chili, broth, peanut butter: When the chicken has all been browned, add the ginger, garlic, chili pepper and 1/2 cup of the chicken broth to the saucepan. Cook for a minute or two, scraping the pan with a spatula and stirring to combine everything well.\nWhisk in the peanut butter, and the remaining 3 1/2 cups of broth slowly, stirring continuously to maintain an even texture.\n4 Add chicken to pot, simmer: Return the chicken to the pot and simmer for 15-25 minutes.\n5 Serve with coriander and garnishes: Right before serving, add the ground coriander, cilantro, mint and green onions. Add salt and lime juice to taste. Serve with rice.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nCurried Chicken Salad with Mango Recipe\nPrep time: 30 minutesCook time: 1 hourYield: 8 servings as a salad, 10 as a sandwich filling\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the salad:\n4 bone-in split chicken breasts, or 4 bone-in whole chicken legs, or a combination (3 pounds total)\n4 cups water\n1 teaspoon salt\n1 cup whole almonds (skinned or blanched)\n1 ripe mango\n1/2 tart green apple\n2 stalks celery\n1 1/2 cups seedless red or green grapes\n3 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro\n6 scallions\n1/2 cup golden raisins\nFor the curry dressing:\n2 tablespoons canola oil\n1 1/2 tablespoons curry powder\n1 tablespoon tomato paste\n1 cup mayonnaise\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper\n1 1/2 tablespoons cider vinegar, plus more to taste\n1 tablespoon lemon juice\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cook and cool the chicken: In a Dutch oven or large sauce pan, combine the chicken pieces, water, and 1 teaspoon of the salt. Bring to a boil, skim the surface thoroughly, and reduce the heat to low.\nCover the pan and simmer the chicken for 30 minutes, rotating the bottom pieces to the top halfway through cooking. Cook until the chicken is cooked through and registers 165\xc2\xb0F with an instant read thermometer in the thickest part.\nLet the chicken cool in the liquid for 30 minutes. Remove from the liquid, pat it dry, and let it finish cooling on a cutting board.\n2 Cut the chicken into cubes: Pull the chicken off the bones; discard the skin and bones. Cut the chicken into 1-inch strips or cubes. Transfer to a bowl large enough to hold all the ingredients.\nThe chicken can also be prepared a day or two ahead and refrigerated until you're ready to assemble the salad. Save the cooking liquid (stock) to make another dish or freeze.\n3 While the chicken cooks and cools, prep the other ingredients: In a small, dry skillet over medium-low heat, toast the almonds, shaking the pan often, for 5 minutes, or until they start to brown and turn aromatic. Transfer to a plate to cool.\nUse a vegetable peeler to remove the peel from the mango. Slice off large pieces on four sides (the pit is in the middle). Cut the pieces into 1-inch dice. Transfer to a large mixing bowl.\nDice the apple (leave the peel on). Add to the mango mixture, and gently toss with a squeeze of lemon (this will prevent the apple from browning.\nCut the celery stalks in half down their length and thinly slice. Halve the grapes. Chop the cilantro. Trim the tops and roots from the scallions and slice on the diagonal. Add all ingredients to the mixing bowl with the mango and apple mixture.\n  4 Make the curry paste: Wipe out the skillet used to toast the almonds. Add the oil. When it is hot, add the curry powder and cook, stirring, for 30 seconds. Remove from the heat and stir in the tomato paste. The mixture may look like a paste. Cool before using.\n5 Make the dressing: In a bowl whisk the mayonnaise, curry paste mixture, remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt, pepper, and vinegar. Stir well.\n6 Mix the salad: Add the chicken, toasted nuts, and raisins to the bowl with rest of the ingredients. Use a large metal spoon to stir gently but thoroughly.\nAdd half the dressing and stir again. Add enough of the remaining dressing to make a salad that has a little dressing or is well coated with dressing\xe2\x80\x94depending on your preference.\nTaste for seasoning and add more salt, if you like. Serve immediately or refrigerate and serve within a few hours. Leftovers will keep for a few days in the fridge, though the ingredients will start to soften. (Any remaining dressing can be saved for up to a week and used as a spread for sandwiches.)\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nChicken Curry Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n1 1/2 pound skinless chicken breast, cut into 1 inch cubes\nSalt\n1 yellow onion, roughly chopped\n2 heaping tablespoons yellow curry powder\n1 cup raisins (soak in water while you prep)\n1 apple (tart or sweet, your preference), peeled, cored, and diced\n1/2 cup chopped fresh cilantro (just lightly packed)\n2 green onions, sliced\n1 tablespoon mayonnaise optional\nMETHOD\n1 Saut\xc3\xa9 cubed chicken breast: Heat olive oil on medium/medium-high heat in a thick-bottomed saut\xc3\xa9 pan. Add chicken breast cubes and cook, stirring frequently until just cooked through, about 5 minutes. Sprinkle some salt on the chicken pieces while cooking.\nCheck doneness by removing the thickest piece and cutting it in half. If it is still pink in the middle, keep cooking. Try not to overcook the chicken or it will be dry.\nRemove chicken pieces with a slotted spoon, set aside in a bowl.\n2 Saut\xc3\xa9 onion, curry, raisins: Add chopped yellow onion and cook. After a few minutes, when the onions are beginning to get translucent, add 2 heaping tablespoons of yellow curry powder. Cook a few minutes more, stirring frequently.\nIf the curry sticks to the bottom or the mixture gets dry, add a bit more olive oil to the pan. As you stir, scrape up the stuck curry bits.\nAdd drained raisins, and cook, stirring another minute. (If adding optional mayonnaise, remove curry from heat and mix in mayo.)\n3 Add raisin onion mixture to chicken: Add raisin and onion mixture to chicken and mix well, coating the chicken pieces with the curry infused olive oil. Refrigerate until cool. At this point you can make the salad a day a head of time.\n4 Mix in apple, green onions, cilantro to serve: When you are ready to serve the salad, mix in the apple, green onions, and cilantro.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Print\nQuick Green Curry Chicken with Zucchini Noodles Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: 4 servings\nIf Thai basil is difficult to find, you can use sweet basil instead.\nIf you don\xe2\x80\x99t have a spiralizer, use a julienne peeler or a vegetable peeler to shave the zucchini into thin noodles.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 1/4 pounds boneless skinless chicken thighs\n2 cloves garlic, minced\n2 teaspoons minced ginger\n1 1/4 teaspoons kosher salt, divided\n1 1/4 pounds zucchini\n1/2 medium yellow onion (about 2/3 cup sliced)\n1 large red bell pepper\n1 large carrot\n1 1/2 tablespoons canola oil (or any high heat oil), divided\n1 1/2 tablespoons green curry paste (like Thai Kitchen or Maesri)\n3/4 cup full-fat coconut milk\n1/2 cup water\n1 1/2 tablespoons lime juice\n3 tablespoons chopped Thai basil, divided\nSpecial equipment:\nSpiralizer\nMETHOD\n1 Prepare and marinate the chicken: Cut the chicken thighs into 1/2-inch to 1-inch pieces. Transfer the chicken to a bowl. Add the garlic, ginger and 3/4 teaspoon salt to the bowl and mix to combine the ingredients. Set the chicken aside while you prep the vegetables.\n2 Spiralize the zucchinis: Rinse the zucchini and trim off the tops and ends. If you have any zucchini that is slightly curved, slice those in half. Make thin zucchini noodles using a spiralizer.\nOnce you have spiralized all the zucchini, give the noodles several rough chops to shorten them. Set the zucchini aside.\n3 Prepare the vegetables: Cut the onion into thin slices. Peel the carrot, cut it into thirds, and then cut each third into thin matchsticks. Remove the seeds from the red pepper, cut it into thick 1-inch slices, and then cut each crosswise into thin matchsticks.\n4 Make and simmer the curry: Heat a large skillet or saut\xc3\xa9 pan with 1 tablespoon of oil over medium-high heat. Once the pan is hot, add the sliced onions and cook for about 2 minutes, until they start to soften.\nTransfer the chicken to the pan and spread it around. Cook the chicken for about 3 to 4 minutes, stirring occasionally. The chicken does not need to be fully cooked.\nAdd green curry paste and stir to coat with the chicken. Add the remaining vegetables and toss with the chicken. Add the coconut milk and water.\nReduce the heat to medium-low, cover, and let everything simmer while you cook the zucchini.\n5 Cook the zucchini noodles: Heat another large skillet or pan with 1/2 tablespoon of oil over medium-high heat. Once the pan is hot, add the zucchini noodles and cook for about 3 minutes. The noodles should be softened but not mushy.\nSeason with a pinch of salt and 1 1/2 tablespoons chopped basil, if using. Turn off the heat.\n6 Finish and serve: Uncover the chicken curry and mix in the remaining chopped basil, lime juice and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Taste the chicken curry and add more salt, if necessary. Serve the chicken with zucchini noodles, spooning extra curry sauce over top.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Print\nChicken Curry with Sweet Potato and Lemongrass Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 40 minutesYield: 4 to 6 servings\nTo divide each chicken thigh into three equal pieces, cut the flat side as one piece, then halve the thicker portion. If large thighs are unavailable, use smaller ones and cut each into two pieces.\nReprinted with permission from Vietnamese Food Any Day: Simple Recipes for True, Fresh Flavors by Andrea Nguyen, Copyright \xc2\xa92019. Published by Ten Speed Press, an imprint of Penguin Random House LLC.\nINGREDIENTS\n1/2 cup coarsely chopped lemongrass, from 2 medium stalks\n2 tablespoons coarsely chopped peeled ginger\n1 medium yellow onion, coarsely chopped\n2 tablespoons Madras-style curry powder, preferably Sun brand\n1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper\n1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper, optional\n1 (13.5-ounce) can full-fat, unsweetened coconut milk, not shaken\n2 tablespoons virgin coconut oil or neutral oil, such as canola\n4 large boneless, skinless chicken thighs (about 1 3/4 pounds total), each cut into 3 pieces\n1/2 teaspoon fine sea salt\n1 1/4 pounds sweet potatoes (white or orange flesh), peeled and cut into 1-inch chunks\n3 to 5 fresh cilantro sprigs, coarsely chopped\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Make the curry paste: In a food processor, whirl the lemongrass into a fine texture, about 3 minutes, pausing occasionally to scrape down the bowl. Add the ginger and pulse to finely chop. Add the onion and pulse again to chop.\nAdd the curry powder, black pepper, and cayenne (if using) and whirl until you have a fragrant yellow paste, about 30 seconds.\n2 Prep the coconut milk: Do not shake the can of coconut milk. Open the can and remove 1/3 cup of the thick cream at the top of the coconut milk. Stir the remaining lighter milk, and set both aside.\n3 Begin cooking the curry: In a 3- to 4-quart pot over medium-high heat, melt the coconut oil. Add the lemongrass paste and cook for 3 to 5 minutes, stirring frequently, until fragrant and no longer raw and harsh smelling. Lower the heat as needed to avoid scorching.\nAdd the chicken and 1/2 teaspoon salt, stir to combine, and cook for 1 minute to meld the flavors. Add the coconut milk and a little water to cover the chicken. Bring to a simmer over medium-high heat, cover, and adjust the heat to gently simmer for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.\n4 Add the sweet potatoes: Uncover the pot, add the sweet potatoes, and return the curry to a simmer. Continue cooking for 10 to 12 minutes, uncovered and stirring occasionally, until the potatoes are tender.\n5 Finish the curry: Turn off the heat, stir the coconut cream into the sauce, and let rest on the burner\xe2\x80\x99s receding heat for 10 minutes, uncovered, to blend and mature flavors. Taste and season with salt (unsalted curry powder may require an additional teaspoon), and splash in a bit of water if the flavors are too strong.\nServe immediately, garnished with the cilantro.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
